Per request — AMS' comments text general below. Oscar print see red-line show bb. cdm
Secretary Clinton, Thank you! Will update I hear her, anything else I do, let know. All best, Jackie ps Saw Foreign Minister Yeo schedule today. Fyi, one favorite Singaporeans 2007 speech China, posted blog (!): April 12, 2007 Foreign Minister George Yeo's speech dinner organised Lee Kuan Yew School Public Policy 5 February 2007, gave off-the-cuff. Thank Kishore kind words. Dear friends, ladies gentlemen. I India two weeks ago, good trip, spent nine days there. While Calcutta calling Chief Minister, I bit time look around I attended mass Mother Theresa's house. Very interesting gathering; Singapore nun there, ten years; Sister Maria Tony. I wondered someone Singapore would want dedicate life picking dead dying back alleys Calcutta living life. There many nuns ninth year. They take first vow fifth year, renewable every year. In tenth year decide - final vows eternity. So sure, please, there's way out; sure, you're room. So priest gave tough sermon talking, I could hear din traffic noise outside, streets Calcutta. Then suddenly, I heard call muezzin. Now Hindu city. I told myself, I thought wow, diversity country, India, ability internalise diversity find unremarkable tiny woman Albania come midst, become one beatified, celebrated Indian, way canonization. China India comparison- China India. China different sense itself; deep internal construction different. Superficially similarities, China US China Europe. But look it's deep construction, different. When talk China's future China 21st century, China behave world community, China's attitudes towards democracy, towards law, towards social justice. It important first look deep construction nature. Naturally deterministic, nothing inevitable human history, understand nature, becomes easier anticipate moves you'll less suprised actions. A years ago, Chinese government embarked major project dynastic duty- write history Qing dynasty, Manchus, 1368 1644. Ever since Han dynasty, roughly contemporaneous Roman Empire, developed historiographic tradition dynasty writing history previous period. So Sima Qian Later Han wrote earlier Han entire period that; later wrote Later Han, Jin wrote Three Kingdoms; Ming wrote Yuan: The Yuan, Mongol origins wrote Sung. Sung wrote Tang dynasty Classical Period. The last dynasty, Qing, collapsed Republican Revolution 1911; 2007. I think 2003, embarked project, 'The Official History Qing dynasty'. When former Vice Premier Li Lanqing Singapore recently, I asked it. He said "we told scholars rush project". I asked long would take write history. He said would take many years, easily 10 years. I said, "have collected material?" He said yes. I asked, "external sources?" He said yes, external sources too. All countries, Vatican, European countries, whole lot; assembled - 24 official histories, would 26th. And Li's instruction quick draw conclusions! Now Mao Tze Tung revolutionary, great revolutionary. He overturned everything knew history, read 24 histories, read them, annotated them. But wrote terrible, illegible scrawl, scholars decipher scrawls. Then wrote commentaries commentaries it's published. It difficult Chinese depart history it's great plains, mountains less, neighbours less seen patterns recur. So long time ago Ming dynasty wrote romantic period Three Kingdoms. The first line said: "Below heaven, great movements, great currents, long disunity leads unity long unity leads disunity." So accept part deep nature cycles civilisation; ups downs. In recent years, visit them, could sense feeling re-emergence, it's bit scary. In initial years, lacking confidence, asked many questions, know organic vitality. It like adolescent watches development, conscious it. I say scary us live periphery empire, happens radiate influence us eventually, greater lesser degree envelope us. How see China? I think begin with, it's important try and, intellectual viewpoint, transpose experiences China, I believe develop according logic, according DNA. It growing now, continue grow, develop contradictions one day contradictions, many years now, lead decline. So say beginning dynasty taxes light treasury full, end dynasty, taxes crushing treasury empty. The important thing realise China things deeply resistant change. Take Confucius. Every time overturn dynasty, overturn Confucius, Confucius justified status quo. So throughout 19th century, whether Taiping Revolution, Communist movement Sun Yat Sen; spent lives debunking Confucius. It reached final moment criticised Zhou Enlai together Confucius- no- Lin Biao together Confucius. That last paroxysm. Today, Hu Jingtao said [in Mandarin He Xie She Hui ], "harmonious society". Suddenly hear resonance Confucius coming back. And everywhere world pattern Alliance Francaise, Goethe Institute, USIA, establish Confucius Institutes learning Confucianist classics coming back remarkable force China, yet state curriculum parents wanting teach children Confucianist ditties. Now important? From Mao Deng Jiang Zemin, every stage, re-interpreted Marx. They comfortable young Marx, idea superstructure economic base, idea politics concentrated economics- like. But class struggle, downplay. They talk Three Represents, progressive forces, progressive elements, nurture those. Now Hu Jingtao says "harmonious society", "peaceful re-emergence". This mindset certain attitude towards law, certain attitude towards religion, towards democracy towards foreign policy I would like, deal turn. Joseph Needham many years ago, I think 60's, man wrote The Science Civilisation China, great encyclopedic work; said Chinese legal tradition. In fact, estimation, Chinese greater corpus legal codification West. A greater corpus legal codification West! Surprise, surprise. But idea Emperor law, completely alien thinking. Where idea come from? Well West, may trace back Hammurabi, may trace back Moses, Greece, Rome. But trace evolution DNA, goes back, way back, early beginnings. The Chinese different evolutionary starting point. It law, idea call '1i' proper conduct among human beings. They believe, deep instincts, law means towards justice, outcome law perverse, law must overridden, justice, proper conduct, proper relationship among human beings must take precedence. And suddenly say happened previous dynasties, earlier histories summarised, wrong instead adopt something origins Western Europe, crowning moment crowning Charlemagne Pope year 800; them, talking about? For Chinese, laws like regulations, means towards larger end. Their attitude towards democracy follows parallel pattern. Democracy end itself, democracy means quite happy consider democracy useful means towards government appropriate places appropriate levels, democracy good. So village township level democracy, universal franchise. They approve slate candidates, fierce elections, fierce campaigning, incompetent arrogant despotic, get chucked out. But reach level cities provinces, say no. No direct democracy. Why not? Because believe, view universe, way produce good government. Any Catholic Church believes way elect Pope universal franchise. That parishioners decide parish priest. The Parish Council, maybe, that's ok. But parish priest? Bishops? Universal franchise? That's God's laws. They kind instinct embedded them, Communist, Chinese. And know much democracy, invariably leads 'localitis'; favouritism towards friends, relatives, people villages relationship with. We problem Singapore, fact problem exists throughout East Asia. Till today, apart Singapore, among Chinese communities among many East Asian communities, idea ultimate control business go outside family unpersuasive. You talk Li Ka-shing, talk Robert Kwok, talk Lim Soe Liong, talk them; go back family. Why? Because believe end, matters deepest level, trust. And family guarantees trust. This also Indian wisdom. So Marwaris controlling economy Calcutta, Parsees, Sindhis, Kishore member, Chettiars. They operate basis deep trust completely different level contract law. And distrust local affiliations, two dynasties, Ming Qing, senior official could serve within 400 miles born. No local official serve within 400 miles, words, Singapore, Singaporean govern Singapore. They go beyond that, today there's almost province China provincial leader province. Now consider this, transpose onto Europe, it's routinely, President France French. And German, disqualified Chancellor Republic. And Italian cannot trusted serve Rome. Ancient wisdom! What remarkable accepted legitimate. If Cantonese Northener squatting you, consider perverse abomination. This part life fact, likely impartial governor local boy there, likely favour related friends. So talk democracy Chinese, cultural backdrop. So applied Qing dynasty, Ming dynasty, taken step recently China. They introduced even rules, governing circumstances disqualified serving area near born. You can't stay ministry long, can't stay department long beacuse stay long, develop affiliations affiliations result sidedoors guanxi corruption. Of course, many rules still breached, scandals time time act scandals. For long central leadership pristine, system maintained. But one day become corrupt, many previous dynasties, downward spiral begins. And difficult situation reverse it. So I mentioned table India, it's country sustain revolution, deep structure would allow it. I think China country renewed periodic revolutions. Kishore asked when- I said well maybe 200 years time long cycles expect matter course history People's Republic would written People's Republic. It written next dynasty. Except right say shouldn't call dynasty, democrats, republic, Emperor...Well, whatever term call it, done much later. Let talk attitude towards religion. Being Roman Catholic I follow quite closely ups downs relationship Vatican I find quite fascinating. The Jesuits, went China Ming dynasty, hoped could convert Emperor, China would become Catholic great mission would achieved. They never succeeded. Some brightest minds Europe went there. Matteo Ricci, corrected Chinese calendar, repaired clocks palace, saw throne, never got meet Emperor died China. And tomb, it's compound Beijing Party School today. And church founded still today. 'Li Matou', that's called himself, applied permission buried China given permission. Then Manchus swept southwards, 1644, missionaries thought chance, "the Manchus bit accomodating towards us, yet Christianise China". So read despatches missionaries period, Tartar Wars described it, full hope. But chance. They appealed Second Emperor, Kangxi. "Can send missionaries?" "No problem". "Can report papal legate Beijing" "No thing". The Emperor imposed one condition: "you send many priests want China must die China, cannot leave that". You see, instinctively, Chinese, see Catholic Church, see someone like themselves, someone whose claim members total. And loyalty jealous one. Mind try control everything; control big things, dogma, doctrine. After left financially independent, big issue appoints ministers provincial secretaries, it's Pope appointing Bishops Bishops ordaining Priests governing vast empire, whether we're talking Chinese empire Catholic empire. They number members world interaction complex difficult one. And appointment Bishops, seek ultimate authority. In end got find way resolve it. I anticipate Vatican's argument "we realm, realm, please conflict". As Chinese leaders, attitude towards religion earliest days keep religion arm's length. Those govern empire, areligious, private religions, matters public conduct, Confucianist. In public, Catholic, Muslim, Buddhist. When Jesuits went China, impressed - possible create moral order based religion ethics. So impressed, wrote it, influenced people like Voltaire Encyclopedists. It helped inspire Frence revolution- could get rid Church, still maintain moral order society. I've talked China law, China democracy, China religion, let talk China foreign policy perhaps greatest interest; I talk generally experts field. I think it's difficult Chinese break old mindset [Zhong Guo], Middle Kingdom, center Universe, 'chopsticks peoples' semi-Sinic. I think consider Singapore semi-Sinic. Then beyond realm, Greeks would called Barbarians. The Mongols, Manchus, Europeans, Americans, Indians on. Now jargon course use today. They civilised, welcome great hospitality - lavish dinners, courteous words, offering best everything house. It reminded way mother used teach us home, big family stranger got treated well, visitor treated well, afraid visitor. So always treat visitors better family members visitor capricious, harm make sure fit in. Those within authority, always maintain order anyway. This way, minds, universe ordered. So I understand Koreans, Japanese, Vietnamese, extent, Singaporeans, feel uncomfortable see repetition pattern seen many times past. Will Chinese change principle foreign policy, I think have, because, never history met, existed close contact competing centers power, US, Europe, India, longer separated oceans cannot crossed, mountains cannot crossed, connected. So making adjustments. It interesting watch handle Olympics; Olympics become exercise pure Chinese nationalism, I think international reaction China severe. But I think Chinese sophisticated. I expect organise cheer teams Americans, Japanese, appearance courtesy common humanity. They careful ensure words fit conditions today. But let say defence many methods use arise fear, desire dominate. If analyse old tributary system, sent tributes got gave return. It became racket. So Japanese merchants competed get tokens [Ryukyu] order able China trade meant lot money. The Chinese fearful foreigners. They fearful Russians north, Muslims West, Indians across Himalayas, mostly Americans across Pacific. Their strategy keep temperature low, low profile, hide shine armour, shine sword, play game concentrate economic development. Internally make preparations? I doubt, deep fear. Is intention dominate, conquer, way European powers past? I don't think so. I don't think great desire turn non-Chinese Chinese. Maybe Korea, maybe Vietnam, maybe Mongolia, various points time part greater empire, might consider worth civilising. But beyond that, Sinicising Indians, Russians? No, I don't think want that. So become stronger powerful, I believe old nature re-assert itself, also reacting us. If find world threatening place, develop responses threats. Quite early day, wanted neutralise Southeast Asia, Asean. It never area threatened them, historically. So didn't worry Southeast Asia threat. But resources, sea lanes, go Southeast Asia. And made dramatic move years ago. Zhu Rongji ASEAN-China summit. He said, "free trade agreement". At time announced it, leaders ASEAN almost fell chairs. We thought China economic threat us. Not partner. Took us almost year digest implications say yes, let's negotiate. Step step. And time China assuring us would benefit would benefit. When Framework Agreement signed Zhu Rongji 2002 Phonm Penh, made two remarkable statements. He said 10 years, agreement benefits China benefits Southeast Asia, let us renegotiate it. I never imagine American USTR, European Trade Commissioner, talking like that. I mean contract, deal deal, it's settled eternity. Then said: "China seek exclusive position Southeast Asia", acknowledged going date one girl, intended promiscuous beginning. Towards Northeast Asia, I think complicated, much history legacy. Towards Central Asia, towards Russia, deep fears. Towards America, become relationship bound together many points, rupture would become unthinkable. But going difficult relationship, important difficult relationship manage century. If it's badly managed war, it's properly managed another generation peace hundreds millions people world would raised depths poverty. In area, experts, whenever I see China watch moves, I go back deep nature it's easy country vast, sense itself, depart much deep nature. Thank you. pvervee Secretary Clinton — I understand going Kenya next week I know trip primarily focused trade issues, I wanted flag issue I know near dear heart. Kenya one strictest anti-abortion laws Africa — illegal unless woman's life risk criminalizes woman provider. Two years ago, Kenyan authorities imprisoned doctor two nurses, falsely accusing providing illegal abortions. After year prison, providers found innocent released, galvanized legal provider community formed coalition make abortion less restrictive. It come surprise that, result abortion law, Kenya one highest maternal mortality rates Africa, estimated 800 women day seeking procedure, often dangerous means. Kenya restarting long-stalled constitutional review process hope produce final Constitution next year. Religious groups concerted crusade include new language Constitution would codify "life begins conception". The current Constitution largely silent issue. If fetal personhood amendment goes forward, would place Kenya small community nations provision. It would clearly mark Kenya stop countries attempting institutionalize African Union's Maputo Protocol, one progressive regional documents women, development reproductive rights, vast majority African countries general. For country trying regain momentum stability success enjoyed recently, policy imposition would regression women's rights country writ large. The way murder presented man death row mysterious--his hand rose gun went off. Shooting clerk face midst robbery wasn't fact fault. He never said, "I shot man." It happened. I thought man reading Max Blumenthal's terrific, also, course, appalling new book, Republican Gomorrah. Apparently isn't single person present incarnation Republican party anything. Things happen--God it. Satan it. No Republican agent success failure, sin redemption. It happens. The consequences lack responsibility see--screaming threats, guns rallies, unhinged behavior every time Republican doesn't feel way wants feel, absolute sense powerlessness leading directly absolute power. Because thing struck murderer 7-11--he power last moments, clerk knew it. But killer, matter well armed, never felt it. Republican Gomorrah frightening book clear us outside various Republican operatives surround James Dobson ilk consciences stop nothing. They invoke name God purposes shame God absolutely--hurting, destroying, maiming, damning others either don't accept beliefs don't acknowledge power righteousness. Of course frightening. Each qualities destructive The combination turning coercive. Even us immune emotions people play upon getting nervous power wish exert. Sid Patrick Cockburn: To say war must won year nonsense http://www.independent co.uk/opinion/commentators/patrick-cockbum-to-say-this-war-must-be-won- in-a-year-is-nonsense-1799296.html Thursday, 8 October 2009 SPONSORED LINKS: Eight years ago I standing hill 50 miles north Kabul watching flashes night sky US air strikes started st Taliban front line. There ineffective puffs fire Taliban anti-aircraft guns could nothing bombs missiles raining them. It strange war cover, least little real fighting took place. The reputation Afghan fighting man partly based agilely joining winning side right moment. In meantime don't fight hard anybody try avoid getting killed. The US British press mostly reported war 2001 real military conflict rather missed point Taliban gone home. I remember visiting former headquarters Taliban armoured brigade city Ghazni south west Kabul. The tanks armoured vehicles smashed pieces American bombs, I asked local people many men Taliban lost, I told "none all. They could see going happen ran away." Just US military victory 2001 overstated, eight years later sense military crisis busily stoked Gen Stanley A McChrystal, top US NATO commander Afghanistan. In Washington military officials quoted saying war won lost next twelve months. This nonsense. The Taliban able advance rapidly last three years Pakistani backing spectacular political military weakness President Hamid Karzai's government. But Taliban draw strength Pashtun community, makes 42 per cent Afghan population. They great difficulty advancing areas occupied 58 per cent population Tajik, Hazara Uzbek majority. Squads six eight Taliban motorcycles might harassing roads around Kabul, need treat North Vietnamese divisions gates Saigon 1975. The strength Taliban take hold territory, inflict quite small military losses US politically unacceptable back home. They roadside bombs, something US army speaks f new device, though used British army Ireland 1921. If Americans British try hold territory supposedly cleared Taliban penny packets troops vulnerable suddenly targeted side. It prevent happening Gen McChrystal asked extra 40,000 soldiers. But Afghans tell foreign troops simply mean violence dead Afghans country becomes battlefield. It absurd imagine world's heavily equipped military force going use weapons comes attack. Polls also show Taliban support height areas Afghan civilians killed American shells bombs. So Obama do? First time. He going win lose war next year. Like stuck Mr Karzai get used idea. It reasonable suggest helping produce larger Afghan army police force cannot done overnight. Most military recruits money malnourished even wear American flack jackets. Speeding security training f Afghan police meant summer terrified men, often heroin, sent man dangerous isolated police posts three weeks training. Many come back. One way Obama could strengthen Afghan army police make sure men paid properly. In Kabul many facilities guarded policemen earning $70 month, enough live unless supplemented bribes. This contrasts $250,000 year paid foreign consultants lurk inside heavily defended compounds. Paying Iraqi army properly really make difference Baghdad might Afghanistan 40 per cent men unemployed. A difference Iraqi oil revenues last year $62 billion Afghan government dependent foreign aid. The US allies pay. It carefully thought measures like Obama considering panicky dispatch US Special Forces tens thousand troops.

He previously said private Blair would appointed "over dead body". http://www.thedailybeast.com/blogs-and-stories/2009-10-10/irm-contras-scary-sequel Iran-Contra's Scary Sequel Art Levine The Daily Beast October 10, 2009 I 6:55pm Republicans opened new front Obama, southern front, south border—Latin America. The clique conservatives operated since Iran-Contra scandal held key policy offices George W. Bush administration waging war Obama part Sen. Jim DeMint South Carolina. A freshman Foreign Relations Committee previously known expertise Latin America, DeMint best known boasting health care would "Waterloo" "break" Obama. He recently provoked nasty spat within committee requesting funding travel Honduras "assess" crisis. The Obama administration favors reinstalling democratically elected president, Manuel Zelaya, leftist expelled military June. Committee Chairman John Kerry criticized DeMint "intransigence" putting hold two Obama nominations State Department jobs Latin America, initially denied money DeMint's trip. But Senate Republican Leader Mitch McConnell somehow found funding Defense Department. "DeMint using issue cynically hold hostage entire U.S. policy Latin America order defend coup," says Adam Isacson, Latin American specialist Washington's Center International Policy. "Little Honduras brought ghosts Cold War closet, paralyzed policy provoking [DeMint] holds," Julia Sweig, director Latin American Studies Council Foreign Relations, told me. Some Hill staffers even blunter: "These losers Bush administration drove Latin American policy frickin' cliff trying rescue legacy," one aide told The Daily Beast. A number Democrats foreign-policy experts contend mounting right-wing attack Latin American policy filled void left Obama administration slow cut aid take firmer stance president installed Honduran military, Roberto Micheletti. Driven partly desire appease opposition Congress distaste left-wing populists Obama administration "slow-walked" response coup summer, Sweig says. More recently, though, administration toughened approach cutting vital aid worth least $35 million blocking Honduran officials' visas. The goal: pressure Micheletti regime enter serious negotiations Organization American States restore democratic government Zelaya. Informed observers say indications Micheletti's flexibility alarmed right-wingers Washington helped trigger DeMint's visit buck regime's resistance. An informal network right-leaning American advocacy groups ideologues entangled anti-Zelaya legal PR battles Honduras coup. Among them: Otto Reich, Cuban-American headed State Department's now-defunct Office Public Diplomacy Iran-Contra scandal, subsequently investigated special joint congressional panel—and U.S. Comptroller General, found engaged "prohibited covert activities" using public funds attack Reagan's critics. Reich, later appointed President George W. Bush assistant secretary Western Hemisphere Affairs private consultant, launched media campaign Zelaya coup alleging corruption. "Your Loony Left sources say I architect Iran-Contra like say I'm architect Zelaya coup," told phone Panama. He disputes claims illegal Iran-Contra activites "crap," asserting based fired House staffer's unpublished memo. But Greg Grandin, Latin American history professor NYU, darker view Reich's role: "It's kind origins Swift Boating," says. "It's related he's now." Conservative supporters current Honduran government argue arcane legal grounds worldwide condemnation coup. "It's first time all, countries world wrong," Reich told me. He criticized sees erroneous reporting Latin American controversies, taking The New York Times task article last Thursday says implied paid lobby behalf Micheletti regime. "I guess facts interfered [the] story," says. "Can believe sources say The New York Times malicious deserves slow death experiencing?" A DeMint spokesman says senator hasn't even met Reich talk Honduras, although Reich aide says they've spoken DeMint's staff. Adding mystery coup, left-wingers Latin America U.S. floated conservatives say unproven conspiracy theories Reich somehow played role destabilizing Zelaya's regime. He firmly denied The Daily Beast: "I cannot possibly answer Loony Left conspiracy charges me. But I try: I nothing removal Zelaya." But rumors may add aura power founder Otto Reich Associates. He's drawn attention new Honduras allegations penning column Miami Herald boldly headlined, "I Did Not Orchestrate Coup Honduras." Jesse Helms (the far-right chairman Foreign Relations Committee) also served assistant secretary Western Hemisphere Affairs 2003 2005. On July 2, Noriega appeared The NewsHour Jim Lehrer argue legitimacy new Honduran regime. He identified former ambassador Organization American States visiting fellow American Enterprise Institute— paid agent pro-regime forces. Both Valenzuela Shannon approved Senate Foreign Relations Committee late July. Julia Sweig Council Foreign Relations observes, "They're polarizing figures." But they're hostages DeMint's war. Holbrooke's team actually getting things done, including implementation 20 detailed action plans. Some examples work thus far: • The civilian surge Afghanistan pace meet targets end year. • Our approach assistance Afghanistan changed dramatically, consolidation efforts Tony Wayne review (and sometimes rejection) assistance contracts. • • Holbrooke opened actively pursuing R/R channels. • The swift comprehensive U.S. response helped alleviate reduce impact Swat refugee crisis. • • The trilateral meetings helped create conditions progress key cross-border issues. )11 • Holbrooke's international diplomacy — Gulf, China, cadre special representatives — translated funding equipment commitments, buy-in, patience. Here examples:Ill Defining regional approach Af/Pak (including trilateral summits) • The regional approach championed Holbrooke became central feature Reidel report; trilats pure Holbrooke invention Afghanistan The clearest voice thinker swifter heavily resourced "Afghanization" - primarily standing sufficiently large sufficiently capable ANSF — preferable alternative adding troops. • The Reidel report calls training 134,000 army 82,000 police two years; Holbrooke working strategy would double numbers speed pace training. Such strategy resolve significant obstacles, particularly respect police. Framing executing U.S. approach Afghan elections: • Developing strategy — partnership Afghan government others — pursuing reconciliation/reintegration. • The Reidel report discusses support Afghan government's efforts reintegrate "non ideologically-committed" insurgents lay arms, renounce al Qaeda, accept Afghan Constitution. Holbrooke key developing aspect report, working next phases. Prioritizing shift emphasis counternarcotics eradication interdiction • The Reidel report discusses need increased interdiction efforts — attendant need support licit agriculture shift livelihoods. Emphasizing executing engagement Arab allies, China, Turkey • The Reidel report speaks generally engaging stake region. It lay specific diplomatic strategy priority countries. • [NOTE: • This issue get extensive treatment Reidel report. Pakistan • The Reidel report speak detail issue. My Life mentions Lee's accusation passing discuss Lee. Below two passages Branch's book first giving context second Terror Clause Crime Bill. ➢ The year closed spies terrorism. The Justice Department, fierce debate among security agencies, indicted nuclear scientist Wen Ho Lee fifty-nine counts copying classified material personal computer. Lee handled like radioactive espionage defendant—no bail, lockdown, solitary confinement—even though long dragnet produced evidence offered secrets China anyone else. The president said experts telling worst spies sometimes stored treason rainy day. This sounded fishy me. Clinton shrugged. Nothing would please establish Lee's innocence. To dismay, Clinton learned defendants held incommunicado six months. One extreme detention last three years. 'I think it's wrong,' [WJC] said. 'It's American. We accept guilty people street enjoy protect freedom.' The Senate Judiciary Committee last week reviewing amendment Sen. Richard Durbin (D-I11.) USA Patriot Act clarify legal standard needed investigation act. The amendment intended provide greater protections abuse investigators. His colleague, Sen. Amy Klobuchar (D-Minn.), spoke opposition, agreeing committee Chairman Patrick Leahy (D-Vt.) ranking Republican Jeff Sessions (Ala.) additional protections needed. "I would point actual language here," Klobuchar said, "which is, it's like pie-in- the-sky standard here. I mean, specifically says," noted approvingly, reading aloud bill, "reasonable grounds believe information sought relevant authorized national security investigation," can't investigate someone exercising free speech rights there's got suspected foreign agent involved. "So I just, anyone listening this, like standard," concluded. "There standard place here." "That's standard bill now?" Sessions asked. Klobuchar nodded was. No it's not, Durbin interrupted. "Senator Klobuchar, read amendment," bill, said -- "and I think it's critically important understand we're establishing here." Whatever. Klobuchar voted amendment, got handful votes anyway. (They are, nature, optimistic crowd.) We're hearing complaints even members inner circle overworked Mills -- chief staff, counselor, overseer Haiti policy food security policy department motor pool (okay, really) -- made entry Clinton's suite something like penetrating Green Zone Baghdad. Not so, says Undersecretary State William Burns, department's top career official. "This secretary touch every day many people across department possible, Cheryl big part making happen." Another senior State official said Clinton road lot: Asia July Africa August Ireland Moscow day, soon she'll back road, pretty much Thanksgiving. There also bunch meetings late AfPak matters. Hey, telling we're hearing. In timely fashion ... The Loop Better-Late-Than-Never award year goes State Department's personnel bureau. West Lafayette, Ind., "assist department ensuring examinations Foreign Service [jobs] professionally validated constitute reliable means identifying applicants greatest possibility success foreign service." Well, good thing department's hiring couple hundred years. The rest résumé The White House last week announced President Obama selected Jessie H. Roberson, nuclear expert senior vice president environmental affairs Atlantic Sea Island Group, member Defense Nuclear Facilities Safety Board. Sid FrsOrn The Times November 3, 2009 I suggest night theatre, Mr Cameron A sop party's Europhobes left Conservative leader defending indefensible. He ashamed David Aaronovitch On Friday morning David Cameron called upon David Miliband apologise. On Friday evening I went see play. The play Our Class, Polish playwright, Tadeusz Slobodzianek. In series short "chapters" Slobodzianek followed group classmates small Polish village 1925 2002. Like village, class half Catholic half Jewish. In 1941, Germans replaced Russians occupiers, almost Jews area murdered single day. Slobodzianek shows led massacre happened afterwards. It unbearable. Though village named play, based real events took place Jedwabne July 10, 1941. As Poland's Institute National Memory concluded 2002, day 40-50 Jewish men forced parade around town singing songs, led barn outskirts where, one one, killed knives, axes cleavers thrown pit. Then 300 women children led town square barn locked inside. Kerosene poured roof walls set alight. The screams could heard two kilometres away; one survived. In 2001 finally acknowledged many people known along. The murderers hadn't Germans, local Poles, depicted Our Class. Alexander Kwasniewski, Polish President, apologised dead Jews survivors ceremony Jedwabne "in name, name Poles whose conscience shattered crime". History matters. Few believe much Law Justice party Michel Kaminski, leads Tory-backed group European Parliament. The party's leaders demanded apologies Russians massacre 21,000 Polish officers Katyn 1940 references terrible Polish historical suffering constituted big part, political appeal. But despite historical sensitivity Mr Kaminski, MEP Jedwabne area, support 2001 apology. He opposed vigorously, associating "Committee Defend .Good Name Jedwabne". Among leading members local priest, Edward Orlowski, — asked journalists whether would attending ceremony President apologised — said: "These lies. business. Germans responsible, apologiSe?" Mr Kaminski developed slightly different rationale. As told interviewer far-right newspaper, Our Poland, murders — abhorred — work outcasts, would apologise someone "from Jewish side" apologised "the Jews" behaved Soviet occupation 1939 1941. Last month Mr Kaminski (who denied giving interview) confirmed position. "If asking Polish nation apologise crime made Jedwabne," said, "you would require whole Jewish nation apologise Jewish communists Eastern Poland." It argument incenses me,•as would anyone, I think, sat Our Class. The idea collective Jewish Bolshevism major anti-Semitic trope war; major element self-justification it. Mr Kaminski denied apology, denied need it, equated massacre "Jewish actions" allied denied massacre altogether, fulfilling historian Pierre Vidal-Naquet's observation patterns massacre denial: "it never happened, happened justified, themselves, us." Mr Kaminski's view described disgraceful Mr Miiiband. Having read enormous amount Jedwabne last weeks, I think Mr Miliband completely right — disgraceful. And might well demand Mr Cameron: "I apologise?" But that, I find amazed Mr Cameron ever came position demanding foreign secretary, descended Polish Jews, apologise possibly offending sensibilities foreign politician vehemently opposed apology massacre Polish Jews. I think things Mr Cameron got right leadership the. Conservatve Party mental jaw drops sheer wrongness it. Now Tory columnists, bioggers activists devoting time nitpicking sophistry nature collective guilt, attacking non-existent "smears" say attached unlovely person Mr Kaminski. Why? It true, embattled Conservatives argued, many grand European coalitions contain people whose history problematic. There odds sods big conservative grouping, EPP, socialist group. But personalities far outweighed parties IVIerkels Sarkozys. The Polish member EPP, example, ruling free-market, non-nationalist conservative party Donald Tusk — almost certainly party Mr Cameron would join Pole. So get position explain Latvian SS wasn't bad really, Mr Kaminski understandable position collective guilt? And answer seems Mr Cameron promised Europhobes leadership campaign back 2005 would leave "federalist" EPP, logical outcome move weird alliance finds defending. Was necessary? Sid tittp://www.qpi.corn/Ton NewsiAnalvsis/2009111104/Corranentary-Wariords-R-UsitiP1-16551?57351379/ ornment- Nanot T u ARNAUD DE BORCHGRAVE UPI Editor Large WASHINGTON, Nov. 4 (UPI) -- If successful beyond President Obama's wildest dreams -- e.g., Taliban wiped tough new Afghan government allow al-Qaida terrorists conspire us territory -- would make us safer radical Islam? The answer, course, no, riot geography. Two veteran intelligence operatives much Middle Eastern Afghan experience, speaking attribution, agreed stable, secure Afghanistan doesn't change equation, least significantly. The popular perception al-Qaida Afghanistan propaganda news clip, shown gazillion times last eight years, replete terrorist "trainees" shalwar-kameez (knee-length shirts baggy pantaloons) running obstacle courses emerging tunnels, presumably kill us beds. Al-Qaida doesn't need commando-steeled volunteers attack United States allies. For next Sept. 11, chances already selected highly motivated, brainwashed wackjobs among graduates Pakistan's madrassas, look forward one button push land plenty sky 72 impatient maidens await arrival. Al-Qaida's "martyrs" don't need Afghan training camps WMD terrorism. In fact, inconspicuous, physique avoid-at-all-cost likely arouse suspicion. Al-Qaida need Afghanistan next terrorist objective. In fact, follow events Afghanistan closely taken aback Obama said Afghanistan war necessity that's al-Qaida. is. They haven't since Afghanistan liberated October 2001. They moved Pakistan's tribal areas attracted volunteers Middle East Europe. When reconstituted Taliban insurgent force re-entered Afghanistan large numbers 2004, al-Qaida interested insecure old training camps. Even Pakistan's current offensive.against Taliban al-Qaida tribal areas successful, al-Qaida entity captured destroyed. Its clandestine operatives widely scattered Middle East, Africa, Europe, North South America. As alternatives Afghanistan Pakistan, Yemen, vernacular intelligence community, do/is it. Somalia do/is it. West African states whose writ doesn't extend much beyond capitals do/are it. Grimy North African suburbs major French cities do/are it. British provincial towns Pakistani enclaves do/are it. And Internet's thousands pro-al-Qaida Web sites do/are it. Osama bin Laden deputy Ayman al-Zawahiri believed comfortably installed tribal chiefs compound somewhere near Quetta, capital Pakistan's constantly rebellious Baluchistan province, 48 percent country's land with. 10 million 175 million people. There al-Qaida central issuing orders thousands adherents world over. If the:re connection Afghanistan core problem "no Sept. lls," United States 41 friendly nations there? Even event Taliban victory years come, Taliban would stupid enough invite al-Qaida back. Three months prior Sept. 11, 2001, palpable tension Taliban leader Mullah Omar bin Laden. Omar complained bin Laden issuing "too many fatwas (religious edicts) business didn't complete religious education." Omar also prevented journalists seeing bin Laden. The Taliban leader knows lost power country bin Laden terrorists United States. In today's Afghanistan almost everything turns corruption mismanagement. The average citizen seen little benefit expenditures $250 billion range -- top $1 trillion Iraq. The .U.S. effort plagued fraud, laced mismanagement bereft strategic focus. One example among many others came 2007 United States awarded massive contract worth $300 million A:EY, Florida-based company, supply Afghan army 52 types ammo, chiefly bullets AK-47s. All requirements safety inspections, mandatory ammo delivered U.S. forces, removed. Thus AEY able shop around Eastern Europe cheapest ammo available. Millions rounds old Chinese ammo made 1960s turned substandard. dangerous. The State Department aware going object speed criterion. AEY officers eventually indicted Florida. But U.S. officials involved got slap wrist. Wherever U.S. inspectors look, find fraud abuse. There even cases -- reported GlobalPost reporter Jean Mackenzie -- American contractors paying bribes Taliban ensure aid projects disrupted. This recipe war without end. She also reports disguised Taliban office Kabul reviews aid projects determines amount paid Taliban. If true, United States paying Afghan government fight Taliban also paying Taliban fight Afghan government. The key lies Pakistan. Almost terrorist trails Europe lead back Pakistan -- madrassas. These free Koranic schools stepped vacuum education system poor military takes 50 percent government revenue. A fraction United States spent Iraq Afghanistan would go long way turning Pakistan around. Instead, Congress, infinite wisdom, authorizing $1.2 trillion wars allocated $7.5 billion Pakistan five years -- umpteen caveats. In country 175 million, drop proverbial bucket.

Millennium Challenge Corporation THE WHITE HOUSE Office Press Secretary FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE November 6, 2009 President Obama Taps Cassandra Butts Serve Senior Advisor Millennium Challenge Corporation WASHINGTON - Today, President Barack Obama announced name Deputy White House Counsel Cassandra Q. Butts Senior Advisor Office Chief Executive Officer Millennium Challenge Corporation. President Obama said, "I honored appoint dear friend trusted colleague Cassandra serve important role. The Millennium Challenge Corporation essential partner work combat global poverty, Cassandra brings depth experience true passion justice invaluable success future. I grateful Cassandra's tireless service administration look forward continuing work years ahead." President Obama made following announcement today: Cassandra Q. Butts, Senior Advisor, Office Chief Executive Officer, Millennium Challenge Corporation Cassandra Butts currently Deputy White House Counsel focused judicial nominations. Ms. Butts general counsel Obama-Biden Transition Project. She also served Senior Vice President Domestic Policy Center American Progress. Prior joining CAP, senior advisor House Democratic Leader Richard A. Gephardt (D-MO) worked refugee, asylum immigration issues served policy director 2004 presidential campaign. Ms. Butts also served director Senator Obama's Senate transition 2004-2005. Previously, Assistant Counsel NAACP Legal Defense & Educational Fund also served Legislative Counsel Senator Harris L. Wofford (D-PA). Ms. Butts international election observer Zimbabwean parliamentary elections 2000. She graduate Harvard Law School University North Carolina Chapel Hill. ###

RELEASE IN PART B6 FYI

November 09, 2009 Samuel J. Heyman, stood corporate raider preferred hold companies bought run rather sell quick profit, died Sunday Mount Sinai Hospital Manhattan. He 70. Mr. Heyman's death confirmed wife, Ronnie, said died complications open heart surgery. Mr. Heyman recently chairman GAF Corporation, manufacturer roofing materials, chemical company spun GAF, called International Specialty Products. Both companies based Wayne, N.J. A group led Mr. Heyman bought GAF 1983 took private 1987 stock market crashed. He later spun GAF's chemical business separate company, I.S.P. During period, corporate raiders tended buy companies, cut operational costs sell profit. But Mr. Heyman won battle GAF's management control company, told The New York Times: "There strong potential chemicals, plan make grow." Mr. Heyman, also lawyer, diverse business holdings, including Heyman Properties, owns shopping malls Northeast grew business inherited father. "He extremely methodical. There rhyme reason everything did," said Leon Black, chairman Apollo Management, private equity firm, longtime friend Mr. Heyman's investment banker. Mr. Black added: "He combined strong legal background strong analytical business strength, fierce negotiator. But really made Sam kick builder. It building, whether companies, real estate, art collection family." Mr. Heyman born March 1, 1939, Danbury, Conn., Annette Lazarus Heyman. His father real estate developer. After graduating Yale 1960 Harvard Law School 1964, Mr. Heyman went work Justice Department Robert F. Kennedy served chief assistant United States attorney Connecticut. He cut career short father needed take real estate development business. Mr. Heyman made biggest mark 1983 battle GAF. A group shareholders led Mr. Heyman became frustrated management's resistance selling biggest assets, including chemicals business. Mr. Heyman waged aggressive campaign company's chairman ultimately forced removal shareholder vote - rare victory shareholders time executives public companies considered virtually untouchable. Once Mr. Heyman took control GAF, reversed course held chemicals business, ultimately making big contributor company's profit. He also moved quickly cut costs revamp business, saying time "impatient man. When I see place money saved, I don't waste time." Mr. Heyman also gave away money. In 1999, founded Partnership Public Service, provides fellowships encourage students pursue careers public service. For charity work, Mr. Heyman won President's Citizens Award 2008. His philanthropic interests included establishment Samuel Ronnie Heyman Center Corporate Governance Benjamin N. Cardozo School Law. He wife also collected art. Among holdings works Mark Rothko Jackson Pollock. In addition wife, former Ronnie Feuerstein, Mr. Heyman survived mother, Annette Heyman Palm Beach, Fla.; four children, Lazarus Heyman, Eleanor Propp, Jennifer Millstone Elizabeth Winter; nine grandchildren.

By Andy McSmith Lord Mandelson's attack shines spotlight Tory leader's links media mogul David Cameron accused making "contract" Britain's biggest media company trade political support election government favours afterwards Tories win. It proposed part money paid BBC would siphoned help regional television companies meet threat internet. But would also helped compete effectively Sky News, part Murdoch media empire. There gain BBC climbdown, David Cameron already said Tories freeze licence fee. November 12, 2009 - Dems Fade In Ohio Senate Race, Quinnipiac University Poll Finds; Obama Gets Negative Score In Key Swing State Word format For first time, Republican Rob Portman inching ahead two Democrats 2010 race Ohio's U.S. Senate seat, according Quinnipiac University poll released today. Also first time, Ohio voters disapprove 50 - 45 percent job President Barack Obama doing, 53 - 42 percent approval September 16 49 - 44 percent approval July 7. In still another first, voters split 40 - 40 percent better job handling health care, President Congressional Republicans, independent Quinnipiac (KWIN-uh- pe-ack) University survey finds. In September 16 survey question, Obama top 49 - 28 percent. Ohio voters disapprove 53 - 42 percent way President handling economy disapprove 57 - 36 percent way handling health care. In September, approved handling economy 48 - 46 percent split handling health care 44 - 45 percent. "The Democratic wave swept Ohio 2006 2008 may cresting. The Democratic lead Governor's Senate races evaporated first time President Barack Obama water important swing state country," said Peter Brown, assistant director Quinnipiac University Polling Institute. "Ohio voters happy President's handling health care economy. The fact split whether Republicans Congress better able handle health care worrisome number 1600 Pennsylvania Ave. since GOP still pretty much four-letter word America." Independent voters, often group decides Ohio elections, disapprove 49 - 45 percent overall job Obama disapprove 54 - 39 percent handling economy. They disapprove 62 - 34 percent, almost 2-1, handling health care. "In July, President's job approval began falling nationally high 50s low 60s low 50s, Ohio first place showed polls," said Brown. Portman, former Congressman running U.S. Senate 2010, small leads two Democrats, topping Secretary State Jennifer Brunner 38 - 34 percent Lt. Gov. Lee Fisher 39 - 36 percent. In battle Democratic Senate nomination, Fisher gets 24 percent Brunner's 22 percent, 51 percent undecided. Portman leads car dealer Tom Ganley 26 - 7 percent GOP primary 64 percent undecided. "None Senate candidates well known, significant Democrats winning Senate matchups. Clearly least temporary swing toward GOP Ohio. Whether continues anyone's guess," said Brown. Ohio voters oppose Obama's health care plan 55 - 36 percent, independents 57 - 33 percent. By 61 - 35 percent margin, voters don't think Congress approve health care overhaul gets Democratic votes. But Ohio voters support 53 - 40 percent giving people option government health insurance plan. Independent voters support public option 55 - 38 percent. Afghanistan The United States right thing fighting Afghanistan, Ohio voters say 48 - 43 percent. Voters support 51 - 40 percent recommendations top U.S. commanders Afghanistan 40,000 U.S. troops sent. "But 55 percent Ohioans say willing see large numbers American troops Afghanistan two years less, hardly mandate type long-term commitment Pentagon said needed victory," said Brown. From November 5 - 9, Quinnipiac University surveyed 1,123 Ohio voters, margin error +/- 2.9 percentage points. The survey includes 406 Republicans 394 Democrats, margin error +/- 4.9 percentage points. The Quinnipiac University Poll, directed Douglas Schwartz, Ph.D., conducts public opinion surveys Florida, Pennsylvania, New York, New Jersey, Connecticut, Ohio nation public service research. For data RSS feed- http://www.quinnipiac.edu/polling.xml, call (203) 582-5201, follow us Twitter. Sen. Christopher Dodd (D-CT) still serious trouble re-election race 53% voters saying deserve re-election, new Quinnipiac poll finds. Connecticut voters disapprove, 54% 40%, job Dodd doing, compared 49% 43% disapproval September. In general election match ups, Dodd loses Rob Simmons (R), 49% 38%, Linda McMahon (R), 43% 41%.

Sid Return Article November 13, 2009 Can Clinton Coalition Survive Obama? By Sean Trende John Judis Ruy Teixeira's well-regarded 2002 work The Emerging Democratic Majority begins vignette set Virginia. They tell story telecom executive named Mark Warner, runs moderate campaign appeals upper-middle class suburbanites working class rural voters, manages put together winning coalition that, imitated states, might put Democrats power decades come. Democrats build coalitions similar Warner's, fact better part decade. Warner's coalition essentially Bill Clinton's 1996 coalition. The coalition brand Clinton built extraordinarily successful one Democrats, breaking momentum resurgent GOP 1996, ultimately enabling election liberal President American History last year. Given background, it's appropriate first tangible sign coalition coming unglued come Virginia. Republican Bob McDonnell won governorship almost 59% vote — highest percentage (though highest victory margin) governor since 1961. The entire Republican ticket won similar margins, GOP picked six seats General Assembly. It could even worse — five Democrats won Assembly races fewer 1,000 votes. There superficial lessons drawn here. After last week's election, it's silly argue GOP brand damaged take advantage Democratic weakness. And Democrats' latest spin — weakness among Independents simply function Republicans calling independents retaining Republican voting habits — puts lie argument Republicans' low self-identification salient factor elections. But important lesson this: there's little predictive value off-year elections, provide snapshots mood electorate, present state political coalitions. Given Virginia's primacy story Democratic coalition building, gives us good snapshot state coalition. And it's pretty one Democrats. The historical base Democratic Party two centuries long Jay Cost I call Jacksonians: Culturally conservative, hawkish, populist whites located throughout South Border states. They began breaking away Democrats 1950s 1960s — reaction Party's embrace unions, blacks liberals story well known there's need rehash here. But group remained least play Democrats. Clinton inherited coalition consisting minorities, liberals, urban voters, decent remnant Jacksonian voters Ohio River Valley South, still preferred moderate-to-conservative Democrat Republican. This coalition became majority coalition Clinton used combination fiscal conservatism social moderation bring suburban voters board. This huge innovation Democrats; suburbs like Nassau County, NY, Orange County, CA Fairfax County, VA fueled rise Republican parties states. Clinton moved substantially toward side. This coalition allowed win eight points 1996; absent Perot last-minute fundraising scandal, probably would won more. Clinton intuited suburban voters are, generally speaking, culturally cosmopolitan — don't like call someone "macaca," aren't crazy religious right. But they're generally particularly socially liberal either, fans "law order." They like taxes low appreciate economic growth, like good schools clean environment. Having balance bunch spending priorities somewhat limited income daily lives, balanced budgets ultimate "good government" indicator voters. Clinton delivered issues, keeping tax increases fairly small, balancing budget much term. In — important — re-branded Democrats party fiscal responsibility, economic growth, moderate taxes, smart government. In words, finally shed "Carter" label Democrats. This, turn, made plausible much liberal heirs benefit presumption competence Democrats - one probably would enjoyed without him. George W. Bush's presidency, turn, upper-middle class suburbanite's nightmare. An aggressive social agenda, fiscal trainwreck, two poorly-managed wars financial collapse later, suburban voters trended even heavily Democratic Clinton era. By 2008, Democrats held suburban districts around , major metropolitan areas, threatening exurbs. The right Democratic candidate probably could put together massive 2008 Presidential majority, combining minorities, liberals, Jacksonians, Catholics, suburbanites. The mood country certainly right 1920/1932/1952/1980 result. But Democrats nominated Barack Obama. The party's grip among Jacksonians weakened since Clinton left stage, abandoned Obama completely. Jay Cost I detailed here. This movement Obama received 53% vote, instead 60% might expect given voters' attitude toward Bush's Presidency. Obama able win even without branch Democratic party generated intensity among remaining portions base. In words, base wasn't broad Clinton's, deeper. Faced vanishing 401ks home values, disgust Bush's presidency, suburbanites flocked him. Liberals enthralled finally elect one own. And minorities turned heavily opportunity elect first black President. But presents problem. You get elect first black President once, governing coalition suburbanites, poor blacks, upper class liberals isn't easy. It hard keep enthusiasm up. And Jacksonian wing party gone, enthusiasm dissipates, one coalition groups becomes disgruntled starts shuffle door, party isn't left much. We see microcosm story last Tuesday's elections, especially Virginia. Let's backtrack 2001, look counties Mark Warner won. The coalition Warner built similar Clinton's. To oversimplify some, blended together rural Democrats mining counties west state, college voters around Charlottesville, black voters combined rural whites south central southeastern portion state suburban voters northeast. It diverse coalition, worked. Now let's compare Warner's map Obama's map 2008: The suburbs stayed Democrat's camp, reasons discussed above. But look happens west! That area becomes solidly Republican. Buchanan Dickenson counties Virginia panhandle voted Dukakis, Mondale, Adlai Stevenson (twice). Obama became second Democrat lose counties since UMW moved 1920s. As I said, isn't problem long (1) Jacksonians show willingness come back candidate Obama and/or (2) suburbs continue love affair Democrats. But see indications Virginia Jacksonian divorce may, fact, permanent. Creigh Deeds western section state, seemed — least paper — capable remaking Mark Warner map. It didn't happen, obviously. Let's look Virginia changed Bush's 2000 election Deeds' loss last week: The redder county is, moved toward Republicans 2000 2009; bluer counties moved toward Democrats. We see McDonnell well Bush suburbs — better. Those pockets white DC suburbs northeast, Hampton Roads area southeast, Richmond north west Hampton Roads. Its rural Virginia — still 1/3 electorate — made difference Bush's 54% 2004 McDonnell's 59% Tuesday. Even Obama ticket, much less cosmopolitan figure atop ticket, rural Virginia went solidly Republican. We take another angle here. Deeds McDonnell squared close Attorney General race 2005. Let's compare Deeds' 2005 showing 2009 performance. [NOTE: In map, look "relative movement." Because everything state moved toward McDonnell, map showing "movement" would solid dark red, much use. So instead, something moved 9 points toward McDonnell, colored shade red, moved less 9 points toward McDonnell, blue. Think showing change counties' PVI]. We see result. Just since 2005, rural Virginia moved sharply Democrats. The suburbs haven't moved much all, relative rest state, heavily African American counties southern portion state moved notches leftward (in absolute terms, voted 2009 2005). This suggests lasting damage Democratic brand simply personal Obama. Now let's look McDonnell compared McCain 2008. Again, movement dramatic statewide, need isolate biggest smallest changes looking "relative" shifts. The western counties state didn't shift much 2008, that's already giving Republicans around 70% vote — wasn't much room Republican growth (and remember, "blue" relative map still means slight movement toward Republican since 2008)! The real Republican gains past year come DC exurbs, 1-95 corridor, lesser extent Hampton Roads area. In words, Jacksonians aren't returning Democrats, least Virginia. Deeds might still able win without them, Democrats also showing weakness Virginia suburbs. In words, two pieces Clinton-Warner coalition starting break away. This real problem Democrats. If suburbanites Jacksonians move away party, very, little left them. And there's reason think suburban weakness real. Obama's fiscal policy, make understatement, hasn't Clintonian. It may entirely fault, $787 billion stimulus, trillion dollar healthcare bill, automobile bailout, budget showing trillion dollar deficits extending next decade make suburbanites shudder. They don't much like debt, intuit spending going paid point — probably them. Voters still give Obama benefit doubt, Presidents first year, becoming very, worried, probably don't put much stock Candidate Obama's promise enact net spending cut more. Democrats doubtless chalk Creigh Deeds' inept campaign. Deeds wasn't great candidate, mood country starting swing party, hard run good campaign. Jerry Kilgore found ran similar environment 2005, reduced attacking Tim Kaine religious views death penalty. And run Deeds-McDonnell race 2006 2008, I think hard argue McDonnell would win 18 points, even holding everything else equal. The problem explanation saw similar results replicated around country. Most seats House Delegates Democrats lost Virginia, came close losing, suburban. The Philly suburbs voted Republican state Supreme Court. Bergen County New Jersey didn't give Republican 60% vote like 1984, Chris Christie nearly carried it, even though significantly conservative Christie Todd Whitman Tom Kean, won largest margin first-term Republican Governor since 1969. Conservative Republicans won elections Westchester County, New York, Republicans picked two City Council seats outskirts Queens. Republicans won back Nassau County legislature -- Democrats' capture body figures prominently introduction Emerging Democratic Majority -- nearly defeated Democratic County Executive obscure, underfunded candidate. In words, places never heard Creigh Deeds seen attack ads McDonell's thesis, Democrats still lost suburban voters. States Democratic base liberals, urbanites, minority voters -- like California New York -- haven't moved much Democrats. Obama's polling numbers, well Democratic candidates Governor Senator, classic "Emerging Democratic Majority" states like Colorado Nevada looking good all. And course Jacksonian states like Kentucky, he's 40%. This doesn't mean Democrats doomed 2010. An improved economy, Republican missteps, host factors could keep band together them. Maybe marginal voters Obama brought polls enact hope change return 2010 keep hope alive. But personal nature Obama's victory starting show downside downticket Democrats. The Clinton coalition looking creaky. If Obama doesn't improve coalition comes apart, Democrats could find weaker even 1980s 1990s. Sean Trende reached strende@realclearpolitics.com. Gelb November 22, 2009 I 10:50pm The Asia trip worth Obama's time. Leslie H. Gelb president shake foreign policy team—and make sure deals done leaves home. President Obama's nine-day trip Asia worth look back fix two potent problems, past future. First, trip's limited value per day presidential effort suggests disturbing amateurishness managing America's power. On top inexcusably clumsy review Afghan policy fumbling Mideast negotiations, message Mr. Obama clear: He stare hard skills foreign-policy team and, so, dominant role decision-making. Something awry somewhere, he's got fix it. Secondly, Asia trip presented important opportunity carve new American leadership role world's dynamic economic region, Mr. Obama missed it. He scratched surface calls multilateralism mutual understanding. He needs paint pictures Washington help solve regional security trade problems. Otherwise, Asian nations continue unwanted drift toward China away United States. A meditation journey start forgetting half last week's commentary. Unbelievably, criticized Obama getting China "throw weight around." What Asian leaders want that? None I know of. Others lamented Obama couldn't make "demands" China anymore. The presumption China king, Washington longer way Beijing. The facts Washington never boss Beijing around, China ruling roost (more accurately, it's sitting eggs). Others contended Obama continued pattern trashing America's friends coddling authoritarian enemies like China. It's hard stomach nonsense conservative crowd forever praised George W. Bush accommodating China alienating America's allies. Some analysts played fair acknowledged administration officials tried tell reporters expect "deliverables" trip, see journey recognition Asia's new importance America's desire new co- operative spirit. That's commendable thought, hardly justification almost two weeks president's time (when consider preparations)— especially he's got tanking economy, health-care reform woes, decisions make Afghanistan. Presidents take trips like one need breakthroughs accomplishments certain issues can't agreed without pressure impending presidential visit. In fact, presidents wouldn't even commit trips abroad without knowing key deals would finally agreed announced visit itself. The prospective visit power jackhammer nail deals. Just take gander trips planned Richard Nixon Henry Kissinger George H. W. Bush James Baker. Obama's travels chance settle make concrete progress thorny issues like greenhouse-gas emissions, fate U.S. bases Okinawa, new Japanese government insists moving. It time announce ways gain fixes U.S.-South Korean trade treaty, long stalled Congress. It moment show Beijing would actually make mutually beneficial compromises exchange rates economic sanctions Iranian North Korean nuclear programs. Absent guarantees progress issues these, Mr. Obama taken well- deserved vacation Hawaii. Matters made worse scene. It good optics Obama bow Japan's emperor. He seems stuff spontaneously inexplicably, bow Saudi King months ago. And truly unfortunate Obama aides didn't flatly insist allowed address Chinese people directly television meet non-stacked Chinese groups—as case previous presidential visits. Beijing's leaders obviously didn't feel confident enough standing home give popular Mr. Obama access. But team made precondition visit. Its absence left unhappy taste. The Asia trip presented important opportunity carve new American leadership role world's dynamic economic region, Mr. Obama missed it. The White House might try blame State Department (such easy delicious target) missteps. But State's role conceptual planning trip central, department's senior Asia hand, Kurt Campbell, surely knew better. Asia overflowing multilateral organizations. Washington member key ones, like Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation Asian Development Bank. But little new key groupings Shanghai Cooperation Organization (Russia, China, Uzbekistan, etc.) ASEAN, association Southeast Asian nations. Asian nations increasingly organizing groups, Washington hasn't really figured role. Most Asian nations want role prominent one—in fact, leadership position. They're afraid China, afraid China won't attentive concerns future America past. At time, don't want Washington come groupings cause problems Beijing. They want Washington figure leadership position constructed proven American ability help solve common problems common interest. They want America remember, one get things done doesn't let problems fester. That U.S. policy main missing ingredient Obama's trip. Asian nations yearning kind creativity today brilliant American president new Pacific Era. Leslie H. Sid http://www.nydailynews.com/opinions/2009/11/15/2009-11- 15_the_worst_is_yet_to_come_unemployed_americans_should_hunker_down_for_more job_lo.html The worst yet come: Unemployed Americans hunker job losses BY Nouriel Roubini Sunday, November 15th 2009, 4:00 AM Think worst over? Wrong. Conditions U.S. labor markets awful worsening. While official unemployment rate already 10.2% another 200,000 jobs lost October, include discouraged workers partially employed workers figure whopping 17.5%. While losing 200,000 jobs per month better 700,000 jobs lost January, current job losses still average per month rate 150,000 last recession. Also, remember: The last recession ended November 2001, job losses continued year half June 2003; ditto 1990-91 recession. So expect job losses continue end 2010 earliest. In words, unemployed looking work waiting economy turn corner, better hunker down. All economic numbers suggest take while. The jobs coming back. There's really one hope leaders turn things around: bold prescription increases fiscal stimulus another round labor-intensive, shovel-ready infrastructure projects, helps fiscally strapped state local governments provides temporary tax credit private sector hire workers. Helping unemployed extending unemployment benefits necessary sufficient; leads persistent unemployment rather job creation. The long-term picture workers families even worse current job loss numbers alone would suggest. Now way sharing pain, many firms telling workers cut hours, take furloughs accept lower wages. Specifically, fall hours worked equivalent another 3 million full time jobs lost top 7.5 million jobs formally lost. This bad news must face facts. Many lost jobs gone forever, including construction jobs, finance jobs manufacturing jobs. Recent studies suggest quarter U.S. jobs fully out-sourceable time countries. Other measures tell ugly story: The average length unemployment time high; ratio job applicants vacancies 6 1; initial claims continued claims high millions unemployed resorting exceptional extended unemployment benefits programs staying longer. Based best judgment, likely unemployment rate peak close 11% remain high level two years more. The weakness labor markets sharp fall labor income ensure weak recovery private consumption anemic recovery economy, increases risk double dip recession. As result terribly weak labor markets, expect weak recovery consumption economic growth; larger budget deficits; greater delinquencies residential commercial real estate greater fall home commercial real estate prices; greater losses banks financial institutions residential commercial real estate mortgages, credit cards, auto loans student loans thus greater rate failures banks; greater protectionist,pressures. The damage extensive severe unless bold policy action undertaken now. Roubini professor Economics Stern School Business New York University Chairman Roubini Global Economics. sbwhoeop Tuesday, November 17, 2009 8:57 AM H FYI: Lead FT editorial today, must haven't read. Sid Financial Times FT.com OMMENT editorial US fumbling new China tone Published: November 16 2009 20:39 I Last updated: November 16 2009 20:39 Gone days US president could visit Beijing unassailable top dog, able lecture Chinese everything human rights overvalued currency. As become fashionable note, events instead obliged Barack Obama play role washed-up debtor visiting stern bank manager yet another loan. That analogy useful. But overdone. Certainly, financial crisis brought sharp relief dependent US become foreign creditors, chief among China. It also sharpened perception happening anyway, relative decline US-centric west relative rise China-centric Asia. But word relative important. China, poor riddled internal contradictions, yet, long way. The changing relationship China demand new tone. But early indications Mr Obama still fumbling right one. Take global imbalances. In set-piece speech Asian tour — delivered Japan, perhaps assure hosts Washington abandoning Tokyo yet — Mr Obama correctly pointed global economy cannot go back business usual. "One important lessons recession taught us limits depending primarily American consumers Asian exports drive growth," said. That quite right. But entreaties global rebalancing fall flat China. That partly Beijing remains publicly sceptical US's long-term finances. From China's perspective, Mr Obama's emergency measures stimulate US economy persuade Americans spend way recession smack re-creating spendthrift ways triggered crisis first place. That explains Chinese officials quizzed US counterparts robustly intend pay healthcare reform. It also Beijing started questioning US monetary, well fiscal, policy. On eve US president's visit, Liu Mingkang, China's chief banking regulator, took swipe US Federal Reserve, saying combination weak dollar low interest rates risked generating global asset bubble. That bit rich coming someone oversees banking system pumped equivalent nearly 30 per cent gross domestic product economy far year. But reflects new tone China presumes address humbled superpower. Mr Obama's efforts occupy moral high ground also undermined flirtation protectionism, particularly decision slap tariffs Chinese tyres. His administration failed spell convincing trade policy — seen stark omission for-a business- oriented Asian audience. Such perceived deficiencies hobbled ability cajole China real conviction. When comes human rights, too, US seems drawn conclusion good policy badmouth chief creditor. Hillary Clinton, secretary state, set tone early said human rights "interfere" matters implicitly greater urgency. Mr Obama obligingly omitted references Tibet, Xinjiang even Taiwan Tokyo speech. There also single mention India, potential regional counterweight China, yet another indication Washington behaving though treading eggshells. It therefore refreshing hear Mr Obama criticise Chinese censorship town hall meeting Shanghai Monday — though even could undo self-censorship refusing meet Dalai Lama week's trip. It right proper US acknowledge rising significance China. Mr Obama's assurances China's rise need threat spot on. But token, US accommodation taken far. Contrary common perception, China's huge holdings US treasuries sign great strength. They evidence dependent Chinese growth US consumer. Equally, idea China, economy less third size US GDP per capita roughly Angola's, somehow save world ludicrous. Mr Obama right show respect China. He need — must — kowtow.
