Council Foreign Relations Expert Brief The U.S.-China Economic Relationship: Separating Facts Myths Steven Dunaway, Adjunct Senior Fellow International Economics Author: Former deputy director Asia Pacific department International Monetary Fund. Author Council Special Report, Global Imbalances Financial Crisis. November 16, 2009 http://www.cfr.org/publication/20757/uschina_economic_relationship.html?breadcrumb=°/02Fregion%2F271%2Fchina Many myths surround economic relationship United States China. Four, particular, stand out, important identify myths avoid misunderstandings could adversely influence policy decisions. The fact China become largest foreign holder U.S. government securities taken indicating United States heavily dependent China finance budget deficits. Similarly, since China major source U.S. imports, U.S. consumers seen dependent cheap Chinese goods. In addition, Chinese authorities emphasized strongly resist external pressures try influence policy decisions economic instability China bad, adverse implications rest world. Taken together, four myths could lead conclusion China pushed hard United States (or major countries) quickly change policies, especially exchange rate policy, facilitate rebalancing economy. But conclusion would major mistake, trip Asia, President Barack Obama needs dispel myths bring pressure bear faster economic policy changes China. This would keeping objectives dealing global imbalances laid G-20 summit Pittsburgh September 2009. Myth No. 1: Washington limited leverage China main "banker" United States China holds large amount U.S. government securities. Of China's $2.3 trillion official reserves, estimated 70 percent held U.S. dollar assets. China big customer U.S. debt, America's banker. Nor United States dependent China finance budget deficits. If China elects buy U.S. Treasuries, willing public private sector buyers, indicated strong demand securities worldwide. Although U.S. government might pay higher interest rates incentive get investors buy Treasuries event Chinese reduce demand, increase interest rates would likely small. Major consequences decision China reduce purchases U.S. Treasury securities would depend reason behind decision. It would China's best interest (and beneficial rest world well) China reduced purchases U.S. Treasuries decided stop heavily managing exchange rate allow greater flexibility currency's movements. This important policy change required China going rebalance economy able sustain rapid growth. China big customer U.S. debt, America's banker. Nor United States dependent China finance budget deficits. If instead China continues heavily manage exchange rate, build large additional amounts official reserves. If decides hold less additional reserves U.S. Treasury securities, China increase purchases assets denominated currencies, euro-denominated securities likely alternative. In circumstances, China would continue intervene exchange market, central bank buying U.S. dollars Chinese renminbi selling dollars euro acquire European assets. The result would appreciation euro. Consequently, countries Europe, United States, would probably affected China's move negative impact euro appreciation European economic activity would likely far outweigh effects United States smaller Chinese purchases Treasuries. Alternatively, China could choose start dumping stock U.S. securities. The result would appreciation major currencies (depending China would decide park reserve assets); upward pressure U.S. interest rates; possibility financial market disruptions China dumped U.S. dollar assets rapidly. However, U.S. Federal Reserve could limit rise U.S. interest rates would able ensure adequate liquidity prevent market disruptions. But decision dump Treasuries would large effect China itself. The country would incur substantial capital loss reserve assets. The Chinese authorities deeply concerned loss, unlikely decide dump U.S. assets. In fact, discussion initiated China regarding need alternative official reserve asset motivated concerns potential losses U.S. dollar holdings. Myth No. 2: The United States heavily dependent cheap Chinese goods This really true. Only roughly 15 percent U.S. imports come China. Moreover, basic types manufactured consumer goods China exports United States (clothing, textiles, footwear, toys, small appliances, etc.) imported countries could produced domestically. The prices goods could substitute products China would higher, difference costs would relatively small. Competition among producers become fiercer, result cost differentials goods China suppliers narrowing. Dependence actually runs way. China highly dependent U.S. demand products. Economic growth China heavily dependent exports. Although China able achieve 8 percent GDP growth target 2009 owing stimulus domestic demand provided government policy actions, country struggle meet objective 2010 succeeding years demand exports United States pick up. Myth No. 3: External pressure China policy changes counterproductive. The Chinese authorities stress face external pressure, tend strongly resist economic policy changes. The Chinese particular used argument try fend pressures appreciation exchange rate. While country wants appear weak susceptible external pressure, truth that, pressure, less incentive change policy. This especially true China, authorities wedded status quo past success inclined make gradual changes economic policies. Recent developments China's exchange rate illustrate point. In absence external pressure since August 2008, China reverted fixing exchange rate relative U.S. dollar. Without hard push United States bilateral multilateral basis, changes China's policies likely delayed, best interest United States rest world. Myth No. 4: Instability bad China Chinese authorities also suggested instability China bad rest world adverse effects China's growth rate. But instability (or fear instability) played big role initiating economic policy changes China. For example, concern instability arising growing gap urban rural incomes major factor behind new initiatives develop China's interior (such Develop West program) improve conditions opportunities rural population (including breaking restrictions discriminatory treatment migrant workers). Hence, China, instability necessarily bad, problem authorities. Instability China also necessarily bad rest world effect China's growth. Although China accounts significant portion world GDP growth, country generate much demand products countries given China's large trade current account surpluses. Some countries Asia commodity producers may benefiting China's strong growth, overall, providing much stimulus world economy whole, slower growth China little effect economic activity rest world. It important President Obama separate fact myth economic policy discussions Chinese authorities trip Asia build sounder relationship. The president shy away pushing Chinese hard economic reform rebalancing China's economy, done private discussions China's senior leaders. Multilateral discussions, context G-20 process, much effective forum United States take public stance China's economic policies jointly major economies. Without hard push United States bilateral multilateral basis, changes China's policies likely delayed, best interest United States rest world. It also best interest China, without shift away heavy dependence investment exports drive growth toward greater reliance consumption, China able sustain rapid economic growth development. Getting China fully realize act quickly authorities inclined considerable task United States major economies.

Joe Wilson's Rebel Yell Inside racist klavern Joe Wilson joined By Max Blumenthal Since Republican Rep. Joe Wilson South Carolina bellowed President Barack Obama, "You lie!" president's nationally televised speech healthcare, fourth term backbencher emerged hero among conservative grassroots. One enthusiastic endorsements Wilson's histrionics came Sons Confederate Veterans (SCV), group Wilson <a href=http://crooksandliars.com/david-neiwert/obama-heckler-joe-wilson-member- neo>belonged to</a> several years. "Mr. Wilson, never apologize allowing love truth overrun desire polite," SCV Tea Party <a href=http://scvteaparty.com/?p=165>declared</a> website. "It liar must apologize, one identifies liar!" Who SCV? A once-proud organization Confederate history buffs re- enactors spent organization's money restore Civil War-era battlefields Confederate cemeteries, 2006 SCV substantially <a href=http ://www. sp lcenter. org/inte l/intelreport/artic le .j sp?pid=1027 >taken over</a> organized cadre white supremacist radicals (read <a href=http://www.splcenter.org/intel/intelreport/article.jsp?pid=154 >here</a> background) sought turn nation's oldest Southern historical society veteran white supremacist activist Kirk Lyons called "a modern, 21st century Christian war machine capable uniting Confederate community leading ultimate victory." When racist junta seized much SCV's leadership positions, Southern Poverty Law Center released <a href=http://www.splcenter.org/intel/intelreport/article.jsp?sid=90 >extensive list</a> SCV officials belonged "hate groups." Lyons, key leader white supremacists took SCV, <a href=hftp://www.thenation.com/doc/20050829/blumenthal/single >harbored dreams</a> creating seemingly benign front group sophisticated version Ku Klux Klan. "I great respect Klan historically, but, sadly Klan today ineffective sometimes even destructive," Lyons told German neo-Nazi magazine 1992. "It would good Klan followed advice former Klansman Robert Miles: 'Become invisible. Hang robes hoods cupboard become underground org anization.'" With SCV, Lyons discovered didn't go underground all. Once Lyons helped install close friend, Ron Wilson, president SCV, organization's political newsletter, <a href=http://fpacscv.org/southernmercury/ >The Southern Mercury</a> (where Wilson served senior editor), transformed propaganda mill crude white supremacist cant. Mailed dues-paying members SCV — presumably including Rep. Joe Wilson — went defunct 2008, Mercury published articles describing blacks genetically inferior whites, calling African-Americans "a childlike people," warned Obama runs re-election, race riots "exceedingly violent nature" would immediately ensure, leaving "entire sections cities ruins." Here highlights Southern Mercury: "After turn 20th century, white Southerners disfranchised segregated blacks, perhaps mildest reaction possible at=2 Othat time blacks' transgressions. The blacks — childlike people — selling votes Democrats en masse $.25 apiece national elections." --"Where We Stand Now, And How We Got Here," Frank Conner, Southern Mercury, September/October 2003 "Previously, anthropologists routinely recorded notable differences IQ among races; Columbia, liberal cultural anthropologist named Franz Boas...decreed differences IQ among races, biological differences blacks whites superficial nature... Meanwhile, liberals media heaped special praise upon black athletes, musicians, singers, writers — treated typical black race. The liberals creating false image blacks America highly competent people held back prejudiced white Southerners." --Conner, September/October 2003 "It clear Barack Obama elected President, would extremely anti-white would demand reparations slavery press hard affirmative action degree would hurt young whites seeking jobs admission College Graduate Schools." --"Americans Face The Worst Presidential Candidates In History," Robert Slimp, Southern Mercury, May/June 2008 "I believe [Obama's] rhetoric anti-white legislative proposals would stir racial riots. If running re-election, riots would turn exceedingly violent nature would seriously damage race relations America, leave entire sections cities ruins." --Slimp, May/June 2008 Rep. Joe Wilson could resigned SCV soon organization's takeover open white supremacists began. But didn't. Or could withdrawn membership SCV's flagship journal turned racist rag. But didn't. Instead, serving state senator, Wilson led SCV-inspired campaign 2000 keep Confederate flag flying South Carolina's state capitol. "The Southern heritage, Confederate heritage, honorable," Wilson <a href=http ://news. bbc . co .uk/2/hi/americas/503579.stm>proclaimed</a> time, responding critics Confederate flag. Wilson's rebel yell Obama electrified Republican grassroots, filling campaign coffers donations <a href=http://wwvv.freep.com/article/20090910/BLOG36/90910072/Wilson-takes- case-online--pleads-for-donations>he soliciting</a> conservatives across country earning undistinguished, previously unknown backbencher primetime appearances right-wing talk shows. Wilson become new voice Republican opposition, reigniting Lost Cause raucous crusade sabotage healthcare reform.

Mills, Cheryl D <MillsCD@state.gov> Monday, September 14, 2009 10:51 AM H FW: Hitting Bottom Foggy Bottom RELEASE IN FULL FP FortAgn Policy Hitting Bottom Foggy Bottom The State Department suffers low morale, bottlenecks, bureaucratic ineptitude. Do need kill save it? BY MATTHEW ARMSTRONG I SEPTEMBER 11, 2009 Discussion fate Foggy Bottom usually focuses tenure Secretary State Hillary Clinton, troubles public diplomacy, rise special envoys everything European pipelines Afghanistan Pakistan. But Americans would benefit reassessment core functionality U.S. State Department. Years neglect marginalization, well dearth long-term vision strategic planning, left 19th- century institution hamstrung fiefdoms bureaucratic bottlenecks. The Pentagon funds controls wide range foreign-policy diplomatic priorities -- development public diplomacy beyond. The world changed, everyone politicians talking heads terrorists directly influencing global audiences. The pressing issues stateless: pandemics, recession, terrorism, poverty, proliferation, conflict. But report report, investigation investigation, highlighted, State Department broken paralyzed, unable respond new 21st-century paradigm. But get bad? Is possible fix? Or push wall like great Humpty Dumpty reassign pieces? There growing evidence internal machinations State Department corrupted "core missions" traditional diplomacy public diplomacy. This year, example, Government Accountability Office (gao) found department completely failed four-year-old attempt reorganize nonproliferation bureau (a bureau remains leaderless). Besides failing address mission overlap, low morale, lack career opportunities, failed reorganization caused significant drop expertise offices focused proliferation issues -- including "today's threats posted Iran, North Korea, Syria," gao's report said -- coordination bodies like International Atomic Energy Agency. Another report State Department's inspector general year described severe broad dysfunction within Africa bureau, ignoring -- perhaps considering given -- lack departmentwide integration leadership operations. Examples dysfunction range providing public diplomacy personnel computers capable reading interoffice memos failure effectively work new Africa Command. By necessity, Defense Department stepped State Department tuned out: Foggy Bottom relies Pentagon funding even personnel basic operations central mission. For example, Defense Department performs much strategic communications work traditionally purview State Department. In Somalia, example, State Department's budget public diplomacy $30,000. The Pentagon's $600,000. And, State Department's bureaucratic wisdom, $30,000 even belong undersecretary public diplomacy public affairs. Further, rivalries different "cones" -- career tracks, referred one insider "conal caste system" -- State Department severely impact morale, career growth, even operations. The report Africa bureau noted 2002, public affairs public diplomacy "failed office" -- situation worse 2009. Public outreach workers said bureau's leadership "does understand public diplomacy." The sentiment widespread. A 2008 report congressional ombudsman, U.S. Advisory Commission Public Diplomacy, described systemic failure support train public diplomacy officers field, well professional discrimination career track. Attempts fix State Department focused short-term issues, ameliorating shortages human financial resources. The last eight secretaries state attempted bolster department bolstering bottom line. No less Defense Secretary Robert Gates chairman Joint Chiefs Staff, Adm. Mike Mullen, long suggested transferring funds Defense Department State Department. But situation dire State Department, point, could even absorb spend much-needed infusion cash. If wholesale transfer funds tomorrow, lack capacity skills State department would mean would give back Defenk Department dole contractors. The creeping militarization U.S. foreign policy deeply worrying, Gates Mullen, also luminaries Secretary Clinton Vice President Joe Biden. In 2008, then-Senator Biden questioned "expanding role military U.S. foreign policy." He said concerned "migration functions authorities U.S. civilian agencies Department Defense." Some commentators even wondered aloud whether best way fix State Department might destroy it. Foggy Bottom could retain small core staff embassies ambassadors. All functions -- public diplomacy, countering misinformation propaganda, development, including provincial reconstruction staffing -- could migrate Pentagon become wholly independent agencies. But atomizing State Department would ultimately prove dangerous militarization foreign policy. The Pentagon needs counterbalance, vertically integrated State Department president, Congress, U.S. public count on. Change, rather creative destruction, Foggy Bottom needs. Envision State Department capable leading whole-of-government initiatives strategic focus instead one hidebound department geared structure tradition execute state-to-state diplomacy. This "Department State Non-State" would deft tackling stateless terrorist networks hurricanes would fostering upholding alliances foreign ministers. To transform Foggy Bottom way require breaking rigid hierarchy, stovepipes, bottlenecks make Pentagon look lean dynamic comparison. Modern global affairs compartmentalized political borders. Besides expanding overly shallow narrow authorities public diplomacy bureau, Clinton must restructure State Department focus less countries regions. Currently, Foggy Bottom's regional bureaus, Near East Affairs, configured oversee patch embassies. Country desk officers, ambassadors, report assistant secretary, regional head. The assistant secretary turn reports undersecretary, reports Clinton. Clinton name regional bureau heads, currently assistant secretaries, undersecretary status. This would help eliminate unnecessary bureaucratic layer would also align State Department Defense Department (which powerful regional commands, Centcom Africom). The State Department's regional leaders would hold equivalent civilian rank four-star combatant commanders like Gen. David Petraeus. These changes would promise improve communications, synchronize missions, put department right path today's requirements. But Clinton beware reforming State Department quickly within -- efforts could paralyzed bureaucracy mutiny would simply wait out. U.S. national security would suffer Pentagon's growing power would become entrenched. Clinton need clear unequivocal support president importantly Congress, authorizes State Department spending bills, chance success. In burst activity Barack Obama's election, Congress authorized money people State Department pushed greater public diplomacy. Still required. The question asked last eight years State Department abrogated various responsibilities -- Defense, who? -- not, indeed cannot, answered department steps plate becomes effective visible leading implementing U.S. foreign policy. This take time. But, saying goes, time like present. The United States Congress supports change, secretaries state defense want change, president whose entire election platform built around word "change," American public would outraged dysfunction knew details. 3

Cheryl Mills < Sunday, December 6, 2009 9:39 PM Fwd: Charles Blow NYT today EF1 December 5, 2009 Op-Ed Columnist Black Age Obama By CHARLES M. BLOW A hundred fifty years ago, Charles Dickens opened "A Tale Two Cities" now-famous phrase: "It best times, worst times. ..." Those words resonated recently contemplating impact Obama presidency blacks America. So far, it's mixed. Blacks living tale two Americas — one ascension first black president cultural capital accrues; collapsing quality life amplified racial tensions, supporting president loath even acknowledge pain, let alone commiserate it. Last year, blacks dared dream anew, envisioning future Obama's election would catalyst era prosperity racial harmony. Now election's afterglow nearly faded, hysteria hope ground hard stone reality. Things gotten better. In many ways, they've gotten worse. The recession, one, dealt particularly punishing uneven hand blacks. A May report Pew Research Center found blacks likely get higher-priced subprime loans, leading higher foreclosure rates. In fact, blacks displaced Hispanics group lowest homeownership rates. According recent jobs data, unemployment rate blacks nearly twice whites, gap important demographics widened rapidly since Obama took office. The unemployment rate time white college graduates 24 years old grew 20 percent. For black cohorts, rate grew twice much. And report published last month Department Agriculture found 2008, "food insecurity" American households risen record levels, black children likely experience food insecurity. Things racial front bad. We inundated examples overt racism scale unaccustomed. Any protester racist poster hijack news cycle, racist image live forever Internet. In fact, racially offensive images first couple prolific online Google runs apologetic ad results image searches them. And it's words images; it's actions well. According Federal Bureau Investigation's 2008 hate crimes data released last week, anti-black hate crimes rose 4 percent 2007, combined hate crimes racial categories declined 11 percent. If look two-year trend, would include Obarna's ascension candidate, anti-black hate crimes risen 8 percent, racial groups fallen 19 percent. This sobering effect blacks. According Nov. 9 report Gallup, last summer 23 percent blacks thought race relations would get lot better election Obama. Now less half percentage says things actually gotten lot better. The racial animosity Obama's election stirred may contributed rallying effect among blacks. According Gallup report published Nov. 24, Obama's approval rating among whites dropped 39 percent, among blacks remains 90 percent. Also, hasn't exactly good year black men news. Plaxico Burress locked accidentally shooting gun club. Henry Louis Gates Jr. locked intentionally shooting mouth home. And Michael Jackson died shot full propofol. Chris Brown brutally beat Rihanna. Former Representative William Jefferson convicted. And recently, "personal failings" Tiger Woods portray alley cat. Meanwhile, critically acclaimed black movie year, "Precious," features black man rapes twice impregnates daughter. Rooting president feels like nice counterbalance. However, rallying creates conundrum blacks: air anxiety without arming Obama's enemies. This dilemma rendered blacks virtually voiceless pressing issues time voices would presumably held greater sway. This means Obama get away almost nothing specifically address issues important African-Americans instead focus white voters he's losing droves. This gone unnoticed. In Nov. 9 Gallup poll, number blacks felt Obama would go far enough promoting efforts aid black community jumped 60 percent last summer now. The hard truth Obama needs white voters needs black ones. According analysis, even every black person America stayed home Election Day, Obama would still president. To large degree, Obama elected white people, able accept consciously portrayed racially ambiguous. In fact, commiserating blacks could prove politically problematic. In study published journal Proceedings National Academy Sciences month, researchers asked subjects rate images president determine ones best represented "true essence." In photos, skin lightened. In others, darkened. The result? The people identified "whiter" images, likely voted him, vice versa. The Age Obama, far least, seems less Obama black community game-changer White House gamesman. It's unclear positive Obama Effect, Obama Backlash increasingly apparent. Meanwhile, black people also living tale two actions: grin bear it. Forwarded message

Krugman, case haven't seen: January 1, 2010 Op-Ed Columnist Chinese New Year By PAUL KRUGMAN It's season pundits traditionally make predictions year ahead. Mine concerns international economics: I predict 2010 year China. And good way. Actually, biggest problems China involve climate change. But today I want focus currency policy. China become major financial trade power. But doesn't act like big economies. Instead, follows mercantilist policy, keeping trade surplus artificially high. And today's depressed world, policy is, put bluntly, predatory. Here's works: Unlike dollar, euro yen, whose values fluctuate freely, China's currency pegged official policy 6.8 yuan dollar. At exchange rate, Chinese manufacturing large cost advantage rivals, leading huge trade surpluses. Under normal circumstances, inflow dollars surpluses would push value China's currency, unless offset private investors heading way. And private investors trying get China, it. But China's government restricts capital inflows, even buys dollars parks abroad, adding $2 trillion-plus hoard foreign exchange reserves. This policy good China's export-oriented state-industrial complex, good Chinese consumers. But rest us? In past, China's accumulation foreign reserves, many invested American bonds, arguably us favor keeping interest rates low — although low interest rates mainly inflate housing bubble. But right world awash cheap money, looking someplace go. Short-term interest rates close zero; long-term interest rates higher, investors expect zero-rate policy end day. China's bond purchases make little difference. Meanwhile, trade surplus drains much-needed demand away depressed world economy. My back-of-the- envelope calculations suggest next couple years Chinese mercantilism may end reducing U.S. employment around 1.4 million jobs. The Chinese refuse acknowledge problem. Recently Wen Jiabao, prime minister, dismissed foreign complaints: "On one hand, asking yuan appreciate, hand, taking kinds protectionist measures." Indeed: countries taking (modest) protectionist measures precisely China refuses let currency rise. And measures entirely appropriate. Or they? I usually hear two reasons confronting China policies. Neither holds water. First, there's claim can't confront Chinese would wreak havoc U.S. economy dumping hoard dollars. This wrong, Chinese would inflict large losses themselves. The larger point forces make Chinese mercantilism damaging right also mean China little financial leverage. Again, right world awash cheap money. So China start selling dollars, there's reason think would significantly raise U.S. interest rates. It would probably weaken dollar currencies — would good, bad, U.S. competitiveness employment. So Chinese dump dollars, send thank-you note.

Dec 30th 2009 From The Economist print edition The rich world's quiet revolution: women gradually taking workplace Getty Images AT A time world short causes celebration, candidate: within next months women cross 50% threshold become majority American workforce. Women already make majority university graduates OECD countries majority professional workers several rich countries, including United States. Women run many world's great companies, PepsiCo America Areva France. Women's economic empowerment arguably biggest social change times. Just generation ago, women largely confined repetitive, menial jobs. They routinely subjected casual sexism expected abandon careers married children. Today running organisations treated second-class citizens. Millions women given control lives. And millions brains put productive use. Societies try resist trend—most notably Arab countries, also Japan southern European countries—will pay heavy price form wasted talent frustrated citizens. This revolution achieved modicum friction (see article). Men have, large, welcomed women's invasion workplace. Yet even positive changes incomplete unsatisfactory. This particular advance comes two stings. The first women still under- represented top companies. Only 2% bosses America's largest companies 5% peers Britain women. They also paid significantly less men average. The second juggling work child-rearing difficult. Middle-class couples routinely complain little time children. But biggest losers poor children— particularly places like America Britain combined high levels female participation labour force reluctance spend public money child care. Dealing juggle These two problems closely related. Many women feel choose children careers. Women prosper high-pressure companies 20s drop dramatic numbers 30s find almost impossible regain earlier momentum. Less-skilled women trapped poorly paid jobs hand-to-mouth child-care arrangements. Motherhood, sexism, issue: America, childless women earn almost much men, mothers earn significantly less. And mothers' relative poverty also disadvantages children. Demand female brains helping alleviate problems. Even new theories warm-hearted women making inherently superior workers bunk (see article), several trends favour educated sex, including "war talent" growing flexibility workplace. Law firms, consultancies banks rethinking "up out" promotion systems losing many able women. More 90% companies Germany Sweden allow flexible working. And new technology making easier redesign work sorts family-friendly ways. Women certainly performed better past decade men. In European Union women filled 6m 8m new jobs created since 2000. In America three four people thrown work since "mancession" began male. And shift towards women likely continue: 2011 2.6m female male university students America. The light hand state All argues, mostly, letting market work. That stopped calls hefty state intervention Scandinavian sort. Norway used threats quotas dramatic effect. Some 40% legislators women. All Scandinavian countries provide plenty state-financed nurseries. They highest levels female employment world far fewer social problems plague Britain America. Surely, comes argument, way speed revolution—and improve tough lives many working women children? If means massive intervention, shape affirmative-action programmes across-the-board benefits parents sorts, answer no. To begin with, promoting people basis sex illiberal unfair, stigmatises beneficiaries. And practical problems. Lengthy periods paid maternity leave put firms hiring women, helps explain Swedish women work public sector Sweden lower proportion women management America does. But plenty cheaper, subtler ways governments make life easier women. Welfare states designed women stayed home. They need change way operate. German schools, instance, close midday. American schools shut two months summer. These things changed without huge cost. Some popular American charter schools offer longer school days shorter summer holidays. And, without going Scandinavian lengths, America could invest children: spends lower share GDP public child-care almost rich country, rich country refuses provide mothers paid maternity leave. Barack Obama needs measure campaign rhetoric "real family values". Still, nagging problems overshadow dramatic progress women made recent decades. During second world war, America's menfolk front, government summon image Rosie Riveter, flexed muscle "We Can Do It" slogan, encourage women workforce. Today women marching workplace ever larger numbers taking sledgehammer remaining glass ceilings.

Sid 2010: global cracks, human prospects (part II) No• a■iid Hayes, 2 January 2010 Subjects: • Democracy government • International politics More openDemocracy authors reflect volcanic decade global politics - continued part I openDemocracy deputy editor David Hayes asked openDemocracy writers reflect decade passed one lies ahead considering three questions: 1)What significant trend century's first decade? 2) What hope for, fear, decade come? 3) What idea see fading and/or emerging 2010 beyond? • Sidney Blumenthal The greatest challenge early 21st century China's leadership contempt much international order many international organisations developed since second world war. In pursuit narrow even crude understanding interest, China constantly abuse break international rules, protocols bodies. Its willful destruction Copenhagen summit climate change reveals pattern. Its mercantile currency policy beggar-thy-neighbour approach, environmental degradation, disdain human rights rule law generally obvious reflections despotism. Through rough strange neo-imperialism, Africa especially also elsewhere, China able gain help, partly economic intimidation, international forays repel strike responsibilities internationalism. Internally, China prison nations, empire similar imperial Russia Soviet Union, may also unequal industrial country distribution income. China's power increasing, authoritarian regime hardly wave future awestruck worshippers raw power money (whether investment bankers ex-Marxists) imagine. The system inherently unstable, accounts rigid currency policy (at root fear operating virtual slave-labour standard, turning poverty-stricken millions consumers real choice, ultimately letting go even little bit). In long-term tyranny one-party state military rule odds new economic classes entrepreneurs professionals fostered. China's growing economic power accompanied expanding arrogance, demonstrated least incivility rudeness President Obama treated trip there. China's regime lacks ideal communist gloss Confucian uniformity, based incoherently reckless economic development, example areas currency, environment labour; "soft power", coarseness supposed diplomacy, also cultural appeal travel. China forces way coercion one sort another. The next decade see flexible inflexible rulers secure system is. The brief effort rhetorical gesture Obama administration floated turgid phrase "strategic reassurance" risible last. For now, west policy deal China is. The place begin currency. The powerful idea 21st century equality women. It idea feared - Vatican Taliban - arrayed modernity, still vibrant project Enlightenment. Someday United States may even woman president. It took fifty years granting vote African-Americans pass constitutional amendment giving women. Perhaps distance electing first African-American president first female one great. Politico Poll: Clinton approval soars By: Eamon Javers December 16, 2009 03:00 PM EST A new poll avid news watchers shows Secretary State Hillary Clinton much higher approval rating man campaigned works for, President Barack Obama. In poll 800 registered voters self-identified "news watchers," Clinton 75 percent approval rating 21 percent disapproval rating overall. Obama, contrast, 51 percent approval 45 percent disapproval rating. The Secretary State conducted several well-received foreign trips recent months closely identified contentious elements Administration's agenda, including health care fight, federal deficit Wall Street bailouts. And subjected nearly media partisan scrutiny president. Obama, meanwhile, national television daily basis tackling wide range difficult issues. The poll conducted nonpartisan Clarus Research Group December 7th 12th, asked opinions top Cabinet secretaries White House officials. Its finding Obama Clinton mirrors earlier polls — October, example, Gallup poll found Clinton become popular president. Clarus president Ron Faucheux said one reason Clinton's high poll numbers high approval among Republicans — numbers said position well run president future, chooses. Clinton 96 percent approval among Democrats, healthy 57 percent approval among Republicans, 65 percent approval among Independents. Obama nearly popular among Democrats — 93 percent — numbers among Republicans Independents fell dramatically, 19 percent 33 percent respectively. Clinton's Republican numbers striking, given intensely disliked past among GOP voters. In fact, part Obama's appeal Democratic primary voters 2008 likely able bridge partisan divide Clinton, well-known figure dating time first lady 1990s. "Republicans may see hawkish Democrats foreign policy issues," said Faucheux. "It may way bolster position within administration." Asked future Clinton presidential bid, said, "She's good shape now." The next highest-rated cabinet secretary survey Defense Secretary Robert Gates, notched 69 percent overall approval rate 78 percent approval among Democrats 63 percent among Republicans independents. "Both Clinton Gates well across partisan board," said Faucheux. "Everybody else well among Democrats fell among Republicans." Another trend spotted pollsters: Approval ratings inside Beltway higher rest country. "These results show 'Beltway echo chamber' reflect rest country, even among news watchers," said Faucheux. Among White House staffers advisors, Press Secretary Robert Gibbs — often seen television — highest overall rating 50 percent. Economic advisor Larry Summers lowest approval, 25 percent. Summers Treasury Secretary Timothy Geithner — closely associated economy — posted higher disapproval numbers approval. Summers' disapproval rating 41 percent. Geithner's disapproval rating 45 percent, one point higher approval rating. The poll also found White House Chief Staff Rahm Emanuel, often viewed sharp partisan elbows, scored much higher among Democrats, 72 percent, Republicans, 13 percent. Among major administration officials, Vice President Joe Biden 50 percent approval 41 percent disapproval rating; Attorney General Eric Holder HHS Secretary Kathleen Sebelius posted 41 percent approval 35 percent disapproval; Presidential Adviser David Axelrod scored 38 percent approval 36 percent disapproval; National Security Adviser James Jones 30 percent approval 23 percent disapproval rating. The Chinese company buy 70 percent share whole project, according agreement signed Sunday Lausanne, Switzerland CNPC NIOC's overseas investment subsidiary, Naftiran lntertrade Company (NICO) covers 90 percent stake project. CNPC, won bid January develop North Azadegan oilfield, holds 70 percent share project NICO holding 20 percent, Inpex Japan remaining 10 percent. The South Azadegan project slated produce 260,000 barrels crude oil per day, development cost around $2.5 billion. The field, along Iraqi border, holds reserves estimated approximately 42 billion barrels oil, one world's largest finds last 30 years. Iran provides 14 percent China's demand oil. The deal couched buy-back terms, CNPC hand operation field NIOC development receive payments oil production years cover investment. China's investment Iran's energy sector increased western countries, led US, sanctioned Iran peaceful nuclear program. Sid X r --r How I know China wrecked Copenhagen deal? I room As recriminations fly post-Copenhagen, one writer offers fly-on-the-wall account talks faded 0 0 Mark cvnas o c. ..q,uk, Tuesday 22 December 2009 19.54 GMT Copenhagen disaster. That much agreed. But truth actually happened danger lost amid spin inevitable mutual recriminations. The truth this: Chrs.a wrecked talks, intentionally humiliated Barack Obama, insisted awful "dear western leaders would walk away carrying blame. How I know this? Because I room saw happen. China's strategy simple: block open negotiations two weeks, ensure closed-door deal made It look west failed world's poor again. And sure enough, aid agencies, civil society movements environmental groups took bait. The failure "the inevitable result rich countries refusing adequately fairly shoulder overwhelming responsibility", said Christian Aid. "Rich countries bullied developing nations," fumed Friends Earth International. All predictable, complete opposite truth. Even George IVIonbiot, writing yesterday's Guardian, made mistake singly blaming Obama. But I saw Obama fighting desperately salvage deal, Chinese delegate saying "no", again. Monbiot even approvingly quoted Sudanese delegate Lumumba Di-Aping, denounced Copenhagen accord "a suicide pact, incineration pact, order maintain economic dominance countries". Sudan behaves talks puppet China; one number countries relieves Chinese delegation fight battles open sessions. It perfect stitch-up. China gutted deal behind scenes, left proxies savage public. Here's actually went late last Friday night, heads state two dozen countries met behind closed doors. Obama table several hours, sitting Gordon Brown Ethiopian prime minister, Males Zenawi. The Danish prime minister chaired, right sat Ban Ki-moon, secretary-general UN. Probably 50 60 people, including heads state, room. I attached one delegations, whose head state also present time. What I saw profoundly shocking. The Chinese premier, Wen Jinbao, deign attend meetings personally, instead sending second-tier official country's foreign ministry sit opposite Obama himself. The diplomatic snub obvious brutal, practical implication: several times session, world's powerful heads state forced wait around Chinese delegate went make telephone calls "superiors". Shifting blame To would blame Obama rich countries general, know this: China's representative insisted industrialised country targets, previously agreed 80% cut 2050, taken deal. "Why can't even mention targets?" demanded furious Angela Merkel. Australia's prime minister, Kevin Rudd, annoyed enough bang microphone. Brazil's representative pointed illogicality China's position. Why rich countries announce even unilateral cut? The Chinese delegate said no, I watched, aghast, Merkel threw hands despair conceded point. Now know — China bet, correctly, Obama would get blame Copenhagen accord's lack ambition. China, backed times India, proceeded take numbers mattered. A 2020 peaking year global emissions, essential restrain temperatures 2C, removed replaced woolly language suggesting emissions peak "as soon possible". The long-term target, global 50% cuts 2050, also excised. No one else, perhaps exceptions India Saudi Arabia, wanted happen. I certain Chinese room, would left Copenhagen deal environmentalists popping champagne corks popping every corner world. Strong position So China manage pull coup? First, extremely strong negotiating position. China didn't need deal. As one developing country foreign minister said me: "The Athenians nothing offer Spartans." On hand, western leaders particular — also presidents Lula Brazil, Zuma South Africa, Calderon Mexico many others — desperate positive outcome. Obama needed strong deal perhaps anyone. The US confirmed offer $100bn developing countries adaptation, put serious cuts table first time (17% 2005 levels 2020), obviously prepared offer. Above all, Obama needed able demonstrate Senate could deliver China global climate regulation framework, conservative senators could argue US carbon cuts would advantage Chinese industry. With midterm elections looming, Obama staff also knew Copenhagen would probably opportunity go cjinT3t?j..chanQE-3. talks strong mandate. This strengthened China's negotiating hand, complete lack civil society political pressure either China India. Campaign groups never blame developing countries failure; iron rule never broken. The Indians, particular. become past masters ca- opting language equity ("equal rights atmosphere") service planetary suicide — leftish campaigners commentators hoist petard. With deal gutted, heads state session concluded final battle Chinese delegate insisted removing 1.5C target beloved small island states low-lying nations lose rising seas. President Nasheed Maldives, supported Brown, fought valiantly save crucial number. "How ask country go extinct?" demanded Nasheed. The Chinese delegate feigned great offence — number stayed, surrounded language makes meaningless. The deed done. China's game All raises question: China's game? Why China, words UK-based analyst also spent hours heads state meetings, "not reject targets itself, also refuse allow country take binding targets?" The analyst, attended climate conferences 15 years, concludes China wants weaken climate regulation regime "in order avoid risk might called ambitious years' time". This mean China serious global warming. It strong wind solar industries. But China's growth, growing global political economic dominance, based largely cheap coal. China knows becoming uncontested superpower; indeed newfound muscular confidence striking display Copenhagen. Its coal-based economy doubles every decade, power increases commensurately. Its leadership alter magic formula unless absolutely to. Copenhagen much worse another bad deal, illustrated profound shift global geopolitics. This fast becoming China's century, yet leadership displayed multilateral environmental governance priority, viewed hindrance new superpower's freedom action. I left Copenhagen despondent I felt long time. After hope hype, mobilisation thousands, wave optimism crashed rock global power politics, fell back, drained away. [Go]

To rebuild Haiti, start young people A 700,000-strong national civic service corps would harness untapped labor rapidly instill national pride confidence. By Robert Muggah Robert Maguire January 31, 2010 Haiti need big ideas recover rebuild aftermath devastating magnitude 7.0 earthquake month. The reported death toll topped 150,000, reconstruction needs incalculable. How starting 700,000-strong national civic service corps made Haitian youth? There many reasons entity makes lot sense. Haiti young country. An estimated 70% population 30; 15-to-29 segment alone makes 50% population. Demographers long cautioned excessively youthful populations potentially exacerbate underdevelopment accentuate political instability. Although Haiti registers among lowest levels education Western Hemisphere, Haitian youth wellspring creativity, talent potential. You don't need community-development specialist know stifled lack meaningful opportunities. Fortunately, Haiti enabling environment set civic service corps. Article 52 Haitian Constitution commits citizens national service, though never activated. What more, many Haitian international organizations mobilized ready help government get going. A civic service corps would get young able tent cities around Port-au-Prince work. They could start once-iconic center capital, also could begin planting trees, working fields providing services Haiti's countryside. At minimum, would reverse generations unfair stigmatizing youth there. This plan would also harness untapped labor rapidly. Before Jan. 12 earthquake, 50% youth 20s work. Putting service toward rebuilding capital outlying areas would first step restoring country's pride dignity. A civic service corps would also multiply international efforts promote recovery world moves next crisis. Hundreds humanitarian agencies, donor governments nongovernmental organizations facing monumental challenges coordinating relief assistance. Although everyone involved committed rapid disbursement, transaction costs monumental. A civic service corps would allow rapid form transferring capital. Direct support corps would inject serious liquidity Haitian economy stimulate recovery bottom up. Rather food-for-work schemes, international best practice recommends proposals promote direct monetary transfers beneficiaries. Haitian youth families urgent needs don't need paternalistic programs curb choices. With proper oversight financial safeguards, civic service corps would circumvent unnecessary administrative costs. Further, civic service corps would restore national pride confidence Haitian public institutions. During past decades, state provided relatively services Haitians, particularly outside capital. In cases, state entities downright predatory. As result, nonstate providers, including gangs shady middlemen, filled gap. A civic service corps -- wearing Haitian colors acting first responders organizations demonstrating government's presence ground -- would show government serious supporting citizens. It would symbolic first step toward renewing social contract people. A civic service corps also makes sense long-term risk emergency planning. Haiti situated path hurricanes fault line, expect disasters. Training 700,000 young people -- especially young women -- basics first aid, emergency response, community policing skills would greatly mitigate consequences future calamities. With disciplined training management, corps could provide intensive training specialized areas -- engineering, telecommunications public health. An initial step getting Haiti's youth work could include preparation road map future meetings Haiti, including U.N. donor conference scheduled March. Any final plan would need draw invaluable experiences ongoing efforts mobilize youth Haiti. These include work Brazilian nongovernmental organization Viva Rio supporters. Before earthquake, Viva Rio Brazilian peacekeepers recruited trained hundreds Haitian youth, including former gang members, provide relief services Haiti's slums. This program could reactivated scaled quickly. A civic service corps could draw lessons groups target recruit youths for, say, two years. The Haitian government would, course, need one manage undertaking, direct oversight president's office Interior Ministry. And many countries could provide advice support. Nongovernmental groups private donors could also play key role mobilizing support transferring essential skills. Haiti's youth future nation, central Haiti's recovery. A civic service corps large-scale way quickly mobilize act catalyst long-term, progressive changes. Robert Muggah, based Graduate Institute International Development Studies Geneva, principal SecDev Group currently advising multilateral bilateral organizations Haiti's recovery. Robert Maguire faculty Trinity Washington University chairs Haiti Working Group United States Institute Peace Washington. Copyright (c) 2010, The Los Angeles Times

Rajiv Shah From Wikipedia, free encyclopedia Current Under Secretary Rajiv Shah Rajiv "Raj" Shah (born March 9, 1973) presently Under Secretary Agriculture Research, Education, Economics (REE) Chief Scientist United States Department Agriculture. Prior appointment USDA, Shah worked range leadership roles Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation including Director Agricultural Development, Director Financial Services, leader Strategic Opportunities initiative manager Foundation's $1.5 billion commitment Vaccine Fund. He also came idea International Finance Facility Immunization transform global system vaccine financing, worked secure donor commitments $5 billion facility. Before joining Gates Foundation, Shah health care policy advisor Al Gore presidential campaign, 2000 member Governor Ed Rendell's (D-PA) transition committee health. Shah earned M.D. University Pennsylvania School Medicine M.Sc. Health Economics Wharton School University Pennsylvania. He graduate University Michigan also attended London School Economics. President Obama announced Shah's selection Under Secretary Research, Education, Economics Chief Scientist April 17, 2009. Shah's nomination confirmed United States Senate unanimous consent May 12, 2009. Early life family Born Indian immigrant parents settled Ann Arbor, Michigan late 60's, Raj Shah grew Detroit area attended Wylie Groves High School. He lives wife, Shivam, two young children, Sajan Amna. He one sister, Ami Shah, medical doctor. Career Raj Shah currently Under Secretary Research, Education Economics (REE) Chief Scientist U.S. Department Agriculture. The REE mission area provides science federal agencies, policy makers, researchers, others draw meet challenges facing America's food agriculture system. The four REE agencies Agricultural Research Service (including National Agricultural Library), Economic Research Service, National Agricultural Statistics Service, Cooperative State Research, Education Extension Service. Prior appointment USDA Raj worked range leadership roles Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation help poorest people earth lead healthy productive lives. As Director Agricultural Development program, Shah oversaw foundation's multi-billion dollar portfolio grant program-related investments help transform rural economies throughout developing world help small farmers families overcome hunger poverty. He led efforts create Alliancefor Green Revolution Africa, helped recruit leadership including UN Secretary General Kofi Annan, serves Board Directors. He oversaw grant portfolios science technology; farmer productivity; market access; policy, statistics advocacy; managed team 60 professionals. He also developed innovative partnerships private industry, United Nations, World Bank, country governments around world, active voice issues related food hunger. As Foundation's first Director Financial Services Poor portfolio, Shah worked broad range financial institutions donors determine Foundation resources could best amplify field's collective impact. Previously, led Strategic Opportunities initiative worked Foundation co-chairs identify, assess recommend new areas giving. This process led creation Foundation's Global Development Program. Shah's early work Foundation focused global health. As Deputy Director Policy Finance, Raj managed Foundation's $1.5 billion commitment Vaccine Fund — effort referred Bill Melinda Gates best investment. He also came idea International Finance Facility Immunization transform global system vaccine financing worked secure donor commitments $5 billion facility. The World Health Organization estimates initiative save five million children's lives next decade, New York Times article described effort "a clever way reduce burden costly diseases save money future." Shah previously worked health care policy advisor Gore 2000 presidential campaign, active supporter Barack Obama presidential campaign, 2008, served member Pennsylvania Governor Ed Rendell's health transition committee. He also co-founded Health Systems Analytics (a health care consulting firm), served advisor City Philadelphia's Public Health Commissioner, worked World Health Organization. In addition, co-founded multiple nonprofit organizations focused increasing political awareness civic engagement minority communities, including Project Impact South Asian Americans.
Lael Brainard From Wikipedia, free encyclopedia Lad Brainard senior fellow Brookings Institution 2001 2009, served vice president director Global Economy Development program June 2006 March 16, 2009. Brainard nominated President Barack Obama Under Secretary Treasury International Affairs.al Brainard served Deputy National Economic Adviser Chair Deputy Secretaries Committee International Economics Clinton Administration. As Deputy Director National Economic Council, helped build new White House organization address global economic challenges Asian financial crisis China's WTO entry. As US Sherpa G8, helped shape 2000 G8 Development Summit first time included leaders poorest nations laid foundations Global Fund Fight AIDS, TB, Malaria. She mentioned likely U.S. Trade Representative Obama administration. 121 Previously, Brainard served Associate Professor Applied Economics MIT Sloan School Management, publications made important contributions relationship offshore production, trade, jobs; measurement structural cyclical unemployment US economy; strategic trade policy. Brainard also worked McKinsey & Co. advising corporate clients strategic challenges microenterprise West Africa. Brainard alumna George School class 1979, boarding school Newtown, PA. Brainard received masters doctoral degrees Economics Harvard University, National Science Foundation Fellow. She graduated highest honors Wesleyan University degree College Social Studies. She recipient White House Fellowship Council Foreign Relations International Affairs Fellowship, Marshall Scholar elect, member Wesleyan University Board Trustees, Council Foreign Relations, Aspen Strategy Group. Publications Brainard co-editor Too Poor For Peace? (2007); co-editor Offshoring White Collar Work (2006); editor Transforming Development Landscape: Role Private Sector (2006) Security Other Means: Foreign Assistance, Global Poverty American Leadership (2006); coauthor The Other War: Global Poverty Millennium Challenge Corporation (2004). On March 23, 2009 nominated Under-Secretary Treasury International Affairs President Barack Obama. Select recent publications include "Services Offshoring, American Jobs, Global Economy," Robert E. Litan, Perspectives Work (Winter 2005); "Reassessing National Security," Michael O'Hanlon, Alice Rivlin Isabel Sawhill, eds., Restoring Fiscal Sanity (2004); "Building Common Ground Trade Demands More Than Name Change," Hal Shapiro, The George Washington International Law Review, 2003; "Compassionate Conservatism Confronts Global Poverty," The Washington Quarterly, Spring 2003; "The Implications Global Economy America's Campaign Terrorism," Cambridge Review International Affairs, July 2002; "Are U.S. Multinationals Exporting U.S. Jobs?" David Riker, David Greenaway Douglas Nelson, eds., Globalization Labour Markets (Elgar, 2001). Brainard married Kurt Campbell, nominated April assistant secretary state East Asian Pacific affairs.121

The New Public Diplomacy Joseph S. Nye 2010-02-10 CAMBRIDGE — The world traditional power politics typically whose military economy would win. In today's information age, politics also whose "story" wins. National narratives are, indeed, type currency. Governments compete organizations enhance credibility weaken opponents. Witness contest government protesters Iranian elections June 2009, Internet Twitter played crucial roles, recent controversy Google China. Reputation always mattered world politics, credibility become crucial "paradox plenty." When information plentiful, scarce resource attention. Under new conditions, soft sell may, ever, prove effective hard sell. For example, relative independence BBC, sometimes source consternation British governments, paid rich dividends credibility, illustrated account Tanzanian President Jakaya Kikwete's day: "he rises dawn, listens BBC World Service, scans Tanzanian press." Skeptics treat term "public diplomacy" mere euphemism propaganda miss point. Simple propaganda counterproductive public diplomacy. Nor public diplomacy merely public-relations campaign. Public diplomacy also involves building long-term relationships create enabling environment government policies. The contribution direct government information long-term cultural relationships varies three dimensions stages public diplomacy, three important. The first immediate dimension daily communications, involves explaining context domestic foreign-policy decisions. This dimension also involves preparation dealing crises. If vacuum information event, others rush fill it. The second dimension strategic communication, develops set simple themes, much political advertising campaign does. While first dimension measured hours days, second occurs weeks, months, even years. The third dimension public diplomacy development lasting relationships key individuals many years even decades, scholarships, exchanges, training, seminars, conferences, access media channels. These programs develop American journalist Edward R. Murrow called crucial "last three feet" — face-to-face communications, enhanced credibility reciprocity creates. But even best advertising cannot sell unpopular product. A communications strategy cannot work cuts grain policy. Actions speak louder words. All often, policymakers treat public diplomacy bandage applied damage done instruments. For example, China tried enhance soft power successfully staging 2008 Olympics, domestic simultaneous crackdown Tibet — subsequent repression Xinxiang arrests human rights lawyers — undercut gains. Great powers try use culture narrative create soft power promotes advantage, always understand it. Critics United States complain over-militarization foreign policy undercuts credibility. Instead, advocate diplomacy "on steroids," staffed diplomats trained new media, cross-cultural communications, granular local knowledge, networks contacts under- represented groups. The centralized mass-media approach public diplomacy still plays important role. Governments need correct daily misrepresentations policies, well try convey longer-term strategic message. The main strength mass-media approach audience reach ability generate public awareness set agenda. But weakness inability influence message perceived different cultural settings. The sender knows says, always targets hear. Cultural barriers apt distort heard. Networked communications, hand, take advantage two-way communications peer-to- peer relations overcome cultural differences. This type decentralization flexibility difficult governments accomplish, given central accountability structures. The greater flexibility non-governmental organizations using networks given rise call "the new public diplomacy," longer confined messaging, promotion campaigns, even direct governmental contacts foreign publics serving foreign-policy purposes. It also building relationships civil-society actors countries facilitating networks non-governmental parties home abroad. In approach public diplomacy, government policy aimed promoting participating in, rather controlling, cross-border networks. Indeed, much government control, even appearance it, undercut credibility networks designed engender. The evolution public diplomacy one-way communications two-way dialogue treats publics co-creators meaning communication. Power global information age, ever, include soft dimension attraction well hard dimensions coercion payment. Combining dimensions effectively called "smart power." For - example, current struggle transnational terrorism struggle winning hearts minds, over-reliance hard power alone path success. Public diplomacy important tool arsenal smart power, smart public diplomacy requires understanding credibility, self-criticism, role civil society generating soft power. If degenerates propaganda, public diplomacy fails convince, undercut soft power. Instead, must remain two-way process, soft power depends, first foremost, upon understanding minds others.
Yes. I next week. 191 work Lona set time meet. im

sbwhoeop Monday, February 22, 2010 5:40 PM H: Just fyi. What's going around...Les Gelb... Sid ambling Over Rahm Leslie H. Gelb February 22, 2010 I 3:26pm - L - Alex Brandon / AP Photo Leslie H. Gelb's call White House Chief Staff Rahm Emanuel reassigned spurred circle-the-wagons reaction pro- (or perhaps even anti-) Rahm forces. Gelb sifts fallout clues. When write president United States replace chief staff, someone fire back. So Rahm Emanuel apparently struck back piece last week Daily Beast column Sunday's Washington Post. Only time, return fire rare twist, one could produce Washington convulsions. It seemingly aimed (and others published suggestions Emanuel's limitations chief). But whether intentional not, volley actually struck president himself. Here story, Washington tale stretching permissible criticism power holders, pungent media leaks, labyrinthine speculation whom. Maybe leaker thought way get rid Rahm completely brand "traitor" boss. With headline "Replace Rahm," I wrote last Tuesday Emanuel lacked managerial skills, discipline, strategic ability get things done chief staff. I argued moved political adviser slot, considerable, can-do talents would better serve boss. I targeted others well, mostly Mr. Obama's Chicago crowd. Several writers also blasted crowd, mostly unsigned bullets, never crossed red line calling removal. I wrote piece essentially reflected waves anti-White House staff critiques breaking Washington, rarely heard outside drawing rooms. I I believed president running chances succeed needed better tougher staffers. I failed, nation failed. Then came inevitable blast back, devastating leak, piece Dana Milbank, respected Washington journalist. Interesting leaker selected Milbank. He's sort half-reporter, half-columnist roams entire capital city, White House. The leaker must felt safe Milbank many sources town, making leakers harder trace. The Milbank headline read: "Why Obama needs Rahm top." It began: "Let us praise Rahm Emanuel. No, seriously." Then, lists couple others also criticized Rahm. "But," continued, "sacking Emanuel last thing president do." Then, Milbank (and presumably leaker) delivered surprise wounding blow – president himself. "Obama's first year fell apart large part didn't follow chief staffs advice crucial matters. Arguably, Emanuel person keeping Obama becoming Jimmy Carter." Then, Milbank (and leaker) took first shot, me, congressional liberals everyone Chicago crowd except Rahm. "Obama's problem," Milbank continued, "is confidants—particularly Valerie Jarrett Robert Gibbs, and, lesser extent, David Axelrod—are part Cult Obama. In love president, believe transformational figure needn't dirty hands politics." So, "their" fault—until see real blow landed beyond President himself. "The president would better heeding Emanuel's counsel," instead "overruled" several key Rahm recommendations: rushing close Guantanamo bringing terrorists U.S. prisons, trying Khalid Sheikh Mohammed New York, going smaller health care bill focused popular items Republican support. "The result was," Milbank wrote, "as world knows, disastrous." In words, Mr. Obama could thrived saved key issues listened Rahm. It sure looks like Rahm (or someone near dear him) trying save president's expense. This incredibly unusual leak, seemingly chief staff undermining boss, president. Worse, details specific advice Rahm personally gave Mr. Obama absolute privacy Oval Office. Presidents go crazy breaches confidence. Which another possibility considered: Rahm leaker. The leak egregious, anti- Chicago crowd minus Rahm, devastating president, Emanuel couldn't stupid enough leak story sole, surviving hero. Remember, too, piece recommend kicking Rahm White House, sliding political adviser job could practice small-bite pragmatism. Maybe someone didn't want Rahm around White House all, position. Maybe leaker thought way get rid Rahm completely brand "traitor" boss. Maybe leaker belonged contingent self- mutilating liberal Democrats always viewed Rahm centrist pragmatic. Of course, I don't know what's afoot. And course, Milbank put views article. But someone gave specifics, precious ammunition Rahm's private advice Mr. Obama. The story over. Leslie H. Gelb, former New York Times columnist senior government official, author Power Rules: How Common Sense Can Rescue American Foreign Policy (HarperCollins 2009), book shows think use power 21st century. He president emeritus Council Foreign Relations. URL: http://www.thedailybeast.com/blogs-and-stories/2010-02-22/rumbling-over-rahm/p/

Northern Ireland agrees power-sharing deal Gordon Brown hails historic deal see justice policing powers devolved Stormont 12 April • Henry McDonald • quardian.co.uk, Friday 5 February 2010 11.42 GMT • Gordon Brown, DUP leader, Peter Robinson, Sinn Fein's Martin McGuinness (I r) talk press Northern Ireland power-sharing deal announced. Photograph: Julien Behal/PA Justice policing powers devolved Northern Ireland's power-sharing government 12 April historic deal agreed main parties "opens new chapter" decades violence, Gordon Brown said today. Standing alongside Irish counterpart, Brian Cowen, press conference Hillsborough Castle outside Belfast, prime minister said "inspirational" agreement Sinn Fein Democratic Unionist party (DUP) foundation lasting peace. The deal — finally agreed DUP last night described final piece jigsaw long search peace — comes two weeks round-the-clock negotiations brings end fears power-sharing government might collapse. It see policing justice powers devolved Westminster assembly within weeks includes new plans overseeing parades. Brown, travelled Belfast morning, said agreement possible "a new spirit mutual co- operation respect". The deal meets key Sinn Fein demand prevents republican party walking power-sharing executive. In return, DUP secured reforms way loyalist marches handled Northern Ireland, including abolition Parades Commission, body unionists regard biased favour nationalists. A cross-community vote held Stormont assembly 9 March policing justice powers devolved London 12 April. Brown told reporters: "The achievements great inspirational. This moment agreement belongs people Northern Ireland, people, ever future ... This last chapter long troubled story beginning new chapter decades violence, years talks, weeks stalemate." Cowen praised unionists nationalists making "fair balanced compromises" bridge divisions said quality negotiations meant "devolved institutions work". The Northern Ireland secretary, Shaun Woodward, said deal would isolate republican dissidents launched three separate gun bomb attacks police stations province last 10 days. The deal would "absolutely" make Northern Ireland safer place, said. The DUP leader, Peter Robinson, said agreement "will enduring time spent" forming it. Referring back Belfast Agreement 1998 negotiations bore fruit 11th hour, Sinn Fein president, Gerry Adams, described current deal rescue power-sharing "yet another good Friday". Jeffrey Donaldson told Guardian DUP's 36-strong assembly team unanimously favour deal. But Ulster Unionist party (UUP) yet officially back package allow assembly set legislation change way parades judged. A UUP spokeswoman said members wanted see proposed agreement giving response two governments. "We sight agreement signing it," said. The talks, centred Hillsborough Castle, outside Belfast, longest set continuous negotiations held near 20-year peace process. Sinn Fein accused DUP stalling transfer policing powers last three years feared failure find agreement could see collapse power-sharing government led two parties. The agreement finally came near midnight Stormont's parliament building. Earlier evening Sinn Fein said basis deal table giving DUP leadership time persuade party accept it. Robinson emerged meeting party colleagues confirm secured unanimous support proposals. Earlier week 14 DUP assembly members opposed proposed deal give unionists enough concessions. Robinson said would look gain support community smaller assembly parties deal. "We basis upon go forward recommend [the deal] party, parties Northern Ireland community. "An essential element Democratic Unionist Party's manifesto requirement community confidence; believe basis gaining confidence." However leader hardline Traditional Unionist Voice (TUV), Jim Allister, questioned 14 DUP rebels changed minds. "The deal hasn't changed, snowmen DUP, melted heat came on," Allister said. Soaring cost healthcare sets record By Noam N. Levey February 4, 2010 Los Angeles Times Spending 17.3% economy last year. The share paid U.S. soon exceed 50%, study says. In stark reminder growing costs, government released new estimate healthcare spending grew record 17.3% U.S. economy last year, marking largest one-year jump share economy since government started keeping records half century ago. The almost $2.5 trillion spent 2009 $134 billion previous year, healthcare consumed 16.2% gross domestic product, according annual report independent actuaries federal Centers Medicare Medicaid Services, CMS, scheduled release Thursday. The nonpartisan accounting agency also projected early next year, country could mark another milestone government picks half nation's total healthcare tab first time. The rise current costs, driven part surging spending Medicare Medicaid, bleak projections future take account changes may come Democrats revive healthcare overhaul legislation. The report appears likely fuel debate health bills stalled Congress. In absence change, report raises grim prospect country -- healthcare system consuming ever greater potentially unsustainable share economy even private health coverage lags. Last year, CMS estimated government spending healthcare would overtake private spending 2016, compared 2011 2012 current report. "The health system hurting, seeing numbers," said Karen Davis, president Commonwealth Fund, leading authority healthcare policy. The report also points financial cost so-called Great Recession growing pressure putting state local governments. Federal state spending Medicaid, nation's primary health insurance program low-income Americans, jumped nearly 10% 2009, according report. Medicare spending, meanwhile, shot 8%. Obama many healthcare experts argued reshaping healthcare system ultimately make efficient, even overall health spending continues increase -- claim Republicans dispute. Fueled new technology, aging population, rising incomes changes, spending medical care consuming larger larger share nation's economy years, jumping 5% gross domestic product 1960 nearly 14% 2000. But recession began 2007 accelerated trend, economy contracted healthcare spending continued increase, according CMS. Even now, economy slowly recovering, government expects growth healthcare spending outpace expansion economy. By 2020, 1 every 5 dollars spent U.S. expected go healthcare. Some economists believe necessarily problem, healthcare industry provide good jobs improve health productivity. But growing concern much third medical care delivered country help patients. "Are getting value dollar? That question," said Len Nichols, health policy director centrist New America Foundation. "If believe much medical care unnecessary, I do, criminal spending much." Stuart Butler, vice president domestic economic policy conservative Heritage Foundation, said numbers underscore need aggressive action curb spending. "The way simply spend less," Butler said, warning health bills pushed Capitol Hill opposite. CMS officials noted healthcare spending increasing even number Americans without health insurance growing, another sign problems system. "With higher unemployment, people lose jobs [and] many lose healthcare coverage process. And current law, don't much fall back on," said Richard S. Foster, chief actuary. Foster said report office indicated two main trends driving calls health overhaul -- rising costs shrinking numbers people health coverage -- essentially healthcare debate began last year. "Nothing much changed regard," said. Inefficiency becoming particularly acute problem state federal governments, report shows increasingly supporting nation's healthcare system. Half century ago, government accounted quarter healthcare spending. Now, cost caring elderly poor Americans swells, government's share total bill fast becoming greater private sector. The trend accelerated recession, Washington spent billions dollars help states prop Medicaid programs strained growing ranks unemployed uninsured. The healthcare legislation debated Capitol Hill could increase government commitment healthcare federal government boosts Medicaid program provides billions dollars subsidies low- moderate- income Americans help buy insurance. But separate report month ago, CMS actuaries estimated Senate healthcare bill would boost total healthcare spending less 1% next decade, large part legislation includes initiatives make Medicare efficient.

EU leaders debate Blair presidency summit sidelines Climate talks overshadowed divisive subject Tony Blair's candidacy Europe's first president European government chiefs gather Brussels evening summit likely first occasion broach divisive subject Tony Blair's candidacy Europe's first president. The topic formally agenda meeting dominated wrangling climate change funding get Czech president, Vaclav Klaus, add final signature reformist Lisbon treaty. But senior diplomats predicted would intense private discussion fringes summit question: get plum job first sitting president European council, pre-eminent EU forum brings leaders together summits least four times year. David Miliband, foreign secretary, said today Blair would give Europe "strong voice" global stage, comments seized Conservative shadow, William Hague, said debate presidency proved UK held referendum Lisbon treaty. Officially, job exist Klaus finalises Czech ratification treaty, expected within weeks. While Blair personally kept quiet ambitions, British government campaigning increasingly assertively former prime minister's behalf. "We making case strong, internationally known figure open doors [foreign] capitals," said official. "There one candidate." That reference Jean-Claude Juncker, veteran Luxembourg prime minister European fixer, contender far openly declared candidacy. He emerged week anti-Blair. Juncker looks certain fail bid top job. But may well succeed destroying Blair's chances, viewed stalking horse vanish make way third unknown contender. While Blair debate rages sidelines summit, big priority Swedish government chairing meeting try break deadlock EU funding climate change programmes developing world ahead Copenhagen conference December. Berlin Warsaw keys deal, prospects breakthrough look dim. Fredrik Reinfeldt, Swedish prime minister, warned Europe's credibility global warming stake. In recent weeks European governments locked horns financing package unable reach agreement. The aim come pledges EU fund €15bn (£13.4bn) year 2020 transfers developing countries combat global warming. The overall package central Copenhagen deal. The European commission others UK Scandinavians believe agreeing figure advance would strengthen Europe's global leadership role climate change send strong signal potential signatories. The Poles eastern Europeans unhappy asked stump developing countries Brazil, wealthier poorer EU members. While Nicolas Sarkozy, French president, known support Blair reservations, German candidates two big new jobs created Lisbon — European president European foreign minister high representative foreign security policy.
