http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/comment/columnists/guest_contributors/article6991697.ece From The Times January 18, 2010 Fear poor hampering Haiti rescue American views rule among rubble Port-au-Prince. That's one reason aid taking long get need Linda Polman Aid workers already baptised earthquake Haiti "historical disaster". It rate high annals humanitarian aid world number victims scale destruction. But rescue operation also becoming notorious slowness aid reaching victims. Five days quake hit, many places still largely bereft international aid. Not lack funds, supplies emergency experts. Those pouring dozens countries. But aid — aid workers — seems stuck airport. Rescue teams pulled survivors five-star hotels, university buildings, supermarket UN headquarters, Port-au-Prince's better neighbourhoods. In poor areas, damage appears much greater, apparently forgotten victims report Twitter yet encounter first foreign rescuer. Many aid workers reported orders venture without armed guards — all, long debates UN military command. The UN lost number staff quake, keen risk lives. But Haitian people seem scare aid workers Somali warlords, Darfuri Janjawid Afghan Taleban. Frightened Dutch aid workers abandoned mission without•reaching collapsed building people trapped, frightened doctors left patients unattended. The experience CNN's medical reporter, Dr Sanjay Gupta, telling. In makeshift clinic encountered Belgian medical team evacuated UN bus. UN "rules engagement" apparently stopped providing security doctors. The Belgians took medical supplies them, keep claws robbers. Dr Gupta camera team stayed night, monitored abandoned patients' vital signs continued intravenous drips — robbed. Some rescuers leaning much toward security allow people die. The media helping. CNN won't stop telling aid workers outside world pillaging (the incidence — first four frustrating days least — compare happened Hurricane Katrina) dangerous distribute food, likelihood "stampedes". Nor US Government, biggest player aid operation, anything help relax atmosphere. On contrary. When President Obama said US aid effort would "aggressive" meant it. The humanitarian operation led civilian agencies, Pentagon. Mr Obama ordered 9,000 troops fleet nuclear-powered ships move in. Victims war Congo (which cost five million lives past years) genocide Darfur would love much American attention — Haiti's fate lay America's backyard sore American eyes decades already. One, perhaps even two million Haitians already live United States, try come. Every day dead Haitian refugees wash Miami's sunny beaches. Haiti constant pain US taxpayers feel billions dollars poured least lifted country position one poorest places Earth. Even earthquake struck, investigations taking place fate several million dollars aid funds, sent victims hurricane hit Haiti 2008, disappeared. Furthermore, horror many godfearing Americans, voodoo officially recognised religion Haiti. And, perhaps all, Haitians poor black. In view Americans two add ... murderous gangs. The invasion soldiers humanitarian workers airport Port-au-Prince reminds American military invasion Haiti authorised President Clinton 1994. I'd lived worked almost two years correspondent Dutch radio. There 20,000 soldiers surprisingly nervous reception unarmed Haitians might store them. It turned wave slum dwellers streaming air sea port greet American guests. In abundant conga lines snaked city, tea cosies heads express happy were. "Liberte! Merci Beel Cling Dong!" shouted. A terrified American GI, still teenager, saw mass pitiful creatures approaching him, asked tea cosies "some kinda voodoo?". He calmed line BMWs Mitsubishis appeared filed past watch invasion. Where soldier came from, owners vehicles like respectable citizens. In Haiti, likely ones smuggling drugs making US aid dollars disappear. The good guys Haiti defenceless people slums. For Western city dwellers, world turned upside down. "Back! Back!" soldier shouted, aiming weapons good guys. The rescue teams stay put airport one reason still don't really know going on. Seventy survivors pulled rubble far, International Red Cross said Sunday. That's 14 rescues per day joint result 1,739 international specialised rescue workers there. That number would surely jump professional equipment brought made available countless groups local people desperately digging victims bare hands, day night. • oClose Window • Print page From The Sunday Times February 28, 2010 Gordon Brown course win election David Smith Jonathan Oliver GORDON BROWN course remain prime minister general election new Sunday Times poll reveals Labour two points behind Tories. The YouGov survey places David Cameron's Conservatives 37%, 35% Labour — closest gap parties two years. It means Labour heading total 317 seats, nine short overall majority, Tories languishing total 263 MPs. Such outcome would mean Brown could stay office deny Cameron keys No 10. The poll result presents Conservative leader one greatest challenges leadership today makes keynote speech party's spring forum. In interview The Sunday Times, Cameron defied right-wing critics believe party's modernisation gone far. He said: "Some people say me, 'Play things safe; try win default — government mess.' I say, 'No. This Conservative party offering radical change. I'm doubling change'." With expected May 6 election two months away, Cameron seek reconnect voters series pledges, including plan restore discipline schools. In echo speech won Tory leadership 2005, address Brighton conference without notes. "This very, clear," said. "I've made choice. There going back. This election change offering change." Cameron insisted unconcerned collapse Tory support. "The polls move around lot," said. "The voters tell us want change. They want know Conservative party changed." The narrowing Conservative lead dramatic rapid. Until January Tories held close 10-point lead. But week ago Sunday Times YouGov poll put gap six points, suggesting hung parliament, Tories still course become largest party. In last election, 2005, support parties generally held steady run-up polling day. YouGov polling The Sunday Times showed Labour leads two five points January June election. Labour's margin victory three points. In today's poll, Labour risen two points previous week, 33%, Conservatives dropped two 39%. The Liberal Democrats unchanged 17%. The collapse Tory poll lead put pressure pound financial markets tomorrow adding fears hung parliament mean insufficient action taken cut Britain's budget deficit. The last time gap two main parties came close Tory support low autumn 2007. That Brown's honeymoon ended failure call snap general election. The Conservatives went peak May 2008 26-point lead. Today's poll suggests recent claims Brown's tantrums intimidation staff may actually helped him. Just 28% people believe prime minister bully 50% agree "strong sense right wrong". The survey disclosed growing concerns Cameron's elite background lack empathy ordinary families. Just 25% think Cameron understands problems faced "people like me", compared 35% Brown.

But week ago Sunday Times YouGov poll put gap six points, suggesting hung parliament, Tories still course become largest party. In last election, 2005, support parties generally held steady run-up polling day. YouGov polling The Sunday Times showed Labour leads two five points January June election. Labour's margin victory three points. In today's poll, Labour risen two points previous week, 33%, Conservatives dropped two 39%. The Liberal Democrats unchanged 17%. The collapse Tory poll lead put pressure pound financial markets tomorrow adding fears hung parliament mean insufficient action taken cut Britain's budget deficit. The last time gap two main parties came close Tory support low autumn 2007. That Brown's honeymoon ended failure call snap general election. The Conservatives went peak May 2008 26-point lead. Today's poll suggests recent claims Brown's tantrums intimidation staff may actually helped him. Just 28% people believe prime minister bully 50% agree "strong sense right wrong". The survey disclosed growing concerns Cameron's elite background lack empathy ordinary families. Just 25% think Cameron understands problems faced "people like me", compared 35% Brown. Furthermore, 28% think Conservative leader wants best "all groups Britain", 39% prime minister. Peter Kellner, president YouGov, Sunday Times pollster, said individual polls could throw unexpected shifts, recent trend significant narrowing Tory lead. "Our daily polls regarded bit like FTSE index: 100-point rise fall day might blip trend — often can't tell days," said. "I confident Tory lead weekend I can't promise whether latest movement sustained, increased reversed days ahead. One reasons daily polls monitor fluctuations." The Tory lead 6%, first reported The Sunday Times, maintained YouGov's polls The Sun last week. The increase support Labour Thursday Friday, latest Sunday Times poll conducted, came figures showed strengthening economic recovery. Under British parliamentary system, prime minister remains office general election either tenders resignation defeated Commons confidence vote. If election result leaves Labour short overall majority, Brown likely battle on, Labour running country minority government. The party would seek deals minor parties Ulster's Democratic Unionist party or, necessary, Nick Clegg's Liberal Democrats, get legislation parliament. If repeated general election basis uniform swing constituencies, today's poll would leave Labour nine seats short 326 needed overall majority new 650-seat House Commons. The Tories would well behind 263 seats, Liberal Democrats 41. Kellner calculated that, even allowing larger swing Tories marginal seats, party spent millions pounds campaigning, poll consistent Labour far largest party. He suggested scenario Labour might win 300 seats, Tories 270 Lib Dems 50. Labour believe benefiting upturn economy. For first time YouGov poll since July 2007, financial crisis, people trust Labour Tories run economy. YouGov, began polling 2001 election, developed reputation accuracy. Its final Sunday Times poll 2005 precisely right, accurately predicted Boris Johnson's victory 2008 London mayoral election results last year's Euro elections. http://www.publicpolicypolling.com/pdf/PPP_Release_MA_45398436.pdf FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE January 9, 2010 INTERVIEWS: DEAN DEBNAM 888-621-6988 / 919-880-4888 (serious media inquiries please, questions directed Tom Jensen) QUESTIONS ABOUT THE POLL: TOM JENSEN 919-744-6312 Senate Race Competitive Raleigh, N.C. — The race replace Ted Kennedy US Senate looking like toss up, Republican Scott Brown 48-47 Martha Coakley. Brown benefiting depressed Democratic interest election huge lead among independents surprisingly strong standing. Those planning vote special election report voted Barack Obama 2008 16 point margin, contrast actual 26 point victory state. That decline turnout Obama voters plagued Democratic candidates Governor Virginia New Jersey last fall. Beyond 66% Republicans say they're 'very excited' turning 48% Democrats express sentiment. Brown leads 63-31 independents winning 17% Democratic vote Coakley receives 6% support GOP voters. Both candidates relatively popular, 57% viewing Brown favorably 25% unfavorable 50% positive opinion Coakley 42% negative. Those folks planning vote special election actually opposed Obama's health care plan 47/41 margin narrowly express approval President's overall job performance 44/43. "The Massachusetts Senate race shaping potential disaster Democrats," said Dean Debnam, President Public Policy Polling. "Martha Coakley's complacent campaign put Scott Brown surprisingly strong position need step final week win victory thought inevitable." PPP surveyed 744 likely Massachusetts voters January 7th 9th. The margin error +/-3.6%. Other factors, refusal interviewed weighting, may introduce additional error difficult quantify. Complete results attached found www.publicpolicypolling.com.

http://www.cbsnews.com/blogs/2010/01/11/politics/politicalhotsheet/entry6084818.shtml?tag=stack January 11, 2010 6:30 PM Obama's Approval Rating Dips New Low (CBS) President Obama's job approval rating fallen 46 percent, according new CBS News poll. That rating Mr. Obama's lowest yet CBS News polling, poll marks first time approval rating fallen 50 percent mark. Forty-one percent say disapprove Mr. Obama's performance president. In last month's CBS News poll, 50 percent Americans approved president handling job, thirty- nine percent disapproved. Analysis: The Irony Behind Obama's Poll Numbers Mr. Obama still receives strong support Democrats (eight ten approve performance), approval rating among Republicans 13 percent. More importantly, Mr. Obama's approval rating among independents declined 10 points recent months — stands 42 percent. Domestic issues — response terrorist threats - appear driving president's approval rating downward. Just 41 percent approve handling economy, Americans say nation's pressing issue. Forty-seven percent disapprove. The president's marks handling health care, reforms still debate Congress, even lower — 36 percent approve, 54 percent disapprove. Both approval ratings lowest Mr. Obama's presidency. Meanwhile, parties Congress receive even lower marks president handling health care. Few Americans think reforms Congress hit right note expanding coverage, lowering costs regulating health insurance industry. (Read health care poll results) (CBS) The president receives slightly higher ratings handling war Afghanistan threat terrorism domestic issues. Forty-six percent approve Mr. Obama's handling Afghanistan, 52 percent approve handling threat terrorism. While Republicans criticized president Secretary Homeland Security Janet Napolitano's responses attempted Christmas Day terror attack, Americans don't share opinion. In poll, 57 percent Americans approve way Obama administration responded attempted attack, 29 percent disapprove. Views highly partisan — 75 percent Democrats approve, 41 percent Republicans 55 percent independents do. More Findings Poll: •Fear another terrorist attack increased since attempted attack Northwest Airlines flight Amsterdam Christmas Day. Now, 26 percent think another attack United States within next months likely, 12 percent latest incident. This highest percentage felt attack likely since March 2003, U.S. invasion Iraq. •While Americans (56 percent) least fair amount confidence government protect citizens future attacks, 15 percent confident. In aftermath 9/11 attacks, expressed confidence. •Few Americans —just 19 percent - think U.S. intelligence agencies could monitor actions suspected terrorists. Seventy-six think could more. •Most Americans support conducting full body scans travelers using digital x-ray machine, device airports using. Seventy-four percent agree machines used provide detailed check hidden weapons explosives reduce need physical searches. Just 20 percent think machines used would produce image passenger's naked body invasion privacy. •Over half Americans think U.S. continue keep Guantanamo Bay prison open. Thirty-two percent think ought closed prisoners transferred somewhere else. •The American public continues volunteer economy jobs important problem facing country (44 percent), health care distant second (14 percent). In wake attempted terror attack Christmas Day, percentage cites terrorism pressing issue risen seven percent zero percent early last month. •The public's overall assessment condition national economy remains grim — 82 percent Americans say economy bad shape. Looking ahead, 31 percent Americans think economy getting better, 19 percent think getting worse. Forty-nine percent say economy staying same.

But Senate majority leader chatted freely two disarmingly charming book authors came office Capitol shortly 2008 election. They — tape recorder — soaking reminiscences wild campaign turned backbencher caucus president United States. Like virtually every Washington political insider, Manley long warm relationship Halperin, longtime political director ABC News set conventional wisdom Washington "The Note." March 15, 2010 Op-Ed Columnist Taking On China By PAUL KRUGMAN Tensions rising Chinese economic policy, rightly so: China's policy keeping currency, renminbi, undervalued become significant drag global economic recovery. Something must done. To give sense problem: Widespread complaints China manipulating currency — selling renminbi buying foreign currencies, keep renminbi weak China's exports artificially competitive — began around 2003. At point China adding $10 billion month reserves, 2003 ran overall surplus current account — broad measure trade balance — $46 billion. Today, China adding $30 billion month $2.4 trillion hoard reserves. The International Monetary Fund expects China 2010 current surplus $450 billion — 10 times 2003 figure. This distortionary exchange rate policy major nation ever followed. And it's policy seriously damages rest world. Most world's large economies stuck liquidity trap — deeply depressed, unable generate recovery cutting interest rates relevant rates already near zero. China, engineering unwarranted trade surplus, effect imposing anti-stimulus economies, can't offset. So respond? First all, U.S. Treasury Department must stop fudging obfuscating. Twice year, law, Treasury must issue report identifying nations "manipulate rate exchange currency United States dollar purposes preventing effective balance payments adjustments gaining unfair competitive advantage international trade." The law's intent clear: report factual determination, policy statement. In practice, however, Treasury unwilling take action renminbi unwilling law requires, namely explain Congress isn't taking action. Instead, spent past six seven years pretending see obvious. Will next report, due April 15, continue tradition? Stay tuned. If Treasury find Chinese currency manipulation, what? Here, get past common misunderstanding: view Chinese us barrel, don't dare provoke China dumping dollar assets. What ask is, What would happen China tried sell large share U.S. assets? Would interest rates soar? Short-term U.S. interest rates wouldn't change: they're kept near zero Fed, won't raise rates unemployment rate comes down. Long-term rates might rise slightly, they're mainly determined market expectations future short-term rates. Also, Fed could offset interest-rate impact Chinese pullback expanding purchases long-term bonds. It's true China dumped U.S. assets value dollar would fall major currencies, euro. But would good thing United States, since would make goods competitive reduce trade deficit. On hand, would bad thing China, would suffer large losses dollar holdings. In short, right America China barrel, way around. So reason fear China. But do? Some still argue must reason gently China, confront it. But we've reasoning China years, surplus ballooned, gotten nowhere: Sunday Wen Jiabao, Chinese prime minister, declared — absurdly — nation's currency undervalued. (The Peterson Institute International Economics estimates renminbi undervalued 20 40 percent.) And Mr. Wen accused nations China actually does, seeking weaken currencies "just purposes increasing exports." But sweet reason won't work, what's alternative? In 1971 United States dealt similar much less severe problem foreign undervaluation imposing temporary 10 percent surcharge imports, removed months later Germany, Japan nations raised dollar value currencies. At point, it's hard see China changing policies unless faced threat similar action — except time surcharge would much larger, say 25 percent. I don't propose turn policy hardball lightly. But Chinese currency policy adding materially world's economic problems time problems already severe. It's time take stand. Sid http://www.tnr.corniarticie/world/the-crisis?page=0,0 Ea Published The New Republic Was Obama's confrontation Israel premeditated'? Yossi Klein Halevi 4. March 16, 2010 17:13 pm JERUSALEM—Suddenly, city feels like war zone..Since suicide bombings ended 2005, life Jerusalem part relatively calm. The worst disruptions traffic jams resulting construction light rail. jUst like normal city. But navy, again, clusters helmeted border nOtiCe near gates Old City. black smoke burning tires Arab village across porch, young men marching green Islamist flags toward neighborhood, ambulances parked strategic places ready city's ultimate nightmare. The return menace Jerusalem mid-level bureaucrat announced stage four seven-stage process eventual construction oft,600 apartments Ramat Shiomo. Jewish neighborhood northeast Jerusalem. Such announcements building projects become routine years Paestinians scarcely responded, let alone violently. In negotiations Palestinians Israelis, permanence Ramat Shiomo, Jewish neighborhoods East Jerusalem, given. Ramat Shlomo, located Jewish neighborhoods French Hill Rarrot, remain within boundaries Israeli Jerusalem accord ng every peace plan. Unlike Snail Jewish enclaves inserted Arab neighbochoocis, Israelis strongly buliding established Jewish neighborhoods East Jerusalem defines national consensus. Why, then, outbreak violence now? Why Harness "day rage" Jerusalem Palestinian Authority's call gather Temple Mount "save" Dome Rock non-existent plans build Third Temple? Why sudden outrage rebuilding synagogue, destroyed Jordanians 1948, Old City's Jewish Quarter, dozens synagogues yeshivas built quarter without incident? The answer lies Jerusalem Washington. By placing issue building Jewish neighborhoods East Jerusalem center peace process, President Obama inadvertently challenged Palestinians less. Astonishingly. Obama repeating key tactical mistake failed efforts restart Middle East peace talks last year. Though Oben-la's insistence settlement freeze help restart negotiations legitimate, went step far including building East Jerusalem. Every Israeli government last four decades built Jewish neighborhoods East Jerusalem; government, let alone one headed Likud, could possibly agree freeze there. Obama made resumption negotiations hostage demand could met. The result Palestinian leaders forced adjust demands accordingly. Obama directly responsible one absurd turns history Middle East negotiations. Though Palestinian leaders negotiated Israeli governments built extensively West Bank, refused sit first Israeli government actually agree suspension building. Obama's demand building freeze Jerusalem led freeze negotiations. Finally, intensive efforts, administration produced pathetic achievement "proximity talks"—setting Palestinian-Israeli negotiations back generation, time Palestinian leaders refused sit table Israelis. That Obama could guilty amateurishness perhaps forgivable was, ail, amateur. But taken failed policy intensified it. By demanding Israel stop building Ramat Shlomo elsewhere East Jerusalem—and placing demand center American-Israeli relations—he's ensured Palestinians won't show even proximity talks. This longer amateurishness; pique disguised policy. Initially, announcement building Ramat Shlomo made, Israelis shared Vice President Biden's humiliation outraged government's incompetence. The widespread sense Netanyahu deserved administration's condemnation, didn't do: He failed convey parts government need caution Biden's visit, symptomatic chaotic style governing generally. But even opposition accused Netanyahu deliberate provocation. These days Yitzhak Shamir, former Israeli prime minister used greet visit Secretary State James Baker announcement creation another West Bank settlement. The findings suggest Tory hopes defining breakthrough overplayed, gap two main parties four points — closest 1CM poll almost two years. Labour support climbed four points 33% since ICM poll carried Guardian last week. Conservative backing dropped one since 37% — Labour's best ICM rating since December 2008 Tories' worst since February. On uniform national swing, figures could leave Labour 30 seats short overall majority. Even Tories perform better average marginal seats — people expect — David Cameron would struggle establish secure parliamentary basis power. Either party could left dependent fiber:a) Democrats, 21% poll — two last week. Despite decline, Lib Dems pleased strength position going election. The party 20% seven year's 11 ICM polls. Meanwhile support parties, peaked last spring European elections, fallen 9%. At start election campaign likely see polling ever British politics, today's figures treated caution unless confirmed surveys. Some polls late last week suggested Conservative lead grown rather shrunk, research may affected Easter holidays, voters would away home. Yet results suggest Labour's chances written off, events leaders' debates could prove decisive coming weeks. Today's poll suggests 60% people planning watch least one debate, 29% saying plan watch three. Only 39% voters said would watch them. The ICM survey also asked voters whether might switch away first choice party and, so;who might back instead. Labour Tory support equally solid. Overall, 71% Labour supporters say definitely back Labour 71% Tories also say stick first choice party. Lib Dems, however, less loyal — 52% sure end giving Nick Clegg vote. That leaves quarter main party's supporters considering backing another party. The proportion Lib Dems ConservatIves. saying might vote Labour instead doubled since ICM last asked question earlier year. The ICM figures suggest maximum potential vote Labour Conservatives — definite supporters, plus potential switchers — running neck neck 42%. The Lib Dem maximum 28%. Realistically, Labour unlikely beat 2005 share 36% even today's poll suggesting shed three points since surprise many. sbwhoeop Saturday, March 20, 2010 5:54 PM H: fyi. sid H: Uri Avnery, Israeli analyst activist, privately circulating analysis today. One consequence: Petraeus cannot run Republican. At least Putin didn't bring big dogs like Merkel. Cheers, Sid Uri Avnery 20.3.10 The Doomsday Weapon IT IS already commonplace say people don't learn history condemned repeat mistakes. Some 1942 years ago, Jews province called Palaestina launched revolt Roman Empire. In retrospect, looks like act madness. Palestine small insignificant part world-wide empire won crushing victory rival power — Parthian Empire (Persia) — put major rebellion Britain. What chances could Jewish revolt have? God knows going mind "Zealots". They eliminated moderate leaders, warned provoking empire, gained sway Jewish population country. They relied God. Perhaps also relied Jews Rome believed influence Senate would restrain Emperor, Nero. Perhaps heard Nero weak fall. We know ended: three years, rebels crushed, Jerusalem fell temple burned down. The last Zealots committed suicide Masada. The Zionists indeed try learn history. They acted rational way, provoke great powers, endeavored every situation attain possible. They accepted compromises, every compromise served basis next surge forward. They cleverly utilized radical stance adversaries gained sympathy whole world. But since beginning occupation, mind become clouded. The cult Masada become dominant. Divine promises start play role public discourse. Large parts public following new zealots. The next phase also repeating itself: leaders Israel starting rebellion new Rome. WHAT BEGAN insult Vice President United States developing something far bigger. The mouse given birth elephant. Lately, ultra-right government Jerusalem started treat President Barack Obama thinly veiled contempt. The fears arose Jerusalem beginning term dissipated. Obama looks like paper black panther. He gave demand real settlement freeze. Every time spat on, remarked raining. Yet now, ostensibly quite suddenly, measure full. Obama, Vice President senior assistants condemn Netanyahu government growing severity. Secretary State Hillary Clinton submitted ultimatum: Netanyahu must stop settlement activity, East Jerusalem included; must agree negotiate core problems conflict, including East Jerusalem, more. The surprise complete. Obama, seems, crossed Rubicon, much Egyptian army crossed Suez Canal 1973. Netanyahu gave order mobilize reserves America move forward diplomatic tanks. All Jewish organizations US commanded join campaign. AIPAC blew shofar ordered soldiers, Senators Congressmen, storm White House. It seems decisive battle joined. The Israeli leaders certain Obama would defeated. And unusual noise heard: sound doomsday weapon. THE MAN decided activate foe new kind. David Petraeus popular officer United States army. The four-star general, son Dutch sea captain went America country overrun Nazis, stood early childhood. In West Point "distinguished cadet", Army Command General Staff College No. 1. As combat commander, reaped plaudits. He wrote doctoral thesis (on lessons Vietnam) Princeton served assistant professor international relations US Military Academy. He made mark Iraq, commanded forces Mosul, problematical city country. He concluded order vanquish enemies US must win hearts civilian population, acquire local allies spend money ammunition. The locals called King David. His success considered outstanding methods adopted official doctrine American army. His star rose rapidly. He appointed commander coalition forces Iraq soon became chief Central Command US army, covers whole Middle East , except Israel Palestine (which "belong" American command Europe). When person raises voice, American people listen. As respected military thinker, rivals. THIS WEEK, Petraeus conveyed unequivocal message: reviewing problems AOR (Area Of Responsibility) — includes, among others, Afghanistan, Pakistan, Iran, Iraq Yemen — turned called "root causes instability" region. The list topped Israeli-Palestinian conflict. In report Armed Services Committee stated: "The enduring hostilities Israel neighbors present distinct challenges ability advance interests AOR...The conflict foments anti-American sentiment, due perception U.S. favoritism Israel. Arab anger Palestinian question limits strength depth U.S. partnerships governments peoples AOR weakens legitimacy moderate regimes Arab world. Meanwhile, al-Qaeda militant groups exploit anger mobilize support. The conflict also gives Iran influence Arab world clients, Lebanese Hizballah Hamas." Not content that, Petraeus sent officers present conclusions Joint Chiefs Staff, In words: Israeli-Palestinian peace private matter two parties, supreme national interest USA. That means US must give one-sided support Israeli government impose two-state solution. The argument new. Several experts said less past. (Immediately 9/11 attacks, I wrote similar vein prophesied US would change policy. It happen then.) But stated official document written responsible American commander. The Netanyahu government immediately went damage-limitation mode. Its spokespersons declared Petraeus represents narrow military approach, doesn't understand political matters, reasoning faulty. But made people Jerusalem break cold sweat. AS IS well known, pro-Israel lobby dominates American political system without limits — almost. Every American politician senior official mortally afraid it. The slightest deviation strict AIPAC line tantamount political suicide. But armor political Goliath chink. Like Achilles' heel, immense might pro-Israel lobby vulnerable point that, touched, neutralize power. It illustrated Jonathan Pollard affair. This American-Jewish employee sensitive intelligence agency spied Israel. Israelis consider national hero, Jew duty people. But US intelligence community, traitor endangered lives many American agents. Not satisfied routine penalty, induced court impose life sentence. Since then, American presidents refused requests successive Israeli governments commute sentence. No president dared confront intelligence chiefs matter. But significant side affair reminiscent famous words Sherlock Holmes dogs bark. AIPAC bark. The entire American Jewish community fell silent. Almost nobody raised voice poor Pollard. Why? Because American Jews ready anything — anything — government Israel. With one exception: anything appears hurt security United States. When flag security hoisted, Jews, like Americans, snap attention salute. The Damocles sword suspicion disloyalty hangs heads. For them, ultimate nightmare: accused putting security Israel ahead security US. Therefore important repeat endlessly mantra interests Israel US identical. And comes important general US Army says so. The policy present Israeli government endangering lives American soldiers Iraq Afghanistan. FOR NOW, said side remark, military document widely aired. But sword drawn scabbard - American Jews started tremble distant rumble approaching earthquake. This week, Netanyahu's brother-in-law used doomsday weapon. He declared Obama "anti-Semite". The official newspaper Shas party asserted Obama really Muslim. They represent radical right allies, argue speech writing "Hussein" Obama Jew-hating black must beaten coming congressional elections next presidential ones. (Yet important poll Israel published yesterday shows Israeli public far convinced insinuations: vast majority believes Obama's treatment Israel fair. Indeed, Obama got higher marks Netanyahu.) If Obama decides fight back activate doomsday weapon - accusation Israel puts lives American servicemen risk - would catastrophic consequences Israel. For time being, shot across bow - warning shot fired warship order induce another vessel follow instructions. The warning clear. Even •present crisis somehow damped down, inevitably flare long present coalition Israel stays power. When movie "Hurt Locker" won awards, entire American public united concern lives soldiers Middle East. If public becomes convinced Israel sticking knife back, disaster Netanyahu. And him.

Sid • Print page From Times Online April 14, 2010 Tory lead narrows amid huge voter disenchantment, Times poll finds olmage :1 20, Peter Riddell The general election race tightening, according Populus poll The Times reveals deep public disenchantment campaign far. The poll, undertaken yesterday morning, says voters hoping hung parliament either Tory Labour outright victory. Conservative support slipped three points past week 36 per cent, Labour point 33 per cent. The Liberal Democrats unchanged 21 per cent. The polls tend fluctuate couple points either way. shifts within margin error average. With new polls pointing firming Labour support, party may enjoyed small boost manifesto launch. Tory strategists hope achieved boost manifesto launch today. If Populus figures repeated general election three weeks' time, uniform switch votes, Labour would largest single party, 300 MPs, ahead Tories 264 Lib Dems 54. This would point Lab/Lib Dem coalition. But many analysts expect uniform national swing. The latest poll shows 32 per cent public hope hung parliament (as opposed expecting one), 28 per cent wanting Tory majority 22 per cent Labour one. Lib Dem voters prefer deal Labour Tories hung parliament, 44 31 per cent. The public evenly split 40 42 per cent whether want Labour Tories either majority minority government. The poll shows number expecting Tory overall majority risen three points 34 per cent past week. This exceeds number expecting hung parliament, 33 per cent, six points compared week ago. Overall, 57 per cent expect Tories largest party, 29 per cent expecting Labour be. The public deeply sceptical honesty parties. Only 4 per cent think completely honest tax plans, 61 per cent partly honest. Only 6 per cent say completely honest cutting deficit 61 per cent partly honest. Some 7 per cent say completely honest extent fund policies cutting waste 58 per cent partly honest. Voters asked say party proposed eight key manifesto pledges. They wrongly identified four: reducing increase national insurance contributions (naming Labour Tories); allowing unsuccessful schools, hospitals police (the Tories, Labour); tightening takeover rules (the Tories Labour); requiring foreign workers employed public services speak fluent English (the Tories Labour). In one case, £150-a-year tax break, half voters (60 per cent) correctly identify party making proposal. In cases, pledge make little difference people's votes, apart three made Labour: foreign workers language pledge, doubling paid paternity leave allowing takover unsuccessful schools, hospitals etc. More two fifths (43 per cent), including 50 per cent women, say "none parties", "don't know", asked party putting across convincing cases voters. This compares 25 per cent naming Tories 18 per cent Labour. Just half public (54 per cent) plan watch first televised leaders' debate Thursday evening. Men middle class professionals likely say view. More two fifths (42 per cent) expect David Cameron win debate, 22 per cent Gordon Brown. More Tories (70 per cent) Labour voters ( 57 per cent) expect leader win. Two fifths public (42 per cent, one point week ago) say seems like change Labour, sure time change Conservatives. Some 33 per cent, one point, think time change Tories. Populus interviewed random sample 1,525 adult voters April 12 13. Interviews conducted across country weighted representative adults. For details go www.populus.co.uk. W „44-4,4 1 E10: „9 : , 4. 4,r 4fr . : w‘ if!'4f i, - Time break fog Middle East politics By David Ignatius Sunday, March 21, 2010; A19 Diplomats love ambiguity. It allows fuzz hard parts negotiation -- "final status" issues, they're often called -- save later, parties amenable pressure. This devotion "constructive ambiguity" hallmark U.S. peacemaking Palestinian-Israeli issue 40 years. Rather state unpalatable concessions analysts recognize required viable settlement -- Israelis must share sovereignty Jerusalem Palestinians must give "right return" Israel -- successive U.S. administrations tried defer unmentionables later. But fog machine blew apart month, isr3e1Interipr i‘,1!inista_rndLinced du ..ripq. visit ily__Vde President Biden Israel would build 1,600 housipg priits ,lerusal. erp. The Obama administration upset, put mildly: Secretary State Hillary Clinton called housing announcement "deeply negative signal" U.S.-Israeli relations "an insult." In ensuing hubbub "crisis" U.S.-Israeli relations, frantic attempts pretend misunderstanding pull cloak ambiguity back peace process. But that's mistake. The East Jerusalem move wasn't accident emphatic public statement Israeli right's rejection concessions Jerusalem. Prime Minister Binyamin Netanyahu trying play along U.S. requests fuzz issue avoiding provocative actions Jerusalem. But right-wing Shas party, controls Interior Ministry, basically called bluff. "Freezing building East Jerusalem one things cannot do," said Dore Gold, right-wing former Israeli ambassador United Nations. And Avigdor Lieberman, Israeli foreign minister settler himself, responded: "Can imagine told Jews New York could build buy Queens?" So administration do, Israeli right put Jerusalem squarely table despite best efforts ambiguity-addicted diplomats? The administration's best strategy considered year ago, state clearly basic principles must frame negotiations. Those guidelines articulated well Zbigniew Brzezinski, former national security adviser: real sharing Jerusalem; right return Palestinians; return 1967 borders, mutual adjustments allow big Israeli settlement blocks; demilitarized Palestinian state. Every negotiation past four decades converged toward parameters. The Obama administration debated whether issue statement principles year ago, began peacemaking effort. Launching negotiations "big bang" made sense officials, including Gen. Jim Jones, national security adviser, But George Mitchell, Middle East envoy, argued based experience Northern Ireland peace talks, better let parties haggle United States stepped bridging proposals. Rather stating U.S. negotiating principles outset, Obama team decided instead push Netanyahu settlements. The administration picked fight flush President Obama's first months office, confident strong Netanyahu weak came showdown, Netanyahu would cave. The Israeli leader coolly bided time, dickering procedural issues Obama got weaker politically month. Netanyahu finally agreed November temporary moratorium new settlements -- excluded Jerusalem. The administration seen coming. In retrospect, seems clear step-by-step approach mistake: Constructive ambiguity, case, proved destructive. It allowed Israeli right wing perpetuate idea could -- obtain peace deal without making concessions Jerusalem. And allowed Netanyahu continue straddle. Jerusalem hardest issue Israeli-Palestinian negotiation, reason, would-be peacemakers wanted save last. But month's crisis makes strategic waffling impossible. Thanks Israeli right, Jerusalem issue joined. What's needed Obama announce negotiations begin, United States state views Jerusalem key issues -- sketching outlines deal Israelis Palestinians want. If Netanyahu refuses play, real crisis U.S.-Israeli relations. davidignatius_@washpost.corn Post Comment View comments posted article. Sid http://www.huffingtonpost.com/joe-wilson/emcourage-and-consequence_b_492602.html?view=print March 9, 2010 Joseph C. Wilson Courage Consequence: Less Memoir Than Hoax Karl Rove's book Courage Consequence less memoir hoax. The chapters relate CIA leak scandal yet another attempt deflect attention central role betrayal Valerie Plame Wilson's identity covert CIA officer. His distortions fabrications consistent approach throughout sordid criminal affair. Joint Statement Former President Clinton Secretary State Clinton Passing Dr. Dorothy Height We deeply saddened learn passing Dr. Dorothy Height, icon America's long march toward equality personal inspiration us both. As woman among "Big Six" civil rights leaders, Dr. Height helped galvanize movement changed country forever. She organized "Wednesdays Mississippi" meetings brought black white women together find common ground break barriers. She never stopped fighting knew right. And all, always best dressed woman room. We blessed know Dr. Height, benefit grace, passion wisdom, call friend. For decades, starting early days Children's Defense Fund, worked her, learned her, drew inspiration example. From Presidential Medal Freedom, Congressional Gold Medal, unveiling long-sought-after bust Sojourner Truth United States Capitol, privilege helping honor Dr. Height accomplishments. Born women right vote, denied access college choice color skin, witness nation divided, Dr. Height dedicated life proposition Americans opportunity live full God-given potential. Our nation poorer loss infinitely richer life led, progress achieved, people touched. Our thoughts prayers Dr. Height's family today, many loving friends colleagues. She would first tell us best way honor memory carry forward work started causes championed, open wide freedom gates. May find strength wisdom live legacy.

FYI Kristof's OpEd From Today's NY Times. April 22, 2010 Op-Ed Columnist Obama Backs Down Sudan By NICHOLAS D. KRISTOF JUBA, Sudan Until reached White House, Barack Obama repeatedly insisted United States apply pressure Sudan avoid humanitarian catastrophe Darfur elsewhere. Yet, president, Mr. Obama aides caved, leaving Sudan gloating American weakness. Western monitors, Sudanese journalists local civil society groups found month's Sudanese elections deeply flawed - yet Mr. Obama's special envoy Sudan, Maj. Gen. Scott Gration, pre-emptively defended elections, saying would "as free fair possible." The White House showed hint backbone hurried reference week "an essential step" "serious irregularities." President Omar Hassan al-Bashir Sudan - man wanted International Criminal Court crimes humanity Darfur - celebrating. His regime calls National Congress Party, N.C.P., quoted Sudan telling rally Blue Nile region: "Even America becoming N.C.P. member. No one will." Memo Mr. Obama: When man charged crimes humanity tells world America pocket, it's time review policy. Perhaps Obama administration caved considers flawed election better election. That's reasonable view, one I share. It's conceivable Mr. Bashir could won quasi-fair election - oil revenues manifestly raised standard living parts Sudan - campaigning create space sharp criticism government. It's also true Sudan behaving better respects. The death toll Darfur hugely reduced, government negotiating rebel groups there. The Sudanese government gave visa travel permits Darfur, allowing travel legally freely. The real game isn't, fact, Darfur elections maneuvering possible new civil war. The last north-south civil war Sudan ended fragile peace 2005, two million deaths. The peace agreement provided referendum, scheduled take place January, southern Sudanese decide whether secede. They expected vote overwhelmingly form separate country. Then question becomes: north allow South Sudan separate? The south holds great majority country's oil, it's difficult see President Bashir allowing oil fields walk away. "If result referendum independence, going war - complete war," predicts Mudawi Ibrahim Adam, one Sudan's outspoken human rights advocates. He cautions America's willingness turn blind eye election-rigging increases risk Mr. Bashir feel get away war. "They're naïve Washington," Mr. Mudawi said. "They don't understand going on." On hand, senior Sudanese government official, Ghazi Salahuddin, told unequivocally Khartoum, nation's capital, Sudan honor referendum results. And it's certainly plausible north south muddle avoid war, sides exhausted years fighting. Here Juba, South Sudan capital, I met Winnie Wol, 26, fled civil war 1994 militia north attacked village kill, loot, rape burn. Her father many relatives killed, escaped made way Kenya - eventually resettled refugee California. She lives Olathe, Kan., returned first time Sudan visit mother sisters last seen little girl. Ms. Wol, every bit well-dressed American, let tag along journey back village Nyamlell, 400 miles northwest Juba. The trip ended thatch-roof hut belonged mother, didn't know coming - one home. Ms. Wol crushed. Then scream woman came running. It Ms. Wol's mother, somehow recognizing her, flew other's arms. To me, felt like peace dividend. Yet peace fragile, Ms. Wol knows northern forces may come back pillage again. "I don't want war," said, "but I don't think allow us separate." My hunch north hasn't entirely decided do, strong international pressure reduce risk another savage war. If President Obama ever going find voice Sudan, better soon.

In 2002, Max wrote report Juarez, first report American scene, winning Annenberg Online Journalism Award, equivalent Pulitzer Prize. • &It:script language="JavaScript" type="text/javascript"&gt; document.write('&Ita href="http://clk.atdmt.com/CNT/go/197071989/directwi.728;hi.90/01/" target=" blank"&gtAltimg src="http://view.atdmt.com/CNT/view/197071989/direct;wi.728;hi.90/01/"/&gt;&it ;/a&gt;'); &It:/script&gt;&lt;noscript&gt;&Ita href="http://clk.atdmt.com/CNT/go/197071989/direct;wi.728;hi.90/01/" target=" blank"&gtAltimg border="0" src="http://view.atdmt.com/CNTIview/197071989/direct;wi.728;hi.90/01/" /&gt;El tia&gt;&lt:/noscript&gt; http://www.salon.com/news/feature/2002/12/04/juarez/print.html Day dead More 325 women murdered free-trade boomtown Ciudad Juarez past decade. Faced government incompetence corruption, people rebelling. By Max Blumenthal Dec 4, 2002 I The body another murdered woman found late last month Mexican industrial hub Ciudad Juarez, dumped behind shrubs squalor Anapra neighborhood, ramshackle hodgepodge corrugated tin cardboard shacks sludge-washed banks Rio Grande. Her hands tied, evidence suggested raped. The body badly decomposed investigators calculated she'd dead seven months. However horrific details, numbing familiarity. The body woman died similar circumstances found dusty lot couple months earlier. The bodies eight women found lot far away little year ago. So many women murdered past 10 years reliable count. Most experts place close 325, average 32 year, nearly three every month. At least 90 deaths believed work one serial killers. Hundreds women simply vanished. Like many others, woman whose body found late October probably come Juarez poverty southern Mexico work $10 day one many foreign-owned assembly plants known maquiladoras sprouted Juarez North American Free Trade Agreement signed 1994. And like them, too, body unclaimed death buried alone anonymous. Such death become way life here. So, too, fear paranoia rise climate. Nobody knows killings, mystery seems deepen. Arrests made local authorities produced allegations torture, witness tampering frame-ups -- convictions. Most believe killer killers must enormous clout. Perhaps, say, killers narcotrafficantes disposing witnesses. Perhaps sons wealthy powerful indulging sick sex. Perhaps cultists whose members come highest levels government finance. The theories differ, common assumption arrests made thus far smokescreen historically opaque corrupt government protect dark secrets cost. One thing seems clear: The murders arise social landscape transformed global economic forces. Where Ciudad Juarez small, sleepy desert outpost across border El Paso, Texas, population past decade exploded 1.2 million people, many drawn lure maquiladoras. The tides people overwhelmed ability city absorb them, overwhelmed health services, social services law enforcement. Free-trade advocates promised NAFTA would transform Juarez City Future -- proven right way never could imagined. Today, Juarez still feel lawless Old West, grim 21st century edge. Despite promises swift justice Mexican President Vicente Fox Chihuahua Gov. Patricio Martinez, yet take offers assistance FBI; bureau agents Texas suggested official corruption hindering efforts stop murders. Chihuahua state investigators seemingly adopted "don't ask, don't tell" policy towards Juarez's homicides, fostering atmosphere impunity pervasive fear. Foreign corporations operating Juarez employed many murdered women largely deny atmosphere exists. But postmodern urban culture, concept community broken down, many bereaved family members local activists begun take matters hands, investigating murders speaking even means threats reprisals. Evangeline Arce's daughter, Silvia, street vendor, disappeared Nov. 3, 1998. Since day, said, authorities done little investigate. "Two days daughter disappeared, I went police filed report," mother says Spanish, face flaring anger. "They promised prompt action I checked back week later, Missing persons report never filed investigation even begun. When finally got witnesses together, none would talk afraid." Even Mexico continues make strides toward becoming open democratic society, epidemic rape murder exposed heavy residue corrupt authoritarian political legacy well contradictions efforts economic expansion. To understand magnitude breakdown, think sniper rampage Washington area fall left 10 people dead three wounded. Imagine Montgomery County Police Chief Charles Moose held press conference asked local citizens catch sniper local police task federal government helpful; imagine federal government charged local officials Montgomery County complicit killings impeding investigation. Chaos would ensue, certainly. But then, multiply. number victims 30, 40, 50, more. That's Juarez today. The jumbled, exhaust-choked commercial core city grown wildly wake NAFTA, adding modern shopping malls, condominiums expansive boulevards. The population growing twice rate national average; expected nearly double 2010, 2 million people. Many directly indirectly rely 300 maquiladoras livelihoods. To accommodate new army workers, city given birth entirely new sectors. The Campestre Juarez luxurious conglomerate gated communities, main gate that's life-size replica Paris' Arc de Triomphe. Nearby, many maquiladoras situated along Avenida de la Industria. Though assembly-line workers sometimes glimpsed behind plate glass window aqua-blue uniforms, usually little sign activity behind maquiladoras' featureless walls. Most new residents poor, brink poverty, live Anapra another grim, violent colonias populares outskirts town. In colonies, residents usually live without sanitation, running water, electricity paved roads. Avenida Manuel Gomez Morin pothole-riddled six-lane avenue ties varied worlds together. Sitio Colosio Valle, medium-sized strip mall, stands corner avenue gateway industrial sector. It fronted vast parking lot inside various clothing outlets boutiques. By day, lot bustles customers scurry back forth, hauling purchases cars -- sight similar mall suburban United States. By night, however, traffic tapers off, stores lock mall's lot becomes dark desolate. Sitio Colosio Valle many slain missing women last seen. In mall's parking lot, Braulio Rosas, 40-year-old security guard, leans door giant Nike outlet. Inside store, bright fluorescent lights, employees frantically check inventory scramble close up. "A lot girls picked here," Roses says voice calm resignation. "But really, it's girls' fault. It's even though weren't putas, [prostitutes] know, like fad/es [easy women]. They didn't get cars didn't want to." Rosas sounds cynical, blaming victims means aberration Juarez. Similar notions offered officials like Suly Ponce, former Chihuahua special prosecutor charge murdered women's cases. "Sometimes cases girl meets person, strikes relationship her, drink ... ends violently," told Washington Post 2000, promoted job governor's office. "It's difficult know." A handful women found murdered since 1993 indeed confirmed prostitutes. But truth large majority missing murdered women hardworking, young, poor part socially conservative. Most migrated Juarez Mexico's depressed south work maquiladoras, sometimes arriving alone little means contacting families back home. The maquiladoras, run companies like Delphi RCA Thomson, prefer hire young women assembly-line jobs. An entry-level assembly-line worker makes minimum wage, $2 hour. With experience, pay rise much $2,50 hour -- compared wages Guerrero Chiapas, that's good money. But Juarez, women caught economic trap: Since cost living slighter lower El Paso, wages seem high new maquiladora workers actually ensure poverty. The workers hired fired spot, little pretext legal protection. And union activities prohibited. Even accept conditions, security elusive. More often now, global companies maquiladoras closing shop transferring operations China take advantage lower taxes, investment subsidies outrageously cheap labor. On June 29, Royal Philips Electronics announced moving P.C. monitor manufacturing operations, cost 900 jobs. On July 1, Scientific Atlanta fired 1,300 workers shutting plant down. According Nov. 5 New York Times, trend cost Juarez 287,000 jobs maquiladoras since peak October 2000. Not slash burn economic base. There brutal social reverberations, too. The city's health system, Instituto Mexicano del Seguro Social, reported 200,000 people falling list insured losing company policies, according July article La Prensa. Esther Chavez Cano, director Juarez's battered- women's shelter, Casa Amiga, said speech summer domestic violence cases risen 50 percent July alone. The combination poverty lack social connections renders women assembly line powerless virtually invisible. And made easy prey. According El Paso Times, third approximately 325 slain women employed maquiladoras time murder. Given maquiladoras provide shuttle service colonies, female workers often preyed upon walking perilous places like Sitio Colosio Valle darkness early morning. At hour, nearby activity bars nightclubs closing male patrons filter street long night drinking. Besides China's attractive economic climate, intangible cause maquiladora flight Juarez's chronic violence. The effect difficult measure. Two companies city's industrial sector -- including TDK, audio tape maker -- posted banners factories reading: "STOP THE VIOLENCE. To Better Our City, Let's Unite." But foreign companies purely economic organisms governed entirely, seems, dictates efficiency. They maintained stunning silence even female workers slaughtered. Consider case 17-year-old Claudia !vette Gonzalez. Her body found November 2001 along seven others overgrown cotton field Avenida Technologico, blocks Sitio Colosio Valle mall across street offices Association Maquiladoras. She worked assembly line Lear Corp., Detroit-based auto-interior supplier. Lear declined publicly address Gonzalez's murder. Greg Bloom, editor Frontera Norte Sur -- Internet news service focuses U.S.-Mexico border -- recalled conversation Gonzalez's mother, Josefina, recounted daughter's last day. In darkness early morning, Gonzalez told him, Claudia set job Lear. When arrived work minutes late missing bus, Claudia lvette promptly sent away policy barring tardy assembly-line workers shifts. A half-hour past usually would returned home, mother knew something gravely wrong. Her worst fear -- nagging fear shared many Juarez mothers -- would soon realized. Andrea Puchalsky, Lear's director communications, acknowledged company made public statements regarding Gonzalez's murder, enacted proactive measures protect employees another wave violence. "Adding security question relates Lear," said. "[Gonzalez's murder] happen Lear property." When questioned murder Lear policies, Puchalsky mentioned company memo prepared responses possible questions. As Lear's worker-lockout policy, apparently put Gonzalez precarious situation day abduction, Puchalsky declined comment whether Gonzalez locked sent home Lear's plant last day. "We policy tardiness tardy many times," Puchalsky said. "When arrived late work shift, time work shift." When asked whether Lear's offices U.S. similar policy late employees barred working shifts, Puchalsky reversed earlier statement, vehemently denying policy existed anywhere within Lear's operations. "There policy send worker home X number tardy arrivals," said. "Typically someone arriving late kind warning system, might notification 'the next time arrive late, take day ...' It's policy, though. There written policy like throughout Lear Corp." The body 17-year-old Lilia Alejandra Garcia found mutilated 300 feet maquiladora February 2001, since case come embody incompetence corruption police prosecutors Ciudad Juarez state capital Chihuahua City south way Mexico City. Garcia, mother 5-month-old baby 2-year-old child, apparently kidnapped left work. She held captivity week, repeatedly beaten raped, strangled. Then-prosecutor Suly Ponce told Juarez newspaper El Diario Garcia first woman year murdered raped area city - - even though two days before, body unidentified woman found naked blocks away. When FBI leak revealed witness testimony linking Lilia Garcia's killers drug dealers, Suly Ponce dismissed it, calling erroneous. She instead blamed workers circus across street strip mall Garcia last seen. When circus managers claimed Ponce offered money blame co-workers, dropped investigation. According July article El Paso Times, former Chihuahua state forensic chief Oscar Maynez Grijalva said Garcia killed similar manner three eight women found cotton field Claudia 'vette Gonzalez November 2001. Curiously, local authorities behaved evasively investigation Garcia's. When Gonzalez seven women's bodies found November 2001, ex-Chihuahua Attorney General Arturo Gonzalez Rascon immediately fingered two local bus drivers culprits. Yet doubts guilt arose, especially Grijalva -- Rascon's evidence expert time -- resigned post, citing pressure fabricate evidence them. And head local prison forced office documented signs torture accused men returned Rascon's office. Four months later, February 2002, search-and-rescue team combing cotton field found Claudia lvette Gonzalez's overalls plastic bag, along strands hair crucial pieces evidence Rascon's investigators failed discover. In response, Rascon offered opinion El Paso Times: "The state police done thoroughly professional job. I doubt that." But Oct. 28, DNA results revealed Rascon's investigators properly identified one eight dead women -- Gonzalez. Stuck far dubious task catching one madman replacing one feeble leader, Juarez's fractured civil society paralyzed. A cynical mood palpable speaking citizens street, unanimously express fear distrust law-enforcement government officials. Some local cops cynical. "We can't sit around deserted places waiting someone drive dump bodies off," said one municipal police officer seated idling paddy wagon refused give name security reasons. "There us city's big ... We don't get much support federal government. Judicially, protected like cops U.S. Plus, arms give us weak bulletproof vests don't really stop bullets. It's that, though. I young woman home I put place parents lost daughters. But it's question society. We need support need conscious going get better here." The scope crime enormous, little success stopping it, suspicion breeds itself. The litany theories killers motive might suggests Juarez become breeding ground every imaginable predator. And yet, nobody knows. Nothing certain. And feeds climate paranoia. Garcia Gonzalez's murders rumored work serial killer possible ties drug dealers. Yet Garcia found marks wrists that, according local forensics experts, identical made police handcuffs. And upon discovery daughter's overalls, Josefina Gonzalez told El Paso Times someone powerful undoubtedly responsible murder. Many Mexico's law enforcement community agree ring rich men behind killings, evidence support theory. Some suggest young men local aristocracy responsible, protected parents. A persistent theory holds murders -- significant subset -- linked powerful narcotraficantes co-opted segments local ruling class. And cynicism exacerbated fact 17 men one woman accused serial killer masterminds murders, one convicted, Abdel Latif Sharif Sharif, Egyptian chemist resident Texas time extradition Mexico 1995. Currently, Sharif awaiting sentencing allegedly paying drug trafficker named Victor Manuel Rivera Moreno carry dozen murders. However, evidence Sharif suspect charges changed repeatedly. Once even charged killing woman, Elizabeth Ontiveros, showed later police offices prove alive. In 1996, Sharif accused paying gang Los Rebeldes kill 17 women. Then, 1999, charged hiring five bus drivers El Paso man jail cell kill seven women. Officials claimed Sharif hired killers deflect blame himself. By 1999, judges cleared charges, citing absence concrete evidence possibility witness intimidation prosecutors. Suly Ponce, supervised case, yet make compelling case him. In 1999 radio interview, rather presenting hard evidence, claimed Sharif aggressively hostile toward women Egyptian background. Now says case Sharif hinges Moreno's declaration Sharif paid carry killings money earned 13 patents developed Benchmark Research Technology. But according article El Paso Times, Benchmark never paid employees patent development. In telephone interview last week Salon, Ponce said hadn't known this. Angela Paiaveras, current special prosecutor, declined discuss Sharif's case aspect investigations. Many local residents scoff notion killers caught. "We don't believe guys arrested killers," says Miguel Angel Jaramillo, mid-level manager Lear Corp. "It's obvious they're scapegoats." Yet Ponce remains ardent belief Sharif center murders. "Today killings continue many imitators," told Salon last week. "But Sharif caught, almost homicides year." But according Juarez daily El Diario, year immediately Sharif jailed -- period spanning October 1995 October 1996 -- 28 young women found murdered. Meanwhile, theories flourish become paranoid, reflecting breakdown public trust. By one popular theory, women murdered blood rituals cabal wealthy, powerful men. Another theory posits financial motive murder. "We're finding lot girls mutilated way," says young municipal police officer declined give name. "Someone's probably killing take organs sell lot money U.S." When asked evidence support theory, officer replied hunch. Such climate sends message killers every day: You get away anything, even crime scale. But climate breeds cynicism hopelessness among people live work here, also provoked incipient revolt. On radio show "Grueso Calibre" ("Large Caliber"), popular host Samira lzaguirre frequently aired views guests critical authorities handled murders. When Attorney General Rascon accused two bus drivers cotton field murders November 2001, lzaguirre hosted drivers' wives show. After interview, advertisements began appearing local newspapers smearing lzaguirre claims frequented strip clubs romantically involved one bus drivers. News media sides border reported receipt ad signed government officials paid it. Then, February, lzaguirre started organizing vigil announced hunger strike show Radio Canon, fired. Fearing safety, moved across border El Paso. Others, too, discovered pressing complaint forcefully brings reprisal. Marisela Ortiz, co-director Nuestras Hijas Regreso Casa (Our Daughters Back Home), legal support group victims' parents, frequent guest "Grueso Calibre." Like Izaguirre, Ortiz focused resources drawing attention government police incompetence slain women's cases. And says that, like lzaguirre, faced ever-increasing danger. In Nuestras Hijas' office central Juarez, located inside small one-story row house "For Rent" sign front, Ortiz described shadow terror stalked since began pressuring authorities. She claims threatened ex-Chihuahua District Attorney Arturo Gonzalez Rascon. "Rascon came way Juarez [from Chihuahua City] tell involve cases," tells Salon. "Then I got message phone saying: 'You daughters alive. Take care them." Rascon, earlier story Associated Press, denied allegation. Last May, Ortiz says, pursued men black pickup truck tried kidnap her. She believes attempt orchestrated Rascon's office since occurred day planned travel El Paso meeting FBI Texas state Sen. Eliot Shapleigh, D-El Paso, calling bi-national investigation murders. Victims' parents came Nuestras Hijas help finding missing daughters also say threatened. Mario Lee Lopez wife, Soledad Aguilar, lost daughter, Cecilia Covarrubias. She kidnapped 1995 along granddaughter, two months old. By granddaughter would 7, Lopez Aguilar's investigation led believe alive living custody well-connected local family. To outsider desperate story, impossible prove. Lopez accuses Ponce coordinating coverup kidnappings murder: again, Ponce denies charge. And adamant government officials harassed one. "I didn't knowledge threats anybody," said. "On contrary, support families encouraged intimately involved investigations." Lopez recalls incident gone Juarez's judicial building press granddaughter's case exactly find kind support Ponce mentioned. While leaving court, Lopez says, confronted high- ranking minister warned didn't drop investigation, would tortured electric shock devices. "But it's late stop now," Lopez adds wistful smile. Despite campaign lzaguirre, perhaps it, vigil took place scheduled March. It unprecedented show solidarity, thousands people gathered cotton field Gonzalez seven others found irrigation ditch. There still tatters yellow police tape there, candleholders left vigil strewn site. Eight red crosses mark spot bodies found. However, city officials plans memorialize site Juarez's residents have. In fact, according Sept. 4 article El Diario, site used dumping ground Juarez's Department Parks Gardens. Near downtown Juarez monument Abraham Lincoln, honoring "establishing North American industries, today important world." Not far away simple gallery Collective Antigone [Antigone Collective], group local artists, organized series public performances, installations conferences focused Juarez's crisis violence. Each week, artists gather collaborate discuss strategy. At table 12 artists writers, expansive room filled cubist-inspired paintings, Antonio Munoz Ortega, 51-year-old writer, describes Collective's goals problems confronting group. "Our government authoritarian, authoritarian governments principally concerned manipulation life," says. "The victims' families feel manipulated authorities' insensitivity manifested greater greater cynicism that's really dangerous. The struggle, then, reparation simply regaining daily lives." Ortega says moved action Samira Izaguirre's candlelight vigil March. He describes building impromptu church front Association Maquiladoras office effort "communicate different language, one that's symbolic." This decision, says, helped lead formation Collective. The rallying cry Collectiva Antigona, evidenced name, Sophocles Greek tragedy, "Antigone," tells tale girl's persecution hands cruel dictator burying brother. The Collectiva organized readings play around state Chihuahua plans public performance future. The Collectiva also begun establish visual presence around central Juarez, noticeably painting wall spanning entire block poetry written participants recent writer's conference violence women. On Nov. 1 2, Mexican holiday Dia de los Muertos, collective filled room traditional altars honoring victims along giant cross center room covered masks, intended symbolize anonymity victims. An estimated 1,500 people viewed exhibit. A week later, working Nuestras Hijas, collective placed coffin flowers bonfire cotton field ditch Claudia Ivette Gonzalez seven others found. "It absolutely necessary affect civil society intention shaking indolence provoke sort reaction people," says Mariela Paniagua, 41-year-old painter. "People longer affected happening city. They lost capacity outrage face acts." While Collectiva Antigona meets, another group gathers miles away combat Juarez's violence drastically different means. Past seemingly endless rows cardboard hovels desperately poor CoIonia Morelos, beyond municipal dump, rocky desert mesa shadow Mount Indio, members search-and-rescue group called Banda Civil spread hills search murder victims. Luz Elena Guerrero Guerra, strong-looking woman late 50s intense gaze, serves president one Banda Civil's six divisions. Guerra tells began search-and-rescue group 1985 assist massive earthquake Mexico City evolved respond Juarez's crisis. She found first slain women's bodies 1989, investigators even identified deadly trend. Today, Banda Civil's members still lend help natural disasters bulk work comes search bodies, monitoring schools citywide crime- awareness campaign. Ever-present terror, coupled impotence Juarez's authorities, forced Banda Civil's transformation, Guerra says. "I've narrowly escaped violence many times," explains. "Sometimes pure luck bus taxi happens come time someone chasing ... All us, we're uncertain authorities telling us. That's indignation. If [the authorities] aren't interested helping, we'll pressure them." Because group required law cooperate police, view suspicion. Yet success activist groups failed. It Banda Civil members made crucial discovery Claudia lvette Gonzalez's overalls February, humiliating Attorney General Rascon breathing new life investigation. And Banda Civil continued find evidence weekly searches Juarez's human dumping grounds. Besides role search-and-rescue/quasi-vigilante group, Banda Civil feel support group, providing members outlet daily fear comes life Juarez. According Guerra, 300 people accompanied group searches many family members missing women. And indeed, searches family activity. On one recent Saturday, search joined 60 participants ages sectors Juarez society, including middle manager Lear Corp. There terrible discoveries day, yet afterward, people stood around talked listened norteno music blaring car stereo, evident deeply murders ingrained life -- people fighting back whatever tools hand. Perhaps quiet optimism derived age-old Mexican axiom death brings rebirth. "Instead spending time criticizing authorities, we're trying find solutions," says Santos. "We sisters daughters feel same. My daughter danger. I can't let live like this." -- By Max Blumenthal [3( Copyright © 2010 Salon Media Group, Inc. Reproduction material Salon pages without written permission strictly prohibited. Sid In light Clegg's rising popularity partly based anti-Americanism Germany's growing hegemony Europe becoming insular, John Kornblum written op-ed reference last graphs US policy. 7.71 April 23, 2010 I.H.T. Op-Ed Contributor Germany Need Dream By JOHN KORNBLUM Has Germany abandoned Europe? Do Angela Merkel's tough conditions aid Greece mean Germany longer motor European integration? Has Frau Merkel fact morphed Miss Europa 2007 Fraulein Germania 2010, Germany's former foreign minister Joschka Fischer suggested? As former American ambassador lived arid worked better part four decades around Germany, Blackberry often glows red hot messages persons asking questions. My response always same: Germany changed little, Europe world changed lot. Therein lies dilemma. Germany worked hard dig way disaster 1945, trauma remains defining issue German society. Sixty five years later, Germany still focused three essentials recovery: stability, respectability peace. Keep triangle mind lots things quickly come focus. From first days Federal Republic. Germany's leaders emphasized importance defining interests solely within common European Atlantic vocation. But also understood renouncing national ambitions remove responsibility pursue specific German goals common institutions. Many important postwar accomplishments conceived pushed Germany, sometimes opposition others — including United States. Ostpolitik controversial years, NATO enlargement. Germany pushed determination. Helmut Kohl consult promulgating 10 points reunification. He agreed French desires common currency, could mirror Deutsche mark, decades European monetary standard. The euro stability pact, object much controversy Greece, result. After 1990, E.U.'s eastward expansion Germany's way firming Eastern flank. Slowly without fanfare, Germany remaking European Union image. At step way, Germany made wishes palatable paying share. Part today's misunderstanding caused Germany's success using contributions build image selflessness. Germany single-minded pursuit goals Charles de Gaulle ever his, almost always left leadership others. A new consciousness grew costs reunification began mount. "Europe" institutional sense become increasingly unpopular. German courts begun define German European issues context German Constitution rather basis E.U. law. At least Ms. Merkel's refusal allow immediate assistance Greece based fears would fan anti-E.U. sentiment home. Are first signs German Tea Party? Here find source hand wringing Germany's role "motor Europe." Ms. Merkel's unwillingness sweeten financial pot echoed throughout Brussels. To many, signified decline German willingness "salute French flag three times raising German flag," Konrad Adenauer used put it. Germans alone objecting throwing money E.U. pot, happen ones something it. Many fear without German complaisance, E.U. stutter stop. But self- denial could never offer viable foundation new Europe. Neither could inefficiency even corruption characterizes many E.U. programs. Most maddening thinking Europeans knowledge Germans right. But them, question whether Germany remaking E.U. fashion palatable majority member states. They sure focus stability accountability right way help diverse collection peoples adjust globalized world. And Angela Merkel raps Greek knuckles, sending message Europeans don't want hear. Not Germany dangerous; even worse, unrelenting. The Neue aricher Zeitung probably spoke many others accused Germany wanting Europe become large Switzerland. The growing gap Germany's aspirations perceived needs members E.U. beginning burden sides. Most Europeans simply ready live German standards. Without flexible sense common purpose, project build democratic Europe could stop dead water. But Germans often tell you: They forgotten dream. Younger Germans feel lack inspiration well. Dreams 200,000 waiting hear rallied hear Barack Obama Berlin two summers ago. They wanted "Dare Hope," characteristically timid German translation title president's best seller. And still waiting. America seems busy elsewhere. The main conclusion I draw debate Germany Germany all. The task building democratic Europe far complete. Most foundations laid residents starting haggle design. Weaving today's 27 states true trans-Atlantic partnership task big Germany even Europe accomplish alone. They desperately need skilled architectural assistance. Uniting Europe North America audacious project ever conceived. If works, United States joined nearly 500 million Europeans form democratic space, within modern democratic values harness energy single nation earth. Democracy's future operating system globalized world assured. European fecklessness seems worry Washington officials days. But Germany forgotten dream United States busy try, guilty perpetuating aimlessness criticize. To hold side bargain, Europe needs exactly Barack Obama originally promised — audacity hope. John Kornblum, senior counselor international law firm Noerr LLP Berlin, served U.S. ambassador Germany 1997 2001.

From ops: CG Shanghai provided update Chinese President Hu's visit U.S. pavilion Shanghai Expo. For situational awareness: SWO Chinese President Hu Jintao visited USA Pavilion Shanghai Expo around 12:30 p.m. 15-20 minutes Thursday, April 29 (Shanghai time). USA Pavilion Commissioner General Jose Villarreal Consul General Beatrice Camp greeted President Hu, accompanied Vice Premier Wang Qishan, Shanghai Expo Bureau officials, large contingent Chinese media. Hu walked pavilion's initial section (the "Overture") Vice Premier Wang Qishan called attention logos pavilion's sponsors. The Chinese president also viewed film clip President Obama welcoming visitors pavilion shook hands 10 nearly 80 U.S. "student ambassadors" staffing pavilion. Before departing, President Hu thanked Commissioner General Villarreal wished USA Pavilion great success.
BEIJING, April 29 (Reuters) - A knife-wielding man injured 28 children, two teachers security guard kindergarten eastern China, state media reported Thursday, fourth stabbing case recent weeks. Xu Yuyuan, 47, unemployed local man, broke classroom Taixing city eastern Jiangsu province Thursday morning, attacking children 20 cm long knife, official Xinhua news agency said. The injured children four years old, five critical condition, added. Xu jobless since fired local insurance company 2001, took part pyramid selling schemes, Xinhua added. The attack fourth reported school stabbing China recent weeks, rash violence prompted public calls measures protect students country many couples one child. A man stabbed 16 students teacher primary school southern China Wednesday, day former doctor executed stabbing death eight school children last month. "More concrete measures taken make school safest place," commentary today's Beijing News said, calling serve punishment killers. Some Chinese people taken Internet discuss root causes increasing number school tragedies
