Sid http://mideast.foreignpolicy.com/posts/2010/03/14/the_petraeus_briefing_biden_s_embarrassment_is_not_the_whole_sto ry The Petraeus briefing: Biden's embarrassment whole story Posted By Mark Perry 4Saturday, March 13, 2010 - On Jan. 16, two days killer earthquake hit Haiti, team senior military officers U.S. Central Command (responsible overseeing American security interests Middle East), arrived Pentagon brief Joint Chiefs Staff Chairman Adm. Michael Mullen Israeli-Palestinian conflict. The team dispatched CENTCOM commander Gen. David Petraeus underline growing worries lack progress resolving issue. The 33- slide, 45-minute PowerPoint briefing stunned Mullen. The briefers reported growing perception among Arab leaders U.S. incapable standing Israel, CENTCOM's mostly Arab constituency losing faith American promises, Israeli intransigence Israeli-Palestinian conflict jeopardizing U.S. standing region, Mitchell (as senior Pentagon officer later bluntly described it) "too old, slow ... late." The January Mullen briefing unprecedented. No previous CENTCOM commander ever expressed essentially political issue; briefers careful tell Mullen conclusions followed December 2009 tour region where, Petraeus's instructions, spoke senior Arab leaders. "Everywhere went, message pretty humbling," Pentagon officer familiar briefing says. "America viewed weak, military posture region eroding." But Petraeus wasn't finished: two days Mullen briefing, Petraeus sent paper White House requesting West Bank Gaza (which, Israel, part European Command -- EUCOM), made part area operations. Petraeus's reason straightforward: U.S. troops deployed Iraq Afghanistan, U.S. military perceived Arab leaders engaged region's troublesome conflict. [UPDATE: A senior military officer denied Sunday Petraeus sent paper White House. "CENTCOM team brief CJCS concerns revolving around Palestinian issue, CENTCOM propose UCP change, CJCS, WH," officer said via email. "GEN Petraeus certain might conveyed WH (if anything) brief CJCS." (UCP means "unified combatant command," like CENTCOM; CJCS refers Mullen; WH White House.)] The Mullen briefing Petraeus's request hit White House like bombshell. While Petraeus's request CENTCOM expanded include Palestinians denied ("it dead arrival," Pentagon officer confirms), Obama administration decided would redouble efforts -- pressing Israel settlements issue, sending Mitchell visit number Arab capitals dispatching Mullen carefully arranged meeting chief Israeli General Staff, Lt. General Gabi Ashkenazi. While American press speculated Mullen's trip focused Iran, JCS Chairman actually carried blunt, tough, message Israeli-Palestinian conflict: Israel see conflict Palestinians "in larger, regional, context" -- direct impact America's status region. Certainly, thought, Israel would get message. Israel didn't. When Vice President Joe Biden embarrassed Israeli announcement Netanyahu government building 1,600 new homes East Jerusalem, administration reacted. But one outraged Biden who, according Israeli daily Yedioth Ahronoth, engaged private, angry, exchange Israeli Prime Minister. Not surprisingly, Biden told Netanyahu reflected importance administration attached Petraeus's Mullen briefing: "This starting get dangerous us," Biden reportedly told Netanyahu. "What you're undermines security troops fighting Iraq, Afghanistan Pakistan. That endangers us endangers regional peace." Yedioth Ahronoth went report: "The vice president told Israeli hosts since many people Muslim world perceived connection Israel's actions US policy, decision construction undermines Palestinian rights East Jerusalem could impact personal safety American troops fighting Islamic terrorism." The message couldn't plainer: Israel's intransigence could cost American lives. There important powerful lobbies America: NRA, American Medical Association, lawyers -- Israeli lobby. But lobby important, powerful, U.S. military. While commentators pundits might reflect Joe Biden's trip Israel forever shifted America's relationship erstwhile ally region, real break came January, David Petraeus sent briefing team Pentagon stark warning: America's relationship Israel important, important lives America's soldiers. Maybe Israel gets message now. • aClose Window • Print lop_ag_ From The Sunday Times March 28, 2010 It's over: MPs say special relationship S dead Winston Churchill, Franklin D Roosevelt Josef Stalin Michael Smith BRITAIN'S special relationship US forged Winston Churchill Franklin Roosevelt second world war -- longer exists, says committee influential MPs. Instead, America's relationship Britain special main allies, according report Commons foreign affairs committee published today. The report also warns perception UK Iraq war America's "subservient poodle" highly damaging Britain's reputation interests around world. The MPs conclude British prime ministers learn less deferential US presidents "willing say no" America. The report, entitled Global Security: UK-US Relations, says Britain's relationship America "extremely close valuable" number areas, particularly intelligence co-operation. However, adds use phrase special relationship, historical sense, "is potentially misleading recommend use avoided". It reflect "ever-evolving" relationship two countries raises unrealistic expectations, MPs say. "Over longer term, UK unlikely able influence US extent past," committee adds. In apparent rebuke Tony Blair relationship President George W Bush, report says "many lessons" learnt Britain's political approach towards US Iraq. "The perception British government subservient poodle US administration widespread among British public overseas," MPs say. "This perception, whatever relation reality, deeply damaging reputation interests UK." While relationship American president British prime minister important part dealings two countries, cabinet parliament also role play. "The UK needs less deferential willing say US issues two countries' interests values diverge," MPs say. They also critical US use extraordinary rendition torture. The report calls comprehensive review use CIA British bases, Indian Ocean island Diego Garcia, carry extraordinary rendition. "The issues relating rendition Diego Garcia previously drawn attention raise disturbing questions uses US bases British territory put", MPs say. They express regret "considerable restraints" ability government parliament scrutinise US activities carried British territory. "We recommend government establish comprehensive review current arrangements governing US military use facilities within UK British overseas territories." The review "identify shortcomings current system scrutiny oversight ... report parliament proposals remedy these". The report also demands statement government implications Court Appeal judgment regarding alleged collusion MI5 torture Binyam Mohamed, British resident. Last month court ordered government release evidence American intelligence reports showed MI5 aware torture. Senior US officials subsequently suggested releasing evidence might prevent US sharing intelligence Britain. FYI INTERNATIONAL NEWS #843 June 21, 2010 Rex Wockner Iceland legalizes same-sex marriage The Icelandic parliament, Albingi, legalized same-sex marriage June 11. The vote 49-0. Fourteen MPs skipped vote. Same-sex couples able marry starting June 27. The registered-partnership apparatus gay couples used past longer available. The national LGBT association, Samtokin 78, said Iceland removed last obstacle equal rights all. Iceland ninth nation same-sex couples marry nationwide 11th nation same-sex marriage possible. Icelandic Prime Minister Johanna Siguroardottir openly lesbian. Gay marriage also legal Belgium, Canada, Netherlands, Norway, Portugal, South Africa, Spain, Sweden, Mexico City, Connecticut, Iowa, Massachusetts, New Hampshire, Vermont Washington, D.C.

PVerveer Sunday, March 28, 2010 9:03 PM Fwd: FW: Recruit Afghan women sell war Europeans: CIA report Interesting. Recruit Afghan women sell war Europeans: CIA report WASHINGTON, March 27, 2010 (AFP) - A CIA expert called recruiting Afghan women public relations bid persuade skeptical Europeans support NATO-led war effort, according document leaked Friday. "Afghan women could serve ideal messengers humanizing" mission European audiences, particularly France, according CIA analysis, posted WikiLeaks, whistleblower website. The views Afghan women would carry special weight could express "their aspirations future, fears Taliban victory," said. The Central Intelligence Agency declined confirm deny document genuine. But WikiLeaks previously posted government corporate documents later verified. The report CIA expert "strategic communications" State Department analysts public opinion warned popular support war Europe weak could easily collapse, citing recent fall Dutch government issue. "The tone previous debate suggests spike French German casualties Afghan civilian casualties could become tipping point converting passive opposition active calls immediate withdrawal," said. The analysis, dated March 11, suggested public relations strategies drum support war Germany France, maintain third fourth largest troop deployments Afghanistan. "Outreach initiatives create media opportunities Afghan women share stories French, German, European women could help overcome pervasive skepticism among women Western Europe toward ISAF (International Security Assistance Force) mission," said. Public relations efforts could "tap acute French concern civilians refugees," report said, suggesting highlighting polls show Afghans support presence coalition troops. Such approach could stress potential dangers facing Afghan civilians NATO-led troops defeated "leverage French (and European) guilt abandoning them." "The prospect Taliban rolling back hard-won progress girls I- education could provoke French indignation, become rallying point France's largely secular public, give voters reason support good necessary cause despite casualties." For German audiences, marketing efforts underline Afghans reportedly optimistic NATO mission international retreat would damage Germany's interests. "For example, messages illustrate defeat Afghanistan could heighten Germany's exposure terrorism, opium, refugees might help make war salient skeptics," said. The report also suggested taking advantage President Barack Obama's popularity France Germany, arguing appeals US president importance allied role war could positive effect. The memorandum titled: "Afghanistan: Sustaining West European Support NATO-led Mission -- Why Counting Apathy Might Not Be Enough." HOUSTON — (March 31, 2010) - Former First Lady Barbara Bush discharged Wednesday The Methodist Hospital Houston undergoing series tests. Doctors believe Mrs. Bush, 84, may mild relapse Graves disease, thyroid condition treated 1989. As result, physicians Methodist adjusted medication. Upon discharge alert, talkative appeared getting stronger prepared return home. Mrs. Bush arrived Saturday hospital, received number tests including blood tests imaging studies. Just year ago Mrs. Bush received replacement aortic valve Methodist, doctors said working well. Mrs. Bush expected make full recovery soon return normal activities.

Sid http://www.ft.com/cms/s/O/df53a396-3c2a-11df-b40c-00144feabdc0.html • Skip main content, accesskev 's" • Homecage, accesskev '1' Financial Times FT.com pOMMENT :Analysis • Close RI US foreign policy: aiting sun king By Edward Luce Daniel Dombey Published: March 30 2010 22:22 I Last updated: March 30 2010 22:22 For better worse, Washington grown used fact PgIrack Obama runs centralised — "White House-centric" — administration since Richard Nixon. When Nixon wanted foreign policy advice, everyone knew got from: Henry 'Kissinger, variously national security adviser secretary state. In contrast, Mr Obama big foreign policy strategist. Even insiders give different answers asked turns advice big international questions. But almost agree following observation. "The truth President Obama Henry Kissinger — one else plays role," says senior official. "Every administration reflects personality president. This president wants trains Barack Obama Great Wall China last year. Unlike predecessor Richard Nixon, turned Henry Kissinger advice, US president big foreign policy strategist routed Oval Office." Fifteen months took office, character structure Mr Obama's foreign policy machinery still evolving. But interviews dozens insiders outsiders, including senior officials authorised unauthorised speak, three former national security advisers, clear buck stops with, often floats quite long time around, Mr Obama himself. Foreigners complained tendency domestic agenda crowd international one — passage last week healthcare reform greeted audible sigh relief among US allies. But within foreign policy itself, centralised structure also result many issues left back burner awaiting presidential attention, say critics. "On positive side, conscientious president takes advice widely," says official. "On debit side, president's intelligence, Barack Obama came office little experience. He doesn't much depth issues.' The core Mr Obama's foreign policy machinery White House-based National Security Council, advises president co-ordinates activities across increasingly complex alphabet soup Washington departments, military commands intelligence agencies. The widely questioned link chain Jim Jones, whom, many people's surprise, Mr Obama brought national security adviser. Only briefly acquainted Mr Obama beforehand, General Jones, retired four-star marine corps general, shows little interest running "inter-agency" process — key part job. Somewhat unconventionally, Gen Jones travels frequently thus often town. Unusually, Mr Obama usually chairs weekly National Security Council, known "principals meeting", Gen Jones. Rahm Emanuel, Mr Obama's chief staff, also key part it. "If ask real national security adviser is, I would say three four, Rehm one Gen Jones probably least important," says another official. Anyone dealt Gen Jones speaks highly matter-of-factness, geniality respect many foreign governments — Pakistan Israel among them. But admitted rather disarmingly last year, taste bureaucracy. Speaking Atlantic Council, think-tank previously worked, Gen Jones provoked laughter said: "I fondly remember [the Atlantic Council] place people actually asked do. In new role I'm finding order basis negotiation." The lack strong national security adviser created recurring difficulties. Perhaps best example Arab- Israeli peace process, Mr Obama launched second day office appointed Geproe Mitphspil envoy. Three months later, Mr Obama insisted Benjamin Netanyahu freeze settlements activity order boost Arab confidence talks. In heated ;34.16NA(dpyin ,Clvg li..0f7;ce. last May, Mr Netanyahu refused accede Mr Obama's demand, officials present Mr Emanuel David Axelrod, senior adviser Mr Obama office campaign. Gen Jones there. The fallout put talks abeyance damped high Arab hopes Mr Obama. "The question is, bright spark advised president demand settlements freeze without working next step Netanyahu inevitably said 'No'?" says Leslie Gelb, official Carter administration former head Council Foreign Relations. "Why wasn't George Mitchell room? Where Jones?" Mr Obama's character also stamped inter-agency process, set managed Tom Donilon, deputy national security adviser. The nitty-gritty foreign policy-making done frequent "deputies' meetings", sometimes consume four six hours day. Described one insider "the powerful man White House whose name isn't widely known", Mr Donilon, official Clinton administration, man keeps Mr Obama's trains running time. And lot trains. Last year, Mr Donilon held 270 deputies meetings — workload described "clinically insane" former senior diplomat Bill Clinton. But time goes on, becoming streamlined — taking roughly two three hours day, say officials. "People forget inherited two wars, terrorism threats, perhaps biggest single eight-year decline [George W. Bush's two terms] America's power reputation history," says senior official. "It took time put place process could deal complex decisions take." Also organiser Mr Obama's 9.30arn national security briefing, Mr Donilon reinstated paper trails needed prevent intra-governmental anarchy, using model devised Brent Scowcroft, national security adviser George Bush senior Gerald Ford. Vice-president Joe Biden's team also incorporated prevent kind "parallel process" Dick Cheney used circumvent bureaucracy George W. Bush. "If look 2002 2003 meeting decision go war iraq taken, cannot find it," says senior official. "By getting process right, improving quality decisions." The deputies' ties go back years. For example, families Mr Don;Ion Jim Steinberg, deputy secretary state, often go holiday together. Mr Donilon's wife, Cathy Russell, chief staff Jill Biden, vice-president's wife. This well, since spend half lives together: "A lot work gets done group," says Ms Flournoy. "Sometimes feels like shovelling coal keep fires going." The refurbished machinery perhaps evidence build-up Mr Obama's decision December send another 30,000 US troops Afghanistan — journey took four months involved 40 hours Oval Office meetings. But diligence process crowded Mr Obama's time focus crises — many. "Time precious commodity president has," says former national security adviser. "On average going 45 minutes day foreign policy, want make sure well spent." The widely expected departure Gen Jones end year also created rivalries within engine room. Those thought ambitions replace include Mr Steinberg, Ms Rice, Mr Donilon Denis McDonough, NSC chief staff foreign policy official personally closest Mr Obama. Although widely respected, none considered big strategic thinker Kissinger Scowcroft mould. Described Mr Gelb Mr Obama's "Lord High Executioner", Mr McDonough "has appended Chicago crowd", says another official. Mr McDonough's widely feared role highlights contradictions Mr Obama's foreign policy apparatus. Once adviser former Senate majority leader Tom Deschle, Mr McDonough frequently Mr Obama's side campaign. Insiders describe "enforcer" keeper "message discipline", key element campaign something drastically slow wheels government. "McDonough guy campaign one plays basketball president — they're close," says official. "Instead Jim Jones telling McDonough president thinks, way round." "Fairly not, McDonough perceived representing process taking place another room, among inner circle, table weren't invited." Mr Obama built machine roads lead him. After Afghan Shift, Top U.S. Civilians Face Tricky Future By MARK LANDLER WASHINGTON — As General David H. Petraeus takes command Afghanistan, two top American civilian officials war face uncertain tricky future, working newly empowered military leader, gaze impatient president put notice fractious war council needs pull together.Richard C. Holbrooke, Obama administration's special representative region, Karl W. Eikenberry, ambassador Afghanistan, hung jobs uproar followed Gen. Stanley A. McChrystal's career-ending quotes Rolling Stone magazine.But privately, least one senior White House official suggested using General McChrystal's exit excuse housecleaning, according senior officials. That rejected disruptive military campaign relies heavily civilian support, people said.ln recent days, administration officials begun floating idea Ambassador Eikenberry might replaced Ryan C. Crocker, highly regarded former ambassador Iraq forged close partnership General Petraeus successful Iraq troop increase. Such prospect viewed remote, given Mr. Crocker's prestigious new post Texas A&M University. But fact name invoked underlines challenges confront Ambassador Eikenberry, adapts new partner — one strong ideas soldiers diplomats work together war. It also illustrates remarkably powerful role General Petraeus assume nine-year-old war, setting almost viceroy Afghanistan key broker negotiations President Hamid Karzai Pakistan eventual political settlement.Before General Petraeus's arrival, critics said White House created problem recruiting several forceful, ambitious personalities giving jobs overlapping responsibilities. Administration officials acknowledge that, one said, "there obviously number substantial personalities team." But White House believes current lineup mesh, difficult war demands much talent. Still, McChrystal blow-up reverberated State Department. Secretary State Hillary Rodham Clinton instructed Ambassador Eikenberry Mr. Holbrooke take hard look civilian team, two officials said. She wedded current lineup continues bog internecine battles, said."You can't major shift civ-mil structure without civilian side take step back look everything," said senior State Department official, using jargon civilian-military campaign.General Petraeus, whose appointment approved 99-0 Senate Wednesday, took pains confirmation hearing Tuesday back unified civilian military effort. He noted telephoned Mr. Holbrooke would rendezvous Ambassador Eikenberry Brussels, two could land Kabul together."Holbrooke wingman, great degree," General Petraeus said interview. "We had, have, good relationship." That role, said, fall Ambassador Eikenberry.Ambassador Eikenberry highly critical Pentagon's proposal last year send 60,000 additional troops Afghanistan, led difficult relationship General McChrystal. But fact General Petraeus true architect plan.The ambassador, retired lieutenant general former commander Afghanistan, graduated West Point 1973, year ahead General Petraeus, know academy. The two share scholarly bent: General Petraeus holds Ph.D. Princeton, Ambassador Eikenberry master's degrees Harvard Stanford.While never assigned together, careers intersected twice. In Iraq, General Eikenberry led assessment Iraqi security forces General Petraeus commanding 101st Airborne Division Mosul. When General Eikenberry commander Afghanistan, General Petraeus led assessment Afghan National Security Forces.General Petraeus declined discuss personnel issues, Ambassador Eikenberry Mr. Holbrooke turned requests interview. Mr. Crocker, dean George Bush School Government Texas A&M, return call comment. For Mr. Holbrooke, new landscape challenging ways. Officials said job security less doubt six months ago, ouster subject Washington chatter. Yet arguably become less central player: Jacob J. Lew, deputy secretary state, manages much civilian influx Afghanistan Mr. Holbrooke helped shape, embassy Kabul carrying out. Mr. Holbrooke's current portfolio played weaknesses, allies admit. He best high-level negotiator, comfortable nitty-gritty work helping Afghanistan build economy.These days, Mr. Holbrooke become globe-trotting diplomat, trying retain flagging European allies seeking draw influential Muslim countries like Egypt helping Afghanistan. At recent conference 35 countries Madrid, Mr. Holbrooke drummed support allies Afghan government's campaign reintegrate Taliban fighters mainstream society.Mr. Karzai's longer-term effort reconcile Taliban leaders, negotiations Pakistan, could propel Mr. Holbrooke back central role. Were talks become serious, several officials said, Mr. Holbrooke's negotiating skills could put use, broker guardian American interests. For now, though, evidence General Petraeus's influence, shuttling Kabul Islamabad, Pakistani capital.On last visit region, Mr. Holbrooke met Mr. Karzai senior Pakistani officials, including army chief staff, Ashfaq Parvez Kayani. Mr. Holbrooke's past run-ins Mr. Karzai, several officials said, hindered ability deal Afghan leader, Pakistani officials said trusted him. Husain Haqqani, Pakistan's ambassador Washington, said Mr. Holbrooke took time understand Pakistan's concerns. "Ambassador Holbrooke liked some, admired others seen effective, even may like him," Mr. Haqqani said.Still, General Petraeus indisputably key player, wasted time asserting control. On secure videoconference call last Saturday, person familiar call said, General Petraeus threw support behind costly, controversial, plan install temporary generators supply electricity Kandahar, Taliban stronghold next major American military target.Mr. Holbrooke Ambassador Eikenberry swiftly assented.

And main points listening (and noting main points real time handy ' uiveaSccibe, pen.) - In contrast dreamy Internet optimism decade ago -- I'm naming names, I remember! -- many people imagined info technology, itself, would undermine oppression bring world together, Clinton started astringent reminder technology, like others, neither good bad already used helpful destructive ways: "Amid unprecedented surge connectivity, must also recognize technologies unmitigated blessing. And nice pivot section, effective it's blunt plain: "On own, new technologies take sides struggle freedom progress, United States does." - Underscoring "this big deal" tone speech, enumerated "Four Freedoms" FDR proclaimed 1941, part struggle world's future, said comparable set Four Freedoms Internet age. Compared US financial power, OK; overtaking japan economic size, yes; crucial player environmental negotiations.., one thing. Bracketed sentence Tunisia Uzbekistan different. If corporate decision makers don't access global sources news information, investors less confidence decisions long term. Countries censor news information must recognize economic standpoint, distinction censoring political speech commercial speech. If businesses nations denied access either type information, inevitably impact growth. "Increasingly, U.S. companies making issue internet information freedom greater consideration business decisions. I hope competitors foreign governments pay close attention trend. (AFP: Matthew Marek United Nations officials say children gone missing hospitals Haiti since devastating January 12 earthquake, raising fears trafficking adoption abroad. "We documented around 15 cases children disappearing hospitals family time," said UNICEF adviser Jean Luc Legrand. "UNICEF working Haiti many years knew problem trade children Haiti existed already beforehand. "Unfortunately, many trade networks links international adoption market." The agency said warned countries past week step adoptions Haiti immediate wake quake. Trafficking networks springing action immediately disaster taking advantage weakness local authorities relief coordination "to kidnap children get country". The UN mission Haiti stepped surveillance roads, UNICEF officials said. Sid http://blog.newsweelocom/blogs/thegaggle/archive/2010/01/22/should-foreign-corporations-spend-money-on-u-s-political- candidates.aspx Posted Friday, January 22, 2010 1:05 PM Newsweek Should Foreign Corporations Spend Money U.S. Political Candidates? Krista Gesaman Foreign businesses might real winners Citizens United v. Federal Elections Commission, landmark case allows corporations unions spend limitless amounts money presidential congressional political campaigns. A majority large businesses owned foreign entities, means international corporations could pour tons money United States political scene, potentially swaying political climate. The biggest questions ruling scope term "corporation," says Edward Foley, law professor Ohio State University College Law director election-law program. Does high court want decision apply foreign corporations well domestic ones, ponders? The truth is, court didn't make decision one way other. Foley best explains potential issues talking electronic, video, communication giant, Sony. The corporation headquartered Japan, large number shareholders reside United States. In fact, people even buy trade Sony's stock New York Stock Exchange. The issue whether corporation, strong ties foreign country United States, permitted independently contribute money presidential congressional campaigns. The court sought expand First Amendment protection corporations, really mean promote free flow ideas Russian Chinese corporations, Foley asks? Justice John Pau! Stevens focused concerns dissenting opinion. The majority's position "would appear afford protection multinational corporations controlled foreigners individual Americans," writes. This afternoon, President Obama asked Congress "develop forceful response" ruling. But Congress juggling many important issues, it's unlikely change made immediate future. This could mean foreign cash could supporting political candidates next year's congressional midterm elections.

FYI: SENSITIVE BUT UNCLASSIFIED January 22, 2010 NOTE FOR THE SECRETARY FROM: G/TIP — Luis CdeBaca SUBJECT: Child Trafficking Haiti G/TIP gravely concerned potential human trafficking (TIP) wake earthquake, result displacement population influx troops aid workers. Even earthquake, Haiti 300,000 restaveks (children given away sold parents enslaved domestic servants), well reports members MINUSTAH used trafficked women prostitution. In 2009 TIP Report Haiti classified Special Case country governance dysfunctional could ranked. The initial disaster response focusing immediate needs food, shelter, medical care, thus far addressed TIP prevention protection issues. While attention paid problems orphans adoptees, TIP adequately addressed UN's initial flash appeal, unclear agency international system lead ground. UNICEF child protection lead, UNFPA leads prevention sexual gender-based violence, IOM tasked shelter camp management. We work remedy, subsequent appeal, omission TIP operational plan. We moving redirect $1 million program funds G/TIP Hispaniola reprogram additional $550,000; work PRM identify funding possibilities. FYI: From one folks hired working Pierre Louis: Lessons Aceh Nias Multi-Donor Trust Fund 1. The Government Indonesia (G01) responded Tsunami issuing series government decrees, immediately organized overview relief efforts ensure rational coordinated response. The first task produce Damage Loss Assessment (DLA). The DLA followed detailed Master Plan Rehabilitation Reconstruction (MPRR). The MPRR provided in-depth sector plans, spatial planning, governance supervision arrangements finances considerable attention avoid minimize corruption. The process behind MPRR consultative, wide range local stakeholders public offices heard. The MPRR presented 26 March, 3 months Tsunami. 2. The MPRR form basis general three-stage strategy. The Relief phase originally set six months, reduced three: January- March 2005. The Rehabilitation phase run 21 months, December 2006, Reconstruction phase July 2006 December 2009. The MPRR provides well defined phasing interventions. 3. The objectives Relief efforts humanitarian relief: rescue; food medicine; emergency infrastructure temporary shelter; burying dead. The Rehabilitation phase restore services minimum level: public services; economic facilities; banking financial institutions; trauma treatments; secure land rights; law order; temporary shelter. Finally, Reconstruction rebuild region: rebuilding economy (production, trade banking); transportation, telecommunications, social cultural systems; improving institutional capacity; housing. 4. The Government set ministerial-level agency manage MPRR program Aceh itself, Rehabilitation Reconstruction Agency Aceh Nias. The BRR formally established end April 2005 became operational early May. The World Bank Board 30 March 2005 formally established Multi-Donor Trust Fund (MDF) Steering Committee comprised BRR, GOI, donors civil society. Having credible local coordinators key success. 5. The EC channels nearly 93% funds MDF, 2.5% USD 400 million US goes MDF. While payments fund slow, disbursements begin even slower. By October 2005, project agreements USD 200 million signed, USD 3 million actually disbursed. Disbursements picked pace thereafter. The delay caused two principal impediments: first, donors quick pledge funds, getting exact written agreements place took time. This points need donors flexible regarding formal agreements, accept simple, generic paragraphs contribute speedy resolution slightly differing phrasings concerns. Second, processing time project approval implementation concern. Since MDF funded projects on-budget, implemented government institutions. This crated bottlenecks. 6. Smaller donors joined wished support reconstruction efforts Aceh capacity often strong views best pursue this. They want Bank assume fiduciary responsibilities funds high-risk environment, also take lead ensuring funds go prioritized activities. The MDF thus seen well-managed bank account paid- administrative services. However, all-inclusive Steering Committee made membership large extent unwieldy, forced discuss policy operational issues. 7. The Multi Donor Fund Secretariat developed Outreach Strategy includes regular radio talk shows, field visits meet discuss beneficiaries communication advertisements well telephone hotline. 8. MDF received praise engaging Government Indonesia (G01) policy dialogue. The MDF thus entry point engaging conditions sustainability, relevance impact. 9. Because MDF accept strict ear marking donor contributions — though allow preference indications — means funds freely available programming according criteria priorities MDF agrees to. Given strong GOI participation, MDF seen successful instrument harmonization coordination environment criticized lack coordination. The MDF's Mid Term Review conducted 2008-2009 found MDF made positive contribution harmonizing donor efforts increasing effectiveness efficiency reconstruction effort. 10. The MDF sufficiently engage private sector coherent job creation strategy. The MDF lacked executive rights, GOI BRR credited leveraging decisive response.

"Let's get rid freeze get back building," declared Israeli Minister Public Affairs Diaspora Yuli Edelstein Israel National Radio yesterday. "It's land anyway!" (Edelstein lives settlement Neve Daniel). Back US, former Israel lobbyist ex-Clinton Assistant Secretary State Martin Indyk took Washington Post's op-ed page praise Netanyahu Barack Obama ensuring "there zero building starts West Bank settlements." During week June 21, I traveled West Bank Swedish photojournalist Linda Forsell document new settlement construction settlers' theft water Palestinian towns. Forsell took series photos Har Homa, massive Israeli settlement towering Palestinian town Beit Sarhour. Her photos show ongoing construction hundreds new settlement units — documents settlement freeze sham. 0 Netanyahu authorized building new settlement units days announced freeze November 2009. He attempted disguise new settlement construction drawing false distinction West Bank "parts Jerusalem" like Har Homa actually lie outside 1967 lines. As Israeli government flack Mark Regev remarked December 2009, "We've made clear distinction West Bank Jerusalem. Jerusalem capital stay such." With exceptions, Obama allowed scheme go forward. According Washington Post, Obama's meeting Netanyahu week reassuring Jewish Democrats halting wholesale colonization West Bank. As Post's Anne Kornblut reported, "The White House meeting dwell difficult time-sensitive issues, including expiration moratorium Israeli settlement construction September." This may mean end settlement freeze, illusion all.

SECURITY COUNCIL PRESIDENTIAL STATEMENT ON THE RECENT INCIDENT IN THE EASTERN MEDITERRANEAN The Security Council deeply regrets loss life injuries resulting use force Israeli military operation international waters convoy sailing Gaza. The Council, context, condemns acts resulted loss least ten civilians many wounded, expresses condolences families. The Security Council requests immediate release ships well civilians held Israel. The Council urges Israel permit full consular access, allow countries concerned retrieve deceased wounded immediately, ensure delivery humanitarian assistance convoy destination. The Security Council takes note statement UN Secretary—General need full investigation matter calls prompt, impartial, credible transparent investigation conforming international standards. The Security Council stresses situation Gaza sustainable. The Council re-emphasizes importance full implementation Resolutions 1850 1860. In context, reiterates grave concern humanitarian situation Gaza stresses need sustained regular flow goods people Gaza well unimpeded provision distribution humanitarian assistance throughout Gaza. The Security Council underscores viable solution Israeli-Palestinian conflict agreement negotiated parties re-emphasizes two-State solution, independent viable Palestinian State living side side peace security Israel neighbours, could bring peace region. Gaza: it's Hamas's move Hamas must seize initiative ever end Israel's occupation Palestine • • c) Jeremy Greenstock o quardian.co.uk, Wednesday 2 June 2010 12.29 BST So happened again. Nearly 18 months Israelis bombed Gaza wasteland, barely load building materials allowed since then, Turkey taken brunt operation humanitarian assistance gone wrong. The UN must establish facts impartially independently and, laws broken, responsible must held account. Political demonstrations posing relief flotillas go wrong easily Israel understandably prevent weapons smuggled Gaza. But really best way bring ships shore examination? A commando attack civilian ships looks callous disproportionate. No one hurt, whatever emotions behind this. Why Gaza siege first place? Under international law, Israelis responsible occupying force proper administration territory; half point Israel law. Yet creating traumatised territory 1.5m neighbours, many whose children seem want grow suicide bombers. They also pouring fertiliser al-Qaida's ground. The director UNRWA operations Gaza, John Ging, gave speech London week entitled "Illegal, inhuman. insane: medieval siege Gaza 2010". This objective humanitarian practitioner listened to. How Israel, democracy region symbol need racially inspired violence end, come risk claim international legitimacy handling situation? Hamas enemy Israel, be. They preach violent resistance readily, yet past 17 months trying control militant groups intent threatening Israel rockets — imperfectly perhaps, single Israeli citizen killed (alas, one immigrant worker was) rocket since Gaza bombing stopped January 2009. They also implacable opponents al-Qaida. They won fair election 2006 claim respect democracy. Let's test that. At present, Hamas security people sniped Israeli Defence Forces try arrest militant groups. This genuinely getting insane. The unwisdom reliance angry military responses clearer mood Palestine, West Bank Gaza, steadily moving towards negotiated end occupation. I convinced direct experience Hamas prepared establish respect long-term ceasefire talking start without threat violence, would enter good faith, reciprocated, negotiations establish two states disputed territories, Israel Palestine, rights responsibilities international law. The distortion position, little fault PR, side good. If comprehensive negotiation much expect now, first step? I believe arrangement end blockade within reach Israel, Egypt Gaza would test possibilities dialogue. Hamas indicated could cease attacks Israeli soil, close tunnels, release Gilead Shalit stop import arms Gaza blockade ended, agreed number Palestinian prisoners released Gaza began rebuilt. The Palestinians course work internal reconciliation, relationship Fatah West Bank Hamas Gaza remains bad. But UN, US, Russia, EU Arab world must make much serious attempt test possibilities, putting ordinary Israelis Palestinians first, political comfort. We coming close losing chance two-state solution. US policy, based West-Bank-only approach, locked cul-de-sac Gaza left equation, majority Palestinian support lacking. Israel confident knowledge cannot militarily defeated. But ignores huge danger losing political, diplomatic, legal moral high ground. This matters today's world, US UK discovered Iraq, government authority public opinion interact closely, legitimacy breeds support. Israel's relationship Turkey key broader understanding Islamic community others beyond west. That lies tatters. If Israel left permanent occupier, controlling one-state structure part population downgraded imprisoned, truly disaster people stand for. I hope Hamas sit back enjoy Israel's discomfiture. They far, political organisation, attracted much narrow range international support. If wish widely accepted negotiating partner, must unequivocally accept fully justified condition set international Quartet — cessation violence — underline objective two-state settlement, win international friends ending occupation. In whoever's hands, bombs, bullets, rockets iron bars achieve nothing. But push justice will. •This article originally written Times published

John Ryan; Susan Mcnamara; Corrine Ebeling; Delano, Omorinsola; Claps, Boys home closing, numbers don't tell full story By Burt Constable I Daily Herald Columnist Published: 6/3/2010 12:01 AM When goal turning around lives young abused neglected boys, filling scoresheet complicated simply marking wins losses. For past 15 years, Ann G. Deuel lived Arlington Heights, heart resided Jamal Place, three-story graystone 1335 S. California Ave. North Lawndale neighborhood Chicago. As founder executive director Jamal Place, Deuel tell countless stories boys, ages 11 17, spent time group home army suburbanites St. Charles, Naperville, Lake Zurich Lisle volunteered, donated served board help kids. Lots people field good things say Deuel Jamal Place. But new fiscal year begins July 1, Illinois Department Children Family Services renew contract Jamal Place, forcing kids go facilities. "To shut us deny kids opportunity unconscionable," says Deuel, takes deep breath dabs eyes attempt keep emotions check. She staff operated last year $1,041,000 contract DCFS provide group home 10 wards state. They've carved wonderful reputation 15 years, happened? The easy answer DCFS put group home new performance-based contracting system determined Jamal Place fell short benchmarks keeping kids running away, requiring hospitalization ending juvenile detention. "Taxpayers expect deserve positive results children serve," says DCFS spokesman Kendall Marlowe. Jamal Place simply didn't measure areas state measures. Because Illinois trimmed number wards state high 52,000 1997 15,500, much higher percentage kids mental illnesses, substance abuse problems. Since state measures agency's performance days kids physically present home, Jamal Place, small population, got bad marks child hospitalized mental-health issue detained judge. "We clinically advisable children got dinged it," says Brian Barclay, assistant executive director Jamal Place. "We kids' best interest." There consideration given "incremental improvements youth behavior, occur trusting relationships develop," Deuel notes. "I wish could find way measure individual aspects." When compared similar facilities, Jamal Place graded lower, Marlowe says, adding "isn't happy day" state ends agreement facility "good people" done "good work" past. He says DCFS renew contract Deuel different transitional living facility serves older population. One Jamal Place's "unfavorable" outcomes involves kid already criminal record came group home age 14. Now 17, says ended juvenile court made mistake hanging wrong people day stole woman's purse. "I've got good relationship staff residents. We things family," says teen, living grandmother. "I love grandmother, I'd rather Jamal Place. I'm trying everything power get back Jamal Place." Intangibles aren't part bureaucratic process. There isn't place evaluation form give credit Deuel staff leading effort closed local "crack house." There's way measure improvements former resident led first time sign "love" name Mother's Day card sent Deuel year. There's scoresheet local gang leader stopped preying Jamal kids confronted Deuel recognized woman gave Christmas present years earlier. The interview story interrupted man calls Deuel, helping find legitimate job. "It enormously frustrating attachment boys develop staff members 'measurable' outcome," Deuel says. "These children. Long DCFS done kids, door still open." Last weekend, many former residents came back explain Jamal Place helped them. On June 26, Jamal Place celebrate 15th anniversary picnic walkathon Douglas Park, across street home. Deuel staff hoping DCFS finds way give time, another year continue mission. "I've always maintained God won't let us fail," says Deuel. "For 15 years, that's case, we've got challenge."

This conference international gathering focuses maternal health include estimated 3,000 representatives governments, civil society, multilateral organizations, private sector. The aim conference generate political commitment financial investment fulfilling Millennium Development Goal 5, pledges three-quarter reduction maternal mortality universal access reproductive health 2015. The conference one several international gatherings year include focus maternal child health (MCH). As result, childbirth remains leading cause death injury women worldwide. • The United States elevated issue maternal health development work Global Health Initiative, $63 billion dollar proposal help countries improve health outcomes strengthened health systems integrated service delivery, particular focus health women, newborns children. Women deliver world – world needs deliver them. He sorely missed.

Mills, Cheryl D <MillsCD©state.gov> Tuesday, June 22, 2010 8:14 AM FW: Rahm's long goodbye Rahm's long goodbye By: Glenn Thrush June 22, 2010 04:34 AM EDT For talk Rahm Emanuel reaching "eject" button, fiery White House chief staff isn't leaving immediate future — could serve well 2011, according people close him. "It's opinion top levels White House Rahm going longer many people think," said senior administration official, speaking condition anonymity. Speculation Emanuel's departure favorite parlor game nearly year — stoked Emanuel's admission he'd love run Chicago mayor (should current' Mayor Richard Daley retire, course), kvetching rigors job, withering attacks left right fact average expiration date chief staff 18 months. Emanuel leaving, departure date proved profoundly elastic. Friends co-workers said vacillates day day, sometimes minute minute. He might leave December midterms; might stay next summer, depending whether Daley runs President Barack Obama asks stick around, said. And even pines native Chicago, Emanuel continues put real roots D.C., recently writing check enroll children exclusive Maret School Washington 2011 school year, according person close Emanuel. He's shown signs loosening grip tiller — bombarding White House staffers long-distance calls first days Gulf oil spill even traveled Israel son's bar mitzvah. And broader sense, it's hard imagine Emanuel's huge personality extracted political, journalistic bar stool life Obama's Washington. Take last game last week's NBA Finals, American voter could wander Tunnicliff's Tavern Capitol Hill witness one powerful men nation egging Boston Celtics — screaming flat-screen TV, actually — joined merry band included Sen. Max Baucus (D-Mont.); Sen. Chris Dodd (D-Conn.); Jim Manley, spokesman Senate Majority Leader Harry Reid (D-Nev.); pair favorite reporters The New York Times The Washington Post. Despite British tabloid story asserting Emanuel sick Obama's "idealism" racing exit, former Democratic Congressional Campaign Committee chairman still loves attention power current job hasn't made mind he's leaving, people know said. "This BS. And need translation, baseless," Emanuel said statement pushing back story U.K.'s Daily Telegraph portraying Emanuel restless! fed up. Replacing Emanuel, eventually goes, easy task Obama small clique close advisers led Pete Rouse, David Axelrod Valerie Jarrett. For one thing, Obama company need know post-November political landscape looks like picking successor: If Republicans take back one house Congress, new chief staff need know leverage executive power hostile Hill; Democrats retain majorities, Emanuel's successor need legislative skills. Barring major course correction, Obama, prizes loyalty familiarity, isn't likely reach far outside inner circle, advisers said. Still, president increasingly cognizant reputation insularity would quite likely give serious look respected former Clinton chiefs staff Leon Panetta, currenW head CIA, John Podesta, runs Center American Progress, major liberal think tank close ties administration. Rouse, senior adviser served Obama's Senate chief staff, considered best pure manager White House logical choice replace Emanuel, according half-dozen.administration officials consultants. But Rouse's colleagues say quiet 60-year-old insider loves work, Grateful Dead cats — despises spotlight would likely turn job unless Obama insisted. "The key thing Pete president trusts would feel very, comfortable charge," said Democratic consultant knows men well. "But probably won't take it." One possible candidate — deputy chief staff Jim Messina, Emanuel's political go-to guy — likely play major role Obama's 2012 reelection campaign expected move Chicago sometime next year. In Messina's absence, another Emanuel favorite — Deputy National Security Adviser Tom Donilon — emerged possible successor, according people close situation. Obama impressed Donilon's presentations President's Daily Briefing, Rhode Island native wide variety political governmental experience, serving congressional liaison President Jimmy Carter, chief State Department spokesman President Bill Clinton campaign adviser helped Obama prepare debates John McCain. One major Donilon drawback: He served executive vice president Fannie Mae, bailed-out mortgage giant, reportedly lobbied stronger regulatory oversight. David Plouffe, Obama's 2008 campaign manager, another contender, reputation discipline, team building solid management skills. But Plouffe reluctant settle Washington, earning stellar living consultant hates press. Former Senate Majority Leader Tom Daschle also possible successor, even though nomination Health Human Services secretary scuttled revelations failed report limo rides paid corporate client. Then there's Ron Klain, 49, Vice President Joe Biden's brainy politically astute chief staff, said intensely interested making move Eisenhower Executive Office Building West Wing. Klain — also served Al Gore's chief staff — well-regarded inside White House. Plus, he's got touch star power: Kevin Spacey played HBO movie "Recount," role guiding Gore campaign 2000 Florida recount. Klain's downside: He's essentially outsider yet develop serious rapport president, according insiders. C 2010 Capitol News Company, LLC


http://maxblumenthal.com/2010/06/the-israeli-medias-flotilla-fail/ The Israeli Media's Flotilla Fail On 06.22.10, By Max Blumenthal My summaty Israeli media's shambolic performance following flotilla massacre originally published Hebrew Dvorit Shargal's excellent Israeli media blog, Velvet Underground. The English version follows: If raid Gaza Freedom Flotilla disaster Israel Defense Forces, aftermath demonstrated equally bewildering performance Israeli media. The IDF Spokesman's Office churned one misleading claim another, one implausible next, seeking implant public's mind version events bore little relation reality. To degree, expected; startling see Israel's respected reporters lined serve military stenographers, barely challenging IDF's rapidly changing versions events. IDF claims flotilla passengers' links Al Qaida, anti-Semitic statements shouted Israeli Navy, terrorist intentions eagerly broadcast Israeli media without second thought. When independent reporters forced IDF retract "clarify" claims, Israeli news outlets refused correct errors, covered without acknowledgment. It happened I arrived Israel research trip day flotilla raid. As result, I able something I always thought basic journalistic practice, basic it's supposed applied routinely: Asking implicated party story produce evidence claims. What I found bewildering least judging Israeli media reports, few, any, mainstream reporters applied practice, visiting colleague job – nobody bothered correct withdraw original report. On June 2, IDF disseminated press release entitled, "Attackers IDF soldiers found Al Qaeda mercenaries." The accusation accompanied conclusive evidence — IDF reported Mavi Marmara passengers equipped night-vision goggles (gasp!). This stop Yedioth's Ron Ben-Yishai, embedded Navy commandos, amplifying baseless charge. Citing "interrogation" Marmara passengers — "lynchers," called — Ben-Yishai wrote day, "Some among [flotilla passengers] believed ties World Jihad groups, mainly Al Qaeda." The article made reference efforts part Ben Yishai investigate claim, seem think ask IDF release dangerous operatives Osama Bin Laden — presumably would attack again, wouldn't they? • On June 3, Israeli journalist Lia Tarachansky Real News Network I placed calls IDF Spokesman's Office demand evidence Marmara's Al Qaeda ties. We received identical responses spokespeople IDF's Israel North America desks: "We don't evidence. The press release based information National Security Council." Hours later, IDF retracted claim, changing title press release to, "Attackers IDF Soldiers Found Without Identification Papers." Despite official retraction, Ben-Yishai's article remains uncorrected. On June 4, IDF released audio clip purporting consist transmissions Mavi Marmara Naval warship. "Go back Aushwitz!" Marmara passenger shouted, according IDF. YNet Haaretz reported reproduced audio clip without investigating authenticity. Forget voice uttering anti-Semitic slur sounded like mentally disturbed teenager; reporters performed cursory search IDF Spokeman's Office website, would found longer clip released May 31 featured dramatically different exchange Marmara mention Auschwitz. Further, voice flotilla organizer Huwaida Arraf featured "Aushwitz" clip, yet Arraf aboard Marmara (she Challenger One). Could IDF doctored audio exploit public hysteria surrounding issue anti-Semitism? On blog, I pointed discrepancies IDF's footage raised question doctoring. The next day, IDF conceded fact doctored footage, releasing "clarification" new clip claiming consist "full" exchange Navy flotilla. Unfortunately, authenticity new clip impossible verify. Despite IDF's admission, YNet Haaretz corrected original reports, though Haaretz least altered headline. Once doctoring exposed, New York Times covered episode detail, directing international attention triumph independent online reporting apparent failure Israel's parochial press corps. On June 7, Haaretz's Anshel Pfeffer reported IDF press release claiming without evidence five flotilla passengers links international terror. The press release larded highly implausible claims, including Ken O'Keefe, runs aid organization Tony Blair's sister-in-law, planning train Hamas commando unit Gaza Strip. When I called IDF Spokesman's Office, I learned again, evidence available support press release. "There limited intelligence give specific case," Sgt. Chen Arad told me. "Obviously I'm unable give information." Did Pfeffer demand evidence? If answered manner I did, Haaretz publish unsubstantiated spin fact? Joined Haaretz military correspondents Avi Isacharoff Amos Harel, Pfeffer became channel another daytime deception IDF. On May 31, three reporters produced article based exclusively testimony Naval commandos — flotilla passengers' side story ignored — claiming faced live fire lynching attempts Marmara passengers. Since story published, IDF produced scant evidence support either accusation. The article accompanied suspicious photo IDF Spokesman's Office depicting bearded Muslim man brandishing knife surrounded photojournalists. Daylight beamed window behind man. Haaretz's caption, sourced IDF, asserted photo taken "after" commandos boarded Marmara. However, commandos raided ship night, photo taken day. Once again, IDF's story fishy. I called Sgt. Arad IDF Spokesman's Office investigate. He told evidence support photo's questionable caption. Soon phone conversation, Haaretz quietly altered caption, removing claim photo taken "after" commando raid. For nearly week, false photo caption remained intact. Why Haaretz suddenly change it? The plausible explanation paper received tip IDF Spokesman's Office. If true, tip-off suggests scandalous level coordination Israeli military country's media. In wake flotilla raid, Israeli journalists unique opportunity lead global media's investigation bloodbath occurred deck Mavi Marmara. After all, one better access military eyewitnesses aboard flotilla. Instead, many among Israeli press corps allowed conscripted IDF's hapless information war, leaving important task investigating raid independent reporters remembered view claims nation's military extreme skepticism. So well-connected, experienced reporters follow IDF baton willingly, fail follow IDF claims retracted? Is simple bias, desire present military best possible light, desire strong abandon duty readers verify information? Are afraid sanctions, losing contacts access information? Do fear personal reprisals? Their readers, world media still relies Israeli journalism vital source information, need know.

The Runaway General Stanley McChrystal, Obama's top commander Afghanistan, seized control war never taking eye real enemy: The wimps White House By Michael Hastings Jun 22, 2010 10:00 AM EDT This article originally appeared RS 1108/1109 July 8-22, 2010. 'Howed I get screwed going dinner?" demands Gen. Stanley McChrystal. It's Thursday night mid-April, commander U.S. NATO forces Afghanistan sitting four-star suite HOtel Westminster Paris. He's France sell new war strategy NATO allies — keep fiction, essence, actually allies. Since McChrystal took year ago, Afghan war become exclusive property United States. Opposition war already toppled Dutch government, forced resignation Germany's president sparked Canada Netherlands announce withdrawal 4,500 troops. McChrystal Paris keep French, lost 40 soldiers Afghanistan, going wobbly him. "The dinner comes position, sir," says chief staff, Col. Charlie Flynn. McChrystal turns sharply chair. "Hey, Charlie," asks, "does come position?" McChrystal gives middle finger. The general stands looks around suite traveling staff 10 converted full-scale operations center. The tables crowded silver Panasonic Toughbooks, blue cables crisscross hotel's thick carpet, hooked satellite dishes provide encrypted phone e-mail communications. Dressed off-the-rack civilian casual — blue tie, button-down shirt, dress slacks — McChrystal way comfort zone. Paris, one advisers says, "most anti-McChrystal city imagine." The general hates fancy restaurants, rejecting place candles tables "Gucci." He prefers Bud Light Lime (his favorite beer) Bordeaux, Talladega Nights (his favorite movie) Jean-Luc Godard. Besides, public eye never place McChrystal felt comfortable: Before President Obama put charge war Afghanistan, spent five years running Pentagon's secretive black ops. "What's update Kandahar bombing?" McChrystal asks Flynn. The city rocked two massive car bombs past day alone, calling question general's assurances wrest Taliban. "We two KIAs, hasn't confirmed," Flynn says. McChrystal takes final look around suite. At 55, gaunt lean, unlike older version Christian Bale Rescue Dawn. His slate-blue eyes unsettling ability drill lock you. If you've fucked disappointed him, destroy soul without need raise voice. "I'd rather ass kicked roomful people go dinner," McChrystal says. He pauses beat. "Unfortunately," adds, "no one room could it." With that, he's door. "Who's going dinner with?" I ask one aides. "Some French minister," aide tells me. "It's fucking gay." When Barack Obama entered Oval Office, immediately set deliver important campaign promise foreign policy: refocus war Afghanistan led us invade first place. David McKiernan — U.S. NATO commander Afghanistan — replaced man didn't know met briefly: Gen. Stanley McChrystal. From start, McChrystal determined place personal stamp Afghanistan, use laboratory controversial military strategy known counterinsurgency. COIN, theory known, new gospel Pentagon brass, doctrine attempts square military's preference high-tech violence demands fighting protracted wars failed states. COIN calls sending huge numbers ground troops destroy enemy, live among civilian population slowly rebuild, build scratch, another nation's government — process even staunchest advocates admit requires years, decades, achieve. The theory essentially rebrands military, expanding authority (and funding) encompass diplomatic political sides warfare: Think Green Berets armed Peace Corps. In 2006, Gen. David Petraeus beta-tested theory "surge" Iraq, quickly gained hardcore following think-tankers, journalists, military officers civilian officials. Nicknamed "COINdinistas" cultish zeal, influential cadre believed doctrine would perfect solution Afghanistan. All needed general enough charisma political savvy implement it. As McChrystal leaned Obama ramp war, fearlessness used track terrorists Iraq: Figure enemy operates, faster ruthless everybody else, take fuckers out. After arriving Afghanistan last June, general conducted policy review, ordered Defense Secretary Robert Gates. The now-infamous report leaked press, conclusion dire: If didn't send another 40,000 troops — swelling number U.S. forces Afghanistan nearly half — danger "mission failure." The White House furious. McChrystal, felt, trying bully Obama, opening charges weak national security unless general wanted. It Obama versus Pentagon, Pentagon determined kick president's ass. Last fall, top general calling troops, Obama launched three-month review re-evaluate strategy Afghanistan. "I found time painful," McChrystal tells one several lengthy interviews. "I selling unsellable position." For general, crash course Beltway politics — battle pitted experienced Washington insiders like Vice President Biden, argued prolonged counterinsurgency campaign Afghanistan would plunge America military quagmire without weakening international terrorist networks. "The entire COIN strategy fraud perpetuated American people," says Douglas Macgregor, retired colonel leading critic counterinsurgency attended West Point McChrystal. "The idea going spend trillion dollars reshape culture Islamic world utter nonsense. In end, however, McChrystal got almost exactly wanted. On December 1st, speech West Point, president laid reasons fighting war Afghanistan bad idea: It's expensive; we're economic crisis; decade-long commitment would sap American power; Al Qaeda shifted base operations Pakistan. Then, without ever using words "victory" "win," Obama announced would send additional 30,000 troops Afghanistan, almost many McChrystal requested. The president thrown weight, however hesitantly, behind counterinsurgency crowd. Today, McChrystal gears offensive southern Afghanistan, prospects kind success look bleak. In June, death toll U.S. troops passed 1,000, number IEDs doubled. Spending hundreds billions dollars fifth-poorest country earth failed win civilian population, whose attitude toward U.S. troops ranges intensely wary openly hostile. By far crucial — strained — relationship McChrystal Eikenberry, U.S. ambassador. "General," called McChrystal, "I didn't even know fighting Uruzgan!" Growing military brat, McChrystal exhibited mixture brilliance cockiness would follow throughout career. His father fought Korea Vietnam, retiring two-star general, four brothers joined armed services. Moving around different bases, McChrystal took solace baseball, sport made pretense hiding superiority: In Little League, would call strikes crowd whipping fastball middle. McChrystal entered West Point 1972, U.S. military close all-time low popularity. His class last graduate academy started admit women. The "Prison Hudson," known then, potent mix testosterone, hooliganism reactionary patriotism. His compelling work extracurricular: As managing editor The Pointer, West Point literary magazine, McChrystal wrote seven short stories eerily foreshadow many issues would confront career. In one tale, fictional officer complains difficulty training foreign troops fight; another, 19-year- old soldier kills boy mistakes terrorist. In "Brinkman's Note," piece suspense fiction, unnamed narrator appears trying stop plot assassinate president. It turns out, however, narrator assassin, he's able infiltrate White House: "The President strode smiling. From right coat pocket raincoat I carried, I slowly drew forth 32-caliber pistol. In Brinkman's failure, I succeeded." After graduation, 2nd Lt. Stanley McChrystal entered Army broken wake Vietnam. "We really felt peacetime generation," recalls. "There Gulf War, even didn't feel like big deal." So McChrystal spent career action was: He enrolled Special Forces school became regimental commander 3rd Ranger Battalion 1986. It dangerous position, even peacetime — nearly two dozen Rangers killed training accidents Eighties. It also unorthodox career path: Most soldiers want climb ranks general don't go Rangers. Displaying penchant transforming systems considers outdated, McChrystal set revolutionize training regime Rangers. He introduced mixed martial arts, required every soldier qualify night-vision goggles rifle range forced troops build endurance weekly marches involving heavy backpacks. But moved ranks, McChrystal relied skills learned troublemaking kid West Point: knowing precisely far could go rigid military hierarchy without getting tossed out. Being highly intelligent badass, discovered, could take far — especially political chaos followed September 11th. "He focused," says Annie. "Even young officer seemed know wanted do. I don't think personality changed years." By accounts, McChrystal's career least two times now. As Pentagon spokesman invasion Iraq, general seemed like White House mouthpiece up-and-coming commander reputation speaking mind. But next stint — overseeing military's elite units, including Rangers, Navy Seals Delta Force — McChrystal took part cover-up would destroyed career lesser man. After Cpl. Pat Tillman, former-NFL-star-turned-Ranger, accidentally killed troops Afghanistan April 2004, McChrystal took active role creating impression Tillman died hands Taliban fighters. He signed falsified recommendation Silver Star suggested Tillman killed enemy fire. (McChrystal would later claim didn't read recommendation closely enough — strange excuse commander known laserlike attention minute details.) "If circumstances Corporal Tillman's death become public," wrote, could cause "public embarrassment" president. Nine days Tillman's death, McChrystal promoted major general. Two years later, 2006, McChrystal tainted scandal involving detainee abuse torture Camp Nama Iraq. In May 2009, McChrystal prepared confirmation hearings, staff prepared hard questions Camp Nama Tillman cover-up. But scandals barely made ripple Congress, McChrystal soon way back Kabul run war Afghanistan. The media, large extent, also given McChrystal pass controversies. Where Gen. Petraeus kind dweeb, teacher's pet Ranger's tab, McChrystal snake-eating rebel, "Jedi" commander, Newsweek called him. He didn't care teenage son came home blue hair mohawk. He speaks mind candor rare high-ranking official. He asks opinions, seems genuinely interested response. He gets briefings iPod listens books tape. He carries custom-made set nunchucks convoy engraved name four stars, itinerary often bears fresh quote Bruce Lee. ("There limits. There plateaus, must stay there, must go beyond them.") "You'd Somewhere, Iraq, someone would take knee beside you, corporal would like 'Who fuck that?' And it's fucking Stan McChrystal." It doesn't hurt McChrystal also extremely successful head Joint Special Operations Command, elite forces carry government's darkest ops. During Iraq surge, team killed captured thousands insurgents, including Abu Musab al-Zarqawi, leader Al Qaeda Iraq. "JSOC killing machine," says Maj. Gen. Mayville, chief operations.
