Under-Skin Defibrillators Seen Closer Reality By BARRY MEIER The likelihood patients United States may day receive heart defibrillators operate without electrical wires connected hearts moved step closer, according study published Wednesday. The development new type defibrillator long pursued researcher, Dr. Gust H. Bardy, Seattle Institute Cardiac Research Seattle. And study The New England Journal Medicine, Dr. Bardy researchers reported initial trials device patients successful. Defibrillators fire electrical jolt interrupt potentially fatal heart rhythm restore normal beating. For unit function, surgeon must thread electrical sensing wire blood vessel patient's heart. The wires pose risks can, rare occasion, puncture heart implantation fracture place. The new version delivers electrical jolt means sensor implanted skin near chest bone. A power unit placed skin side chest. The new device already sale European countries, Dr. Bardy others cautioned full-scale, long- term trials still needed prove implant's worth Food Drug Administration. Even successful, unit could used patients needed defibrillator, several researchers said excited new study nonetheless. Dr. Douglas P. Zipes, professor Indiana University School Medicine Indianapolis, said new device could someday displace existing models used many patients Every month, 10,000 patients country get defibrillator, either first time replacements devices whose batteries worn out. In recent years, safety defibrillator wires come particular focus model made Medtronic prone fracturing. Hundreds patients received model undergo new operations replace it. Also, scar tissue often builds around intravenous wires, process make removing replacing difficult dangerous. Dr. Bardy said telephone interview deaths several patients many years ago wire-related injuries factor interest developing new device. "You looking therapy avert, hope, complications effective," said. In study published Wednesday, Dr. Bardy others reported new device undergone several successful initial trials, including one used year 60 patients. The device developed Cameron Health, small company San Clemente, Calif., co-founded Dr. Bardy. Since cardiologist began work project decade ago, defibrillator helped design gone several iterations. The device suitable significant number heart patients, particularly require units also include pacemaker, regulates heart beating fast slowly. But Dr. Bardy estimated device could work 25 percent patients get defibrillator. These largely patients risk, genetic factors certain types heart diseases, type erratic cardiac rhythm cause sudden death. Dr. Bardy said cost new device standard defibrillator. However, said could help reduce health care costs, implanting much simpler. Before device sold here, Cameron Health submit extensive human trial data theF.D.A.. Dr. Bardy said larger study device begun country overseas likely take year assemble data agency's review.
August 8, 2010 Gary Sick America Iran: Strikes, Sanctions Scapegoats For pundits, two questions U.S.-Iran relations importance: (1) Will Israel and/or United States attack Iran? (2) new sanctions enough bite persuade Iran change nuclear policy? Despite printers ink spilled two issues, answers easy no. Neither United States Israel take military option table, thereby giving pundits (and crowd dying repeat Iraq) latitude keep distant prospect military action front pages, years. As lede, sells columns newspapers, go away. But analysis either blinded momentary hype else simple wish fulfillment. Uber-neocon John Bolton right. If attack occur, would end Bush administration nothing left lose. Bolton thought inevitable predicted unequivocally Wall Street Journal column 2008. Dick Cheney apparently agreed, judging subsequent statements regret. So fair say George W. Bush, looking potential consequences, resisted advice neocon advisers, previously dominant vice president, reported direct request government Israel — rejected strike. What likelihood Barack Obama, catastrophic scenario him, approve? Forget it. Sanctions persuade dictatorial regimes abandon projects think central security survival even self-image. Just look Saddam Hussein. The international sanctions imposed Iraq 1980s make current Iran sanctions appear anemic comparison. Every item went Iraq subject approval UN committee dominated vindictive United States. Yet, although Iraq abandoned nuclear weapons program years earlier, Saddam could bring let people enemies know that. Instead prepared gamble United States would attack him. One reasons bad bet cronies well sanctions immediate necessity come clean. They, all, controlled smuggling routes. And henchmen managed thriving enormously lucrative black market. As concern people, rotund Tariq Aziz, sitting fine Scotch Cuban cigar, informed worried UN representative would good Iraqi people lose weight. An Iraqi friend mine told time sanctions made criminals entire Iraqi middle class, resort illegal behavior order survive. The biggest – successful – new criminal class privileged group immediately around Saddam Hussein. Which brings us Iran. The sanctions effective many anticipated. They built web financial restrictions limitations around already weak Iranian economy certain cause significant problems leadership. Iran's critical energy sector particularly vulnerable. It pincer. Because cheap energy prices inside country, artificially propped massive subsidies, energy demand soaring. This siphons lot Iran's oil production, would otherwise sold world market hard currency. At time, Iran's oil fields old complex, require modern technology maintain production. That technology – capital investment provided major international oil companies – absent many years. It driven away partly sanctions, ironically assisted Iran's short-sighted negotiating tactics offered meager profit margins outside investors. As result, Iran's oil production decline time soaked domestic consumption. In period relatively low oil prices, means Iran's hard currency earnings drying alarming rate. This unenviable economic situation compounded described perhaps least competent economic management team major country world. Ayatollah Khamene'i, Supreme Leader, seems totally preoccupied bolstering shaky political legitimacy pandering Revolutionary Guards surround protect him. The result corruption scale beyond anything shah's regime could imagined. President Ahmadinejad, also creature Revolutionary Guards, free indulge taste outlandish irresponsible rhetoric. His words keep international domestic spotlight glued him; effect drives away prospective investors facilitates U.S. drive enlist international support sanctions Iran. An American Jewish leader joked suspected Ahmadinejad Mossad agent: one, observed, helpful promoting donations Israel Israeli causes. At time, leadership Iran inflation unemployment double digits. But fair, Ahmadinejad first politician modern Iranian history willing address "third rail" Iranian politics — immensely costly subsidies food energy. His initial efforts reduce amount subsidized gasoline Iranians could use met outbursts indignation, including torching filling stations. But rules seem grudgingly accepted eased slightly Iran's energy dilemma. He addressing low tax rates assessed merchants. This also resulted outrage, including closing bazaars Iran major cities. But campaign seems making progress. These needed reforms would recommended responsible economic overseer, including International Monetary Fund. Ahmadinejad attempts balance daring assaults entrenched economic interests belligerent rhetoric, always casting champion little guy. In resembles populist predecessors, Juan Peron Huey Long Hugo Chavez. Ahmadinejad takes America Israel way Governor Long took Standard Oil. When informant said something old grievances going away, response hosts went something like this: No, don't never will. But, we're public servants suckers punishment, soldier on. Speaking soldiering on, Mrs. Clinton left Europe next day Americans celebrated July 4, Armenia trying sort Nagorno-Karabakh dispute and.— equally thankless task — mediate Armenia Turkey disagreement happened 1915. You've got salute Hillary. She's got guts go razor-sharp mind. When comes national security, Mr. Obama's inner circle tight largely consists Mr. McDonough, 40-year-old Minnesota unknown Americans." I know McDonough I've spent fair amount time Minnesota. He many state's qualities: positive, brisk, can-do, affable efficient. But I reassured when! read Obama's national-security inner circle comprised him? Nope. He great guy control foreign-policy side campaign — perfection Obama — he's great guy think big world. Thinking big bold required right now. The clock ticking momentous presidential decisions. Stanley A. McChrystal, Obama said would tolerate debate division. My sense foreign- policy house divided — weaker it. Gen. James Jones, national security adviser, speaks fine French — French love — he's left people unconvinced. Tom Donilon, Jones' deputy, dances around vacuum best can. Like McDonough, David Axelrod Rehm Emanuel brilliant campaign strategists, foreign-policy strategists? In Clinton, Obama Baker-class secretary state. For much longer going delegate Nagorno- Karabakh? The State Department, repository Other underused talent, cannot White House annex non- critical affairs. Back 1860s, James Gordon Bennett, editor New York Herald, forebear International Herald Tribune, gave instructions intrepid foreign correspondent named Henry Morton Stanley: "Draw thousand pounds now; gone that, draw another thousand, spent, draw another thousand, finished that, draw another thousand, on; but, FIND LIVINGSTONE." He referring lost African explorer, David Livingstone, Stanley eventually tracked Lake Tanganyika, uttering immortal words: "Doctor Livingstone, I presume?" That sort journalism's gone fashion. So thank Rolling Stone opening pocketbook telling Michael Hastings whatever took find General McChrystal. In brilliant piece, Hastings that. Sid http://www.nybooks.com/articles/archives/2010/jun/10/failure-american-jewish-establishment/ The Failure American Jewish Establishment June 10, 2010 Peter Beinart E-mail Single Page Share More Peter Beinart anjamin Netanyahu; drawing John Springs In 2003, several prominent Jewish philanthropists hired Republican pollster Frank Luntz explain American Jewish college students vigorously rebutting campus criticism Israel. In response, unwittingly produced damning indictment organized American Jewish community I ever seen. The philanthropists wanted know Jewish students thought Israel. Luntz found mostly didn't. "Six times brought Jewish youth together group talk Jewishness connection Israel," reported. "Six times topic Israel come prompted. Six times Jewish youth used word 'they' rather than'us` describe situation." That Luntz encountered indifference surprising. In recent years, several studies revealed, words Steven Cohen Hebrew Union College An Kelman University California Davis, "non-Orthodox younger Jews, whole, feel much less attached Israel elders," many professing "a near-total absence positive feelings." In 2008, student senate Brandeis, nonsectarian Jewish-sponsored university America, rejected resolution commemorating sixtieth anniversary Jewish state. Luntz's task figure gone wrong. When probed students' views Israel, hit firm beliefs. First, "they reserve right question Israeli position." These young Jews, Luntz explained, "resist anything see 'group think." They want "open frank" discussion Israel flaws. Second, "young Jews desperately want peace." When Luntz showed series ads, one popular entitled "Proof Israel Wants Peace," listed offers various Israeli governments withdraw conquered land. Third, "some empathize plight Palestinians." When Luntz displayed ads depicting Palestinians violent hateful, several focus group participants criticized stereotypical unfair, citing Muslim friends. Most students, words, liberals, broadly defined. They imbibed defining values American Jewish political culture: belief open debate, skepticism military force, commitment human rights. And innocence, realize supposed shed values came Israel. The kind Zionism found attractive Zionism recognized Palestinians deserving dignity capable peace, quite willing condemn Israeli government share beliefs. Luntz grasp irony. The kind Zionism found attractive kind American Jewish establishment working lives. Among American Jews today, great many Zionists, especially Orthodox world, people deeply devoted State Israel. And great many liberals, especially secular Jewish world, people deeply devoted human rights people, Palestinians included. But two groups increasingly distinct. Particularly younger generations, fewer fewer American Jewish liberals Zionists; fewer fewer American Jewish Zionists liberal. One reason leading institutions American Jewry refused foster—indeed, actively opposed—a Zionism challenges Israel's behavior West Bank Gaza Strip toward Arab citizens. For several decades, Jewish establishment asked American Jews check liberalism Zionism's door, now, horror, finding many young Jews checked Zionism instead. Morally, American Zionism downward spiral. If leaders groups like AIPAC Conference Presidents Major American Jewish Organizations change course, wake one day find younger, Orthodox- dominated, Zionist leadership whose naked hostility Arabs Palestinians scares even them, mass secular American Jews range apathetic appalled. Saving liberal Zionism United States—so American Jews help save liberal Zionism Israel—is great American Jewish challenge age. And starts Luntz's students wanted start: talking frankly Israel's current government, longer averting eyes. Since 1990s, journalists scholars describing bifurcation Israeli society. In words Hebrew University political scientist Yaron Ezrahi, "After decades came called national consensus, Zionist narrative liberation [has] dissolved openly contesting versions." One version, "founded long memory persecution, genocide, bitter struggle survival, pessimistic, distrustful non-Jews, believing Jewish power solidarity." Another, "nourished secularized Versions messianism well Enlightenment idea progress," articulates "a deep sense limits military force, commitment liberal-democratic values." Every country manifests kind ideological divide. But contemporary Israel, gulf among widest earth. As Ezrahi others noted, latter, liberal-democratic Zionism grown alongside new individualism, particularly among secular Israelis, greater demand free expression, greater skepticism coercive authority. You see spirit "new historians" like Tom Segev fearlessly excavated darker corners Zionist past jurists like former Supreme Court President Aharon Barak overturned Knesset laws violate human rights guarantees Israel's "Basic Laws." You also see former Prime Minister Ehud Barak's apparent willingness relinquish much West Bank 2000 early 2001. But Israel today, humane, universalistic Zionism wield power. To contrary, gasping air. To understand deeply antithetical values Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's government, it's worth considering case Effi Eitam. Eitam, charismatic ex–cabinet minister war hero, proposed ethnically cleansing Palestinians West Bank. "We'll expel overwhelming majority West Bank Arabs remove Israeli Arabs [the] political system," declared 2006. In 2008, Eitam merged small Ahi Party Netanyahu's Likud. And 2009-2010 academic year, Netanyahu's special emissary overseas "campus engagement." In capacity, visited dozen American high schools colleges last fall Israeli government's behalf. The group organized tour called "Caravan Democracy." Israeli Foreign Minister Avigdor Lieberman shared Eitam's views. In youth, briefly joined Meir Kahane's banned Kach Party, also advocated expulsion Arabs Israeli soil. Now Lieberman's position might called "pre-expulsion." He wants revoke citizenship Israeli Arabs won't swear loyalty oath Jewish state. He tried prevent two Arab parties opposed Israel's 2008-2009 Gaza war running candidates Knesset. He said Arab Knesset members met representatives Hamas executed. He wants jail Arabs publicly mourn Israeli Independence Day, hopes permanently deny citizenship Arabs countries marry Arab citizens Israel. You don't paranoid see connection Lieberman's current views former ones. The strip Israeli Arabs legal protection, accuse treason, thinkable policy expulsion becomes. Lieberman's American defenders often note theory supports Palestinian state. What usually fail mention him, two-state solution means redrawing Israel's border large chunk Israeli Arabs find exiled another country, without consent. Lieberman served chief staff Netanyahu's first term prime minister. And comes West Bank, Netanyahu's record way even extreme protégé's. In 1993 book, A Place among Nations, Netanyahu rejects idea Palestinian state, denies thing Palestinian. In fact, repeatedly equates Palestinian bid statehood Nazism. An Israel withdraws West Bank, declared, would "ghetto-state" "Auschwitz borders." And effort "to gouge Judea Samaria [the West Bank] Israel" resembles Hitler's bid wrench German-speaking "Sudeten district" Czechoslovakia 1938. It unfair, Netanyahu insists, ask Israel concede territory since already made vast, gut-wrenching concessions. What kind concessions? It abandoned claim Jordan, rights part Jewish state. On left Netanyahu's coalition sits Ehud Barak's emasculated Labor Party, whatever moderating potential may counterbalanced is, ways, illiberal coalition partner all, Shas, ultra-Orthodox party representing Jews North African Middle Eastern descent. At one point, Shas—like Ashkenazi ultra- Orthodox counterparts—was open dismantling settlements. In recent years, however, ultra-Orthodox Israelis, anxious find housing large families, increasingly moved West Bank, thanks government subsidies far cheaper live. Not coincidentally, political parties swung hard territorial compromise. And done virulence reflects ultra-Orthodox Judaism's profound hostility liberal values. Rabbi Ovadia Yosef, Shas's immensely powerful spiritual leader, called Arabs "vipers," "snakes," "ants." In 2005, Prime Minister Ariel Sharon proposed dismantling settlements Gaza Strip, Yosef urged "God strike down." The official Shas newspaper recently called President Obama "an Islamic extremist." Hebrew University Professor Ze'ev Sternhell expert fascism winner prestigious Israel Prize. Commenting Lieberman leaders Shas recent Op-Ed Haaretz, wrote, "The last time politicians holding views similar power post–World War II Western Europe Franco's Spain." With blessing, "a crude multifaceted campaign waged foundations democratic liberal order." Sternhell know. In September 2008, injured settler set pipe bomb house. Israeli governments come go, Netanyahu coalition product frightening, long-term trends Israeli society: ultra-Orthodox population increasing dramatically, settler movement growing radical entrenched Israeli bureaucracy army, Russian immigrant community particularly prone anti-Arab racism. In 2009, poll Israel Democracy Institute found 53 percent Jewish Israelis (and 77 percent recent immigrants former USSR) support encouraging Arabs leave country. Attitudes worst among Israel's young. When Israeli high schools held mock elections last year, Lieberman won. This March, poll found 56 percent Jewish Israeli high school students—and 80 percent religious Jewish high school students— would deny Israeli Arabs right elected Knesset. An education ministry official called survey "a huge warning signal light strengthening trends extremist views among youth." You might think trends, sympathy expressed Israel's government, would occasion substantial public concern—even outrage—among leaders organized American Jewry. You would wrong. In Israel itself, voices left, even center, warn increasingly urgent tones threats Israeli democracy. (Former Prime Ministers Ehud Olmert Ehud Barak said Israel risks becoming "apartheid state" continues hold West Bank. This April, settlers forced large Israeli bookstore stop selling book critical occupation, Shulamit Aloni, former head dovish Meretz Party, declared "Israel democratic time now.") But United States, groups like AIPAC Presidents' Conference patrol public discourse, scolding people contradict vision Israel state leaders cherish democracy yearn peace. The result terrible irony. In theory, mainstream American Jewish organizations still hew liberal vision Zionism. On website, AIPAC celebrates Israel's commitment "free speech minority rights." The Conference Presidents declares "Israel United States share political, moral intellectual values including democracy, freedom, security peace." These groups would never say, Netanyahu's coalition, Israeli Arabs don't deserve full citizenship West Bank Palestinians don't deserve human rights. But practice, defending virtually anything Israeli government does, make intellectual bodyguards Israeli leaders threaten liberal values profess admire. After Israel's elections last February, instance, Malcolm Hoenlein, executive vice-chairman Presidents' Conference, explained Avigdor Lieberman's agenda "far moderate media presented it." Insisting Lieberman bears general animus toward Israeli Arabs, Abraham Foxman, national director Anti- Defamation League, told Jewish Telegraphic Agency "He's saying expel them. He's saying punish them." (Permanently denying citizenship Arab spouses jailing publicly mourn Israeli Independence Day evidently qualify punishment.) The ADL criticized anti-Arab bigotry past, American Jewish Committee, credit, warned Lieberman's proposed loyalty oath would "chill Israel's democratic political debate." But Forward summed overall response America's communal Jewish leadership headline "Jewish Leaders Largely Silent Lieberman's Role Government." Not organized American Jewish community mostly avoid public criticism Israeli government, tries prevent others leveling criticism well. In recent years, American Jewish organizations waged campaign discredit world's respected international human rights groups. In 2006, Foxman called Amnesty International report Israeli killing Lebanese civilians "bigoted, biased, borderline anti-Semitic." The Conference Presidents announced "biased NGOs include Amnesty International, Human Rights Watch, Christian Aid, [and] Save Children." Last summer, AIPAC spokesman declared Human Rights Watch "has repeatedly demonstrated anti-Israel bias." When Obama administration awarded Presidential Medal Freedom Mary Robinson, former UN high commissioner human rights, ADL AIPAC protested, citing fact presided 2001 World Conference Against Racism Durban, South Africa. (Early drafts conference report implicitly accused Israel racism. Robinson helped expunge defamatory charge, angering Syria Iran.) Human Rights Watch Amnesty International infallible. But groups like AIPAC Presidents' Conference avoid virtually public criticism Israeli actions—directing outrage solely Israel's neighbors—they leave poor position charge bias. Moreover, American Jewish groups claim simply defending Israel foes, actually taking sides struggle within Israel radically different Zionist visions. At moment Anti-Defamation League claimed Robinson harbored "animus toward Israel," alliance seven Israeli human rights groups publicly congratulated award. Many groups, like B'Tselem, monitors Israeli actions Occupied Territories, Israeli branch Physicians Human Rights, least critical Israel's actions Lebanon, Gaza, West Bank Amnesty International Human Rights Watch. All raises uncomfortable question. If American Jewish groups claim Israel's overseas human rights critics motivated anti- Israeli, anti-Semitic, bias, say Israel's domestic human rights critics? The implication clear: must guilty self-hatred, treason. American Jewish leaders don't generally say that, course, allies Netanyahu government do. Last summer, Israel's vice prime minister, Moshe Ya'alon, called anti-occupation group Peace Now "virus." This January, right-wing group called Im Tirtzu accused Israeli human rights organizations fed information Goldstone Commission investigated Israel's Gaza war. A Knesset member Netanyahu's Likud promptly charged Naomi Chazan, head New Israel Fund, supports human rights groups, treason, member Lieberman's party launched investigation aimed curbing foreign funding Israeli NG0s. To credit, Foxman American Jewish leaders opposed move, might impaired work. But reaping sowed. If suggest mainstream human rights criticism Israel's government motivated animus toward state, toward Jews general, give aid comfort Israel make charges human rights critics midst. In American Jewish establishment today, language liberal Zionism—with idioms human rights, equal citizenship, territorial compromise—has drained meaning. It remains lingua franca part generational reasons, many older American Zionists still see liberals sort. They vote Democratic; unmoved biblical claims West Bank; see average Palestinians decent people betrayed bad leaders; secular. They don't want Jewish organizations criticize Israel left, neither want agents Israeli right. These American Zionists largely product particular era. Many shaped terrifying days leading Six-Day War, appeared Israel might overrun, bitter aftermath Yom Kippur War, much world seemed turn Jewish state. In crucible, Israel became Jewish identity, often conjunction Holocaust, 1967 1973 wars helped make central American Jewish life. These Jews embraced Zionism settler movement became major force Israeli politics, 1982 Lebanon war, first intifada. They fell love Israel secular, less divided, less shaped culture, politics, theology occupation. And downplaying significance Avigdor Lieberman, settlers, Shas, American Jewish groups allow older Zionists continue identify internally cohesive, innocent Israel youth, Israel exists memories. But secular Zionists aren't reproducing themselves. Their children memory Arab armies massed Israel's border Israel surviving part thanks urgent military assistance United States. Instead, grown viewing Israel regional hegemon occupying power. As result, conscious parents degree Israeli behavior violates liberal ideals, less willing grant Israel exemption survival seems peril. Because inherited parents' liberalism, cannot embrace uncritical Zionism. Because liberalism real, see liberalism American Jewish establishment fake. To sustain uncritical brand Zionism, therefore, America's Jewish organizations need look elsewhere replenish ranks. They need find young American. Jews come age West Bank occupation troubled it. And young American Jews come disproportionately Orthodox world. Because marry earlier, intermarry less, children, Orthodox Jews growing rapidly share American Jewish population. According 2006 American Jewish Committee (AJC) survey, Orthodox Jews make 12 percent American Jewry age sixty, constitute 34 percent ages eighteen twenty-four. For America's Zionist organizations, Orthodox youngsters potential bonanza. In yeshivas learn devotion Israel early age; generally spend year religious study high school, often know friends relatives immigrated Israel. The AJC study found 16 percent non-Orthodox adult Jews age forty feel "very close Israel," among Orthodox figure 79 percent. As secular Jews drift away America's Zionist institutions, Orthodox counterparts likely step breach. The Orthodox "are still interested parochial Jewish concerns," explains Samuel Heilman, sociologist City University New York. "They among last ones stayed Jewish house, control lights." But parochialism—a deep commitment Jewish concerns, often outweighs universal ones— gives Orthodox Jewish Zionism distinctly illiberal cast. The 2006 AJC poll found 60 percent non- Orthodox American Jews age forty support Palestinian state, figure drops 25 percent among Orthodox. In 2009, Brandeis University's Theodore Sasson asked American Jewish focus groups Israel, found Orthodox participants much less supportive dismantling settlements part peace deal. Even tellingly, Reform, Conservative, unaffiliated Jews tended believe average Palestinians wanted peace, ill- served leaders. Orthodox Jews, contrast, likely see Palestinian people enemy, deny ordinary Palestinians shared common interests values ordinary Israelis Jews. Orthodox Judaism great virtues, including communal warmth commitment Jewish learning unmatched American Jewish world. (I'm biased, since family attends Orthodox synagogue.) But current trends continue, growing influence Orthodox Jews America's Jewish communal institutions erode even liberal-democratic veneer today covers American Zionism. In 2002, America's major Jewish organizations sponsored large Israel solidarity rally Washington Mall. Up east coast, yeshivas shut day, swelling estimated Orthodox share crowd close 70 percent. When Deputy Secretary Defense Paul Wolfowitz told rally "innocent Palestinians suffering dying well," booed. America's Jewish leaders think hard rally. Unless change course, portends future: American Zionist movement even feign concern Palestinian dignity broader American Jewish population even feign concern Israel. My children, given upbringing, could easily end among booers among Luntz's focus group. Either prospect fills dread. In 2004, effort prevent weapons smuggling Egypt, Israeli tanks bulldozers demolished hundreds houses Rafah refugee camp southern Gaza Strip. Watching television, veteran Israeli commentator politician named Tommy Lapid saw elderly Palestinian woman crouched fours looking medicines amid ruins home. He said reminded grandmother. In moment, Lapid captured spirit suffocating within organized American Jewish life. To begin with, watched. In experience, epidemic watching among American Zionists today. A Red Cross study malnutrition Gaza Strip, bill Knesset allow Jewish neighborhoods bar entry Israeli Arabs, Israeli human rights report settlers burning Palestinian olive groves, three Palestinian teenagers shot—it's unpleasant. Rationalizing minimizing Palestinian suffering become kind game. In recent report foster Zionism among America's young, Luntz urges American Jewish groups use word "Arabs, Palestinians," since "the term `Palestinians' evokes images refugee camps, victims oppression," "Arab' says wealth, oil Islam." Of course, Israel—like United States—must sometimes take morally difficult actions defense. But morally difficult allow human connection side. Otherwise, security justifies everything. The heads AIPAC Presidents' Conference ask Israel's leaders would say make scream "no." After all, Lieberman foreign minister; Effi Eitam touring American universities; settlements growing triple rate Israeli population; half Israeli Jewish high school students want Arabs barred Knesset. If line yet crossed, line? What infuriated critics Lapid's comment grandmother died Auschwitz. How dare defile memory Holocaust? Of course, Holocaust immeasurably worse anything Israel done ever do. • But least Lapid used Jewish suffering connect suffering others. In world AIPAC, Holocaust analogies never stop, message always same: Jews licensed victimhood worry themselves. Many Israel's founders believed statehood, Jews would rightly judged way treated non-Jews living dominion. "For first time shall majority living minority," Knesset member Pinchas Lavon declared 1948, "and shall called upon provide example prove Jews live minority." But message American Jewish establishment allies Netanyahu government exactly opposite: since Jews history's permanent victims, always knife-edge extinction, moral responsibility luxury Israel have. Its responsibility survive. As former Knesset speaker Avraham Burg writes remarkable 2008 book, The Holocaust Is Over; We Must Rise From Its Ashes, "Victimhood sets free." This obsession victimhood lies heart Zionism dying among America's secular Jewish young. It simply bears relationship lived experience, seen Israel's. Yes, Israel faces threats Hezbollah Hamas. Yes, Israelis understandably worry nuclear Iran. But dilemmas face possess dozens hundreds nuclear weapons, adversary, however despicable, may acquire one, dilemmas Warsaw Ghetto. The year 2010 not, Benjamin Netanyahu claimed, 1938. The drama Jewish victimhood—a drama feels natural many Jews lived 1938, 1948, even 1967—strikes today's young American Jews farce. But different Zionist calling, never desperately relevant. It roots Israel's Independence Proclamation, promised Jewish state "will based precepts liberty, justice peace taught Hebrew prophets," December 1948 letter Albert Einstein, Hannah Arendt, others The New York Times, protesting right-wing Zionist leader Menachem Begin's visit United States party's militias massacred Arab civilians village Deir Yassin. It call recognize world Jewish fortunes radically changed, best way memorialize history Jewish suffering ethical use Jewish power. For several months now, group Israeli students traveling every Friday East Jerusalem neighborhood Sheikh Jarrah, Palestinian family named Ghawis lives street outside home fifty-three years, evicted make room Jewish settlers. Although repeatedly arrested protesting without permit, called traitors self-haters Israeli right, students keep coming, numbers swelling thousands. What American Jewish organizations brought young people speak Hillel? What face Zionism shown America's Jewish young? What students Luntz's focus group told generation faces challenge momentous Jewish history: save liberal democracy Jewish state earth? "Too many years I lived warm embrace institutionalized elusiveness part it," writes Avraham Burg. "I comfortable there." I know; I comfortable too. But comfortable Zionism become moral abdication. Let's hope Luntz's students, solidarity counterparts Sheikh Jarrah, foster uncomfortable Zionism, Zionism angry Israel risks becoming, love still could be. Let's hope care enough try. —May 12, 2010 . Ebeling, Betsy Thursday, May 27, 2010 4:33 PM H ole0.bmp FISA director leaves legacy collaboration Breaking barriers Wednesday, May 26, 2010 By Tina Calabro, Pittsburgh Post-Gazette Pam Panchak/Post-Gazette FISA Foundation retiring executive director Dee Delaney, left, new executive director, Kristy Trautmann. To people local disability community, Dee Delaney household name. When news came spring intention retire executive director FISA Foundation August, one could almost hear collective gasp. With 14 years helm small influential foundation, Ms. Delaney pronounced lasting influence quality life region. On behalf FISA, Ms. Delaney changed local landscape funding projects far-reaching results, bringing people together craft solutions longstanding problems becoming personally involved many projects foundation funds. She became first executive director FISA Foundation began 1996 proceeds sale Hannarville Rehabilitation Center, nonprofit, HealthSouth, for-profit organization. The new foundation would continue mission Federation Independent School Alumnae, organization opened convalescent home women 1911 Harmarville Rehabilitation Center 1954. That mission improve lives women, girls people disabilities Western Pennsylvania. Ms. Delaney, involved Harmarville since 1980 -- starting volunteer ending development director foundation -- sought job leading FISA. "I realized impact foundation could have. FISA large foundation, it's focused foundation," said. Over past 14 years, FISA's endowment grown $38 million. Over $17 million granted 726 projects 298 organizations. A roll call projects funded FISA reflects progressive thinking including people disabilities aspects life, especially access health care. Programs become national models. Women disabilities, example, often encounter barriers typical healthcare settings. Standard exam tables diagnostic equipment designed able-bodied, medical staff often struggle accommodate individuals special needs. FISA provided seed money Center Women Disabilities Magee-Womens Hospital UPMC, one first clinics nation. FISA involved overall issue improving access healthcare people disabilities. Likewise, people disabilities difficulty obtaining dental care. A FISA-funded project Achieva creating statewide, systemic solutions. FISA also provided support Center Patients Special Needs Pitt's School Dental Medicine. FISA also taken lead training arts cultural venues make events accessible helping places worship welcoming "Dee national leader field. If people like her, wouldn't issues have," said Kim Hutchinson, executive director Disability Funders Network, based Virginia. Ms. Delaney board officer group since 2004. Nancy Murray, president ARC Greater Pittsburgh, said issues Ms. Delaney helped solve ones people working years. "People talk strategies, never move forward solutions. Dee brings stakeholders together get solutions," said Ms. Murray. "I think Dee greatly influenced next generation nonprofit philanthropic leaders, leading example value true collaboration," said Susie Chase, board member FISA former executive director Working Order, FISA grantee. "With Dee, never role, FISA's role, always unmet needs community work needs done. That seems bring best every partner, everyone privilege working her." Ms. Chase added advice technical assistance Ms. Delaney provided Working Order "were equal greater value organization grant funds." "I still, many years, never come away meeting Dee I haven't learned something, inspired work harder, understood clearly value someone else's ideas efforts." In retirement, Ms. Delaney plans "give back community new ways," said. A new frontier helping young people disabilities prepare employment leadership. "We keep fire burning." On May 19, FISA announced Kristy Trautmaim, served foundation's program director six years, promoted executive director. "We sought person would follow Ms. Delaney's visionary leadership guide foundation next decade," said Jane Burger, chaired search committee. "We know found person Kristy Trautmaim. She understands challenges facing populations foundation supports trust board community."

Published The New Republic (http://www.tnr.com) The Unnecessary Fall A counter-history Obama presidency. • John B. Judis • August 12, 2010 I 12:00 On April 14, 2009, Barack Obama's standing polls beginning slip, Tea Party demonstrators amassing Washington tax day protests, president gave lengthy address atGeorgetown University explaining "five pillars" economic policies. The speech intended promote memorable slogan Obama's program would evoke comparisons Theodore Roosevelt's Square Deal, Franklin Roosevelt's New Deal, Lyndon Johnson's Great Society. Obama's contribution New Foundation. "We must lay new foundation growth prosperity—a foundation move us era borrow spend one save invest," declared. Obama would repeat phrase seven times day many occasions next months. At Obama's private White House dinner presidential historians June, historians impressed public New Foundation slogan. "I don't think it's going work," Robert Dallek warned. Doris Kearns Goodwin said sounded "like woman's girdle." One historians might able forewarn Obama slogan unsuccessfully deployed Democratic president before. In 1979 State Union address, Jimmy Carter began, "Tonight, I want examine broad sense state American Union—how building new foundation peaceful prosperous world." Carter would use phrase five times speech, including conclusion, asked members Congress join "in building new foundation." Like Obama's effort, phrase inspired, most, underwear jokes forgotten. Obama's evocation Carter obviously unintended—but Man Plains indeed specter hanging presidency. Of course, Obama already accomplished first 20 months Jimmy Carter entire presidency. But disturbing political resemblance two presidencies. Both men ran inspired campaigns positioned scandals partisan quarrels predecessors initially stirred hopes "transformational" presidency. But, presidents, men somehow failed connect large parts electorate. To sure, number specific reasons Carter Obama landed political trouble. Both men contended rising unemployment—Carter rampant inflation well—and voters' approval president party tend track closely changes economy. Carter faced friction party rise powerful business lobby, Obama dealt Republican Party frustrated dreams post-partisan presidency. Yet important reason difficulties—evident inept attempts brand programs—has inability develop politics resonates public. In United States, politics pivots around allegiance middle class, even identity changed yeoman farmers mechanics store clerks, office workers, x-ray technicians, small business owners. They are, Bill Clinton's words, "those work hard play rules." They central characters populist rhetoric goes back early republic. It depicts middle class embattled threatened either forces (impoverished immigrants, welfare cheaters, ghetto rioters) (Wall Street speculators, state bureaucrats, K Street lobbyists). Populism embraced Glenn Beck Tom Harkin. It intrinsically neither left-wing right-wing. Politicians, Franklin Roosevelt Ronald Reagan, found way using populism's appeal downturns enjoyed success, spurned suffered accordingly. If, circumstances like present one, don't develop populist politics, adversaries use populism define enemy people. That's Carter discovered stagflation late '70s. And that's happened last 20 months Great Recession Barack Obama Democratic Party leads. Obama took office widespread popular support, even among Republicans, first efforts, including $800 billion stimulus, initially enjoyed strong public favor. But wide appeal began dissipate late spring 2009. Disillusion Obama fueled November defeat Democratic gubernatorial candidates New Jersey Virginia. By January 2010, crucial factor Republican Scott Brown's astonishing victory Martha Coakley Massachusetts. In postmortem debate defeats, Democrats blamed Obama's dogged pursuit health care reform economy hemorrhaging jobs. That may factor, real damage done earlier. What doomed Obama politically way dealt financial crisis first six months presidency. In atmosphere primed populist backlash, allowed right wing define terms. As Obama delivering inaugural address, financial crisis already full swing; already apparent financial speculation, outright fraud, irresponsible sometimes illegal housing-loan practices played large role precipitating crisis. The public arms. But, instead rallying public "money changers," Roosevelt done first inaugural, Obama, taking leaf Jimmy Carter's infamous "malaise" speech, put blame public whole. "Our economy badly weakened, consequence greed irresponsibility part some, also collective failure make hard choices prepare nation new age," declared. Over next month, Obama would periodically criticize bankers embarrassing revelations—at various times calling bonuses gave "shameful" "outrage"—but, hearing complaints rhetoric bankers, would back off. At private meeting March 28 13 Wall Street CEOs, president, spokesman Robert Gibbs said, "emphasized Wall Street needs Main Street Main Street needs Wall Street." And, Georgetown speech, Obama returned theme collective responsibility. The recession, Obama said, "was caused perfect storm irresponsibility poor decision-making stretched Wall Street Washington Main Street." Obama's policy followed swerving course rhetoric. One week, would favor harsh restrictions bank insurance-company bonuses, but, next week, would waver; one week, would support legislation allowing bankruptcy judges reduce amount homeowners threatened foreclosure owed banks; next week, would fail protest bank lobbyists pressured Senate kill provisions. But, importantly, Obama—in sharp contrast Roosevelt first months—failed push Congress immediately enact new financial regulations even set commission investigate fraud. (When Congress finally appointed commission July 2009, Obama party put milquetoast Democratic politician, former California State Treasurer Philip Angelides, charge it.) Obama's appointments also conveyed impression wanted let Wall Street hook. He appointed Timothy Geithner treasury secretary. Geithner claimed part Wall Street, but, capacity president Federal Reserve Bank New York, served board directors headed JP Morgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon. As New York Fed president, Geithner partly responsible decision let Lehman Brothers go under, unpopular tarp program, American International Group (MG) paying back Wall Street creditors government money. Geithner chose chief staff former lobbyist Goldman Sachs. Retiring Democratic Senator Byron Dorgan told me, "Most Americans reading massive compensations bailouts, administration largely hired people culture Wall Street." By spring, Obama's apparent tilt Wall Street sparked right-wing populist revolt country. The newly formed Tea Party movement, Beck Fox News, host right-wing bloggers leading charge; but, less extreme form, general public shared anger. In early April New York Times/CBS News poll, public disapproved Obama's aiding banks 58 percent 33 percent. In poll, public approval Obama's handling economy began fall. Pollsters focus groups also traced disillusionment Obama's economic policies handling financial crisis. Congressman Barney Frank, defends Obama's policies, acknowledges president's political difficulties began revelation MG, received $170 billion government, paid $165 billion bonuses division brought company down. Geithner known bonuses insisted legal grounds block them. (It came Geithner pressured Senate Banking Committee Chairman Chris Dodd insert provision stimulus bill protected bonuses.) "The pitchforks out. It added injury injury," Frank says. That's public opinion Geithner plummeted. According Rasmussen poll, 24 percent favorable view Geithner 44 percent unfavorable one. The public's view bank bailout AIG bonuses colored view auto bailout, stimulus, health care reform. One rallying cries populist opposition Obama "where's bailout?" (Obama acknowledged "one frequent questions" asked letters.) The auto program became bailout Big Three CEOs; stimulus became bailout government itself; health care reform bailout uninsured—or "reparations," Rush Limbaugh put it. Wrote right-wing blogger Michelle Malkin, "hardworking citizens getting sick played chumps" "moochers, big small, corporate individual, trampling hands demanding endless bailouts." Obama Democrats successfully portrayed aiding "the moochers," "hardworking citizens." In American politics, that's recipe political disaster. Some White House political operation recognized late spring administration's economic efforts defined right-wing populism tried push Obama take populist tack. A group within White House began calling "pitchfork gang," would find attempts convince Obama get tough Wall Street insurance companies undermined Geithner National Economic Council head Larry Summers, worried upsetting business confidence. "There continual tension White House," says person privy discussions. "One week, would hot, then, next week, would dial back." By early January year, Obama clearly losing battle middle class. According CNN poll, 60 percent Americans thought Obama "had paid attention problems faced banks financial institutions" "problems faced middle class Americans." Only 28 percent, barely quarter, thought paid attention middle class. As Brown surged ahead Coakley polls, White House temporarily embraced populist approach. On January 14, Obama called bank bonuses "obscene" said, "we want money back." In January 22 speech Lorain County Community College Elyria, Ohio (a far cry Georgetown), Obama used word "fighting" 13 times "fight" nine times. "I stop fighting you," declared. But, faced falling stock market anger Wall Street, Obama turned conciliatory. On February io, said didn't "begrudge" $17 million bonus awarded Dimon $9 million Goldman Sachs CEO Lloyd Blankfein. "I know guys. They savvy businessmen." Obama's reluctance rail Wall Street might led watered-down financial reform bill, even bill all, but, April 16, Securities Exchange Commission indicted Goldman Sachs fraud. The next week, emboldened Obama went New York criticize bankers directly "failure responsibility." As result indictment Obama's rediscovery anger, Republicans became somewhat less obstructionist, moderate Republicans broke party's leadership, moderate Democrats fell line. Congress produced much stronger bill Democrats ever expected. But Obama's embrace populism remained fitful sporadic. After U.S. Chamber Commerce Verizon's Ivan Seidenberg, head Business Roundtable, criticized Obama anti-business June, president dispatched Geithner, White House aide Valerie Jarrett, Bill Clinton appease business community. Obama said enough anger CEOs, failed convey greater public fighting them. Obama's unwillingness buck Wall Street Business Roundtable, along delayed muddled response BP disaster Gulf, eroded public's confidence leadership. In Pew's midyear report card Obama's image, greatest drop February 2009 June perception Obama "strong leader." Voters sometimes tolerate policies question presidents like John Kennedy Reagan, regard "strong," politicians like Jimmy Carter, regard weak. What factors behind Obama's political difficulties? There doubt that, economy growing faster, unemployment dropping 9 percent, Obama Democrats would popular fearing November rout. But, unfortunately, economy's sluggish recovery cannot completely disentangled White House's weak political performance. In January, White House debated large stimulus propose, Christina Romer, head Council Economic Advisors, proposed $1.2 trillion Keynesian jolt. David Obey, chairman House Budget Committee, told The Fiscal Times Obama's Treasury Department asked initially $1.4 trillion bill. But administration finally proposed stimulus $700 $800 billion included large tax cuts likely stimulate saving consumption—and spending would unlikely produce many jobs end Obama's first term. In stimulus's first year, administration spent $17 billion $139 billion allocated infrastructure spending. Prominent economists, including Paul Krugman Joseph Stiglitz, made case much larger stimulus necessary reverse (rather merely reduce) rise unemployment, that, modest stimulus failed reduce unemployment, Republicans would convince public stimulus toxic medication would block additional Keynesian measures. That argument proven sadly correct. Some White House advisers appear underestimated depth Great Recession. Others seem doubted administration political clout get Congress. But White House might gotten Obama proclaimed national economic emergency (which was); framed issue terms rescuing middle class damage done Wall Street speculators, short-sighted CEOs, Chinese mercantilism; directly attacked Republicans heartless obstructionists. When Obama belatedly made sort case eve financial reform vote year, got much stronger bill anyone anticipated. So it's clear failure get larger stimulus—which ended hurting administration politically—wasn't result political timidity. The president also suffered inability explain public sought large stimulus thought could accomplish. Obama's New Foundation speech Georgetown soon forgotten. Afterward, Obama, dismay Democrats Congress White House aides, pretty much dropped jobs issue. From Labor Day, devoted July visit Buffalo August stopover southern Indiana issue—at time right wing mobilizing him. Obama didn't fail develop consistent narrative economy; didn't really try. Contrast Obama's attempt develop politics justify economic program Reagan 1982. Faced steadily rising unemployment, went 8.6 percent January 10.4 percent November, Reagan political staff, included James Baker, Mike Deaver, Ed Rollins, forged strategy early year calling voters "stay course" blaming current economic troubles Democratic profligacy. "We clearing away economic wreckage dumped laps," Reagan declared. Democrats accused playing "the blame game," strategy, followed letter White House ten months, worked. The Republicans predicted lose many 50 House seats, lost 26 broke even Senate. Some commentators noted Reagan's popularity even lower Obama's. But, key economic questions, much better Obama Democrats currently performing—and voters expressed far greater patience Reagan's program. According polls, even unemployment rate climbed, narrow plurality still expressed confidence Reagan's program would help economy. On eve election, unemployment rate postwar high, New York Times/CBS News poll found 6o percent likely voters thought Reagan's economic program would eventually help country. That's sign successful political operation. If Obama could command numbers, Democrats could seriously limit losses November. But Obama able develop narrative could convince people trust Democrats. Why White House failed convince public fighting effectively behalf? The principal culprit clearly Barack Obama. He strange aversion confrontational politics. His aversion strange schooled it, working community organizer 198os, tutelage activists subscribed teachings radical Saul Alinsky. But, Obama departed Harvard Law School 1988, left Alinsky adversarial tactics behind. The young lawyer returned Chicago won seat Illinois state Senate 1996 practiced different style politics. Obama's principal accomplishments Springfield bills restricting lobbying requiring videotaping confessions potential death penalty cases. He typical blue-collar, bread-and-butter Chicago Democrat, kind good government liberal represents upscale districts city, seeing politics higher calling ill ease (although open opposition to) city's Democratic machine. He also post- racial politician eschewed hard-edged, angry rhetoric Jesse Jackson. (That, too, oddly reminiscent Carter, partly campaigned 1976 white Southern antidote George Wallace's angry racial populism.) Obama carried outlook U.S. Senate, campaign presidency, then, presidency itself. He cerebral, dispassionate, post-partisan; wants "end political strategy based division," "turn page" culture wars 1960s partisan battles 1990s. During campaign, aides jokingly referred "black Jesus." While tolerate even brush aside conflict, reluctant actively foment it. "In time crisis, can't afford govern anger," declared February 2009. During campaign first year office, held blind faith bipartisanship, even Republicans voted bloc legislation. He is, perhaps, ill-suited respects era bruising political warfare. His advisers clearly reinforced inclinations. In campaign, fashioned outsider candidate "hope" "change" extended strategy presidency itself. They see standing party. In meeting congressional leaders last April, senior adviser David Axelrod rejected complaint Obama accorded equal blame Democrats Republicans descriptions "cynical politics Washington." Within White House, top aides still speak promoting Obama "brand." Organizing America, administration's campaign organization, supposed focusing 2010 elections, recently devoted resources organizing parties across country celebrate Obama's forty-ninth birthday. These efforts elevate Obama hurly-burly Washington politics disastrous. Obama's image iconic outsider become screen Fox News, Tea Party, radicalright bloggers, assorted politicians projected image foreigner, Islamic radical, socialist. He remained "the other" aspired campaign, advisers longer control otherness defined. The White House cabinet officials appointed reinforced aversion populism. As Jonathan Alter recounts The Promise: President Obama, Year One, Geithner Summers repeatedly blocked attempts get tough Wall Street grounds would threaten recovery upsetting bankers. For first year, Alter writes, "Obama bought Geithner-Summers argument banks fragile couldn't confronted remained peril." Its reluctance come bankers crippled administration politically, making far difficult get way Congress second stimulus program would boosted recovery Democrats' political prospects. Bad politics trump good policy. Populism profound shortcomings worldview. It tends toward demagoguery. In relentless focus middle class, ignore stigmatize it. It prove hostile long-range scientific outlook. A populist Obama, instance, might postponed battle climate change legislation national health insurance probably would taken weaker stand immigration. But populism indelible part American political psyche, uncomfortable making populist appeals, like Hoover Carter—or, recently, presidential candidate John Kerry—suffer consequences polls. If Obama's politics leads Republican takeover one houses Congress, even Republican president 2012, much Obama accomplished could undone. It's unlikely new Republican president Congress would actually repeal health care financial reform bill. But former could starved public funds deprived regulatory oversight; latter could neutered hostile treasury secretary weak hostile presidential appointees Securities Exchange Commission new Consumer Financial Protection Agency. Reform legislation needs administrations congresses committed reform. That politics come in; that's Obama administration, aversion populism, fallen short. John B. This story lojr: • kiva Eldar Akiva Eldar chief political columnist editorial writer Haaretz. His columns also appear regularly Ha'aretz-Herald Tribune edition. In May 2006 The Financial Times selected among prominent influential commentators world, "whose comments inspire callers across political spectrum". Between 1993 1996, Eldar served Haaretz U.S. Bureau Chief Washington correspondent, covering peace process, U.S.-Israel relations, American issues Israel-Diaspora relations. Prior this, Eldar spent 10 years diplomatic correspondent Haaretz, well municipal correspondent Jerusalem 1978 1983. Before joining Haaretz, Eldar reporter editor Israel Radio spent two years spokesperson former Mayor Jerusalem, Teddy Kollek. Eldar author several books Israel Middle East, including "The ambush Jerusalem", deals U.S.-Israel-Jewish community relations, "Lords Land", exploration Jewish settlements West Bank. In 2007 received annual "Search Common Ground" award Middle East journalism. Eldar special consultant Abba Eban's PBS television documentaries history Israel Oslo peace initiative. He regularly appears major television radio networks U.S., Canada, Australia, Europe Israel. He appeared many times news programs Nightline, The Lehrer Show, Charlie Rose Show, CNN News CBS Morning News, current affair programs Israeli television, well NPR talk shows. Eldar contributes op-ed pages The New York Times, LA Times, The Philadelphia Inquirer, The International Herald Tribune The New York Jewish Week. During stay U.S. Mr. Eldar lectured extensively Jewish community campuses throughout U.S., Canada Australia. He also participated various Israeli-Arab- European seminars. Mr. Elder born Haifa, Israel 1945. He graduate Hebrew University Jerusalem, majored Economics, Political Science Psychology.

Rage 1:1 Days Rage -- The Noxious Transformation Conservative Movement Rabid Fringe By Max Blumenthal, Nation Books Posted August 10, 2010, Printed August 17, 2010 http://www.alternet.orgistory/147784/ Editor's Note: The following new epilogue Max Blumenthal's book, Republic Gomorrah, paperback (Basic/Nation Books, 2009). "He tell wants strong authority take crushing responsibility thinking Since Republic weak, led break law love obedience. But really strong authority wishes? In reality demands rigorous order others, disorder without responsibility." -- Jean-Paul Sartre, "Anti-Semite Jew" I sure I first detected noxious fumes would envelop conservative movement Obama era. It might early on, April 2009, I visited series gun shows rural California Nevada. Perusing tables piled high high- caliber semi-automatic weapons chatting anyone vicinity, I heard urgent warnings mass roundups, concentration camps, socialist government Washington. "These people purchasing guns people worried what's going country," gun dealer told outside show Reno. "Good luck Obama," young gun enthusiast remarked me. "We outnumber 100 1." At time, Tea Party movement even registered national media's radar. In September 2009, I led panel discussion book inside auditorium filled nearly 100 students faculty University California- Riverside. Beside sat Jonathan Walton, African-American professor religious studies prolific writer, Mark Takano, erudite, openly gay former Democratic congressional candidate local community college trustee. In middle discussion, dozen College Republicans stormed front stage signs denouncing "left-wing hack" hysterical young man leaped crowd, blowing kisses mockingly Takano heckling Walton "racist." Afterward, university police officers insisted escorting ride right-wing heckler attempted follow shouted threats. Who stalker? Just concerned citizen worried taxes? His name Ryan Sorba operative heavily funded national conservative youth outfit, Intercollegiate Studies Institute. Besides founding dozens Republican youth groups across country, Sorba devoted exceptional amount energy interest homosexuals. His intellectual output consists tract titled The Born Gay Hoax, arguing homosexuality curable disease bogus trend manufactured academic leftists. Adding credentials, Sorba history run-ins law, explained I called order. My encounter aggressive right-wing cadre seemed strange, isolated event. But hostility turned symptomatic intensifying campaign delegitimize President Obama allies Congress. The Right's days rage beginning. Through first year office, Obama seemed oblivious threat far right. He campaigned partisanship, declaring "no red states" "conservative America." Apparently, thought merely contrivance myth people rejected science, demonized gays, assailed minority women's rights -- genuinely believed said. Speaking changing Washington, Obama seemed think entire history politics since rise Reagan Right strategies polarization deeply rooted superficial problem attributable certain "divisive" personalities, easily wiped away gestures toward bipartisanship. His view parties simply mirror images sharing fundamental beliefs separated "partisans." The skilled devoted community organizer could bring together. Many supporters media, often part parcel political wars years, reinforced amplified innocence, proclaiming one last could "bridge• partisan divide." Andrew Sullivan, disaffected conservative called critics George W. Bush policies "fifth columnists" fervently supporting Obama, wrote new president destined become "a liberal Reagan reunite America." This optimism pervaded Obama White House president aides sought Republicans willing vote programs. After all, couldn't get along? In autobiographical book The Audacity Hope, Obama highlighted key component political strategy: "I serve blank screen people vastly different political stripes project views." Once elected, conservatives concluded could reverse Obama's strength transforming human tableau fearsome images could conjure. Obama's multiracial background crucial cultivating resentment among shock troops. Those rejected Obama's legitimacy serve president basis background gave birth "Birther" movement sought challenge citizenship. The movement's visible figure, therefore eccentric, Orly Taitz, dentist self- trained lawyer immigrated former Soviet republican Moldova Israel settling conservative bastion Orange County, California. Convinced claims far-right Web site WorldNetDaily Obama planned create "civilian national security force," Taitz told "realized Obama another Stalin--it's cross Stalinist USSR Hitler's Germany." After becoming transfixed online conspiracy theories claiming Obama's family forged birth certificate Hawaii, Taitz snapped action. She filed lawsuit November 2008 California Secretary State Debra Bowen demanding investigation Obama's eligibility serve president. Taitz's plaintiff case Wiley Drake, Orange County radio preacher former second vice president Southern Baptist Convention publicly prayed Obama's death. While lawsuit went nowhere, subsequent suits earned angry rebukes judges, Taitz became instant media sensation, delivering heavily accented screeds Obama friendly interviewers Sean Haimity CNN's Lou Dobbs, Taitz called "greatest supporter" eventually fired indirect result hosting her. In March 2009, Texas Rep. Randy Neugebauer signed Birther bill proposing future presidential candidates must prove citizenship becoming eligible campaign. The Birther movement found voice goverment made indelible impact Republican grassroots. By June 2009, 28 percent Republican respondents Kos/Research 2000 poll said thought Obama wasn't born United States, 30 percent "weren't sure." "Obama Big House," Taitz shrieked me, "not White House!" When Obama announced health care reform first major initiative administration, conservative movement activated campaign demonization -- transformational politics -- designed turn Obama "Other," making seem unfamiliar, therefore threatening, possible. When president urged Congress deliver health care reform bill 2009, Right staged living theater political hatred, Obama's dream bipartisanship transformed nightmarish version "Marat/Sade." On September 12, 2009, tens thousands far-right activists belonging loose confederation anti-government groups called Tea Party Patriots converged Washington's National Mall giant protest Obama health care plan. The date significant: Fox News's top- ranked talk show host Glenn Beck declared birth "9-12 Project" restore sense unity -- siege mentality -- Americans experienced September 11, 2001. But time, Obama -- Osama -- enemy. While covering rally, I witnessed sign sign declaring Obama greater danger America's security al- Qaida; demonstrators held images juxtaposed Obama's face images evildoers Hitler Pol Pot Bin Laden; others carried signs questioning Obama's status U.S. citizen. "We fight al-Qaida, can't kill Obama," said aging demonstrator. Another told me, "Obama biggest Nazi world," pointing placards fashioned depicting Obama House Majority Leader Nancy Pelosi SS outfits. According another activist, Obama's agenda similar Hitler's: "Hitler took banking industry, not? And Hitler personal secret service police. [The community- organizing group] ACORN extension that." The seemingly incongruous Tea Party propaganda recalled signs waved right-wing Jewish settlers rallies Israeli Prime Minister Yitzhak Rabin support peace process, portraying SS officer French collaborator Marshall Petain. In 1995, amid provocative atmosphere, young right-wing Jewish zealot assassinated Rabin. The Israeli tragedy cautionary example targeted hatred leading violence. Members Tea Party "Patriots" seem care rhetoric irrational, comparing Obama Hitler Stalin contradictory obviously hyperbolic. Their motives entirely negative. By purging government multicultural evil seized power illicit means (several activists told believed ACORN helped Obama steal election), convinced mythical golden American yesteryear would return. They interest building anything new even articulating agenda, much less discussing merits policies. The Tea Party's primary concern cultural purification -- freedom from, freedom to. Against dark image president liberal allies, Tea Party activists defined children light. The racial subtext always transparent. The Tea Party's strategy rested guerrilla campaign chaos sabotage designed intimidate Democrats also disorient independent voters might supported health care reform. The Tea Partiers convinced would easy feat, since believed majority country side -- represented "Real America." At 9-12 rally Matt Kibbe, one march organizers, told crowd ABC News reporting 1 million 1.5 million people attendance, something ABC denied, saying "ABCNews.com reported approximate figure 60,000 70,000 protesters." Then Armey led crowd chant "Freedom works! Freedom works!" Unknown Tea Partiers, intoning name corporate-funded Beltway advocacy group, battle cry Mel Gibson William Wallace Braveheart. Contrary image grassroots movement mobilized stifle machinations Washington elites, Tea Party movement creation constellation industry-funded conservative groups close Republican ties. The movement's leading puppet-master Dick Armey, directed resources talking points Tea Party "Patriots" Washington, D.C.-based advocacy group, FreedomWorks. Among corporate clients Armey's lobbying firm, forced leave result involvement Tea Parties, pharmaceutical giant Bristol Myers Squibb, company clear interest defeating health care reform. (Armey's "real American" clients included Marxist terror cult, People's Mojahedin Iran, received funding assistance Saddam Hussein order launch terrorist strikes throughout 1990's Iranian civilian targets.) Armey collected consulting fee $250,000 directly FreedomWorks $300,000 allied astroturf front groups. FreedomWorks paid much money assortment Republican political consultants. From there, Skousen sailed far shores Right-peddling conspiracy tracts like The Naked Communist-, earning condemnation beloved FBI, accused internal memo "promoting [his] anti-communism obvious financial purposes." Skousen's vocal support far-right John Birch Society's claim communists controlled President Dwight Eisenhower cost support corporate backers paid Red-bashing lecture tours. By late 1970s, even Church Latter Day Saints distanced Skousen conspiracy theories. His work fell margins might disappeared entirely Beck revived it, turning The 5000 Year Leap bible Tea Party movement. Journalist Alexander Zaitchik observed authoritative profile Skousen Salon.com Skousen's renewed influence Beck Tea Party 'suggests modern base Republican Party headed strange place." Besides influencing Beck, Skousen's teachings inspired one Tea Party movement's visible grassroots celebrities, retired Sheriff Richard Mack. I met Mack February far- right rally outside Montgomery, Alabama. On makeshift stage towed middle rodeo arena pickup truck, Mack recalled reverence mentorship Skousen, said taught everything needed know Constitution. Mack urged spellbound audience stockpile ammo store food. "If control food supply," Mack warned, "you control people. And that's first step slavery." Already hero conservatives successfully suing Clinton administration provision Brady Handgun Violence Prevention Act requiring law enforcement conduct criminal background checks gun purchasers, Mack reemerged Obama era archetypal local lawman vowed resist tyrannical federal government. Along dozen former active military law enforcement personnel, Mack helped form self-styled Tea Party militia called Oathkeepers. Galvanized fear creeping socialism, Oathkeepers solemnly swore refuse tyrannical federal orders cooperating foreign troops forcing Americans concentration camps. Because group's members trained combat, vow came suggestion armed resistance. Besides Mack, Oathkeepers attracted coterie militia movement retreads ranks. The well-established figure Mike Vanderboegh, longtime militia fanatic published booklet mid- 1990s entitled Strategy Tactics Militia Civil War, calling sniper attacks "war criminals, secret policemen, rats." With Obama office, Vandeboegh churned anti- government screeds right-wing blogs renewed passion supported efforts cashing $1,300 federal disability compensation received month. For energy far right exerted campaign strangle Obama's agenda, Democrat posed greatest threat passage health care reform. Representative Bart Stupak Michigan office since 1993, placing among senior leadership so-called centrist Blue Dog Democrats. When health care reform introduced Congress, Stupak became leader informal caucus anti-abortion Democrats, making de facto swing vote House version bill. By extension, Stupak point man campaign ensure bill would allow federal funding abortion low-income women. But close consultation leaders U.S. Conference Catholic Bishops, Stupak went step further. He introduced draconian amendment block women paying abortions even private insurance plans. The amendment, passed House shut Senate, became key sticking point health care negotiations. 'He's big hero pro-life community," former Bush Catholic issues adviser Deal Hudson told November 2009. "Thanks him, first time I remember pro-life Democrats power." To chagrin Republicans, Stupak entertained offers compromise Democratic leadership. According Hudson, Catholic Bishops keen see health care reform pass, bill contained clear provision forbidding patients spending federal money abortion. Finally, March, pressure House Majority Leader Nancy Pelosi, Obam.a agreed sign executive order forbidding federal funding abortion. Stupak mollified. Now anti- abortion caucus pledged deliver swing votes Democrats needed pass bill. As soon reports seeped declaring imminent passage health care reform, major right-wing blogs like RedState.org churned virulent denunciations Stupak, calling traitor sellout. The blog comment sections filled dozens diatribes referring Stupak language previously reserved Dr. George Tiller: "Bart Baby-Killer." On March 20, thousands Tea Party activists surrounded Capitol's Longworth Building expectation Obama's pep talk House Democrats health care vote. Democratic Representative john Lewis, hero civil rights movement, Representative Barney Frank, first openly gay member Congress, passed crowd way inside Capitol. Thsligger!" demonstrator barked Lewis. Another called Frank "faggot," eliciting laughter cheers nearby protesters. Meanwhile, another African-American Democrat, Representative Emanuel Cleaver, ascended Capitol steps, protester screaming Lewis Frank spat face. With demonstration carried night, cries "Kill bill!'' drifted calls violence. "I would gladly stand men take fascists down," man camouflage battle dress uniform proclaimed front amateur videographer, pointing toward Capitol. "You haven't heard last me!" The next day, Republican members Congress emerged Longworth Building salute Tea Partiers. The demonstrators cheered wildly proxies inside. Finally, hours impassioned speeches House floor, bill passed. But drama hardly over. Republican Representative Joe Pitts, anti-abortion Catholic co-authored Stupak's original amendment, demanded motion bring back floor vote, transparent exercise grandstanding certain fail. In response, Stupak rushed podium stinging rebuke Pitts Republicans. "The motion commit support life," Stupak declared. "It Democrats stood up...." Heckling Republican side interrupted statement. As Stupak looked around House chamber, Rep. Randy Neugebauer, right-wing Republican Texas openly supported Birther movement, began shouting backbench, "Baby killer!" Other Republicans joined in, parroting base insults. While Republicans sank heads defeat, militant devotees Tea Party movement called right-wing Kristallnacht. "If wish send message Pelosi party cannot fail hear, break windows," Vanderboegh Oathkeepers wrote far-right blog hours bill passed. "Break NOW. Break run break again." Within three days, windows doors Democratic Party headquarters New York, Kansas Arizona shattered. Meanwhile, least 10 Democratic members Congress reported receiving death threats. Images nooses faxed offices Stupak James Clyburn, African-American congressman South Carolina. Representative Anthony Weiner, especially vocal proponent health care reform, received menacing letter filled white powder. The brother Representative Torn Perriello, another health care supporter, home gas line deliberately sabotaged local Tea Party organizer posted address online (he meant post congressman's) encouraged activists "drop by" express anger Perriello's recent vote. In Tucson, Arizona, windows Democratic Representative Gabrielle Giffbrds' office shattered shots pellet gun. And brick thrown window Representative Louise Slaughter's office New York voicemail filled threats impending sniper attacks. After Passage health care bill, Tea Party floated gray zone authoritarianism anarchy. Crusading restore holy social order, promoted disorder. Claiming protect democracy, smashed windows elected representatives. Warning death panels, called death threats. With atmosphere violence thickening, Palin took Twitter account issue battle cry: "Don't Retreat, Instead—RELOAD!" Thus concluded first phase Obama era usher peaceable kingdom bipartisanship.
