sbwhoeop Wednesday, August 18, 2010 9:18 AM H: Interesting relevant contribution debate interrelated jobs issue China policy. Go back proposals revival manufacturing sector, too. What Bill's program lm jobs mentioned? If won't listen, simply op-ed. Sid Does Thomas Friedman Have Talk "Senior Economic Policy Makers" Get So Many Things Wrong? Dean Baker co-director Center Economic Policy Research Washington, DC. Wednesday, 18 August 2010 04:04 Thomas Friedman begins oiece 1Q(44v telling readers that: "over past weeks I've chance speak senior economic policy makers America Germany." This might lead readers believe share great insights would possible someone special access senior economic policy makers. Readers expectation seriously disappointed. There nothing insightful found Washington Post's editorial pages average workday. Friedman rehashes usual cliches, usual lack thought. In so, gets story recent past present seriously wrong. Starting past, badly misrepresents prior business cycle: "we've ended decade debt-fueled growth borrowed money China give tax cut entitlements nothing curtail spending make long-term investments new growth engines." The main problem facing U.S. economy last decade lack demand. This large part due fact China lent us. China's lending policy propping value dollar order maintain export market United States. (At start decade, Clinton administration also tried promote over-valued dollar.) The over-valued -U.S. dollar made imports China countries cheap United States made exports expensive countries. This led large growing trade deficit business cycle. The trade deficit replaced domestic demand, preventing economy approaching normal levels employment (even boost housing bubble) crash. There reason whatsoever believe China's decision prop dollar way affected Bush tax cuts. In words, neither Bush tax cuts growth entitlements anything borrowing China. The issue China's decision lend thereby prop dollar. Given weakness demand decade, expenses could easily filled domestic production without borrowing abroad. Friedman better shifts discussion past present. He refers businesses' reluctance hire result "unusual uncertainty," phrase attributed Federal Reserve Board Chairman Ben Bemanke. Of course reluctance hire, simply lack demand labor. A reluctance hire would reflected increasing number hours per worker, employers sought meet demand labor working existing workforce hours. This happening. There modest uptick hours low point downturn, increase hours per worker certainly rapid recessions average workweek still far shorter every sector downturn. Later tells readers: "America's solvency inflection point coinciding technological one. Thanks Internet diffusion, rise cloud computing, social networking shift laptops desktops hand-held iPads iF'hones, technology destroying older, less skilled jobs paid decent wage faster pace ever spinning new skilled jobs pay decent wage require education ever." This great story -- social networking soaring, IPads everywhere -- Friedman evidence whatsoever development increased demand educated workers reduced demand less educated workers? If so, would place column present evidence. Otherwise, readers might think 4.7 percent unemployment rate college grads (nearly triple pre-recession level), coupled decline real wages decade, implies reduced demand labor highly educated workers well less educated workers. Friedman's proposed fix also seems bit wide mark. He insists: "There one way deal challenge: innovation stimulate new industries jobs pay workers $40 hour, coupled huge initiative train Americans win jobs global competitors. There way." We better hope another way. A wage $40 hour would put worker well 90th percentile wage distribution. Even double number jobs pay range -- incredible accomplishment -- happens 80 percent workforce? Friedman warns us challenge Europe getting Germany's past present wrong: "Keeping Germany won't easy. A decade ago Germany 'sick man Europe.' No more. The Germans pulled together. Labor gave wage hikes allowed businesses improve competitiveness worker flexibility, government subsidized firms keep skilled workers job downturn." Germany clearly done sorne changes benefited economy, like work sharing, haven't, past "sick man Europe" invention Friedman highly placed sources. Germany always ran trade surplus. That basic measure country's competitiveness: foreigners buying goods. Germany's unemployment rate 2.000 ayeravd 7 .,5_percept, hugely different current 7.0 percent rate. The story Friedman seems completely missed basics current economic crisis spite weeks conversing senior economic policy makers. The current crisis due lack demand pure simple. If generate demand either expansionary Fed monetary policy, greater fiscal stimulus, increased exports due falling dollar, reason believe economy return high levels employment. Certainly Friedman presented evidence increased demand generate increased employment always has. The longer term debt problem overwhelmingly health care story. Apparently Mr. Friedman's sources don't access documents like Medicare trustees report, imply U.S. health care costs controlled serious long-term deficit problem. This may prove -Wrong, seems would least worth noting column. Of course, fixed health care system, always achieve huge saving retyinq efficient health care systems countries. If Friedman's intention scare us, succeeded. After all, senior economic policy makers U.S. Germany badly misinformed Friedman implies, expect times ahead.

Sid http://www.newstatesman.com/asia/2010/08/india-pakistan-afghanistan iNT aLOSE The military mullahs William Dalrymple Published 23 August 2010 The Pakistani state long history nurturing jihadis means dominating Afghanistan undermining India. It proving fatal alliance. It May nightmarish year Pakistan pretty good one country's inscrutable chief army staff, powerful man Land Pure, General Ashfaq Parvez Kayani. For start, army's response floods compared well usual corrupt incompetence Pakistan's civilian politicians, guided chateau-hopping president, Asif Ali Zardari (while minister investment, nicknamed "Mr 10 Per Cent"; upgraded "Mr 110 Per Cent"). This led discussion army circles whether time drop civilian fig leaf return country loving embrace military. So serious threat, one country's senior well-connected journalists. Najam Sethi, editor-in-chief Friday Times, went record month warn elements army plotting yet another coup."( know definitely discussed," said. Then news Kayani going allowed keep job second term: "an extraordinary situation requires extraordinary decision overcome it", explained brigadier, writing Nation newspaper. Kayani, former head Pakistan's notorious intelligence agency, Inter-Services Intelligence (ISO, continue run army, default Pakistan's foreign policy, November 2013. But Kayani's biggest triumph year, arguably greatest career, visit Kabul July honoured guest Afghan president, Hamid Karzai. The visit marked important thawing Pak-Afghan relations, glacial ever since Karzai came power 2001. It also coincided sacking Amrullah Saleh, Karzai's pro-Indian rabidly anti-ISI former security chief. Saleh tough Tajik rose prominence mujahedin protege Ahmed Shah Massoud, Indian-backed "Lion Panjshir". The Taliban, sponsors ISI, regarded Saleh fiercest opponent, something Saleh enormously proud of. When I dinner Kabul May, spoke length frustration ineffectiveness Karzai's government taking fight Taliban, extent ISI managing aid, arm train puppet insurgents North Waziristan Balochistan. Saleh's sacking gave notice important change direction Karzai. As Bruce Riedel, Barack Obama's Af-Pak adviser, said news broke, "it means Karzai already planning post-American Afghanistan". • It seems Kayani Karzai discussing sort accommodation Afghan government ISI- sponsored elements Taliban, maybe Sirajuddin Haqqani, could give much Pashtun south pro-Pakistan Taliban, preserve Karzai power Kabul US withdrawal. The expulsion India, Pakistan's great regional rival, Afghanistan, least closing four regional consulates, would top priority ISI return deal kept Karzai power. With US toppling Taliban 11 September 2001 attacks, Pakistan's influence disappeared abruptly Afghanistan India quickly filled vacuum. To ISI's horror, early years decade, India provided reconstruction assistance training worth roughly £835m total. It also built roads, sanitation projects, new Afghan parliament free medical facilities across country. It even offered help train Afghan army. Nato refused. As General Stanley McChrystal put report last year, "while Indian activities largely benefit Afghan people, increasing Indian influence Afghanistan likely exacerbate regional tensions encourage Pakistani countermeasures". McChrystal right. The Pakistanis always paranoid small Indian presence Afghanistan. "We strong evidence [that India is] using Afghanistan Pakistan's interests destabilise Pakistan," foreign ministry spokesman claimed March. Pakistan's military establishment, terrified economic superpower emerging south, believes would suicide accept Indian presence regards Afghan backyard - potential point retreat army event Indian invasion, something Pakistani analysts refer vital "strategic depth". According Indian diplomatic sources, still fewer 3,600 Indians Afghanistan; ten Indian diplomatic officers, opposed nearly 150 UK embassy. Yet horror encircled led ISI risk Pakistan's relationship main strategic ally, US, order keep Taliban play leadership ISI patronage Quetta - policy Kayani developed head IS!. Karzai's new deal Pakistanis, clear intention try reach accommodation proxies among Taliban, therefore represents major strategic victory Kayani Pakistan's military, well grave diplomatic defeat India. Pakistan's support Taliban today recent chapter old story complicity jihadi movements Pakistani state. Since days anti-Soviet mujahedin, Pakistan's army saw violent Islamic groups ingenious cost-effective means dominating Afghanistan (which finally achieved retreat Soviets 1987) bogging Hindu-dominated Indian army Kashmir (which managed great effect 1990 onwards). The former ISI director Dick Dastardly lookalike Hamid Gul, largely responsible developing strategy, said me: "If jihadis go contain India, tying one rnillion men army soil, legitimate cause, support them?" Next Gul Islamabad living room lay piece Berlin Wall presented city's people "delivering first blow" Soviet empire use jihadis 1980s. The WikiLeaks documents suggest still busy liaising jihadis "retirement". The Pakistani military top brass long convinced could control militants nurtured. In taped conversation President Pervez Musharraf Muhammad Aziz Khan, chief general staff, India released 1999, Aziz said army jihadis "tooti" (balls). Yet Islamists increasingly followed agendas, sending suicide bombers Pakistan's religious minorities political leaders, even IS! headquarters. Nonetheless, many army still believe jihadis practical defence Indian hegemony nuclear weapons. For them, supporting Islamist groups ideological religious whim, much practical patriotic imperative - vital survival strategy Pakistani state. The army ISI continued duplicitous risky policy 11 September 2001 despite Musharrafs public promises contrary. The speed US lost interest Afghanistan invasion embarked plans invade Iraq convinced Pakistani army Washington long-term commitment Karzai's regime. This led generals keeping Taliban reserve, used reinstal pro-Pakistani regime Kabul American gaze turned elsewhere. So .ISI gave refuge leadership Taliban fled Afghanistan 2001. Mullah Mohammed Omar kept IS! safehouse Quetta; militia lodged sprawling suburb Pashtunabad. There, Mullah Abdul Ghani Baradar presided Taliban military committee war chest. Gulbuddin Hekmatyar, leader Hizb-e-lslami, lured back exile Iran allowed operate freely outside Peshawar, Jalaluddin Haqqani, one violent Taliban commanders, given sanctuary North Waziristan. Other groups despatched safehouses Balochistan. By 2004, US filmed Pakistani army trucks delivering Taliban fighters Afghan border recovering days later; wireless monitoring US base Bagram picked Taliban commanders arranging Pakistani army officers border safe passage came Afghanistan. Western intelligence agencies concluded ISI running full training programme Afghan Taliban, turning blind eye raised funds Gulf allowing import materiel, mainly via Dubai. By 2005 Taliban, covert Pakistani support, launching full-scale assault Nato troops Afghanistan given covering fire returned bases Pakistan. At time, Taliban attacks Indian interests Afghanistan intensified, beginning process turning Afghan conflict, like Kashmir, today: lndo-Pak proxy war. The Indian embassy Kabul twice bombed - July 2008 October 2009 - two city-centre hotels thought used Research Analysis Wing (Raw), Indian intelligence agency. Seven Indian civilians two Indian military officers died blasts. The degree ISI controlling Afghan Taliban become clear, documents published WikiLeaks. A report Matt Waldman Carr Centre Human Rights Harvard, based interviews ten former senior Taliban commanders, closely documents IS! "orchestrates, sustains strongly influences" Taliban shows !SI even represented Taliban's supreme leadership council, Quetta Shura. Meanwhile, Punjab, Hafiz Mohammad Saeed, founder Lashkar-e-Toiba, man believed behind 2008 Bombay attacks, allowed continue operating Muridke, near Lahore. "The powerful western world terrorising Muslims," told conference Islamabad year. "We invaded, manipulated looted. We must fight evil trio America, Israel India. Suicide missions accordance Islam. In fact, suicide attack best form jihad." At time Pursuing policy selectively using jihadis, Pakistan appeased US giving generous assistance CIA arresting foreign Arab al-Qaeda personnel. A major assault also launched militants took Lal Masjid ultra-radical Pakistan Taliban took Swat Valley announced intention turning country Islamic Emirate. In course operations others Federally Administered Tribal Areas, 1,500 Pakistani soldiers policemen killed; another 250,000 people made homeless Pak army assault Bajaur. The IS1 even prepared arrest members Afghan Taliban didn't follow orders. Hence seizure Karachi, February, Taliban second-in- command, Mullah Abdul Ghani Baradar, along aboutia dozen senior Taliban ISI regarded infringing hospitality opening talks Karzai administration via Saudis, without ISI clearance. Yet, even though Pakistani army conducted major offensives six tribal areas, seventh, North Waziristan, left alone, home ISI's favourite proxies: Haqqani Hekmatyar. Similarly, Pakistan's foot-dragging response 2008 attacks Bombay, lack response attacks minority faith groups Pakistan past months, show Janus-faced policy remains place. This summer, chief minister Punjab, Shahbaz Sharif, quoted heatedly denying militant groups working Pakistani Punjab, Punjabi Taliban even existed. There still, eyes many Pakistani establishment, good Taliban bad Taliban, useful militants expendable ones. In eyes, ongoing defeat Nato Afghanistan, US British troops suffering record casualties last month, vindication long-term strategy. Islamabad succeeded regaining influence Afghanistan Delhi checked. But India take lying down. Already Indian press reported attempts - resuscitate Northern Alliance contingency Taliban's takeover south, India working conjuction Russia, Iran central Asian "stans". The Indian national security adviser, Shivshankar Menon, despatched Afghanistan March, foreign minister, S M Krishna, visited Tehran. Post-American Afghanistan looking increasingly likely divided Tajik, Uzbek Hazara north Pashtun south, either formally, partition, likely, slip inter-ethnic civil war, India supporting arming north Pakistan south. As diplomacy gathers pace, Afghan Taliban, already control 70 per cent country. continue increase power. The worrying development spread Taliban units previously peaceful north, taken pockets Pathan settlement around Kunduz Badakhshan. The death British aid worker Karen Woo 5 August direct result. In Pakistan. too, jihadi activity growing. Last year 87 suicide attacks across country, killing roughly 3,000 people ISI week stated that, first time nation's history, regarded home-grown Islamic militants bigger threat integrity nation India. At time Pakistan's economy crisis, electricity supply increasingly erratic educational system complete breakdown, Kayani secured huge increase country's defence budget. It pretty picture: growing violence everywhere, increasing Indo-Pak tensions defeat western interests region. Worst all, Pakistani army regards major triumph, unlikely change policy time soon. http://www.ft.com/cms/s/5799a774-b534-11df-9af8-00144feabdc0,dwp_uuid=236ce648-33fa-11da-adae- 00000e2511c8,print=yes.html Financial Times FT.com r . OLUMNISTS JVlartin Wolf Obama cautious fearful times By Martin Wolf Published: Au• ust 31 2010 22:48 j Last updated: August 31 2010 22:48 Suppose US presidential election 1932 had, fact, taken place 1930, early stage Great Depression. Suppose, too, Franklin Delano Roosevelt won then, though landslide 1932. How different subsequent events might been. The president might watched helplessly output employment collapsed. The decades Democratic dominance might happened. On chances wheel history turns. But time different: crisis brought Barack Obama power close beginning economic collapse. I (among others) argued policy needed hugely aggressive. Alas, not. I noted February 4 2009, beginning new presidency: "Instead overwhelming fiscal stimulus, emerging small, wasteful ill-focused." A week later, I asked: "Has Barack Obama's presidency already failed? In normal times, would ludicrous question. But normal times. They times great danger. Today, new US administration disown responsibility inheritance; tomorrow, it. Today, offer solutions; tomorrow become problem. Today, control events; tomorrow, events take control it. Doing little far riskier much." This right. The direction policy wrong: policymakers — though economists — learnt great deal 1930s. Sensible people knew aggressive monetary fiscal expansion needed, together reconstruction financial sector. But, Larry Summers, Mr Obama's chief economic adviser, said: "When markets overshoot, policymakers must overshoot too". Unfortunately, administration failed follow excellent advice. This allowed opponents claim policy ineffective merely inadequate. In consequence, administration lost credibility public chances renewed fiscal expansion disappeared. With Federal Reserve cautious, too, likelihood lengthy period weak growth heavy joblessness high. So, too, chances domestic global political friction. True, idea policies adopted last months Bush administration first months one far better nothing weirdly controversial US. A recent paper Alan Blinder, former vice-chairman Fed, Mark Zandi Moody's argues critics wrong. They use standard macro-economic model assess would happened without intervention, without financial interventions (including monetary policy) without fiscal action. They conclude peak trough decline gross domestic product would close 12 per cent policy response, compared actual decline 4 per cent (see chart). Similarly, unemployment rate would peaked 16.5 per cent, instead actual 10 per cent. The bigger collapse would also meant fiscal deficit $2,600bn fiscal year 2011. The outcome also disastrous modest fiscal response financial •olic res•onse. It little better way round. The implication modest stimulus package February 2009 — mere 5.7 per cent 2009 GDP, spread several years — made positive contribution supported analysis Congressional Budget Office: argues 2010, US GDP 1.5 per cent 4.1 per cent higher unemployment rate 0.7 1.8 percentage points lower, result package. Panglossians believe private economy always equilibrium, unless governments intervene, disagree. I wish way run experiment without hurting hundreds millions people. But I find idea allowing collapse much financial system, avoiding unconventional monetary policy struggling close fiscal deficit would consistent rapid sustained recovery quite bizarre. A fascinating perspective come, however, comparisons happened advanced countries. The recession US output (and demand) relatively small, decline employment exceptionally large, result extraordinary surge US productivity (see charts). This contrast would happen output would happen employment missed initial Congressional Budget Office analysis stimulus. Since US epicentre financial crisis, relatively small decline output remarkable. Moreover, since fiscal monetary stimuli bear directly demand output, jobs, policy success. At time, enthusiasm US managers laid workers also extraordinary. No doubt, due collapse construction. But must due ease US companies lay workers incentives managers maintain profits downturn expense jobs. Debate emerging much surge unemployment structural. My answer, European experience, one way ensure becomes structural let linger. In short run, simplest way prevent happening expand demand output. Since huge slack labour market, slightest threat inflation — far risk deflation — constraint bond foreign exchange markets monetary fiscal stimulus, policies pursued. Yet, alas, Fed seems decided fall asleep administration lost initiative. So going happen? I assume that, midterm elections, resurgent Republicans offer new tax cuts ignore fiscal deficits. They pretend nothing reviled stimulus, though much thing — increasing fiscal deficits, thereby offsetting private frugality. That would put administration spot. It would choose vetoing tax cuts accepting them, allowing Republicans get credit "yacht mansion-led" recovery. Any recovery better none. But could much better this. Those cautious bold pay big price. martin.wolf@ft.com More columns www.ft.com/martinwolf Copyright The Financial Times Limited 2010. Print single copy article personal use. The political brain Americans today reflects volatile mixture fear fury, mix together, get explosion. The question point mitigate damage bomb detonates November. The "Obama Doctrine" Americans want work ability contribute productivity nation right work, private sector can't meet demand jobs, plenty roads bridges fix, new energy sources develop manufacture, schools build renovate kids workers returning training compete 21st century global economy. The story told tragedy two acts. Act I: The GOP Sets Country Course Economic Destruction President Calls Truth Reconciliation without Truth Part • A strong economic downturn devolves Great Recession, stock market crashes major banks fail. Americans frightened, willing waiting hear alternative narrative "government problem, solution" path back economic recovery security. • The White House refuses tell American people three stories desperately need hear. • The first economy gone ditch, it. The president steadfast position "look forward, backward," even GOP blocking every initiative clean mess. As conservative attacks Democrats increase, refuses indict Republicans Congress President Bush destroyed economy putting one eight Americans work one five either behind mortgage process homes foreclosed bankers gambled away. Why need tell American people responsible misery -- repeat again? Because otherwise, worst economic crisis since Great Depression didn't subside within year half, voters would start associate party. This Neuroscience 101 - - it's mental associations formed. But president never even uttered George W. Bush's name first year office, first time mention Bush appoint him, along former President Clinton, co-lead American relief efforts Haiti. It's hard story tell, even sound bite. But one best educators occupy Oval Office decades chose educate -- actually once, prodding, never repeated superb explanation --- remind voters every time opponents attacked deficit spending left 1.2 trillion dollar deficit day walked office unpaid-for tax cuts millionaires unpaid-for war Iraq called one sacrifice except soldiers families (and kids grandkids, paying war generations). A year later, Democrats ropes, president started tell story. It right move, appeared defensive hadn't part guiding narrative start. • The third story president needed offer alternative narrative government. The president party offer effective government solution multiple problems 30 years solid branding conservatives since Ronald Reagan government problem. But narrative never came. • The White House Democratic Congress pass virtually economists outside Goldman Sachs-to- Washington pipeline consider half-stimulus predict likely produce half-results. It fulfilled promise. Instead blasting Republicans hurled country toward abyss would take drastic measures avert warning American people could easily first two three trillion-dollar packages might needed get Americans back work get gears economy grinding could start returning kinds surpluses Bill Clinton left last time Democrat White House, president chose compromise party unpopular took office 20 percent voters point would even admit pollster considered Republicans -- lowest point GOP since rise public opinion polling 50 years earlier. • The economy continues free-fall, shedding 700,000 jobs month. Meanwhile, stimulus portrayed Republicans mixture pork fat, one effectively answering charges, creating increasingly negative associations act never adequately crafted sold. • The logical follow-up bill designed pull economy ditch make bill unnecessary future, attacking Wall Street thrown us crisis passing strong legislation rein excesses created economic meltdown. (Heading November, is, fact, popular piece legislation Democrats passed, took nearly year half get there, then, neither president Democratic Congress enjoyed good average American.) Instead, banks received bailouts foreclosing record rates homeowners whose payroll taxes funded bailouts don't seem get kind attention needs federal government. Act II: An Anemic Economy Meets Anemic Health Care Plan • The public clamoring health care reform. Over 40 million people don't health insurance all, 85 percent voters health care seen costs double Bush years time real income declined. Effective narratives health care widely available win 2:1 margin toughest Harry-and-Louise anti-reform language side. The opposition knows it, evident leaked memo Republican wordsmith Frank Luntz, warns uphill climb opponents reform, would well accept major elements it. • But instead using well-tested narratives highly effective campaign devising new ones own, administration decides try "sell" health care without narrative. (I wrote detail year ago repeat history here, except telegraphic form.) The president refuses state stands substantive debates health reform year, whether "public option" (a term ill-conceived it's hard believe public supported anyway; imagine support might received called instead "the one health care plan health insurance companies don't get control"). Instead, White House uses phrases "bending cost curve" conservatives flood airwaves evocative phrases "government takeover," "a bureaucrat doctor," "death panels." • Instead using Big Pharma health insurance industry villains health care story, would explain need overhaul rather Band-Aid, White House offers story without protagonists antagonists, cuts secret deals industries become public. • Over interminable months trying get votes Republicans fought Medicare seniors 30 years program popular keep attacking still trying gut Social Security despite popularity, public watches George Will describes "serial bribery" Republican Democratic Senators alike, gets take turn 60th vote. • At 11th hour, compromise plan finally going pass, president nixes idea Medicare-like alternative Americans choose health-insurance industry plan desire, despite 60 percent even swing voters wanting included bill. • Instead signature bill demonstrates Democrats govern effectively government force good working middle class Americans (who told better plans they've negotiated offered years employers "Cadillacs" going taxed existence), entire process proves average American government can't anything right scares moderate Democrats away voting bill would ever put record supporting government spending. • "Government" hits all-time low polls, matching popularity big corporations, CEOs, bailouts. • Populist anger emerges primary emotion across political spectrum, president's job approval swing voters drops high thirties. • Following conventional wisdom, Democrats return all-too-familiar defensive crouch, conclude trouble, tack right. On health care, president Cabinet fan television "reassure" public health care abortion won't covered (thanks reassurance, us didn't find reassuring), domestic partners won't covered, immigrants won't covered. None issues needed conceded. (I know I tested messages them, well- messaged progressive positions would boosted popularity bill swing voters.) • The White House starts adopting failed conservative policies talking points leave public utterly confused president, extension, party, stands central issues day. The president talks cutting deficits increasing spending breath, using metaphor families tightening belt tough times, strengthens resolve stimulating faltering economy; pledges support massively expanding offshore drilling "clean coal" (which doesn't exist, way) speech climate change; sends 1200 additional National Guards Arizona apparent reward passing "No Latino Left Behind," publicly objecting legislation. • The underlying psychological assumption moves mix policies right left equal parts, win center. In fact, one ever won center way. It appears weak, opportunistic, incoherent average swing voter, particularly problematic time people center desperately want know leaders vision coherent plan (which FDR Ronald Reagan effective moving voters center). It doesn't win votes right. But one predictable effect: It sucks motivation base, feel demoralized betrayed (if they're part "professional left") less likely vote (if they're average voters don't follow politics carefully don't feel enthusiastic anymore, even don't really know why). • Capping off, BP disaster occurs two weeks president adopted "drill here, drill now," "all above" position Republican Party oil companies. This could perfect opportunity go offensive, contrast Democrats stand (common sense, protection safety, land leave children, key American industries jobs, sticking ordinary Americans big businesses lobbyists) Republicans stand for; connect dots happened Wall Street (with regulators owned operated companies supposed regulate) happened Gulf (where precisely thing happened). Instead, administration finds defensive, increasingly sounding like subsidiary BP, allowing BP call shots control information weeks, defending increasingly hard-to-believe statistics, issuing press releases appear indistinguishable issued BP inconsistent assessments independent scientists. Where Do We Go Here? So find today: Democratic Party Democratic base demoralized unlikely vote high numbers November; Republican Party selling replanted Bushes tremendous enthusiasm; vast political center filled voters utterly confused unsure turn certain things aren't going well. In January 2009 one could predicted Democrats would predicament today. Perhaps Democrats might lose seats lost off-year election, certainly that. We seen -- American public knew seen -- disastrous performance president party living history, American people elected tremendously charismatic young president enormous Democratic majorities houses Congress. They given president Congress strong mandate whatever kind change necessary get us economic free-fall put Americans back work. But red flags already end Obama's first week office led offer following advice new administration: Tell story got mess you'll it. Tell coherent story deficit spending. Re-brand government there's one story (Reagan's), it's one supports progressive agenda. Never let attacks go unanswered, emboldens opposition leads public believe answers them. And throw bipartisan party one comes, don't throw another one. All followed predictable unfortunate. A year half later, White House hasn't consistently done things, although President intermittently them, does, well. The question today whether Democrats channel populist anger seeing around country late game. The answer we'd better try. Having recently tested messages economics jobs, including talk deficits taxes -- widely assumed Democrats' Achilles Heel, particularly -- little question Democrats progressives center left simply say believe ways evocative, values-driven, speak people's worries 'anger, many stand good chance surviving November, particularly opponents nothing say warmed-over rhetoric cutting taxes millionaires multinationals fiscal restraint except cuts profits campaign contributors. Even evocative boilerplate conservative messages fall flat honest messages speak need get Americans working again. And issue issue, message resonant right one sides working middle class Americans small business owners special interests, big business, lobbyists. But actions speak louder words, Americans want see action. It may late kind jobs bill seen year half ago, isn't late Democrats go offensive Republicans - - virtually -- opposed extending unemployment insurance millions Americans thrown work Republicans' corporate sponsors. On every one issues, strong populist message trounces anything side say. But Democrats need play offense. They need take up-or-down votes bill bill, including expect side block, knowing every one votes leverage campaign ad behind it. They need change narrative sounds average American like whiny impotent one -- "the Republicans won't let us it" -- narrative strength numbers shared constituents. Hurricane Tomas route Haiti hit 4 Nov right southern claw. SouthCom's announcement: USS IWO JIMA DEPLOYS TO HAITI AS TROPICAL STORM APPROACHES MIAMI - U.S. Southern Command directed amphibious ship USS Iwo Jima (LHD 7) steam toward Haiti today preparation forecasted arrival tropical storm Tomas later week. Iwo Jima deploy Haiti Suriname, arrived Thursday final country visit Continuing Promise 2010, four-month, humanitarian civic assistance deployment eight nations Caribbean region. The ship scheduled arrive Haiti later week. Large amphibious ships, like Iwo Jima, resemble small aircraft carriers include ability support helicopter landing craft operations quickly move personnel cargo, making ideal platform support humanitarian-relief missions short notice. A crew 1,600 military civilian medical, engineering, aviation, logistical support personnel embarked aboard Iwo Jima, including U.S. Navy engineers, contingent 500 Marines logistical-support expertise, volunteers U.S. Public Health Service various non-governmental organizations (NG0s), well medical, dental engineering professionals Europe, North America South America. Eight CH-46 Sea Knight, medium-lift, dual-rotor helicopters; two MH-60 Knight Hawk helicopters two amphibious landing craft units (ICU's) Iwo Jima support ship's operations. Iwo Jima Wasp-class amphibious ship capable speeds excess 20 knots provide robust ship-to-shore, well shore-to-shore logistics support contingencies ranging traditional military operations humanitarian disaster-relief missions. Because Caribbean region's history severe-weather events peak months hurricane season, ship remained area throughout present deployment, ready support U.S. disaster relief efforts directed. Iwo Jima Port-de-Paix, Haiti, July 24 Aug. 3. It first stop CP10 crew provided medical assistance 4,000 Haitian citizens, performed 32 surgeries, completed six engineering projects, delivered 231 pallets humanitarian-assistance supplies donated NG0s. In September 2008, amphibious ship USS Kearsarge deployed Haiti support U.S. relief efforts succession storms (Fay, Gustav, Hanna Ike) devastated country. Kearsarge provided robust air sealift support, delivering 3.3 million pounds food, water aid communities impacted disasters. ### Related links: About Continuing Promise 2010: http://www.southcom.mil/AppsSC/factFiles.php?id=155 Photo USS Iwo Jima: http://www.southcom.mil/AppsSC/images/uploads/634159131775283089.jpg CLASSIFICAT1ON:UNCLASSIFIED

You suggested I touch relationship Gulf Arabs, especially Saudi Arabia, this. It honor challenge address subject capital / ministry. The ongoing conflict Holy Land increasingly disturbs world's conscience well tranquility. The Israel-Palestine issue began struggle context European colonialism. It stimulated escalating terrorism Israelis home allies abroad. Since end Cold War, interaction Israel captive Palestinian population emerged fountainhead global strife. http://maxblumenthal.com/2010/11/the-return-of-ghosts-debating-the-rise-of-geert-wilders-and-the-far-right/ The Return Ghosts: Debating rise Geert Wilders far-right Nexus Symposium On 11.18.10, By Max The Nexus Institute's Return Ghosts conference inspired rise far-right politician Geert Wilders Netherlands I spent last week Amsterdam, I participated "Return Ghosts" symposium Nexus Institute, discussion/debate resurgence neo-fascism Europe anti-democratic trends West. Besides providing forum debating European politics, symposium occasion first public appearance Europe Peruvian writer Mario Vargas Llosa since awarded Nobel Prize Literature last month. The arrival Vargas Llosa, one world's foremost intellectuals, resulted overflow crowd filled members Dutch media, country's political class, royal family. Even Vargas Llosa spotlight, participants' attention focused Geert Wilders, leader far-right Dutch People's Party Freedom Democracy, third leading party Netherlands. With gathering influence, Wilders essentially placed Dutch coalition government stranglehold; government meets every Wednesday gauge opinions ask instructions. While Wilders dictates government, remains independent it, comfortably avoiding consequences policies helped shape. It perfect position politician whose agenda comprised exclusively xenophobic populism, typical strategy far-right countries across continent. Wilders' base lies mostly Catholic south, ironically people ever encountered Muslim. He also generated support city Groeningen, citadel communists. Seeking expand base, Wilders promised hire scores "animal cops" investigate prosecute abuse animals, clever wedge strategy country I know party dedicated exclusively animal rights. Of course, Wilders could care less furry friends. His stated goal end immigration Holland Europe; ban Quran (free speech "Judeo-Christian" community), severely limit rights Muslim citizens Europe by, instance, instituting called "head rag tax" Muslim women. Wilders' international allies include goosestepping neo- Nazis English Defense League, far-right pogromist Pam Geller, Belgian neo-fascist party Vlaams Belang, substantial portion US neocon elite. Over course years, become perhaps influential Islamophobe world. But make Wilders fascist? Rob Riemen, director Nexus Institute, thinks so. Riemen published book entitled "De Eeuwige Terugkeer Van Het Fascisme," "The Eternal Return Fascism" (I eagerly await English translation), dedicated highlighting danger Wilders' eerily familiar brand right-wing populism. In book, Riemen urges readers compare Wilders' politics early incarnations European fascism, genocidal terminal stage fascism late World War II. He calls parallels Wilders early fascists "one- and-one." In economic civilizational crisis like kind Netherlands facing, Riemen warns reactionary figures like Wilders easily seize power centrist elements stand politely passively, refusing call spade spade. Where Wilders' ascendancy lead unknown, stopped tracks, Riemen certain B6 story end well. In week publication, Riemen's book flew shelves, selling 5000 copies generating heated reactions across spectrum debate. Riemen told despite public enthusiasm book, characterization Wilders attacked "un- Dutch." In Dutch culture, many others, open confrontation avoided cost. Political disagreement welcomed expressed collegial manner, though nothing reputations stake. So Dutch cultural elite generally goes along get along. The resistance Riemen met since called Wilders seemed alarmed frustrated him. Why difficult liberal elements Netherlands recognize clear resonances fascism Wilders' political style? wondered. And seem concerned regulating terms debate forming united front far-right? Once symposium opened I able see Dutch elite action, I began understand Riemen's indignation. The symposium began speech Vargas Llosa, complex personality allied center-right parties Spain elsewhere whose politics remain fundamentally rooted cultural liberalism. Vargas Llosa's differences leaders left, used belong to, exploded issue free trade. He ardent neo- liberal reviles Latin populists like Hugo Chavez 011anta Humala advocate protectionism industrial nationalization. Vargas Llosa decorated speech literary metaphors natural imagery describe challenges democracy, particularly Europe. But body address devoted supposed threat Islamic extremism posed Western civilization. Vargas Llosa singled suicide bombing dangerous phenomenon, pointing Madrid London bombings al-Qaida inspired operatives, curiously mentioning suicide attacks secular groups like Tamil Tigers Kurdish PKK, nationalistic suicide terror Palestinian militants (Vargas Llosa declared speech "Israel deserves treated like nation," harshly critical state past). During first panel, I participated in, Fania Oz-Salzberger, Israeli professor history daughter famed author Amos Oz, boasted crowd Israel's "vibrant democracy." She enthusiastically seconded Mitchell Cohen, former editor Dissent devoted considerable energy assailing anti-Zionist Jews, writing "the dominant species anti-Semitism encourages anti-Zionism." I found odd neither expressed concern almost endless stream anti-democratic laws passing Knesset, general authoritarian, anti-liberal trend Israeli society. Oz-Salzberger went announce smattering applause "Geert Wilders politicians like welcomed Israelis." Yet Wilders one Israel's frequent guests, visited country 40 times 20 years. In fact, claims views Islam Arabs forged living Israeli moshav. "Nowhere I special feeling solidarity I get I land Ben Gurion airport," said. Wilders reportedly receives heavy support Dutch financial backers Israel, met range Israeli officials. His closest allies lie within extremist settler movement, prompting call forced transfer Palestinians Jordan. Members liberal Zionist intelligensia like Oz-Salzberger may want Wilders around, Israel listening them? Israel's mainstream leadership echoes Wilders' crudest talking points regular basis, Zionist left clings dwindling handful Knesset seats watches passively — even resentfully — rag-tag band leftist radicals fights equality all. Consider recent statement former Prime Minister Ehud Olmert, seen centrist within Israeli political spectrum: "The origin terrorism within Islam," Olmert declared month. The pro-Israel position new breed European far-rightists recognized much convenient political tactic. Of course, saying "stand Israel," Wilders often does, easy way insulate charges anti-Semitism. But extreme right also attracted Israel country represents highest ideals. While critics see Israel racist apartheid state, people like Wilders see Israel racist apartheid state — like it. They richly enjoy Israel mows Arab Muslims dozens tells world go hell; admire Israel's settler culture; all, yearn live land like Israel privileges ethnic majority others point systematically humiliates dispossesses swarthy racial outclass. The endgame far-right make Europe less tolerant Israeli. After Italian philosopher Paolo Flores D'Arcais proclaimed Italy longer democratic country, citing PM Silvio Berlusconi's control 90 percent country's media, government's deep seated corruption Prime Minister's repeated attempts impose onerous restrictions journalistic freedom, Riemen asked United States democracy given rapidly rising influence corporations media elections. After two panelists described Israel vibrant democracy another labeled Italy non-democratic quasi-dictatorship, I decided definition democracy subjective best. So I sidestepped question outlined greatest blows American democracy, elimination Fairness Doctrine Telecommunications Deregulation Act Citizens United SCOTUS decision. Later evening, D'Arcais would remark amazement never knew American media ever regulated first place. I responded course not, citing example secular groups like Tamil Tigers brought tactic practice second suicide. Oz-Salzberger jumped in, proclaiming occupation little nothing motives suicide bombers. She marshal evidence support point, possibly time limited. He silver haired curmudgeon aristocratic stock reminded instantly "paleocon" characters I've met covering white nationalist conventions like American Renaissance. Marking landmark moment Daily Herald Editorial Board Published: 8/26/2010 12:05 AM Today marks watershed moment nation's history. Know is? Any plans celebrate occasion? Ninety years ago day, United States secretary state signed law 19th Amendment U.S. Constitution giving women right vote. That significant moment history securing basic civil right one two genders existence came 70-year struggle saw pioneering "radical" women jailed physically abused fought justice. Ninety years ago today. Not long ago, really. We still women among us lived time basic powerful activity prohibited. Denied mothers grandmothers, older sisters aunts. Illinois played pivotal role struggle, Illinois suburban women continue mark history, politics policy. And continue exercising right, speaking working change policies affect us all. Illinois allow women vote presidential local elections 1913 and, according votingwomen.org, Illinois, Michigan Wisconsin first three states ratify 19th Amendment June 10, 1919. From start, Illinois suburbs home pioneering women. Libertyville's Clara Colby listed first woman vote, cast ballot new town hall while, papers time reported, husband stayed home "scrub clothes laundry." There Jane Addams, Cedarville, III., native social worker suffragist founded Chicago's Hull House one first women win Nobel Peace Prize. And Illinois elected 14 female members Congress. The first Chicago Republican Winnifred S. Huck, third woman elected Congress, two years 19th Amendment ratification. Huck first wife mother elected Congress. Republican Ruth Hanna McCormick worked Springfield lobbyist helped pass law allowing Illinois women vote elections 1913 moved Congress. Democrat Emily Taft Douglas, early leader League Women Voters internationalist wife former U.S. Sen. Paul Douglas cousin President William H. Taft, beat isolationist Republican Stephen Day 1945, according Women Congress website. In recent times, Rockford Republican Lynn Martin moved Congress Labor Secretary Chicago Democrat Carol Moseley Braun became first black woman U.S. Senate. Now, course, also Secretary State Hillary Clinton, hails Park Ridge. In suburban trenches along way, women leading agitating change. Former Democratic state Rep. Eugenia Chapman Arlington Heights credited helping start community colleges Illinois. Republican Giddy Dyer Hinsdale joined supporting Equal Rights Amendment also passed DuPage County's first clean air ordinance. Chapman worked Republican Virginia B. Macdonald Arlington Heights establish women's center Harper College. And omit goes. Nice, say, big deal? Indeed, big deal and, indeed, women shaping lives still big deal. Men, imagine life without women? Women, imagine life without women? American women come long way 90 years society better it. Women vote greater numbers men years, nationally Illinois. They well vote, write laws, lead play even influential roles next 90 years, beyond, may bring us all.

Sid Financial Times FT.corn A poisoned process holds little hope By David Gardner Published: August 25 2010 22:46 1 Last updated: August 25 2010 22:46 „ As caravans Middle East peace negotiators rumble Washington next week umpteenth time, pervasive cynicism sense deja vu overwhelming — good reason. The Middle East peace process long ago turned tortured charade pure process events ground — particular relentless strategic Israeli colonisation occupied Palestinian land — pull opposite direction peace. "We colluding gigantic confidence trick," one Arab minister puts it, "and go again." While many factors combined hand veto powers rejectionists sides, heart question remains continuing Israeli occupation. It essential remember biggest single increase Jewish settlers Arab — 50 per cent rise — took place 1992-96 governments peace-makers Yitzhak Rabin Shimon Peres at.the high-water mark Oslo peace accords. Many Israelis point perfidy late Yassir Arafat, wanted talk peace keep option armed resistance dangerously play. But killed Oslo occupation. The second intifada erupted decade ago essentially Oslo war. A decade on, Israeli settlement enterprise turned occupied West Bank discontiguous scattering cantons, walled security barrier built yet annexed Arab land criss-crossed segregated Israeli roads linking settlements. Last month, B'Tselem, Israeli human rights group, published study showing Israel taken 42 per cent West Bank, 300,000 settlers another 200,000 East Jerusalem. The siege Gaza turned sliver land vast, open-air prison. The main feature present situationi disconnect high politics utterly discredited peace process — Israeli parlance — "facts ground". At last month's White House summit, Barack Obama Benjamin Netanyahu massaged long estrangement political armistice, US president praised Israeli prime minister leader "willing take risks peace". But evidence whatsoever. True, June last year, response Mr Obama's Cairo speech denying legitimacy Israel's settlements, Mr Netanyahu forced utter words "Palestinian state" — surrounded barbed-wire caveats voided meaning. Indeed, words sides use — peace, resolution, security, — may same; side means different. The mainstream Palestinian leaders, President Mahmoud Abbas Salem Fayyad, prime minister, Quartet made US, European Union, UN Russia, talk negotiated resolution. This means two states living peace security, Palestinian homeland 22 per cent Mandate Palestine taken Israel 1967 Arab-Israeli war. East Jerusalem would serve capital West Bank Gaza, marginal land swaps preserve Israeli settlements near Jerusalem. But Mr Netanyahu mean? He clear mean. For start, set face concessions Jerusalem. He wants keep settlements except far-flung "ideological" ones 100-plus "outposts" established pawns traded chess game began. His idea demilitarised Palestinian state like sort supra-municipal administration self-determined, independent government. Will surprise us, hackneyed Nixon China principle holds politicians right easily close difficult deals? There little suggest that: The thinking Mr Netanyahu, son celebrated promoter Greater Israel, always profoundly irredentist. While nationalist Likud faces constraints coalition assortment ultra-rightist ultra-orthodox parties well Labour, plainly choice; centrist Kadima party (and remains) alternative. To fair, Israel's electoral system — low threshold entry Knesset makes multi-party coalitions inevitable — means lobbies settlers take national interest hostage. But Mr Netanyahu magnifies choice partners diligently firing ultra-hawks pro-Israel lobby US. As risks he. taken peace, Exhibit A much-hyped moratorium settlement-building, expires next month has, case, speciously interpreted. While bulldozers build settlements idling, moreover, bulldozers demolishing Palestinian homes roaring: rate demolition around Jerusalem doubled year, army razed village al-Farisiye Jordan Valley, line Mr Netanyahu's strategically obsolete obsession keeping valley Israel's eastern border. As diplomacy struggles keep alive viability two-state solution, three rival systems control crystallised occupied territories would make future Palestinian homeland: settlements; crimped Palestinian Authority Mr Abbas Mr Fayyad; Hamas, Israel Arab western allies tried failed marginalise. Time short negotiated outcome; may even run out. The outlines deal clear, (Bill) Clinton parameters 2000 Arab Peace initiative 2002, endorsed 22 Arab 57 Muslim countries (as well Hamas, part 2007 Mecca accord). There end occupation, US Quartet cannot allude this; must demand it. The writer international affairs editor "FT" "Financial Times" trademarks Financial Times. See Haaretz today: • Home • Print Edition • Nt- - 3ws • Published 00:56 26.08.10 • Latest update 00:56 26.08.10 Interview / Why Israel end policy nuclear ambiguity An interview Avner Cohen, expert nonproliferation issues author forthcoming book "The Worst-Kept Secret: Israel's Bargain Bomb." By Nia. tasha Mozwvava Tags: Israel news Avner Cohen senior fellow James Martin Center Nonproliferation Studies Monterey Institute International Studies. He author "Israel Bomb" forthcoming "The Worst-Kept Secret: Israel's Bargain Bomb." Avner Cohen, claim time come Israel abandon policy nuclear ambiguity. Why now, would good Israel? "Nuclear ambiguity cornerstone Israeli strategic thinking. It born many years ago, sealed part comprehensive deal United States 1969. It appropriate time, today. opinion, anachronistic, foolish anti-democratic. Even realpolitik terms, 'own goal' Israel. In view, undermines genuine Israeli interests, including need gain recognition legitimacy counted among responsible states strategic field." Are sure pressure Israel severe? If Israel criticized nuclear program, usually marginal. The brunt criticism treatment Palestinians. • "Israel received tacit consent nuclear program Western world appeared small, state' surrounded enemies, memory Holocaust still fresh. Israel's image different then. "In long term, Israel appears reject peace one opposes two-state solution, perceived regional bully possesses nuclear weapons. So world lot less forgiving nuclear issue. The situation ambiguity, don't real legitimacy, good place be." The United States called Israel join nonproliferation treaty, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's visit Washington, U.S. President Barack Obama said recognizes special nature threats Israel faces, threats warrant special security measures. The Americans want appear fair issue seen Israel completely sacred. They want look though respect that. This agreement [with U.S.] passed along president president, I don't believe issue sacred Americans Israelis." Do give credence slippery slope theory, abandoning ambiguity would lead demands Israel disarm? "Those cliches used defense establishment. Nobody 'demands Israel make announcement without first preparatory work among allies Arab states. This great fear slippery slope ridiculous. Israel interests; nobody coerce things." What claim ambiguity keeps Arab states feeling need launch arms race Israel? "I don't dismiss claim hand, if, study thought, fear turns warranted, I would prepared wait. But ways, ambiguity insulting Arabs. The claim mention treats Arabs though children: If told Israel doesn't admit it, frees need deal reality. I believe Arab countries don't want play game make-believe, rather want discuss topic directly realistically." You say, basically, Iran imitating Israel's nuclear behavior. That comparison would certainly rankle Israel supporters. "But way Iran advanced toward nuclear capability via announcements tests, rather rumors. It even remain within bounds Nuclear Non-Proliferation Treaty. If rankles anybody, let rankle. "If Iran attacked, want achieve status ambiguity; I see nearly certain. The international community thus another reason accept idea ambiguity legitimate. The norm state nuclear weapon must say clearly part nonproliferation regime. The longer Iran continues path, less patience world Israel." How envision scenario 'coming nuclear closet?' "Censorship plays central role enforcement nuclear ambiguity. So long [military] censor, hard alter ambiguity. If censorship didn't exist, israeli newspapers would able write subject openly. "Another issue need law addresses nuclear topic. There Shin Bet [security service] law, law Mossad law Israel Atomic Energy Commission. This problematic situation. "On international level, it's sensitive subject demands preparatory work. Ultimately, I see political statement Israel's government prime minister would find right way put subject table. He would talk historical background responsible way Israel dealt topic. With rare exceptions, weapons military use; Israel views means deterrence. I don't think Israel would need go detail regarding many [bombs] exactly has. "Israel right bomb less New Delhi, even United States. Ambiguity creates sense sinners, though done something terrible can't tell awful truth - I don't think awful. This country world viewed nuclear state long time, time come say something positive huge, complicated awe-inspiring topic... "All states ultimately committed treaty signed achieve world without nuclear weapons. Whether happen lifetimes I can't say." You say ambiguity undermines Israeli democracy prevents debate matters life death, question whose finger button. Do think Israeli public ready discussion? "There little creative thinking area, ambiguity one stifling factors produced unacceptable, closed culture incapable creative thinking. Ambiguity's power derives fact Israeli society accepts it, seems public attempt deviate would cause serious damage Israeli security. "Ambiguity created public incapable dealing topic, one afraid prefers issue handled 'trustworthy hands' take responsibility itself. Ambiguity created ignorant, craven public.which, certain sense, betrayed civic, democratic duties subject." What's like researching topic nobody discusses? "When I started studying subject 25 years ago, I feeling I entering palace nothing could touched. It took years find right way handle topic responsibly - researcher's perspective, standpoint someone directly involved matter. Today I think possible initiate meaningful dialogue concrete, real issues." • Print Page • Send friend. • Comments • Share • Text Size -1-1: • Follow us Twitter • Become Haaretz.com Faceboolr friend This story by: • atasha Mozoovaya

. Subject: H: fyi, discuss come air... Sid http://www.newsweek.com/2010/04/15/europe-s-new-politics-of-fear.print.html Europe's New Politics Fear Denis MacShaneApril 16, 2010 There new divide Europe. Not iron curtain, iron intolerance politicians revert blaming minorities nations' woes. In Western Europe Muslims. In Eastern Europe Jews, Roma, gays. In Netherlands, Geert Wilders surged election victory March back anti-Muslim, anti-Quran populism. In Hungary Fidesz Party won big recent elections attacks "Jewish capital... wants devour entire world." To right Fidesz openly anti-Jewish Jobbik Party, won two seats fewer Socialists. Its leaders want wear neo-Nazi uniform pre-1939 Hungarian Guard take seats Budapest's Parliament. Contemporary political scientists like highlight anti-Semitism. They prefer term "radical populism," anyone half sense European history, parallels older, Jew-baiting politics longer dismissed. Economic dislocation rapid loss confidence traditional politics gave rise ultranationalist movements first half last century. Now global recession hunt someone blame jobs incomes disappear producing toxic politics. The Fidesz leader, Viktor Orban, youthful evangelist liberalized open markets 1990. Now strikes much nationalist tone. His Socialist opponents accept austerity IMF package. Unlike Greece—which helped, far, euro-zone partners—Hungary alone boom-time euro loans buy houses cars paid back ever-devaluing forint. Blaming Socialist government, globalization, international capital easy. But Fidesz went further. In bid votes far right, Fidesz parliamentarian, Oszkar Molnar, says it's time give "primacy Hungarian interests global capital, Jewish capital." Like Jean-Marie Le Pen's National Front France, Jobbik support 15 percent Hungarian voters. The Czech right-wing ODS Party dismiss leader, former premier Mirek Topolanek, attacked Jewish origins current Czech prime minister castigated gay transport minister. In new book, The Populist Radical Right Poland, Oxford-educated Warsaw political professor Rafal Pankowski writes: "Antisemitism crucial Polish populist right. The number Jews Poland today minimal, anti-Jewish prejudice serves code general hostility diversity Polish [liberal] democracy." For time being, criticism nationalist politics suspended Poles mourn President Lech Kaczynski national leaders killed air-crash tragedy month. But record party activists—including Michal Kaminski, Poland's best-known M.E.P. leader small right- wing group Strasbourg Parliament—is disturbing. An admirer late Chilean dictator Augusto Pinochet, Kaminski uses ugly language gays, says apologize killing Jews Polish soil World War II "Jews apologize killing Poles." Mainstream political parties sought play rise minority bashing. But Fidesz affiliated center- right European People's Party, groups Angela Merkel's ruling Christian Democratic Union Party Germany, Nicolas Sarkozy's Union Popular Movement government France, ruling conservative parties Sweden, Italy, Belgium. When Austrian rightist Jorg Haider entered coalition Austria decade ago, European Union held Vienna political quarantine Haider removed. But Fidesz massive majority built attacking "Jewish capital" language even Haider didn't dare utter. So radical populism—anti-Muslim Western Europe, anti-Jewish Eastern Europe, anti-foreigner anti- immigrant rhetoric everywhere—is longer fringe politics. In Britain's general election, main parties seeking appease anti-foreigner feeling language immigrants would tolerate applied British citizens living working abroad. Comparisons prewar Europe overdrawn. Fascism dead coming back. But new politics intolerance afoot Europe, one knows deal it. http://www.newsweek.com/2010/09/05/how-marine-le-pen-is-changing-french-politics.print.html B6 Eit What Tea Party Looks Like Europe Marine Le Pen moving father's rabble-rousing, far-right party away fringe, redefining French politics process. Tracy McNicoll Christopher DickeySeptember 05, 2010 amuel Bollendorff / The New York Times-Redux Marine Le Pen heir apparent leadership National Front, right-wing party father Jean-Marie (left) leads today Jean-Marie Le Pen, 82-year-old firebrand France's far right—the man decades played inchoate fears, xenophobia, knee-jerk racism, ill-disguised anti-Semitism many supporters—had finished speaking faithful farm far English Channel. As members youth wing National Front party feasted barbecue apple pie, thrilled see grand old man hold forth, still "provocateur" taunting establishment, "toreador" hides sword cape lets press run like bull. Even youngsters knew, however, Jean-Marie's time ring nearing end. The old man made clear he's. determined step down. All eyes day daughter Marine. "She will, courage, temperament necessary, competence," Le Pen told reporters farmhouse. "It seems indisputable camp's best candidate 2012." Tall, blonde, plain-spoken, thick-skinned, Le Pen's youngest child, 42, heir apparent party. She's expected win contest leadership January, she's passionate advocate core message: strong French nationalism, relentless Euro-skepticism, lot hard-nosed talk fighting crime immigration. She's fresh face, new look, and, rising poll numbers placing third crowded field possible 2012 candidates, new threat French politics. In eyes many, she's effective—and thus dangerous—than father. It's measure Le Pens' enhanced power they've managed push President Nicolas Sarkozy right cast party mainstream. Over summer, Sarkozy essentially gave flirtation left, began election 2007. He cherry-picked popular Socialists centrist government, dividing party. But elections past March, Sarkozy's UMP party managed keep control one 22 regional governments. So decided swing back right playing fears public safety immigration. He proposed taking citizenship away criminals immigrant background launched campaign Roma (or "Gypsies"), booting hundreds country. While measures proved popular opinion polls, Sarkozy, ironically, not. His abysmal approval ratings remain low 30s. The younger Le Pen takes great pleasure watching Sarkozy squirm. "I think I get [his] nerves quite bit," says. "My profile much complicated deal father." The old man could painted creature past, purveyor old prejudices "sulfurous" reputation, says Marine. Today, however, Front wants bill "neither left right." If means losing fringe elements (many support Marine's rival, Bruno Gollnisch), well, "tent pis," says. Other right-wing movements Europe also pushing political mainstream. The government Prime Minister Silvio Berlusconi Italy long relied alliance two groups used considered extreme—one former Fascist Party Gianfranco Fini, secessionist Northern League Umberto Bossi. A falling-out Berlusconi Fini left Bossi current kingmaker Italian politics. In Netherlands, militantly Islamophobic Geert Wilders won enough seats last elections become pivotal figure drawn-out process trying build new coalition government. Yet movements often differ significant ways right wing that's made U.S.A. Put aside usual caricature "people pointy hoods Ku Klux Klan," Marine Le Pen says, still believes "the American right much right National Front." She might agree want manage American frontiers effectively prevent massive illegal immigration, she's also big believer state's ability obligation help people. "We feel state means intervene," says. "We attached public services A la frangaise way limit inequalities among regions among French," including "access level health care." Le Pen grew household politics time, father object sometimes violent attacks competing factions right, well left. When Marine 8, someone set 20-kilo bomb family's Paris apartment building. Miraculously, one killed seriously injured, front building brought down. The crime never solved. "The worst part wasn't attack, single politician sent word condolence," says. "It difficult, builds character, hardens you." That's real asset political life anywhere. If Sarkozy finds facing Marine Le Pen presidential race year half now, may find wishing old man stayed around little longer. With Barbie Nadeau Rome
FYI The Christian Science Monitor - CSMonitor.com War terror: Obama softened language, hardened Muslim hearts The Obama administration's shift counterterrorism language sought bridge divide Muslim world soften Americans' fear Islam. But new rhetoric hasn't matched policy, unintended costs home abroad high. By Stuart Gottlieb posted October 14, 2010 9:58 EDT New Haven, Conn. — One defining aspects Obama administration's counterterrorism strategy effort change America's rhetorical approach threat terrorism, particularly Islamic terrorism. "The language use matters," President Obama told Arabic satellite television station Al Arabiya interview first week office. Scrubbed George W. Bush-era terms like "war terrorism," "radical Islam," "jihadist."The White House's 2010 National Security Strategy formally replaced term "Islamic terrorism" "violent extremism." The purpose shift semantics two-fold. First, aimed repackage fight terrorism specific fight Al Qaeda, Islamic extremism, Mr. Obama believes contributed post-9/11 perception America "at war Islam." Indeed, new rhetoric gone hand hand Obama's outreach Muslim world build "a new partnership based mutual respect mutual interest." Second, part broader effort soften Americans' fear Islamic terrorism, Obama officials believe plays directly hands extremists. Language change ineffective Now fair ask whether Obama's use language regarding terrorism proven effective. Startling new polls suggest hasn't. The first, Brookings Institution Washington, shows May 2009 May 2010 number Middle Eastern Arabs expressing optimism Obama's approach toward region dropped 51 percent 16 percent, describing "discouraged" Obama presidency rising 15 percent 63 percent. The second, Pew Research Center, shows August 2010 fewer Americans held favorable view Islam (30 percent) five years earlier Bush administration (41 percent), Americans (35 percent) saying Islam encourages violence religions (in 2002, 25 percent). These starkly negative trend lines suggest limited utility language fighting terrorism. Yes, terrorism propaganda-fueled activity – ongoing battle win hearts minds attract new recruits fight cause. And course language used combating terrorism vital – counterproductive "smoke 'em out" rhetoric Bush administration case point. But rhetoric match policy, appears discount play threats, credibility – thus effectiveness – overall counterterrorism strategy may undermined. It appears Obama administration dug hole. Rhetoric doesn't match policy When looking beyond nuanced language appealing promises, Muslims around world see administration ramped war Afghanistan; killing scores Muslim civilians drone strikes; continues hold 1,000 Muslim detainees Guantanamo, Bagram, prisons; maintains seemingly unconditional support Israel. This critique policies, point match raised expectations Muslim world muddled Obama's oft-stated goal turning Muslims toward America away extremist movements. The price downplaying threat A large price also paid domestically disconnected rhetoric. Despite maintaining nearly Bush's hard-line tactics — USA Patriot Act, warrantless surveillance, indefinite detentions White House consistently played threat, even face clear uptick terrorism activity. For example, following failed 2009 Christmas Day airline bombing, Obama described suspect "isolated extremist," despite ties Al Qaeda. And administration's initial response failed May 2010 Times Square bombing American Muslim trained Pakistan call "one-off' event. Attorney General Eric Holder stated congressional testimony believed recent Islamic terror plots unconnected, unrelated radical Islam. There little doubt administration's unwillingness speak candidly Islamic terrorism taken toll public's trust. A Gallup poll released last month shows Americans favoring Republicans Democrats issue terrorism 55 percent 31 percent — 49 percent 42 percent last fall. Time reverse trend Obama entered office promising fight smarter effective war terrorism, many ways has. His instincts maintain aggressive tactics toning inflammatory rhetoric sound. Yet administration seems overlearned key lesson Bush years — overstating threat terrorism costs attached. So, too, rhetoric understates threat, especially detached policy. It late reverse troubling trend. The White House begin focusing less overly reassuring rhetoric — paid dividends home abroad — candid accounting threats faced policies employed confront them. Stuart Gottlieb, former foreign-policy adviser speechwriter US Senate (1999-2003), director policy studies Jackson Insti tute Global Affairs Yale. He's editor "Debating Terrorism Counterterrorism: Con filo ting Perspectives Causes, Contexts, Re sponses." The original version piece appeared online edition The National Interest. © The Christian Science Monitor. All Rights Reserved. Terms service provided you. Privacy Policy.

President Obama leads Sarah Palin 48 - 40 percent. Romney, Huckabee, Palin former House Speaker Newt Gingrich bunched together Republican voters asked prefer GOP's 2012 presidential nomination, independent Quinnipiac (KWIN-uh-pe-ack) University survey finds. Democratic voters say 64 - 27 percent want anyone challenge President Obama party's nomination 2012. "The Democratic base remains squarely behind President Barack Obama comes re-election, weakness among independent voters point makes 2012 election prospects uncertain," said Peter A. Brown, assistant director Quinnipiac University Polling Institute. "The demographic splits electorate voters asked whether president deserves second term roadmap re-election strategists need focus appeal. Only 39 percent men, 34 percent whites, 35 percent political independents 38 percent age 35 think deserves four years Oval Office." In trial heats 2012, former Massachusetts Gov. Romney receives 45 percent 44 percent Obama, president gets 46 percent 44 percent Mr. Huckabee. Matched Indiana Gov. Mitch Daniels, virtual unknown voters, president leads 45 - 36 percent. Tim Pawlenty 6 percent Daniels, Mississippi Gov. Haley Barbour Sen. John Thune South Dakota 2 percent each. From November 8 - 15, Quinnipiac University surveyed 2,424 registered voters nationwide, live telephone, margin error +/- 2 percentage points. For Sunday reading, summary interesting proposal former Jordanian foreign minister Marwan Muasher. "Palestinian-Israeli Direct Talks: The Case Regional Approach"By Marwan Muasher (Carnegie Endowment Bulletin, August 2010) Marwan Muasher – former Jordanian foreign minister, ambassador, deputy prime minister – advocates regional settlement Israeli-Palestinian conflict, capitalizing 2002 Arab Peace Initiative. His approach depends first securing end-game "deposits" parties: The parties would offer hypothetical commitments might willing give onset, "deposited" U.S. committed side willing same. Saudi Arabia's deposit, instance, would outline agree package included details Jerusalem. The Saudi package would also promise secure Arab Muslim backing painful compromises Palestinians would need accept. Muasher advocates similar approach Syrian track—asking Syria deposit end-game commitments return full Israeli withdrawal Golan Heights. In deposits, Saudis Syrians must clearly commit address inclusion Hamas Hezbollah regional agreement. The Arab states would end logistical, financial, military support two groups, would assume responsibility delivering two actors, helping transform political players. Israel's deposit would spell commitment solution based 1967 borders return Golan. According Muasher, deposits would make much easier President Abbas engage talks aimed ending conflict. After given Arab cover, Abbas could provide end-game deposits. According Muasher, absent commitments Arab states, Palestinian positions remain maximalist. Once U.S. deposits sides make reasonable, comprehensive package, put package table cooperation Quartet. Once comprehensive package presented, U.S. focus confidence- building measures move sides toward end game. AM

Sid US Election And The Fed Welcome To The New (Old) World September 19, 2010 One main debates inside senior Fed offices much may balance much conservative fiscal policy Republicans take over. This important question facing officials sides fence (far squiggles whirls monthly numbers). But it's spending taxes, important are, it's also implementation Reg Reform Health Care Reform. All going change November. Here details. Amid snarkiness crazy Tea Party candidates may (and, know, LOVE snarkiness) two things lost: 1. The President lost control spending tax agenda 2. The President lost control implementing Reg Reform health care legislation Congress pushed through. All polling parties independent sources point strongly Republicans taking House. Although less likely take Senate, able gain effective control spending, taxes large scale administrative reforms. Let's start spending: The basic fact spending approved Congress starts House. As wrote nearly week ago, House Republican Leader Boehner senior staff made clear us would like freeze spending 2008 levels annual cost savings $340 billion. This one top Republican priorities. Freezing spending 2008 levels happen. However, even unlikely event Republicans take House budget -- -- frozen near FY 2010 levels (i.e. last time money formally appropriated). Since spending bills approved fiscal year starts October, Congress pass "continuing resolution" keeps government running specific appropriations made (the 1995 government shutdown happened appropriations continuing resolution...the government literally runs spending authority). Congress pass CR next weeks likely run formation new Congress (say February March) next year. They could lame duck session, would cutting close cute. Because new Congress - even Republicans fail take full control House - dominated fiscal conservatives, Boehner's CR idea traction. The Senate make moderate, President veto thus shut government sign take hit. In turn two things: (1) frees money Bush tax rollovers (2) helps plan slow freeze implementation reg reform health care reform bills. The first part obvious. The second may less so. People forget implementation rules requires staff increases, staff reg writing, etc that's money. By freezing spending previous levels freeze ability hire new staff seriously obstruct new rule writing process. Add Boehner's commitment overturn two major regulatory reforms you've got tidal wave indecision paralysis (Jesus, talk mixed metaphors although would interesting see one those). The hearings announce simply chilling effect threatening overturn laws accomplish ninety-percent wants get done, potentially give courts time strike parts health care bill appeal. THE SENATE While everyone written Republican control Senate (we haven't), attention Senate look like even consensus 52-54 Democratic majority prevails. The point US Senate function January 2011 given new membership. We got glimpse would look like moderate Republican Scott Brown elected health care public option panned Reg Reform trimmed around edges. The incoming crop members much ardent government spending, debt, taxes regulatory oversight. They make Boehner's job much easier Take quick look new members (and several marry sworn office).
