Slaughter, Anne-Marie <SlaughterA@state.gov> Tuesday, November 23, 2010 11:52 PM Abedin, Huma; Sullivan, Jacob J; Mills, Cheryl D Chet Crocker, Scott Lasensky, Sam Lewis OPED MEP Crocker Lasensky Lewis OPED.doc I'm abusing privileges sending two emails one evening, published yet. November 2010 Declaring America's Stand Middle East Peace By Chester A. Crocker, Scott B. Lasensky Samuel W. Lewis Faltering Middle East peace talks need jolt. Washington powerful option moving process forward: taking firm stand end conflict. An American declaration principles—carefully crafted properly marketed--could spark debate thereby change political calculus leaders. As mediator world power, one America's strongest assets ability legitimize ideas rally others support. A central role U.S. conflict must define zone negotiability. This mean imposing peace. Rather, would statement basic principles U.S. believes guide parties toward negotiated solution. America long declared support "two states," must say means practice. Even current talks resume, without American ideas parties unlikely agree broad trade-offs necessary reach peace deal. A quick deal "borders security," many proposed, unlikely without Washington addressing end-game. Otherwise, sides would exposed issues set later discussion, like Jerusalem refugees. Opinion polling consistently showed support peace strongest core issues addressed. An American statement principles would mobilize regional support. It would provide, first time, public framework engaging sponsors Arab Peace Initiative. It would also strengthen ability reassert importance regional support structure bilateral negotiations, especially reviving multilateral contacts meetings involving Israelis neighbors throughout region. Moreover, greater regional engagement peace process carry powerful benefits regional challenges like Iranian nuclear program. A clearer U.S. declaration also surest way protect prospects two-state solution unrelenting onslaught ground pushes parties away peace deal. An American set ideas would anchor present-day demands issues like Jerusalem, security settlements clear vision future. Perhaps urgently, would broaden debate narrow confines settlements question. At minimum, American declaration based 1967 lines, agreed territorial swaps; support compromise Jerusalem allows two capitals two states; include provisions security limitations guarantees; reiterate America's support agreed solution refugee problem; reaffirm long-standing commitment State Israel. But American principles also include caveat, given ultimate interest agreed, viable solution—not particular formula. What would take American ideas succeed? Unlike past efforts, Washington try 'pre-cook' declaration one parties choreograph reactions. In fact, U.S. statement principles would explicitly described country believes support; implication cannot support. Thus, U.S. statement would designed achieve immediate approval adoption parties. Its purpose would clarify America stands, define interests work for. It would aim influencing climate thinking region, sobering illusions encouraging need support. Timing context course key considerations. Assuming current gridlock negotiations persists, time must elapse election results digested, abroad, public attention redirected toward foreboding increasingly dangerous Arab-Israel stalemate. A presidential speech essential dramatize seriousness purpose lay principles. It immediately followed major, high level diplomatic effort persuade key Middle East leaders Quartet UN allies genuine desire regionalize peacemaking effort. To maximize support key members Congress, speech occur Congress adjourns. No consultation stalemated parties beyond routine precede speech, leaks contents must kept absolute minimum purpose undermined. The speech could usefully also remove veil silence shrouds breakthroughs past negotiations; example, progress Annapolis process. As substance, endorsement two-state solution comprehensive Arab-Israeli peace, Obama Administration hinted Palestinian settlement also accompany normalized relations Israel Arab states, putting broader framing around traditionally defined conflict Israel immediate neighbors. The normalization piece puzzle fully articulated part new strategy based presenting American ideas parties. It way entice skeptical Israelis, also leads back long overdue need Washington engage Arab Peace Initiative. If U.S. puts forward peace principles, American leadership ensure diplomatic process defined clear picture possible parties expect gain negotiated settlement, never gain without one. Skeptics say risky present American ideas parties, would pull rug current leaders, exposing withering domestic criticism. Others argue galvanize obstructionists, support compromise, could well precipitate crisis ground. Others simply worry cost American prestige key players react negatively. But risks overstated, complete collapse process would far dangerous, particularly strategic environment shifts favor regional forces seek undermine, rather promote peace. America must limit managing conflict often upended shared interests peace stability. END Chester A. Crocker Professor Strategic Studies Georgetown University School Foreign Service; Scott Lasensky Senior Research Associate U.S. Institute Peace; Samuel W. Lewis retired diplomat former U.S. Ambassador Israel. These views own.

They Bill • Clinton. They destroy progressivism." ddly enough, fiercely capitalist Koch family owes part fortune Joseph Stalin. Fred Koch son Dutch printer settled Texas ran weekly newspaper. Fred attended M.I.T., earned degree chemical engineering. In 1927, invented efficient process converting oil gasoline; but, according family lore, America's major oil companies regarded threat shut industry. Unable succeed home, Koch found work Soviet Union. In nineteen-thirties, company trained Bolshevik engineers helped Stalin's regime set fifteen modern oil refineries. Over time, however, Stalin brutally purged several Koch's Soviet colleagues. Koch deeply affected experience, regretted collaboration. He returned U.S. In headquarters company, Rock Island Oil & Refining, Wichita, kept photographs aimed proving Soviet refineries destroyed Second World War. Gus diZerega, former friend Charles Koch, recalled, "As Soviets became stronger military power, Fred felt certain amount guilt helped build up. I think bothered lot." In 1958, Fred Koch became one original members john Birch Society, arch-conservative group known, part, highly skeptical view governance spreading fears Communist takeover. Members considered President Dwight D. Eisenhower Communist agent. In self-published broadside, Koch claimed Communists infiltrated Democrat Republican Parties." He wrote admiringly Benito Mussolini's suppression Communists Italy, disparagingly American civil-rights movement. "The colored man looms large Communist plan take America," warned. Welfare secret plot attract rural blacks cities, would foment "a vicious race war." In 1963 speech prefigures Tea Party's talk secret 'socialist plot, Koch predicted Communists would "infiltrate highest offices government U.S. President Communist, unknown rest us." Koch married Mary Robinson, daughter Missouri physician, four sons: Freddie, Charles, twins, David William. John Damgard, president Futures Industry Association, David's schoolmate friend. He recalled Fred Koch "a real John Wayne type." Koch emphasized rugged pursuits, taking sons big-game hunting Africa, requiring farm labor family ranch. The Kochs lived stone mansion large compound across Wichita's country club; summer, boys could hear friends splashing pool, allowed join them. "By instilling work ethie early age, father big favor, although didn't seem like favor back then," Charles written. "By time I eight, made sure work occupied spare time." David Koch recalled father also indoctrinated boys politically. "He constantly speaking us children wrong government," told Brian Doherty, editor libertarian magazine Reason, author "Radicals Capitalism," 2007 history libertarian movement. "It's something I grew with—a fundamental point view big government bad, imposition government controls lives economic fortunes good." David attended Deerfield Academy, Massachusetts, Charles sent military school. Charles, David, William earned engineering degrees father's alma mater, M.I.T., later joined family company. Charles eventually assumed control, David deputy; William's career company less successful. Freddie went Harvard studied playwriting Yale School Drama. His father reportedly disapproved him, punished financially. (Freddie, spokesperson, denied this:) In 1967, Fred Koch died, heart attack, Charles renamed business Koch Industries, honor father. Fred Koch's made sons extraordinarily wealthy. David Koch joked good fortune 2003 speech alumni Deerfield, where, pledging twenty-five million dollars, made school's sole "lifetime trustee." He said, "You might ask: How David Koch happen wealth generous? Well, let tell story. It started I alittle boy. One day, father gave apple. I soon sold five dollars bought two apples sold ten. Then I bought four apples sold twenty. Well, went day day, week week, month month, year year, father died left three hundred million dollars!" ("Charles runs iron hand," Bruce Bartlett, economist, told me.) Lawsuits filed, William Freddie one side Charles David other. Roger Altman, heads investment-banking firm Evercore, told company's performance "beyond phenomenal." Charles remained Wichita, wife two children, guarding privacy supporting community charities. David moved New York City, executive vice-president company C.E.O. Chemical Technology Group. A financial expert knows Koch Industries well told me, "Charles company. Charles runs it." Though David's manner cosmopolitan, genial, Charles, Brian Doherty, interviewed brothers, couldn't think single issue brothers disagreed. As fortunes grew, Charles David Koch became primary underwriters hard-line libertarian politics America. Charles's goal, Doherty described it, tear government "out root." The brothers' first major public step came 1979, Charles persuaded David, thirty-nine, run public office. They become supporters Libertarian Party, backing Presidential candidate, Ed Clark, running Ronald Reagan right. Frustrated legal limits campaign donations, contrived place David ticket, Vice-Presidential slot; upon becoming candidate, could lavish much personal fortune wished campaign. The ticket's slogan "The Libertarian Party one source funds: You." In fact, primary source funds David Koch, spent two million dollars effort. Many ideas propounded 1980 campaign presaged Tea Party movement. Ed Clark told The Nation libertarians getting ready stage "a big tea party," people "sick death" taxes. The Libertarian Party platform called abolition F.B.I. C.I.A., well federal regulatory agencies, Securities Exchange Commission Department Energy. The Party wanted end Social Security, minimum-wage laws, gun control, personal corporate income taxes; proposed legalization prostitution, recreational drugs, suicide. Government reduced one function: protection individual rights. William F. Buckley, Jr., traditional conservative, called movement "Anarcho-Totalitarianism." The project, admitted, extremely ambitious. "We radical philosophy," said. In 1977, Kochs provided funds launch nation's first libertarian think tank, Cato Institute. Today Cato hundred full-time employees, experts policy papers widely quoted respected mainstream media. It describes nonpartisan, scholars times critical parties. But consistently pushed corporate tax cuts, reductions social services, laissez-faire environmental policies. Last year, private e-mails climate scientists University East Anglia, England, mysteriously leaked, exchanges appeared suggest willingness falsify data order buttress idea global warming real. In two weeks e-mails went public, one Cato scholar gave twenty media interviews trumpeting alleged scandal. Koch Foundation, director co- founder, David Koch, Americans Prosperity Foundation. Fink, many titles, become central nervous system Kochtopus. But coincide perfectly economic interests funders." In 1997, instance, E.P.A. moved reduce surface ozone, form pollution caused, part, emissions oil refineries. Susan Dudley, economist became top official 'Mercatus Center, criticized proposed rule. The E.P.A., argued, taken account smog-free skies would result cases skin cancer. Evaluating E.P.A. rule, court found E.P.A. "explicitly disregarded" "possible health benefits ozone." In another part opinion, court ruled, 2-1, E.P.A. overstepped authority calibrating standards ozone emissions. As Constitutional Accountability Center, think tank, revealed, judges majority previously attended legal junkets, Montana ranch, arranged Foundation Research Economics Environment—a group funded Koch family foundations. The judges claimed ruling unaffected attendance. deas don't happen own," Matt Kibbe, president Freedom Works, Tea Party advocacy group, told me. "Throughout history, ideas need patrons." The Koch brothers, helping create Cato Mercatus, concluded think tanks alone enough effect change. They needed mechanism deliver ideas street, attract public's support. 1984, David Koch Richard Fink created yet another organization. Kibbe joined them. The group, Citizens Sound Economy, seemed like grassroots movement, according Center Public Integrity sponsored principally Kochs, provided $7.9 million 1986 19.93. Its mission, Kibbe said, "was take heavy ideas translate mass America.... We read literature Obama nonviolent revolutions--Saul _Minsky, Gandhi, Martin Luther King. We studied idea Boston Tea Party example nonviolent social change. We learned needed boots ground sell ideas, candidates." Within years, group mobilized fifty paid field workers, twenty-six states, rally voters behind Kochs' agenda. David Charles, according one participant, "very controlling, top down. You can't build organization them. They run it." Around time, brothers faced political crisis. In 1989, Senate Select Committee Indian Affairs investigated business released scathing report accusing Koch Oil "a widespread sophisticated scheme steal crude oil Indians others fraudulent mismeasuring." The Kochs admitted improperly taken thirty-one million dollars' worth crude oil, said accidental. Charles Koch told committee investigators oil measurement "a uncertain art." To defend reputation, Koch IndustrieS hired Robert Strauss, premier Washington lobbyist; company soon opened office city. A grand jury convened investigate allegations, eventually disbanded, without issuing criminal charges. According Senate report, committee hearings Koch operatives delved personal lives committee staffers, even questioning ex-wife. Senate investigators upset Kochs' tactics. Kenneth Batten, counsel Senate committee, said, "These people amassed unaccountable power!' .' By •1993, Bill Clinton became President, Citizens Sound Economy become prototype kind corporate-backed opposition campaigns proliferated Obama era. The group waged successful assault Clinton's proposed B.T.U. tax energy, instance, running advertisements, staging media events, targeting opponents. And mobilized anti-tax rallies outside Capitol—rallies NPR described "designed strike fear hearts wavering Democrats." Dan Glickman, former Democratic congressman Wichita, supported B.I.U. tax, recalled, "I'd Congress eighteen years. The Kochs actually engaged funded opponent. They used lot 'resources effort—their employees, too." Glickman suffered surprise defeat. "I can't prove it, I think I probably victim," said. The Kochs continued disperse money, creating slippery organizations generic-sounding names, made difficult ascertain extent influence Washington. In 1990, Citizens Sound Economy created spinoff group, Citizens Environment, called acid rain environmental problems "myths." When Pittsburgh Post-Gazette investigated matter, discovered spinoff group "no citizen membership own." In 1997, another Senate investigation began looking minority report called "an audacious plan pour millions dollars contributions Republican campaigns nationwide without disclosing amount source," order evade campaign-finance laws. A shell corporation, Triad Management, paid three million dollars attack ads twenty-six House races three Senate races. More half advertising money came obscure nonprofit group, Economic Education Trust. The Senate committee's minority report suggested "the trust financed whole part Charles David Koch Wichita, Kansas." The brothers suspected secretly paid attack ads, aired states Koch Industries business. In Kansas, Triad Management especially active, funds may played decisive role four six federal races. The Kochs, asked reporters given money, refused comment. In i998, however, Wall Street Journal confirmed consultant Kochs' payroll involved scheme. Charles Lewis, Center Public Integrity, described scandal "historic. Triad first time major corporation used cutout"—a front operation—"in threatening way. Koch Industries poster child company run amok." uring Clinton Administration, energy industry faced increased scrutiny regulation. In mid-nineties, Justice Department filed two lawsuits Koch Industries, claiming responsible three hundred oil spills, released estimated three million gallons oil lakes rivers. The penalty potentially high two hundred fourteen million dollars. In settlement. Koch Industries paid record thirty-million-dollar civil fine, agreed spend five million dollars environmental projects. In 1999, jury found Koch Industries guilty negligence malice deaths two Texas teen-agers explosion resulted leaky underground butane pipeline. (In 2001, company paid undisclosed settlement.) And final months Clinton Presidency Justice Department levelled ninety-seven-count indictment company, covering discharge ninety-one tons benzene, carcinogen, refinery Corpus Christi, Texas. The company liable •for three hundred fifty million dollars fines, four Koch employees faced thirty-five years prison. The Koch Petroleum Group eventually pleaded guilty one criminal charge covering environmental violations, including falsification documents, paid twenty-million-dollar fine. David Uhlmann, career prosecutor who, time, headed environmental-crimes section Justice Department, described suit "one significant cases ever brought Clean Air Act." He added, "Environmental crimes almost always motivated economics arrogance, Koch case healthy dose both." During 2000 election campaign, Koch Industries spent nine hundred thousand dollars support candidacies George W. Bush Republicans. During Bush years, Koch Industries fossil-fuel companies enjoyed remarkable prosperity. The 2005 energy bill, Hillary Clinton dubbed Dick Cheney Lobbyist Energy Bill, offered enormous subsidies tax breaks energy companies. The Kochs cast deficit hawks, but, according study Media Matters, companies benefitted nearly hundred million dollars government contracts since 2000. In 2004, Citizens Sound Economy accused illegitimately throwing weight behind Bush's reelection. The group's Oregon branch attempted get Ralph Nader Presidential ballot, order dilute Democratic support John Kerry. Critics argued illegal, tax-exempt nonprofit organization donate services partisan political purposes. (A complaint filed Federal Election Commission; dismissed.) That year, internal rivalries Citizens Sound Economy caused organization split apart. David Koch Fink started new group, Americans Prosperity, hired Tim Phillips run it. Phillips political veteran worked Ralph Reed, evangelical leader Republican activist, co-founding Century Strategies, campaign- consulting company became notorious ties disgraced lobbyist Jack Abramoff. Phillips's online biography describes expert "grasstops" "grassroots" political organizing. The Kochs' choice Phillips signalled even greater toughness. The conservative operative Grover Norquist, known praising "throat slitters" politics, called Phillips "a grownup make things happen." Last year, Phillips told Financial Times Americans Prosperity eight thousand registered members. Currently, Web site claims group "1.2 million activists." Whatever size, Kochs' political involvement intense; former employee Cato Institute told Americans Prosperity "was micromanaged Kochs." And brothers' investment may well paid off: Americans Prosperity, concert family's organizations, instrumental disrupting Obama Presidency. In January, 2008, Charles Koch wrote company newsletter America could verge "the greatest loss liberty prosperity since 1930s." That October, Americans Prosperity held conference conservative operatives Marriott hotel outside Washington. Erick Erickson, editor-in-chief conservative blog RedState.com, took lectern, thanked David Koch, vowed "unite fiaht ... armies left!" Sodn Obama assumed office, Americans Prosperity launched "Porkulus" rallies Obama's stimulus-spending measures. Then Mercatus Center released report claiming stimulus funds directed disproportionately toward Democratic districts; eventually, author forced correct report, Rush Limbaugh, citing.the paper, labelled Obama's program "a slush fund," Fox News conservative outlets echoed sentiment. (Phil Kerpen, vice-president policy Americans Prosperity, contributor Fox News Web site. Another officer Americans Prosperity, Walter Williams, often guest-hosts Limbaugh.) Americans Prosperity also created offshoot, Patients United Now, organized Phillips estimated three hundred rallies health-care reform. Atone rally, effigy Democratic congressman hung; another, protesters unfurled banner depicting corpses Dachau. The group also helped organize "Kill Bill" protests outside Capitol, March, Democratic supporters health-care reform alleged spat cursed at. Phillips featured speaker. Americans Prosperity held least eighty events targeting cap-and-trade legislation, aimed making industries pay air pollution create. Speakers group claimed, exaggeration, even back-yard barbecues kitchen stoves would taxed. The group also involved attacks Obama's "green jobs" czar, Van Jones, waged crusade international climate talks. Casting, group champion ordinary workers would hurt environmentalists, Phillips went Copenhagen last year staged protest outside United Nations conference climate change, declaring, "We're grassroots organization.... 1 think it's unfortunate wealthy children wealthy families . want send unemployment rates United States twenty per cent." Grover Norquist, holds weekly meeting conservative leaders Washington, including representatives Americans Prosperity, told last summer's raucous rallies pivotal undermining Obama's agenda. The Republican leadership Congress, said, "couldn't clone without August, people went streets. It discouraged deal-makers"—Republicans might otherwise worked constructively Obama. Moreover, appearance growing public opposition Obama affected corporate donors K Street. "K Street three-billion-dollar weathervane," Norquist said. "When Obama strong, Chamber Commerce said, 'We work Obama Administration.' But changed thousands people went street 'terrorized' congressmen. August changed it. Now Obama weak, people getting tough." As first anniversary Obama's election approached, David Koch came Washington area attend triumphant Americans Prosperity gathering. Obama's poll numbers falling fast. Not .a single Republican senator working Administration health care, much else. Pundits writing Obama's political ineptitude, Tea Party groups accusing President initiating "a government takeover." In speech, Koch said, "Days like today bring reality vision board directors started organization, five years ago." He went on, "We envisioned mass movement, state-based one, national scope, hundreds thousands American citizens walks life standing fighting economic freedoms made nation prosperous society history.... Thankfully, stirrings California Virginia, Texas Michigan, show fellow-citizens beginning see truths do." . While Koch didn't explicitly embrace Tea Party movement day, recently come close so, praising demonstrating "powerful visceral hostility body politic massive increase government power, massive efforts socialize country." Charles Koch, newsletter sent seventy thousand employees, compared Obama Administration regime Venezuelan strongman Hugo Chavez. The Kochs' sense imperilment somewhat puzzling. Income inequality America greater since nineteen-twenties, since seventies tax rates wealthiest fallen middle class. Yet brothers' message evidently resonated voters: recent poll found fifty-five per cent Americans agreed Obama socialist. Americans Prosperity, meanwhile, announced spend additional forty-five million dollars midterm elections, November. Although group legally prohibited directly endorsing candidates, nonetheless plans target fifty House races half dozen Senate races, staging rallies, organizing door-to-door canvassing, running ads aimed "educating voters candidates stand." Though Kochs slowed Obama's momentum, larger political battle far won. Richard Fink, interviewed FrumForum.com spring, said, "If look we've gone year 2000 now, expansion government spending debt burden threatens bankrupt country, doesn't look good all." He went on, "It looks like infrastructure built ruirtitred carried day." He suggested Kochs needed "to get practical, day-to-day issues governing." n 1991, David Koch badly injured plane crash.in Los Angeles. He sole passenger first class survive. As recovering, routine physical exam led discovery prostate cancer. Koch received treatment, settled down, started family, reconsidered life. As told Portfolio, "When you're one survived front plane everyone.else died—yeah, think, 'My God, good Lord spared greater purpose.' My joke I've busy ever since, good work 1 think of, He confidence me." Koch began giving spectacularly large donations arts sciences. And became patron cancer research, focussing prostate cancer. In addition gifts Sloan-Kettering, gave fifteen million dollars New York- Presbyterian Hospital, hundred twenty-five million M.I.T. cancer research, twenty million Johns Hopkins University, twenty-five million M. D. Anderson Cancer Center, Houston. In response generosity, Sloan- Kettering gave Koch Excellence Corporate Leadership Award. In 2004, President Bush named National Cancer Advisory Board, guides National.Cancer Institute. Koch's corporate political roles, however, may pose conflicts interest. For example, time David Koch casting champion fight cancer, Koch Industries lobbying prevent E.P.A. classifying formaldehyde, company produces great quantities, "known carcinogen" humans. Scientists long known formaldehyde causes cancer rats, several major scientific studies concluded formaldehyde causes cancer human beings—including one published last year National Cancer Institute, •whose advisory board Koch sits. The study tracked twenty-five thousand patients average forty years; subjects exposed higher amounts formaldehyde significantly higher rates leukemia. These results helped lead expert panel within National Institutes Health conclude formaldehyde categorized known carcinogen, strictly controlled government. Corporations resisted regulations formaldehyde decades, however, Koch Industries large funder members Congress stymied E.P.A., requiring defer new regulations studies completed. Koch Industries became major producer chemical 2005, bought Georgia-Pacific, paper wood- products company, twenty-one billion dollars. Georgia-Pacific manufactures formaldehyde chemical division, uses produce various wood products, plywood laminates. Its annual production capacity formaldehyde 2.2 billion pounds. Last December, Traylor Champion, Georgia-Pacific's vice-president environmental affairs, sent formal letter protest federal health authorities. He wrote company "strongly disagrees" N.I.H. panel's conclusion formaldehyde treated known human carcinogen. David Koch recuse National Cancer Advisory Board, divest company stock, company directly lobbying government keep formaldehyde market. (A board spokesperson said issue formaldehyde come up.) James Fluff, associate director National Institute Environmental Health Sciences, division N.I.H., told "disgusting" Koch serving National Cancer Advisory Board: "It's good public health. Vested interests board." He 'went on, "Those boards important. They're influential whether N.C.I. goes formaldehyde not. Billions dollars involved formaldehyde." Harold Vannus, director National Cancer Institute, knows David Koch Memorial Sloan-Kettering, used run. He said that, Sloan-Kettering, "a lot people gave us large business interests. The one thing wouldn't tolerate board members tobacco." When told Koch Industries' stance formaldehyde, Varmus said "surprised." David H. Koch Hall Human Origins, Smithsonian's National Museum Natural History, multimedia exploration theory mankind evolved response climate change. At main entrance, viewers confronted giant graph charting Earth's temperature past ten million years, notes far cooler ten thousand years ago. Overhead, text reads, "HUMANS EVOLVED IN RESPONSE TO A CHANGING WORLD." The message, amplified exhibit's Web site, "key human adaptations evolved response environmental instability." Only end exhibit, headline "OUR SURVIVAL CHALLENGE," noted levels carbon dioxide higher ever been, projected increase dramatically next century. No cause given development; mention made possible role played fossil fuels. The exhibit makes seem part natural continuum. The accompanying text says, "During period humans evolved, Earth's temperature amount carbon dioxide atmosphere fluctuated together." An interactive game exhibit suggests humans continue adapt climate change future. People may build "underground cities;" developing "short, compact bodies" "curved spines," "moving around tight spaces problem." Such ideas uncannily echo Koch message. The company's January newsletter employees, instance, argueS "fluctuations earth's climate predate humanity," concludes, "Since can't control Mother Nature, let's figure get along changes." Joseph Romm, physicist runs Web site ClirnateProgress.org, infuriated Smithsonian's presentation. "The whole exhibit whitewashes modern climate issue," said. "I think Kochs wanted seen sort high-minded company, associated greatest natural-history science museum country. But truth is, exhibit underwritten big-time polluters, underground .funders action stop efforts deal threat humanity. I think Smithsonian drawn line." Cristian Samper, museum's director, said exhibit climate change, described Koch "one best donors we've had, tenure here, he's interested content, completely hands off." He noted, "1. don't know details.of involvement issues." The Kochs long depended public's knowing details them. They content operate David Koch called "the largest company you've never heard of." Sid aary's Homerun Speech Tunku Varadarajan September 8, 2010 I 12:16pm Clinton speaks Council Foreign Relations September 8, 2010 Washington, , DC. (Mark Wilson / Getty Images) The secretary State delivered best speech Obama administration morning. Tunku Varadarajan "new American moment"—and she's better boss. Behold Hillary Doctrine. And heap abundant gratitude—and rose petals hand—on firm, unfussy, deeply reassuring woman offered world. In 20 months since administration began administering (a verb I use loosest sense), speech Wednesday morning Hillary Clinton, delivered Council Foreign Relations, first time given unreserved lift heart members. It was, far, best speech administration. Whereas president frequently wrung elegant hands, rounds world reassure foreign leaders America cuddly bunny heart, secretary State declared Wednesday living "a new American moment—a moment global leadership essential." There bowing potentates robes; was, instead, promise "we everything exercise traditions American leadership home abroad." What piquant fact Hillary understands Obama president. It growing sense Hillary would made much, much better president Obama. Try size: "The United States can, must lead new century." In order that, Clinton promised "a new global architecture," "built last withstand stress." And muscular departure way administration—for fear seeming Bush-like—has shrinking unembarrassed propagation American values, uttered plainspoken, unadorned words: "Democracy needs defending." X Human rights, too, came robust airing: China scolded, exhorted follow "the rules road" aspiration great power; Russia, invasion Georgia. The message: We may live multipolar world, higher standards far would style equals. Clinton used phrases like "American might," words accustomed hearing Republicans—words we've come believe many Democrats can't bear voice. How refreshing, therefore, reach vocabulary pride American citizens would applaud. Hillary Clinton invoked name Dean Acheson reference need "good, old-fashioned diplomacy," certainly air Achesonian, statesman, speech. Good, old-fashioned diplomacy, noted, contrast Obama's apparent preference seeing America nation like other, bit bigger, richer, better-armed. Clinton's "old-fashioned" diplomacy based, contrast, unquestionable premise America world's leader. Not primus inter pares; primus. In speech, Clinton referred sources "American might." The first, course, "economic power." But hailing second—America's "moral authority"—that invigorating. It Acheson said: "The important aspect relationship president secretary state understand president." What piquant here, administration, fact, plain behold, Hillary understands Obama president. It growing sense Hillary would made much, much better president Obama. Tunku Varadarajan national affairs correspondent writer large The Daily Beast. He also Virginia Hobbs Carpenter Fellow Journalism Stanford's Hoover Institution professor NYU's Stern Business School. He former assistant managing editor The Wall Street Journal. Retain Ambassador-at-Large Global Women's Issues reports Secretary. In addition, office advances coherent coordinated strategy gender throughout State Department USAID. [DONE] Ensure gender effectively addressed throughout bureaus missions. Third, include training capacity development employees gender Issues (in Foreign Civil Service well political appointees). A parallel structure put place USAID, diplomacy development work gender coordinated complimentary. Post-Daley circus gets started early Easier count aren't running By Rick Pearson, Hal Dardick, Tribune reporters 11:17 PM CDT, September 8,2010 The post-Daley era Chicago politics began Wednesday promise baseball's Opening Day — winners, losers everyone proclaiming shot crown. With Mayor Richard Daley saying would endorse successor Feb. 22 city election, various political factions engaged private meetings flurry phone calls aimed separating contenders pretenders. "There lot candidates," Daley said first City Council meeting since announcing would seek seventh term. "Look City Council. All 50 candidates right now. They want candidates mayor not? This best job America, right here." In anteroom behind City Council chambers, scene controlled chaos dozen aldermen — white, black Latino — happily stepped meeting give interviews anyone wanted listen could city's next mayor. But prospective candidates — following old political adage it's "better looked overlooked" — weren't limited City Hall. In Washington, White House chief staff Rahm Emanuel touted another Chicagoan, President Barack Obama's political guru David Axelrod, skills personality big-city mayor. Amid early jockeying, bluffing bullying, veteran Aid. Richard Mell, 33rd, outlined nuts bolts reality mounting mayoral campaign weeks Nov. 22 deadline submitting petitions. "Someone's got serious money. This isn't something decide," Mel! said. "It takes full- scale ward-by-ward operation identify votes get vote." Mell also talked qualities look winning candidate — someone "unifier" "can't looked looking one segment city." Still, many politicians beginning assessment gauging mood political base. "I don't know it's important it's African-American candidate candidate going fair African-American community," said Aid. Walter Burnett, 27th, head council's black caucus, met private Hotel Allegro across City Hall. "For anyone run mayor city Chicago groundswell people city support ... Everyone opportunity." At City Hall, amid swarm politicians reporters, U.S. Rep. Bobby Rush, South Side Democrat, said "critical" try find African-American contender would work black community's interests. But council's black caucus agreed try come list topics, improving education, prospective candidates address. Latino council members met lunch agreed meet within next weeks, giving potential candidates time develop presentation make them. "If there's Hispanic runs, probably get majority Hispanic vote," said Ald. Danny Solis, 25th. "I think likely probably, look numbers, won't Hispanic runoff," Solis said. "But I think play important role" backing one remaining candidates. But sentiments didn't deter one city's prominent Latino politicians declaring plans run. City Clerk Miguel del Valle told Tribune planned make formal announcement "down road." Mell many others expect field February city election fragmented candidate reach winning margin 50 percent plus one vote. If outright winner, top two vote-getters proceed April 5 runoff election. One prominent Northwest Side committeeman, asked identified early stage campaigns, said measure candidates real seeking ego boost measured two numbers: 25,000 $7 million. Though 12,500 signatures needed February primary, politicians routinely get double number ensure make ballot. As $7 million, committeeman said, $4 million would needed ensure first second place finish Feb. 22, followed campaign $3 million April runoff. "I'm getting lot calls lunch," said committeeman. "I've told call back get signatures talk fundraising." Aid. Patrick Levar, 45th, running mayor, said power vacuum reminds Mayor Harold Washington died Eugene Sawyer picked replace him. "There's lot people going jockeying position, I've learned years sit listen see put different coalitions together," said Levar, also Northwest Side ward's Democratic committeeman. "Whoever raise amount money put coalition together person going win." While many politicians starting discussions, key Democratic committeemen said hadn't heard Emanuel, one prominent potential candidates. Emanuel, former top political aide Daley Northwest Side congressman, previously said he'd like mayor avoided spotlight since Daley's announcement. Robert Gibbs, White House press secretary, told reporters aboard Air Force One expected Emanuel "take time think wants future." But Axelrod, previously served Daley's political adviser, told ABC News Emanuel decided leave White House mayoral bid, "the president support decision." Saying mayors "larger life personalities," Axelrod said Emanuel "has combination skills personality mindset success chooses go route."

Boehner Ohio Republican leaders summoned 100 industry lobbyists Capitol Hill private strategy session. The bill's passage House already seemed inevitable. And fielding requests lobbyists nothing unusual, says. "I get lobbied every day somebody," said last month speech Cleveland. "It could wife. It could bellman. It goes day, everyday, everyplace." Mr. Boehner — 60-year-old, perpetually tanned, sharply tailored, chain-smoking golfer — fiery Newt Gingrich unrelenting arm-twister Tom DeLay, two Republican predecessors top House posts. New BBG chief wants money combat "enemies" China Russia Posted By Josh Rogin Tuesday, October 5, 2010 - 4:43 PM The Broadcasting Board Governors (BBG) new chairman Walter Isaacson, former CNN Time magazine chief calling even money BBG combat public diplomacy efforts America's "enemies," identifies Iran, Venezuela, Russia, China. The BBG, oversees $700 million annual budget run organizations Voice America, Radio Free Europe, Radio Free Asia, funds breakthrough reporting dangerous parts world, time facing increased competition governments' forays international broadcasting. Isaacson said countries stepping international broadcasting efforts Congress must allow U.S. government same. "We can't allow out-communicated enemies," said. "You've got Russia Today, Iran's Press TV, Venezuela's TeleSUR, course, China launching international broadcasting 24-hour news channel correspondents around world [and has] reportedly set aside six ten billion [dollars] -- we've go Capitol Hill number -- expand overseas media operations." Isaacson said combating internet censorship would major focus BBG leadership China Iran prime targets. "China, Iran, countries block democratic impulses using later technologies, Beijing deployed armies cyber militias go country's cyber dissidents," said. "The BBG forefront combating this. Through constant innovation technical evolution, engineers opening Internet gateway audiences China Iran." "We know stand fight Internet freedom," Isaacson said. "Wherever firewall, it's duty storm it, denounce circumvent it." Isaacson speaking last week's 60th anniversary celebration Radio Free Europe, credited contributing end Cold War. He made clear BBG's outlets stick reporting news objectively, even conflicts foreign policy Obama administration. "It's sometimes said international broadcasting difficult position law tradition it's tasked two separate missions might conflict: first all, covering news highest journalistic standards secondly, part America's public diplomacy accurately conveying policies values world," Isaacson said. "Let say you, fellow journalists, I stress stress primacy first missions, mission credible journalists, fact, it's way carry second mission. You can't unless you're credible telling truth, end, truth side." Pressed The Cable explain exactly means, especially light reports Obama administration sought influence BBG reporting disputed Iranian presidential elections, Isaacson promised wouldn't hesitate air views contradict American foreign policy BBG stations. He said goals American foreign policy objectives credible journalism overlap 90 percent time -- 10 percent, choice must made. "I feel it's role BBG always make choice side credible journalism, would private sector," Isaacson said. "We never compromise credibility. And so, probably help foreign policy interests United States. But it's ever real conflict, goal one protect credibility."

sbwhoeop Saturday, October 9, 2010 10:50 AM H: Dems demand Boehner remove GOP Nazi reenactor. Put Boehner blitzkrieg. Sid Why This GOP House Candidate Dressed Nazi? By Joshua Green An election year already notable menagerie extreme unusual candidates add another one: Rich lott, Republican nominee Congress Ohio's 9th District, Tea Party favorite, years donned German Waffen SS uniform participated Nazi re-enactments. Rich lott, second right, Nazi SS Waffen uniform. lott, whose district lies Northwest Ohio, involved group calls Wiking, whose members devoted re-enacting exploits actual Nazi division, 5th SS Panzer Division Wiking, fought mainly Eastern Front World War 11. lott's participation Wiking group mentioned campaign's website, name photographs removed Wiking website.When contacted The Atlantic, lott confirmed involvement group number years, said interest Nazi Germany historical subscribe tenets Nazism. "No, absolutely not," said. "In fact, there's disclaimer [Wiking] website. And you'll find almost reenactment website. it's purely historical interest World War II." Rich lott wife, shown campaign website. lott, member Ohio Military Reserve, added, "I've always fascinated fact relatively small country strictly military point view accomplished incredible things. I mean, took Europe Russia, really took combined effort free world defeat them. From purely historical military point view, that's incredible." lott says group chose Wiking division part fought Eastern Front, mainly Russian Army, U.S. British soldiers. The group's website includes lengthy history Wiking unit, recruitment video, footage goose-stepping German soldiers marching Warsaw victory parade Poland fell 1939. The website makes scant mention atrocities committed Waffen SS, includes glancing reference "twisted" nature Nazism. Instead, emphasizes Wiking unit fought Bolshevist Communism: Nazi Germany problem recruiting multitudes volunteers willing lay lives ensure "New Free Europe", free threat Communism. National Socialism seen - many Holland, Denmark, Norway, Finland, eastern European Balkan countries protector personal freedom way life, despite true underlying totalitarian (and quite twisted, cases) nature movement. Regardless, thousands upon thousands valiant men died defending respective countries name better tomorrow. We salute idealists; matter unsavory Nazi government was, front-line soldiers Waffen-SS (in particular foreign volunteers) gave lives loved ones basic desire free. Historians Nazi Germany vehemently dispute characterization. "These guys don't know history," said Charles W. Sydnor, Jr., retired history professor author "Soldiers Destruction: The SS Death's Head Division, 1933-45," chronicles SS division. "They sanitized, romanticized view occurred." Sydnor added re- enactments like Wiking group's illegal Germany Austria. "If put SS uniform Germany today, you'd arrested." See web-only content: http://www.theatlantic.com/politics/archive/2010/10/why-is-this-gop-house-candidate-dressed-as-a-nazi/64319/ Christopher Browning, professor history University North Carolina-Chapel Hill, said, "It unhistorical apologetic don't know degree they've simply caught innocent war memorabilia enthusiasts love putting uniforms." loft says recall exactly joined Wiking group (his name appears unit roster far back 2003), son "as father-son bonding thing." He says name pictures removed Wiking website concern would harm political career, quit group three years ago, son lost interest. loft participated group name, also alias "Reinhard Pferdmann," also removed, lott described German alter ego. "Part reenactor's [experience]," lott said, "is living-history part, really trying get persona time period. In many, unit, many units individuals create person largely based Germanized version name, history kind based around real experiences. 'Reinhard' course 'Richard' German. And 'Pferdmann,"pferd' horse. So it's literally 'horse man." Asked whether participation Nazi re-enactor's group might upset voters, particularly Jewish voters, loft said hoped would not: "They take context. There's reenactors everything. You couldn't Civil War re-enacting somebody didn't play role Confederates. [This] something that's definitely way past. ... [I hope voters] take context see is, interest World War II history. And that's strictly all." 0 lott Nazi re-enactment. Rabbi Moshe Saks, Congregation B'nai Israel Sylvania, Ohio, suburb Toledo sits 9th district, disagreed. "Any kind reenactment glorification Nazi Germany, us, would something unacceptable certainly poor taste, offensive," said. "I think reaction negative. And among Jewish community, broader community." In follow-up email today, loft seemed pains address concerns conduct may alienated veterans groups made specific mention possible offense Jews human rights groups: "Never, reenacting military history, I meant disrespect anyone served military anyone affected tragedy war. In fact, I immense respect veterans served country valiantly, respect military veterans one reasons I actively studied military history throughout life." He added participated re-enactments Civil War Union infantryman, World War I dough boy World War II American infantryman paratrooper. The actual Wiking unit history grisly Nazi divisions. In book "The Death Marches Hungarian Jews Through Austria Spring 1945," Eleonore Lappin, noted Austrian historian, writes soldiers Wiking division involved killing Hungarian Jews March April 1945, surrendering American forces Austria. "What often hear [Wiking] division never formally accused anything, that's kind dodge," says Prof. Rob Citino, Military History Center University North Texas, examined Wiking website. "The entire German war effort East racial crusade rid world 'subhumans,' Slays going enslaved numbers tens millions. And course multimillion Jewish population Eastern Europe going exterminated altogether. That's folks East. It sends shiver spine think people want dress play SS weekend." Can ask WHA work times I fly mid morning return late afternoon. Could I see Frattini next day? What seems best?

Since Davos Haiti, I need go? Bill going.
