Diplomacy Before After Conflict By Marc Grossman Conflict universal condition,' older diplomacy. While conflict constant human history, nature armed conflict, especially nature 21st-century warfare, transformed. General Rupert Smith identified changes book The Utility Force: "The ends fight changing; fight amongst people; conflicts tend timeless; fight lose force; occasion new uses found old weapons; sides mostly non-state."2 The nature 21st-century diplomacy also changing. To successful, diplomats must simultaneously shape, act upon, react global challenges. As Hans Binnendijk Richard Kugler National Defense University argue, single problem, danger, threat holds key world's future. What matters interaction simultaneity responses.3 The definition victory, too, different today. Twenty-first-century national security success encompass comprehensive definition security, achieved broadest simultaneous application elements national power. This key understanding Philip Bobbitt's concept "preclusive victory," describes "anticipatory, precautionary attention possible futures," requiring expansive integrated approach modern diplomacy, defense, development. A diplomatic strategy designed produce preclusive victory include conflict prevention, successful negotiation, deterrence, preparation conflict else fail, efforts establish order, ensure stability, promote political economic pluralism conflict. Diplomats always participants prevention management conflict aftermath. The conflict prevention side diplomacy occupied much time State Department 1993 1997 Department's Executive Secretary U.S. Ambassador Turkey. Postconflict diplomacy defining issue last third career State Assistant Secretary State European Affairs Under Secretary State Political Affairs 2001 2005. I tried draw upon experiences observations discuss scope complexity modern diplomacy, methods goals needed prevent conflict, diplomacy's role conflict seems unavoidable, contribution diplomacy make restoring stability following conflict. Diplomacy Conflict Prevention Thanks efforts scholars practitioners, make better use methods theory conflict prevention. The United States Institute Peace Woodrow Wilson International Center Scholars two among many institutions taken leadership role efforts. Michael Lund, practitionerscholar, notes present uncoordinated patchy nature preventive diplomacy reflects absence accepted international conflict prevention regime system governance—that is, agreed upon arrangements geographic jurisdictions allocated, functional responsibilities assigned, norms procedures formulated, actors held accountable responsibilities.' He asks crucial question seek "coordinate rationalize" system preventive diplomacy: responsibility tasks preventive action located—early warning, decision act, formulation response, provision bureaucratic political support? Should horizontal, across different organizations actors, vertical, chains command?6 An example conflict prevention meets Lund's tests effort undertaken North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO), close collaboration European Union (EU) Organisation Security Co-operation Europe, supported United States, avoid civil war Macedonia 2001. It difficult recall that, September 11, 2001, possibility civil war Macedonia leading international headline. This successful campaign conflict prevention defined remarkable personal institutional cooperation NATO Secretary General Lord Robertson EU High Representative Common Foreign Security Policy (and former NATO Secretary General) Javier Solana. I spoke often period Lord Robertson, Solana, Ambassador James Pardew, President George W. Bush Secretary Colin Powell appointed U.S. representative effort who, along Francois Leotard, EU Special Envoy, played crucial role negotiating implementing Ohrid Framework Agreement. As direct participant, senior NATO official Mark Laity stated insights modern diplomacy conflict prevention drawn effort, including need personal institutional teamwork, importance early engagement trying head violence, need choose right people tasks kind (including 21st-century diplomats act "unconventionally"), necessity able apply appropriate force quickly.' Diplomacy When Conflict Is Seems Be Unavoidable When diplomacy fails prevent conflict, role diplomat changes. The new requirement may justify use force efforts avoid conflict fail seek address underlying source conflict force seems inevitable imperative. The February 1999 diplomatic negotiations Rambouillet, France, designed show world NATO Contact Group willing make one last effort avoid using military force stop Slobodan Milosevic's attacks Kosovo. I Rambouillet Assistant Secretary State European Affairs support Secretary Madeleine Albright. After first day meeting, much chaos I urged Secretary Albright depart Rambouillet leave "negotiating" us junior. My strategy present, Secretary State— administration—could keep distance outcome might unacceptable United States. The Secretary different vision. Albright hoped Rambouillet would end brutality Kosovars, also prepared meeting fail, thereby options avoiding military conflict would exhausted. Her idea seen everything could diplomatically, including continued presence, Rambouillet failure, could excuses taking military action. Secretary State James Baker pursued similar strategy first Gulf War 1991. Baker relates memoirs, The Politics Diplomacy, President George H.W. Bush concluded United States offer meeting Washington Iraqi Foreign Minister Tariq Aziz followed Baker trip Baghdad show America's commitment avoiding war possible. Baker writes thought proposal three merits: would give administration one last diplomatic opening avoid war; would shore domestic support conflict; would show that, deadline Iraq's withdrawal Kuwait neared, administration something preparing war. The President's offer turned famous meeting Baker Aziz January 9, 1991. As Baker recounts, "I illusions. I assumed talks would unsuccessful within matter days, would war."8 In 2001-2003, State Department leadership generally saw Iraq diversion Afghanistan central war terror. Saddam Hussein dictator menace— "in box," posing immediate, direct threat United States; focus kept defeating al Qaeda Afghanistan supporting new Afghan government.9 Iraq source tension disagreement inside State Department since beginning administration, sought move policy support "smart" United Nations (UN) sanctions toward aggressive posture Saddam. Secretary State Henry Kissinger wrote Years Upheaval second term Nixon administration State Department culture emphasizes negotiability, consciousness side accept.' Kissinger consider trait particular positive time, department's culture negotiability serve good guide institutional behavior senior State officials participated interagency debate leading invasion Iraq. If period surrounding 1970s détente Russia, diplomatic efforts Shah Iran, crisis Middle East resulting 1973 war, culture negotiability longer served good guide institutional behavior senior State officials participated interagency debate leading invasion Iraq. We took part planning conflict aftermath assuming—or hoping—that events either home abroad would turn preparations conflict successful coercive diplomacy rather military action ordered spring 2003. The State Department's Director Policy Planning, Richard Haass, observed "60:40 going war. . . organization could function people left every time lost 60:40 decision."' Haass operating belief Iraq weapons mass destruction; known not, says would 90:10 war. And senior Department State officer resigned protest. The department sought instead try recreate successful Gulf War coalition President George H.W. Bush argued United States allies might compel Saddam submit deployment force region early 2003. If failed, sustained diplomatic effort create broad coalition move militarily later 2003. This possibility broad international coalition lost relevance January 20, 2003, French government announced would never support second UN Security Council resolution authorize use force Iraq. Diplomacy Preparation Conflict Once conflict inevitable initiated, one job diplomats support military commanders getting need make conflict short possible, fewest casualties Americans, allies, civilians. This objective United States pursued Turkey first Gulf War, resulted President Turgut Ozal's support American efforts. The diplomatic effort prepare conflict Kosovo also involved whole U.S. Government governments NATO Allies. To pursue successful bombing campaign, diplomats many NATO countries arranged overflight support Allied forces. A similar effort U.S. diplomats took place invasion Afghanistan 2001. American allied diplomats worked closely nations surrounding Afghanistan, including forging contacts Central Asian states security issues first time order achieve transit, overflight, bed-down rights American coalition forces October 7, 2001, beginning action Afghanistan. Before invasion Iraq March 2003, especially January 20, 2003, similar effort began earnest. Diplomats supported U.S. Central Command commander General Tommy Franks order make war short successful possible limit American, allied, Iraqi civilian casualties. American diplomats worked military commanders seek access facilities U.S. forces participate public diplomacy effort gain much support possible armed liberation Iraq. American diplomats Pentagon officials paid particular attention Turkey effort convince Turks allow 4th Infantry Division transit country create northern front battle Saddam's forces. Although State Department worried size Department Defense (DOD) request Ankara, worked closely civilian military authorities Pentagon try meet need identified Chairman Joint Chiefs Staff. Joint DOD—State diplomacy, however, could overcome negative vote Turkish parliament, reflected strong public opposition war. The way debate using force carried inside government influences attitudes actions conflict well future decisions whether use force. Military force may restore security, cannot resolve political cultural sources conflict. As Rupert Smith writes, "We engaging conflict objectives lead resolution matter directly force arms, since basic tactical level objectives tend concern intentions people leaders rather territory forces."' Smith argues civil-military structure designed make political- military decisions "deeply problematic" distorts decisionmaking many ways.13 In book, Smith imagines debate British Foreign Commonwealth Office (FCO) Ministry Defense (MOD) officials address genocide taking place number weeks Rwanda summer 1994. FCO: What face events Rwanda? MOD: What want us do? FCO: We ought act. Something must done. We can't people massacred. As permanent member UN Security Council cannot seen nothing. MOD: So want us use military force? FCO: Yes. MOD: To what? To stop killing? FCO: Yes. Exactly. MOD: Who want us fight? We clear killing: tribe tribe, force found _from tribe? And Rwanda big country. Where start? Kigali, presumably, it's capital would want airhead. FCO: Well, must international force, course. MOD: And would British aim joining force? FCO: To play part permanent member UN Security Council. MOD: Is Britain lead force? FCO: No, led UN—a proper UN mission. MOD: That take time assemble, probably late stop killing. FCO: Then mission aimed bringing postconflict order. MOD: OK But need clear many British troops currently available. Given deployments Ireland, Bosnia places, many. FCO: What suggest? MOD: What government's priorities? Is contributing force higher priority tasks already undertaking? FCO: Probably not. MOD: In case, UN forces always lack expeditionary logistic support. And want speed deployment force, offering logistic unit would probably valuable contribution. FCO: Will put soldiers risk? MOD: Hardly any." Many American diplomats recognize imaginary conversation, participated something like dozens times since fall Berlin Wall. In American debate, issue also quickly focuses pays bills. It worth stating, least American case, officials Pentagon DOD often legitimately frustrated State Department's inclination promote military missions Pentagon Armed Forces increasing number situations important, vital, U.S. national interests. While readiness volunteer U.S. military forces solve problems around world direct result lack civilian capacity jobs required, leads understandable consternation among uniform. Diplomacy Restoring Stability Following Conflict There many issues—defeating extremism, promoting pluralism, bringing benefits globalization yet benefited, living sustainably planet, nonproliferation— part definition successful 21st-century diplomacy. But getting postconflict diplomacy right—creating conditions preclusive victory—may crucial all. This easy assignment. The concept success redefined fact, complicating assessment. Successful democratic governance economic development cannot delivered certain date, therefore need time patience necessity ground. However, patience limited home countries, "fatigue" often sets in. Thus, potential failure high. Industrial war produced winners losers; today's lines clearly drawn, timeline may longer. Rupert Smith brings clarity assessment: We intervene even decide escalate to, conflict order establish condition political objective achieved means ways. We seek create conceptual space diplomacy, economic incentives, political pressure measures create desired political outcome stability, possible democracy. . . . decisive strategic victory hallmark interstate industrial war, establishing condition may deemed hallmark new paradigm war amongst people.15 Smith's point pressed even recognizing additional distinction military operation carried following Smith's rules ambiguity inherent trying create conditions Smith identifies objectives. Christopher Schnaubelt noted typical military operation unambiguous geographic boundaries (areas responsibility) assign specific units responsible every inch ground cubic foot airspace. There obvious chain responsibilities expected actions individual Soldier Marine ground commanding general. Nothing comparable exists economic development governance tasks, tend assigned function rather local geography rigid hierarchy authority.16 Postconflict diplomacy among defining diplomatic issues last third career State Department. In aftermath first Gulf War 1991, almost 500,000 Kurds fled mountains Iraq Turkey. Stranded harsh conditions, began starve thousands day. I Deputy Chief Mission Turkey. Inspired leadership Ambassador Morton Abramowitz, American diplomats, followed American military forces international coalition governments nongovernmental organizations, initiated Operation Provide Comfort (which became Operation Northern Watch). This "whole-of-government" "whole-of-theinternational- community" campaign provide humanitarian assistance return Kurds homes Northern Iraq. Once home, needed protected, 11 years, United Sates allies, including Turkey, worked ground recreate functioning society protected area Saddam enforcing no-fly zone. These years also punctuated activity Balkans. As Richard Holbrooke recounts, pre-Dayton negotiations Bosnian leader Alija Izetbegovi took place residence I Ambassador Turkey:7 As one Holbrooke's successors Assistant Secretary European Affairs, I watched effort made Ambassadors Robert Gelbard James Dobbins implement Dayton Accords applying whole-of-government efforts postconflict post- Yugoslavia. I picked diplomatic thread Under Secretary State Political Affairs promoting reconciliation, development, political progress, nationbuilding Kosovo. Other postconflict diplomacy efforts Haiti, East Timor, Liberia called upon resources United States governments try create conceptual space development sustained peace. The U.S. effort Colombia, too, highlighted need focus integrated cross-sectoral approach, included disarmament, demobilization, reintegration former combatants promoted justice postconflict society. But main events modern diplomacy's postconflict paradigm Afghanistan Iraq. The key understanding U.S. diplomacy postconflict Afghanistan Iraq recall profound disagreement inside U.S. Government, especially DOD State, whether United States engage "nationbuilding," policy President Bush campaigned 2000. State Department professionals generally proud effort United States made nationbuilding peacekeeping, supporting deployment U.S. military forces participate, example, Multinational Force Observers Sinai peacekeeping nationbuilding activities East Timor, Haiti, Balkans. Most believed nationbuilding, properly funded executed, effective long-term tool integrated modern diplomacy United States. The effort create new Afghan government overthrow Taliban piece classical diplomacy carried 21st-century context.'8 Secretary Powell directed Ambassador Dobbins support regional negotiation hosted Germans Bonn 2001 create new Afghan government. Much planning detailed, focused lessons learned first Gulf War. The department's Future Iraq Project, important, would solved Iraq's postwar problems. State capacity take responsibility immediate postconflict administration Iraq, leadership agreed Executive order creating postconflict Iraq structure reported Secretary Defense. There need recount lost lives lost opportunities well chronicled others immediate postconflict period Iraq, although Dobbins's argument that, looking back, Coalition Provisional Authority accomplished great deal trying circumstances worth noting.23 On July 1, 2004, State Department officially open (on time budget) Embassy Baghdad, allowed expansion diplomacy led comprehensive senior civilian-military cooperation. There another important lesson draw recent postconflict efforts: need adequate civilian capacity respond, including role revitalized U.S. Agency International Development (USAID). As journal chronicled article' Ambassador John Herbst, Secretary State's Coordinator Reconstruction Stabilization (S/CRS), office mandated develop whole-ofgovernment civilian response stability operations ensure civilian-military coordination. The Civilian Response Corps (CRC) early stage, ultimately made reserve component, addition existing active standby components. The personnel anticipated represent full range sector experts: engineers, lawyers, judges, corrections officials, diplomats, development experts, public administrators, public health officials, city planners, border control officials, economists, others. Currently, active standby components stepped drawn State, USAID, core group domestic U.S. Agencies. Once congressionally funded, reserves would drawn state local governments private sector. Between January 2008 May 2009, 56 CRC members deployed 11 countries, including Afghanistan planning purposes, realistic plans 250 active members 1,000 standby members ready deploy end 2010. There least 14 countries United States allies civilian peacebuilding capacity—some including stability civilian police, employing wholeof- government "comprehensive" approaches similar created Washington. Several, fact, higher budgets proportionate gross national products America's.25 One way State support S/CRS effort would consider creating new personnel specialty: "expeditionary diplomat." Washington's diplomatic personnel have, course, always one sense expeditionary; majority Foreign Service deployed abroad majority time. But post-9/11 diplomatic experience, especially effort Iraq Afghanistan, means State needs explicit expeditionary nature future diplomatic work prepare small significant number people serve successfully hardest places moment's notice. This would allow flexibility across institution encourage desire whose family circumstances might change time participate well. The department would also need make sure taking career path recognized career beyond norm Foreign Service promoted rewarded. The creation S/CRS symbol comprehensive, simultaneous diplomacy needed future, expeditionary diplomat could form backbone State USAID commitment civilian response capacity. There still key questions answered civilian capacity. In face real world situation, DOD really support State Department—led operation? Will Congress adequately fund S/CRS, including reasonable contingency fund? How S/CRS resurgent USAID work together? Where lines drawn immediate postconflict needs nationbuilding? From Martin: The principle conclusion quick visit Israel Ramallah weekend Netanyahu strong position politically, unusually stable ruling coalition. Nobody I spoke believed government would fallen decided extend settlement freeze expiry, gesture U.S. peacemaking efforts. In view, could easily garnered support large majority people, settlers marginal concern. And would given leverage ministers ensure support abstention cabinet. As Dan Meridor noted, Likud voters left Knesset members comes peacemaking (70 percent support two-state solution, vs 50 percent leadership). Lieberman, Likud, Bibi's chief concern. He wants keep government long possible fear leaves garner support right, including Likud, oppose peacemaking. For time being, Bibi uses threat alternative coalition Kadima keep Lieberman tent. But clock ticking. According Tzipi Livni, bring party government now, willing without demand "rotation," provided Bibi serious negotiating peace. But elections grow closer, party members turning idea joining government. They strengthened views recent internal polling shows Kadima 32 seats (up 28 now), Likud slightly 25, Labor 5. Therefore, Bibi intends make deal Abu Mazen, need sooner rather later. The longer waits, less leverage Lieberman likely Lieberman break away oppose next elections. In context, Bibi's negotiating tactics become self-defeating. Believing great negotiator, operating Middle East bazaar, inflates requirements well beyond anything reasonable belief best way secure highest price. The process bringing reasonable price uses lot energy, uses lot goodwill, humiliates Palestinian negotiating partner, raises doubts seriousness. Pinstripes cargo pants -- Clinton tailors new vision diplomacy By Elise Labatt, CNN October 27, 2010 12:51 p.m. EDT STORY HIGHLIGHTS • It first-ever undertaking State Department • Approach focus American leadership civilian power • Going forward, diplomats likely wear cargo pants pinstriped suit. Washington (CNN) -- Secretary State Hillary Clinton outlining plans redefine U.S. diplomacy development ahead top-down review taken place year released coming weeks. In essay November/December issue Foreign Affairs, Clinton previews Quadrennial Diplomacy Development Review, commonly referred QDDR. The review, first-ever undertaking State Department, meant balance similar quadrennial review Defense Department projects strategy priorities. The new approach development, Clinton says, focus American leadership civilian power. Both Clinton Secretary Defense Robert Gates talked "demilitarizing" foreign policy, Clinton says QDDR suggest that, whole new set resources diplomacy development, much geared toward fragile states conflict crisis. In article, Clinton painted broad strokes document, called blueprint reforms implemented next four years. Those reforms include modernizing coordinating diplomacy across U.S. government agencies, creating stronger nexus diplomacy development ensuring development undertaken U.S. lasting "sustainable" impact. "Economic growth surest route poverty, expanding strengthening middle classes around world key creating sustainable international order lies heart United States' national security strategy," Clinton wrote Foreign Affairs. She said U.S. ultimate goal development "put business" boosting countries assume responsibility projects future. President Barack Obama laid vision basic pillars policy September United Nations General Assembly released "U.S. Global Development Policy," changes U.S. efforts focus building countries demonstrate good governance economic potential. But QDDR outline put policy practice. Officials say 150-page document detail everything United States conducts multilateral diplomacy, United States undertakes "stabilization" efforts post-conflict areas, State Department works USAID contractors types numbers personnel needed implement new approach. American diplomats going forward, Clinton said, likely wear cargo pants pinstriped suit.

H: Les Gelb, oversaw writing Pentagon Papers, makes points Wikileaks show US today trying solve difficult international problems, telling truth diplomats acting professionally. Wiki Leaks Accidentally Helps U.S. Leslie H. Gelb November 30, 2010 I 10:42pm Julian Assange clearly intended State Dept. cable leaks smear U.S. evil selfish. Leslie H. Gelb inadvertently proved opposite. The Wikileakers dumped vast pile secrets prove United States selfish, stupid wicked—but revelations proved opposite. When remove gossip obvious trivia mesmerized press, clearly see Wikileakers never expected: A United States seriously professionally trying solve dangerous problems frighteningly complicated world, yet lacking power dictate solutions. U.S. policymakers diplomats shown, quite accurately, supposed do: ferreting critical information foreign leaders, searching paths common action, struggling right amount pressure apply allies adversaries. And cases, villain Washington, foreign leaders escaping common action cowardice hypocrisy. Don't think New York minute Julian Assange, Wikileaker, unloaded trove save humankind. Why toss cables Italy's leader rake Germany's chancellor cautious fuddy-duddy, President Hamid Karzai Afghanistan "paranoid"? To save world? Not chance. He get attention, got attention drooling press, went call material highlighting trivial. Did Assange leak critical conversations Chinese Arab leaders help solve problems Korea Iran? Not hair chinny chin chin. He show could it—and attention. Anyone hopeless left-wing ideologue knows leaks crush future serious conversations leaders time come. Just think: told someone serious critical confidence someone else, confidant went told others, would soon repeat mistake? Assange leak cables help solve world problems. These leaks absolutely gratuitous served purpose making media marvel. When actually read cables, here's see: American leaders American diplomats trying solve crucial world In explaining deed publicly, Assange suggests he's uncovering American misdeeds lies. His aim, says, inform citizens democracies peoples around world leaders really doing. Assange also insists transparency's sake. Yet got look inside, didn't see plain: diplomats good job. Indeed, turn nonsense stop listening strange commentary cable news even front pages great newspapers, actually read cables, here's see: American leaders American diplomats trying solve crucial world problems. But turn nonsense stop listening strange commentary cable news even front pages great newspapers, actually read cables, here's see: American leaders American diplomats trying solve crucial world problems. —Washington needs China's help bolstering sanctions Iran, China balks fear jeopardizing oil gas flow country. The Obama team arranges Saudi Arabia guarantee loss supply China. If world wants slow even prevent Iran's march nuclear weaponry, key path so. — The U.S. discovers North Korea manufactured new medium-range missiles trying deliver Iran China. The Obama team discovers this, informs Beijing, asks Beijing stop transfer. Beijing declines. Really creepy. — Yemen's leader takes public responsibility American missile attacks Al Qaeda Yemen. He wants diminish power terrorists, Americans others world. The "lie" Yemeni president harmless way get critical job done—that is, job fighting international terrorism. Wikileaks tears away political cover Yemen's leaders. —No country anywhere near much influence nutty North Korea China. So, U.S. diplomats searching desperately figure Chinese thinking North Korea order compose plan avoiding war Korean Peninsula. So, Wikileakers expose Chinese leaders actually trying give us insight Chinese thinking North Korean craziness. They won't soon. Time again, one actually reads cables, one heartened professionalism insights U.S. diplomats. What doing? They lying, U.S. leaders lying. They actually, believe not, trying solve problems. That seriousness purpose professionalism execute jumps materials. So, naïve say, it's good show effectiveness diplomats. Give break. Ask American diplomat choose looking intelligent leaked cables making progress toward avoiding war. None say leaks, press pursue classified information necessary helpful sensible public debate policy. If U.S. administration lying, distorting facts, telling one story public another itself, means, let's public. If U.S. government concocting intelligence order justify wars, let's hope enterprising reporter finds rest us. But Wikileaks dump providing essential information Americans others—information need serious policy discussion. This massive trashing Wikileaks legitimate effort U.S. government preserve confidentiality least shame most, crime. Leslie H. Gelb, former New York Times columnist senior government official, author Power Rules: How Common Sense Can Rescue American Foreign Policy (HarperCollins 2009), book shows think use power 21st century. They are, judge WikiLeaks dump quarter-million private secret cables, thoughtful, well-informed dedicated servants American interest write clear, declarative English sentences. I've heard much torrent Wiki-chatter admirable career diplomats whose diplomacy condemned unquiet. Yet whose lives upturned. Every journalist knows correspondence several years suddenly made public, would lose sources. That give every journalist pause. So front line U.S. diplomacy. Contacts self-censor. They go quiet, particularly conspiratorial parts world also tend unstable, like Middle East. Layers secrecy added. Julian Assange, thin-skinned founder WikiLeaks, hurt U.S. interests across broad probably shallow spectrum. That satisfy he's self-styled foe United States. The guy makes queasy. Perhaps shocking thing Assange treasure trove — beyond "shock" venal Gulf Arab Sunni leaders looking war cheap Shiite Iran long doesn't disrupt U.S.-armed fiefdoms; "shock" Pakistani double-dealing nuclear procrastination; "shock" yet premature Israeli predictions Iran nuclear weapon; "shock" continued Saudi funding Al Qaeda; "shock" Chinese Politburo hacking Google; "shock" Muammar el-Qaddafi's taste voluptuous Slavic women Silvio Berlusconi's taste women — perhaps biggest shock professional, sober short embarrassment cables much conform world already knew it, right familiar adjectives evoking French President Nicolas Sarkozy: "hyperactive," "mercurial," "authoritarian," "erratic," "monarch-like." I swear, hadn't become diplomats lot State Department people could become good hacks. It good know innermost conviction American diplomacy: fraud evident anyone Tehran election violent aftermath. Their vested interest prevailing Middle Eastern strategic equation strong; nothing would redraw Middle East overcoming U.S.-Iranian psychosis. The second President Barack Obama's approach Iran much conventional initial outreach suggested. Old habits attempted coercion trumped originality. Very quickly fell back Dennis Ross's tired thinking balancing "appetizing carrots" "sharp sticks" tackling Iran's nuclear program. The cables reveal early March 2009, senior U.S. diplomat talking "dual track," telling Europeans "engagement alone unlikely succeed" calling added "pressure." Perhaps Iranian skepticism could never overcome; certainly approach guaranteed longstanding Iranian grievances would fester. Assange clearly understands nothing Iran Middle East diplomacy. In interview Time, expressed approval Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu "coming interesting statement leaders speak public like private whenever can" bought Netanyahu's view this, Assange's words, would "lead kind increase peace process Middle East particularly relation Iran. It Huh? Netanyahu referring Arab leaders' now-documented private calls U.S.-led war Iran, option also favors. And that, Assange, step forward peace! He's place. What make brainy naïf told colleague John Burns America threat democracy? He's loose canon; let be. My impression he's self-armed spade he's digging. And messenger's message? The cables intriguing, offering plenty voyeuristic titillation gasp discovery. They provide texture break little new ground. Yet publication done significant damage courageous work America's diplomats may endanger lives. That's tradeoff I find troubling unpersuasive.

Kennedy, religion politics By Kathleen Kennedy Townsend Friday, December 3, 2010; 6:00 PM Sarah Palin found new opponent debate: John F. Kennedy. In new book, "America Heart," Palin objects uncle's famous 1960 speech Greater Houston Ministerial Association, challenged ministers - country - judge him, Catholic presidential candidate, views rather faith. "Contrary common newspaper usage, I Catholic candidate president," Kennedy said. "I Democratic Party's candidate president happens also Catholic." Palin writes growing up, taught Kennedy's speech "succeeded best possible way: It reconciled public service religion without compromising either." Now, however, says revisited speech changed mind. She finds "defensive . . . tone content" upset Kennedy, rather presenting reconciliation private faith public role, instead offered "unequivocal divorce two." Palin's argument seems challenge great American tradition, enshrined Constitution, stipulating religious test public office. A careful reading book leads conclude Palin wishes precisely test. And seems think she, think like her, qualified judge would pass would not. If religious test, need candidate's religious affiliation "reconciled." My uncle urged religion private, removed politics, feared making faith arena public contention would lead American politics ill-disguised religious warfare, candidates tempted use faith manipulate voters demean opponents. Kennedy cited Thomas Jefferson argue that. part American tradition, essential keep semblance religious test political realm. Best judge candidates public records, positions war peace, jobs, poverty, health care. No one, Kennedy pointed out, asked died Alamo church belonged to. But Palin insists evaluating acting authority candidates' faith. She faults Kennedy "telling country faith enriched him." With line, proceeds path fraught danger - precisely path uncle warned said president's religious views "neither imposed upon nation imposed nation upon condition holding office." After all, candidate's faith matter believe right serve arbiters faith. Is worthy? Is deep? Is reflected certain ideology? Palin criticizes Kennedy because, "rather spelling faith groups provided life-changing services education millions Americans, repeatedly objected government assistance religious schools." She seem appreciate Kennedy courageous arguing government funds used parochial schools, despite temptation please constituents. Many Catholics would liked money. But wisely thought use public dollars places nuns explicitly proselytized would unconstitutional. Tax money used persuade someone join religion. As contrast Kennedy's speech, Palin cites former Massachusetts governor Mitt Romney's remarks 2008 Republican primary campaign, spoke publicly "how faith would inform presidency, I elected." After paying lip service separation church state, Romney condemned unnamed enemies "intent establishing new religion America - religion secularism." "There one fundamental question I often asked," Romney said. "What I believe Jesus Christ?" Romney, course, Mormon. He answered question, proclaiming "Jesus Christ son God." Palin praises Romney delivering "thoughtful speech eloquently correctly described role faith American public life." But religious test politics, candidate feel compelled respond misplaced questions belief Jesus? When George Romney, Mitt Romney's father, presidential candidate 1968, felt compulsion. Respect Constitution founders' belief separation church state suggests kinds questions play role political campaigns. Palin contends Kennedy sought "run away religion." The truth uncle knew quite well made America special revolutionary assertion freedom religion. No nation Earth ever framed law faith interest government officials. For centuries, European authorities murdered tortured whose religious beliefs differed own. To demand citizens display religious beliefs attacks foundation nation undermines precise reason America exceptional. Palin's book makes clear dangerous proposed path be. Not want people reveal beliefs, wants sit judgment views don't match own. For instance, criticizes Rep. Nancy Pelosi (Calif.), Democrat faithful Catholic, "talking (God) talk walking walk." Who Palin say God's "walk" is? Who anointed grand inquisitor? This woman also praises Abraham Lincoln's Second Inaugural, even though Lincoln explicitly declared, "But let us judge judged." The problem setting free-floating tribunal evaluate faith that, contrary Lincoln, installing judges look others' souls assess worthiness. Kennedy would that, indifferent faith. In fact, unlike Romney Palin, fealty faith Constitution, promised day Houston would resign religion ever interfered duty president. My uncle man faith tested. His brother brother-in-law killed World War II, sister died plane crash soon war. He suffered painful injuries inflicted Navy service PT boat cut two Japanese destroyer. His God make life easy require commitment justice. America's first oniy Catholic president referred God three times p_;.-: .:1,rai.adc'res invoked Bible's command care poor sick. Later presidency, 1.-.a ur;:•:-.1uvocaliv. riohi:s: We confronted primarily moral issue. It old Scriptures clear American Constitution." Faith runs deep current family. Faith inspired uncles' father's dedication justice. My father, Robert F. Kennedy, returning apartheid-era South Africa 1966, wrote magazine article titled "Suppose God Is - Black." And uncle Teddy fought health care Americans, even book }Dalin presumes judge took positions "directly odds Catholic faith." Teddy Kennedy believed stands one faith. He disagree Roman Catholic hierarchy times. But seen, hierarchy's positions change, church, obligation help bring changes. That may Palin's theology, glory America support would disagree - even difficult personal matters, religion. John F. Kennedy knew tearing wall separating church state would tempt us toward self-righteousness contempt others. That one reason delivered Houston speech. Palin, part, argues "morality cannot sustained without support religious beliefs." That statement amounts wholesale attack countless Americans, study reasonable argument I seen heard would support blanket condemnation. For person claims admire Lincoln, Palin curiously ignores injunction Americans, even engaged Civil War, show "malice toward none, charity ail." Pal fails understand genius nation. The United States one vibrant religious countries Earth precisely religious freedom. When power faith entwined, faith loses. Power tends obfuscate, corrupt focus temporal rather eternal purposes. U.S. Orders Diplomats Sto Telling Truth httrzquIrmw.truf,hdig.coardreipiartliteir/us orders dirtbrnats stoo teilinq truth 20'1012051 Posted Dec 5, 2010 Fake news Andy Borovvibe; WASHINGTON—In first major policy fallout WikiLeaks disclosures, State Department ordered U.S. diplomats "cease desist telling truth notice." "We working overtime fly make sure leaks like don't happen again," Secretary State Hillary Clinton told reporters. "But we've got leaks plugged, it's incumbent diplomats put lying caps." Clinton noted since many U.S. diplomats major political donors long careers business world, "this shouldn't reach them." But career diplomats came Foreign Service, State Department holding series "truth avoidance seminars," led executives Goldman Sachs. Additionally, Clinton said, State Department would install diplomats' computers new software called CandorShield', automatically translates truthful language less embarrassing truth-free version. For example, explained, software would translate phrase "two-faced weasels" "trusted Pakistani allies" would delete references French President Nicolas Sarkozy "Monsieur Shorty Pants." Elsewhere, Interpol issued statement pursuit WikiLea.ks founder Julian Assange: "We find Julian Assange, hire him."

STATEMENT BY SECRETARY CLINTON The Cancun Agreements Over last year, United States worked international partners build progress achieved climate change conference Copenhagen. We pressed substantive steps would advance vision Copenhagen Accord. This month joined nations world Cancun new round talks aimed mobilizing common action meet shared global challenge climate change. Today I pleased announce secured Cancun Agreements, set balanced international decisions United Nations Framework Convention Climate Change (UNFCC) represent meaningful progress global response climate change. These agreements advance core elements Copenhagen Accord: They anchor Accord's mitigation pledges; build system transparency substantial detail content International Consultations Analysis provide confidence country's pledges carried out; launch new Green Climate Fund; create framework reduce deforestation developing countries; establish technology mechanism; Setup framework committee promote international cooperation action adaptation. The Cancun Agreements represent balanced significant step forward. In days months ahead, United States work friends partners keep world focused urgent challenge continue building progress. ###

THE NBC/YORKER December 14, 2010 The Envoy Posted Hendrik Hertzberg Last night, I unlocking bike windswept Greenwich Village sidewalk leaving holiday party, friend approached, cell phone hand. A minutes earlier, I inside, chatting happily amid buzz warmth holiday party. Now tears eyes. "Richard Holbrooke died," said. Notwithstanding hospital bulletins since fell ill Saturday—critical condition, damaged aorta, emergency surgery—this sudden, awful ending shock, Richard Holbrooke astounding volcano vitality. Everything large: physical size, including ultimate "in face" face, face like Times Square billboard; buzz-saw voice, highly expressive instrument, equally adept piano (a side-of-the-mouth, gossipy wisecrack, often pleasingly nasty) forte (a high-decibel outburst anger indignation, almost always calculated effect); appetites (for experience, danger, praise, power, fun); ambitions (for himself, beliefs, United States, world). He doe-eyed peacenik, diplomat labored long hard seek alternatives war ways end particular wars. He sentimental unsentimentality, romantic tough-guy realism. Unlike tearful informant, known Holbrooke family friend since little girl, I acquainted casual way many journalists editors. He peer well "source," prolific forceful writer whose favorite venues, The New Republic The New Yorker, happened places I've spent working life. He gregarious fond big, splashy black-tie evenings. The last time I saw six weeks ago, November 1st, New York Public Library's "Literary Lions" celebration. At pre-dinner reception, would normally feet, looming large, repaired folding chair behind little table let wife, Kati Marton, bring party him. At sixty-nine tired—that much obvious—but sharp voluble ever. He still plenty do. Not long Holbrooke achieved greatest diplomatic triumph negotiating 1995 end Balkan wars, I asked liked Warren Zevon's wonderful song "The Envoy." He said he'd never heard it. The next day I sent CD. After that, mentioned every single time I've seen him, including NYPL gala, saying puts on, loud, needs lift. And wonder: life drama, liked way. If Supreme Court allowed votes counted 2000, Envoy, almost certainly, would become Secretary State, next decade would unfolded differently. As is, Holbrooke left stronger, positive, creative mark history held post. He certainly die broken heart—Kati Marton saw that—but surely ghastly, impossible demands last, impossible assignment brought rending aorta. He died country surely soldier. And deathbed words may turn important ever spoke.
